reviews.review: Lovely early morning walk. Just make sure you start at 6am to avoid the heat - there is no shade on the track... can end beautifully with a breakfast at Karsa Cafe or a massage at Karsa Spa.

Holiday. Did this twice while in Ubud. An easy walk with lovely views. Many locals along the way. Depending how many photographs you take and how long you stop for a drink determines how long it takes. Ubud return for us was about an hour and a half.
Beautiful. We actually found this place whilst we were lost and completely forgot the stress due to the scenic beauty that surrounded us.

A great walk to take in the sights...on the way to Karsa Spa/Kafe. We had a lovely walk to Karsa Kafe and Karsa Spa. It has uphill sections but nothing too hard. It's hot in Bali so you know you're going to be hot. Take lots of water with you although there is a spot to get water about 1/2 way to Karsa. Beautiful views, some shade although not much. I'd do it again in a heartbeat!

Worth the mini trek! . Boasting amazing views of Ubud, this walk is a must during your stay in Ubud! My friends and I thoroughly enjoyed the views after enjoying breakfast at a nearby restaurant. It was such a blissful journey up hill with our drone capturing the walk from above!

Great scenery... then caught in a tropical downpour!. We were staying at the Payogan Villas, and the Campuan Ridge Walk took us a good chunk of the way back there. Walking out of town back home the scenery was picturesque pretty quickly and we soon ended up wandering in between the rice paddies.As we were going quite a bit further than just the walk, we ended up getting caught in a massive downpour - thankfully just as we arrived at a little stall outside the Payogan temple. Fortunately they had a roof and a cold Bintang so the day was saved!

Beautiful walk. I highly recommend this walk, as it was an exceptional experience! We followed the Lonely Planet book walking guide, which I personally prefer to any kind of guided tour. We enjoyed stops along the way for lunch and to chat with a local artisan, which really added to the experience. Be prepared with water and appropriate attire; it is a long grind in a hot climate.
Take the walk around sunset. Offers amazing views, the sun sets right over it if you start from the center of Ubud going north. Very nice, relaxing and really beautiful.

DON'T MISS IT. It is the only walk here in Ubud central were you feel the tranquility of nature no cars no motorbikes in the first half of this walk.The view the feeling of breeze and nature will capture you for this 40 minutes...probably you will connect to higher realm and figure out something about you.
Nice stroll. It's a nice walk, but don't go in thinking its a very long hike. It's a nice walk with a steep incline in the humidity. Worth the trip though as the views are very nice.
Sunrise Hike! . Jet lag woke us up at 4am every morning, so we decided to walk this trail by our hotel. Absolutely stunning, great way to relax and start your day.
Serenity and peace. great walk about 45 minutes and you can have rest in Karsa Café enjoy the fantastic view of the rice field ,the pizza is great there and fresh juices.
Beautiful place , go with bike tour it s amazing. Going by bicycle was an a zing experience with this view , it s so beautiful you could cry. Don t miss to go there

So so only . After the rice terrace, we were so excited and immediately proceed to this campuhan ridge walk. Started out pretty promising but after awhile we were just wondering whether this place is overrated??? It's not too bad but only go if you really enjoys nature. Nothing much to see really, and honestly I wonder about the previous reviews ...🤔🤔

DO IT!!. I woke up at 5:30 to do this walk. And I recommend you do to... To beat the heat and to witness the beautiful colours of the sky as the sun rises.
One of my favourite walks yet, you can through the large palm trees rice fields and witness the works starting their day.

Nice little walk. Nice 2km walk. After 2km, there is a nice little restaurant where you can have a drink or something to eat. Great views over the rice paddies. Just outside of Ubud, no need to book a guided tour, just go there (we rented a motorbike).

Great views. This is great little escape from the throng (ie, noise, traffic fumes and constant badgering) of the centre of Ubud. It's short, not challenging, well-paved, and pretty well kept (certainly not as litter-strewn as some of the areas we visited). There are also many varieties of butterflies, quite a few birds species, and a few nice warungs/cafes en route.

Good walk. It was very hot and humid the day we walked the ridge but it was a lovely walk and we stopped a couple of times for drinks. Walking back was busier so suggest going early if you want the views without the tourists.

Beautiful walk must do while in Ubud . Lovely walk- like some reviewers have said more of a jungle walk than a rice field walk but there is a bit of both for sure. I was staying at top end of Ubud and it took me 1 hour from villa to top of ridge (and I passed everyone else on the trail I walk at a decent speed) I stopped at karsa cafe at the top- beautiful views and great for resting and having a drink after the walk up. But terrible service and a basic cafe with no internal plumbing and really rough kitchen, I wouldn't want to try and eat here but getting a juice was fine. I sat up top level for breeze and view or you can sit downstairs for the lily ponds, both lovely. Then walk back down and back to villa also took me an hour. I did it between 4-6pm roughly, sun setting while walking back down, home before dark, wasn't too hot, do early or late in the day for sure. Also there is a really rough village at the top with dogs roaming everywhere and people sitting there saying hi as you walk by. You can keep walking too, on and on, to more villages, but I was tired.

Walk it and feel the peace. I found it by mistake while searching for something else! It is close to Ubud Palace and worth the few km to walk. Try to go a bit before sunset since the light is just astonishing on the green rice field and the ocre colors from roof tops.

Pleasant walk. Uphill walk that you can pace yourself with, pleasant views. Cafe at the top to recover. Long way back if you want to wander through the lanes and village on your return trip - though you see more "Bali" by doing this.

Nice view. Of you stay in ubud you should visit this path!!! It's walkable and you won't regret it as along the path you can take a look at the local art galleries, the rice fields and enjoy the nature!!!

Just beautiful. It's my third time in Ubud and the third time I did this walk. It is beautiful seeing Ubud from this side. The walk is quite short (1.5 km) and is makable for everybody with normal fitness level. It is recommended to do it in the morning because is is cooler. There is not much shade on this walk. However I did it at noon in the hottest time and it was still ok. Don't miss it. It's easy to do by your own, no guide is needed. Don't miss the Karsa Cafe (after 2km) at the end of the walk. It offers beautiful views!It's also very nice to go even further. There are many very beautiful rice paddies further on.

A mini trek away from maddening crowds & with mesmerising views. The Campuhan Ridge Walk takes you to natural green landscapes away from the crowds. The trek is comfortable for all ages & can be interesting if done either early morning at 6 am & evening at 5 pm to avoid the scorching Sunshine. The growling Campuhan river flowing through the gorge & the lovely rice terraces make it an interesting activity. You can also visit the Spa for foot massage on the way.

Nice for a morning walk. Great to walk along the ridge early in the morning befor it gets to hot. It is very popular and you will come across cyclist as well. It tends to get busy in teh late afternoon.

Going to the hill! . A great way to spend a morning. The track starts at the Warwick Ibah villas and whilst a few do this track it didn't feel crowded in any way. The path is mostly paved but suggest you wear walking shoes. The scenery is great, a mixture of forest, valley and rice fields. Drop into the cafe at the end of the track for a relax and a delicious juice to sustain you for the trip back!

A lovely walk with stunning views. The ridge walk is an easy and paved walk. Although if you don't like walking in full sun I would advise to go early morning. Beautiful views and if you keep going to the Karsa Cafe and Spa (go upstairs) there are amazing rice terraces!

Enjoyable morning/evening nature walk. I've lived in Ubud a couple years now and try to walk the ridge once every couple weeks at least. It can get hot during the day, so I recommend going early in the morning or around 5/530 in the afternoon.

Lovely views. Gorgeous walk that takes in river & views across Ubud. Good idea to do it early in the morning & stop for a break at Karsa Kafe (or the spa) before returning. The walk back is mainly downhill so easier than the walk there.

Easy walk on the paved ridge. Wanted to see the temple the start of this, but that was shut, so we decided to walk for a bit, we actually walked to the spa 3km from the start. Not much rice field views which makes a change, lots of butterflies to chase. It was a nice easy walk. The spa at the end (karsa cafe & spa) serves nice refreshing drinks and a lovely palm sugar and coconut pancakes with some great views from upstairs before you head back

Beautiful view. The ridge is a great walk with a beautiful view, especially at sunrise or sunset. There is also an artist village at the end of the trail with great artwork...worth visiting. And if you are up to walking even further the are photo opportunities to get some beautiful rice paddies. If you struggle with walking in the heat it is best to do this walk ealier in the morning or later in the afternoon around sunset. You can also walk the ridge from Ubud to the spa in the artist village and take a shuttle back to town from the spa.

Good views, great exercise. Good way of blowing off the cobwebs is to walk the Campuhan Ridge. Lovely views and a few cafés at the end. The walk back to Ubud is uninspiring (and tough). We gave up half way back and jumped in a taxi.
Walking on the ridge. Beautiful walk to take early in the morning before it gets too hot. Finish it off with by stopping in at Karsa Cafe for some refreshments or possibly a massage.
Invigorating Experience. We did the Campuhan Ridge Walk early morning on 05th October 2016 and it was a good trekking track among the lush green views.

great walk. this is a good walk to do in the morning, the view along the way is amazing, you can stop at a café for coffee then walk back, or you can keep going, we decided to keep going and did a big loop back to ubud, but there is not signage to tell you which way to go, my husband sort of knew where to go and was lucky he didn't listen to me as we would of well and truly got lost

Away from the Maddening Crowds!. As we really wanted to do the Campuhan Ridge walk which we were staying close to we caught a taxi to Karsa Kafe to begin the walk at 6.30 am. This meant we were walking downhill back towards Ubud and we beat the heat of the day. The scenery is breathtakingly beautiful and it is great to be able to take your time and enjoy the moment! Quite a number of people were walking and jogging both ways! We ambled along the paved track stopping frequently to take photos or revel in the beauty of the countryside! We took about two hours to complete the walk one way but that was at an extremely slow pace. Take water and don't forget your hat. We only had sandles as footwear and they were fine.

Good walk with nice views. It's a nice morning walk. Can be done in around 1 hour until the Cafe. Parking is easy to spot after you turn right at the sign. Both the parking and the walk are free. There are stairs at the beginning of the walk (or at the end if you start from thr opposite direction) so I think riding a bike is not a good idea.

Bali relax 2016. Walked along the ridge walk for 2 hours, 1 hour one way, easy walk with beautiful scenery and views of the rice paddies and countryside. Few cafes along the way if you need refreshment. Lots of lovely photo opportunities. Then returned same way. A must do while in Ubud although no shelter so not advisable if wet.

Green scenery. If you love nature walk or trekking,this place is best for you,though the view here not very marvelous,still worth the effort to come here,your will see green scenery all the way,good for your eyes,but if you walk in the afternoon,you might be suffer in the hot weather,so walk in the morning better,there are some cafe,warung in the middle of the way,and a spa also,besides,you can see some shops selling painted eggs,talk with the artist,and get a good price!

Great views. If you're going to walk the walk then make sure you go early morning and wear comfy shoes (& font forget that bottle of water). It gets very hot & uncomfortable,even by 10am. The terrain is uneven & mainly uphill & if you walk for long enough (about 30-40 mins from karsa spa) you'll be in ubud town centre. There are some lovely views along the way,including temples & small shops. You can always stop off for a chilled fresh coconut water!
good trail. try to catch a sunrise in this place, not to early but it will grant you beautiful scenery and less people

Great activity close to Ubud main streat. Had a very nice day walking around Ubud and surrounding area. This was a great place for normally healty people. Impossible to get around with wheelchairs or strollers. I was impressed by the cleanlyness of the antire walk. People was generally very postive and friendly along the way.

Wonderful walk! Wear the right shoes!. My husband and I walked up this mountain and found t a very enjoyable experience. We didn't have proper footwear but we're okay. There is a village at the top where everyone is super friendly and they sell drinks & snacks. I highly recommend stopping at Karsa Kafe at the top! You can sit on the water in bungalows!!! It's truly amazing

Stunning - a must for keen runners and walkers when you're in Ubud!. I LOVE this ridge. We run along it at sunrise time (make sure you get there from 5.50am to catch beautiful skyscapes) when the air is cooler. It's only 1.1km long or so, so running up and back a few times is great. It's moderately challenging with hills and stairs. Bliss!

Worth the effort. A pleasant walk but I recommend that you do it as early as possible - we started the actual walk at around 7:00 but should have been earlier. It is a relatively easy walk for someone who does not have any issues walking - if you do, then I suggest you do something else.
Early morning is best . I started out about 6.30am from the Campuan bridge and enjoyed a relatively peaceful walk up to the village of Bang Kiang Sidem. About 40 min at return at a steady pace.
Great view. Very beautiful and peaceful for morning or afternoon walk and not too strenuous either.Rice paddies, small village, art studio, all beautiful

easy morning walk. This walk starts just of the main streat and is about 2KM long. Best to do it in the morning before it gets to hot as there is not alot of shade. There a number of place to get a cold juice or coffee at the top. Scenery is worth taking the walk.

Pleasant way to spend a couple of hours.. A bit of a yomp uphill then flat to mildly undulating along the ridge. Once through the village you can either take the road left to Ubud, (steep for the first half kilometre or so then fairly flat) or retrace your steps - our preferred alternative. Usually busy, even early morning. Best time is probably the hours before sunset, unless you want the views of Agung, then very early is best, before the clouds roll in.

Lovely views. Did this ridge walk at 6.00am & arrived at top at 6.50 and kafe was closed. Not happy about that. Walk is not as easy as everyone says. I walk at home for an hour a day and this wasn't easy. The climb up is hard especially the steps. I have done it but wouldn't do it again.
Beautiful Views. We did the walk very early to keep out of the heat of the day. It was beautiful and had great views into the valley. I would recommend going early to avoid the crowds.
Wonderful views. Easy hike through lush green scenery, rice fields, artist studios, and plenty of places to stop for a bite to eat with amazing views. Photographers dream walk!!

interesting, but not the best walk in the area. This walk is a reasonable introduction to the rice paddies around Ubud, but its not the best available. Its hot and exposed and, frankly, a little boring. You can eat and have a drink at the cafe at the end, but you should taxi or walk back the way you came, dont bother walking the round trip back to Ubud, too much traffic and steep hills

And it's free. Located at the center of Ubud just before Blanco Museum. it's a nice place to walk, jogging or even biking. Many people came here to do that, but of course some tourist don't want to walk that far. Best time to go is after rain, but be careful because it's slippery when we go up to the hill. Morning and afternoon it's good time too. Must visit when you around Ubud.

Peaceful trail among the locals and nature. This is a good walk to take if you are into that sort of thing. Bit of a hill to climb, but the views once you get to the top are pretty decent for it. There are also some small shops at the top of the walk who sell the best, coldest young coconut, which is perfect after walking that stretch. A couple of art dealers and restaurants as well. Good for an evening trek, or a bit earlier in the morning.

A lovely escape from the hustle & bustle of Ubud town centre. Not far from the main centre, this is a nice activity to get some photos, enjoy the scenery and do some exercise. We walked for about 1 hour and it was a nice break in the day.

Nice walk. Covering about 2kms we decided to take this walk while in Ubud.The walk was pretty easy and scenery was nice.There are a number of galleries that you can visit along the way and various options for a cold drink.Well worth the detour to have stroll.

Stunning walk from central Ubud. This walk is easy to access from Ubud. The track starts next to the Warwick Ibah Hotel . The walk is a bit uphill,so you need good fitness. ALong the way there are a few places to buy fresh coconuts and other drinks. At the end of the walk we had lunch at Karsa Cafe which was great. This walk is best done early or late as there is little shade along the way. It took us about 35 min to walk to the Karsa Cafe .
Free, fantastic. Well worth an early morning expedition and snacks/drinks up the top. Managed a three wheel stroller, but easier to carry young children

Sunrise walk in the early morning. Lovely little walk in the centre of Ubud. I highly recommend going before the sunrise so you can see the beautiful light come out of the horizon when you are nearing the top. It is a great little walk and many of the expats living here do this regularly with their pets etc.Great!

Where i found my peace of mind.. A local friend took me here in a late afternoon for walk. It's hidden behind a temple, a bit hard to find and seems to be not very popular for everyone. I couldn't believe that such kind of place really exists. Totally fell in love with it. Strolling along that small cement road overwhelming in the beautiful green color of grass fields leading down to the valleys by my sides is such a hardly expressed feeling, it's the mixture of peacefulness, carefreeness and freedom for those wanderlust. In that moment, I believed that my mind was perfectly no worries. The road is also long enough for those who are into jogging. Absolutely excellent!!

Beautiful jogging track. When you stay in ubud, you MUST visit this track.... best time to go is in the afternoon around 5pm before the sunset.... the track is suitable for any age from toddler to the elderly, as it is quite a short walking track but every steps is very memorable... as the view on both sides of the track is beyond amazing ...

Relaxing walk. We enjoyed this walk very much as it leads you through breathtaking nature. Make sure you walk all the way to the little Warung that is located next to a wonderful rice terrasse. To arrive there you need to go through the little village at the end of the walk. You can't miss it.

Morning walk with an outstanding view. This place has a great scenery that suit with morning walk or morning exercise. Lot of people coming on the weekend, thus i suggest to come in the morning around 6.30-9.30am. You can feel the fresh air and the sounds of surrounding insects yet other birds that come into.

A great way to see some beautiful countryside by foot. We walked to the start of the ridge walk from our villa..a 40 minute plus walk before the actual ridge walk starts. We were warm before we even started and should have taken more water than we did as well as hats. The walk has some steeper sections but well pathed and the views along the way quite beautiful. We met a local man on the path and stopped for a chat. He was very informative and didnt try and sell us anything. He walks the path as a health/spiritual thing regularly. The cafes and restaurants at the end made the walk even more enjoyable as did the artists shops. We returned on foot, but you can hire a taxi to take you back to Ubud if you are footsore etc. I rate the walk as Well worth the effort.

timing is everything. the best timing to go to this place is in the morning and late afternoon around 4:30 upward as the heat is not as bad as when you do it outside these time. make sure you wear a comfortable sneakers as the the trekking is rather steep. the path is also not that smooth as shown on the picture..it's just trekking and walking while you enjoy the workout and the weather..there is no sweeping view once you reach up there...

One of the best strolls in Ubud . Also known as Bukit Cinta (Love Hill) because of the keen frequentation by local teen couples in search of a romantic hideaway, this ridge offers stunning sceneries. You can do a full loop going through Champuhan bridge, Penestanan and Karsa Spa, one of the best spas in Ubud and with a stunning restaurant space. Especially recommended in the early morning. Enjoy!

The best thing to do in Ubud. If you are first timer in ubud, MUST do this... This activity is free and healthy... Try to do opposite route to avoid the crowd and do it in very early morning as Ubud can be really hot.. You can easily combine with different route! Just bring water..

A nice romantic walk. For me, the place was a charming blend of sweet drizzle, fresh air, exotic smell and lots of greens. It was like walking in a fairy land. When the raindrops got bigger, I and my friend stopped by a small café in the middle of the forest where we had coffee and fresh juice.The Campuhan Ridge is definitely not a place to be missed when in Ubud. One can have early morning walks (or jog) to see sunrise or later in the day to see sunset, weather permitting but with rain too, it is pretty enjoyable (carry an umbrella, though).I can smell the grassy scent of the place as I write this review. If I could’ve bottled it, I would!
Perfect stroll after Karsa Spa. An easy stroll downhill back into Ubud after visit to Karsa Spa, which is awesome! Beautiful views. See Balinese homes from a distance. Finish at the Grand Palace.
lovely walk. we went there for sunset but we were having no luck with the weather. Then came back for sunrise and is was amazing! No crowds, no heat (yet) just some joggers :)

Hike to the Rice Fields. A pleasant, paved, and uphill hike from the river valley up along the ridge was rewarded with beautiful set of rice fields. Nice places to grab a drink and take in the views. Flip flops are fine. Bring water.

Awesome hike up the ridge walk!. Stunning views of the ridge valley in Ubud. The easiest way to start is the trail next to the Warwick Ibah hotel. You will see a sign that says "Ibah" and from there it is easy to see which way to go to park for the walk. Then once you start the trail you will see a small sign that reads "Going to the hill". My husband and I hiked up all the way about a mile past Karsa cafe/spa and back. It is a pretty long and tedious trek with a steep incline in some areas but my husband and I both made it as amateur inexperienced hikers. Just be sure to bring water, sunscreen, comfortable shoes, sunglasses and a hat. It was definitely a must see for the incredible views. There were not too many people and at times we were on parts of the trail by ourselves. The trail is defined well with stairs (although steep) and concrete walkways.

Peaceful walk. This place is very peaceful, calm and has great view.Walked there in the early morning. Enjoy the fresh air and great view.Go to a cafe at the end of the walk and enjoy rice fields view from there.Highly recommended walk.

Lovely walk close to town centre. Walked here early morning. Lovely walk with fantastic views either side of the ridge.Take water as it was warm even early morning.You can purchase drinks close to the end of the trip.Highly recommended walk.

Gorgeous morning walk. This hike was one of the highlights of my short stay in Ubud. I went for sunrise and was not disappointed. The views of the rice paddies at the top were stunning. Early morning for sunrise is the best time to go.
Calm walkaway. Ridge walk was very calm trail with stunning view. You can walk in the middle of Rice Field and canyon. There are also a nice coffee shops during the walk.

One of the highlights of Ubud. I've done this walk a number of time over the years. This time I did it backwards and caught a taxi to the start of the villages - smart move. Finished in under 2 hours. I was surprised at how much the area just before the 'ridge' (after the rice fields) part has changed - lots of hotels and eating places there now.

Perfect early morning stroll!. We greatly enjoy this walk which is best done from the 'top' end down to the bridge at the bottom of the hill. Ask your hotel to organise a lift up there (preferably before 8am as it gets warmer and busier thereafter). Lovely expansive views and comparative peace and quiet!

Excellent , Must do in Ubud. I heard from fellow traveller and tried. Probably one of the best things in Ubud. It's free and comes with beautiful views throughout the ridge, all natural and fresh.Must do while in Ubud. Entry is bit tricky, from hotel Ibah, thanks to some Travellers blog, go downhill from left of hotel entrance, keep right follow the temple and you hit the ridge. After 2 km there is famous Karsa Cafe for break and you will see some village houses mainly Painters. We stopped a little early to have coconut water, not for those who have knee problems and path is bit rough but scenery is worth .While coming back either you turn back from Karsa cafe, walk much further which finally goes to Ubud palace or knock the door of local villager as what we did. He dropped us to our hotel next to Blanco museum in 100k rupiah in his car.Highly recommended, free activity and Must do while in Ubud.

Stunning . A lovely walk. Do it super early in the morning or late afternoon because the heat is deadly. It offers stunning views of forest, a small village and rice fields. Just a fyi - there is no summit besides it being called a hill.

Nice scenery. The ridge walk is a pleasant change of scenery from the congested Ubud centre, although I would say the views are average at best. The walk itself is not difficult, just watch out for lizards on that path. Not bad, but not amazing.
Wandering. Awesome Kodak moments. Stunning scenery and Sari organics quenches your thirst. Relaxing meander. Very peaceful

Get up early, beat the heat!. Great walk, have breakfast at the top and walk back down. Preferably to do earlier in the morning as it's much cooler. Start by 8 or 8:30 about an hours walk or less , breakfast then 1/2 hr walk back down.

Great hike in Ubud to get away from scooters and enjoy nature. Hike in the heart of Ubud - to view the ridge and rice fields. Steep down hill start on steps; as well as steep beginning. Once on the ridge a gradual incline. Beautiful views and a nice change walking in town.

Beautiful escape from Ubud town center . This was a beautiful scenic walk and nothing too strenuous either. We did it in the late afternoon to avoid the sun but it got dark by the time we had finished our beers at Karsa cafe so we took a taxi back. Be sure to bargain with the taxi if you want a lift back though! I think it would be better to do it early morning so you can enjoy the walk back to town as well!
Good walk. Nice and quiet early in the morning.p, just after sunrises. Best time to walk, later on it gets too hot.Steep steps in the beginning, but easy going after that
Relaxing walk. This is a long but very relaxing walk. Find your zen while you walk through rice fields. Take this walk if you have a lot of time and wants to reconnect with nature!

Amazing walk!. We got up early on our first morning in Ubud and Bali and walked from our hotel near the Monkey Forest, up Monkey Forest Road, along JL Raya Ubud Road and up to Campuhan ridge. It took about half an hour to walk up through to start the walk (lots of shops etc to look in!) then we started the 2km walk along Campuhan Ridge to Karla Kafe. The walk is beautiful, you are literally walking (the wide and safe) ridge between 2 rivers and the views are stunning. It took about half an hour at most to on a relaxed pace to get to Karsa Kafe. The walk isn't hard but the uphill parts in the heat tested my breathing for sure! We had a couple of juices at Karsa Kafe with a gorgeous view of locals working the rice paddies and then walked back. We loved this walk, again we found it on Almost Landing who have a great guide of how to find the walk itself. (Walk west along Jl Raya Ubud until the end of the shops, it runs downhill with high walls and lovely hanging tree's, you then see a sign for Iba Warwick Hotel/Villas, turn in there. Just in front of you is a small sign that says "going to the hill", follow the arrow to the left and walk down the hill. Then take the steps at the bottom to the right where you'll see a sign post saying "Karsa Kafe, Campuhan Ridge, 2 km" you can't go wrong!)
off the beaten path. it's a nice small trek off the beaten path and most of all off the crazy traffic of jalan raya...there are a small bar and a bigger one during the path

Fun walk for all ages. The Campuhan Ridge Walk is good fun for all ages. My family and I started from the top and walked mostly down toward Ubud Centre. It was relaxing and fun way to get out of the hustle of central Ubud and good to just enjoy a beautiful walk. I would recommend doing this, although if the weather is hot, it is quite exposed so take sun cream, lots of water and a hat.

Great walk. This walk starts off in Ubud near the bridge walk past the school. It's not long before you feel you are in open countryside. The Karsa Cafe is towards the end, which is great to relax after the hot walk. Take plenty of water you will need it.
Nice scenery for a jogging . Really peaceful early morning and breathtaking views...Offer a hilly track which is good for a maximized exercise.Will miss it when I will continue my Bali tour!!!

Great free walk and amazing views. This walk is free and you can start from near the centre of Ubud which worked well for us. We didn't complete the whole walk but stopped off at Karsa Cafe for a drink and enjoyed the views. Well worth visiting and the steps/walk itself isn't challenging or difficult, if you can walk...you can do this

Main Reason to come to Ubud!!. I almost gave up because I was so lazy to wake up early morning :( but then I convince my self that it'll be worthed. We went at 6 AM, parked the car near Ibah and walk from there. (to park a car is quite tricky since we cant park along side the road- but just heading to Ibah and go to the left, you will find parking area at some private school right before the bridge- it applied for motorcycle too). There is signs to give clear direction about where we need to walk (thanks Karsa Cafe!) Surprisingly to arrive at the famous hill was not taking a long time. It only need 10 minutes from starting point. We spent 40 minutes just to take a picture and oftenly bump into another tourist (lot of them came here for a morning run or cycling). We didn't go along way to Karsa Cafe but this is why I came to Ubud and it's all totally WORTHED!!
Natural. You should come here and experienced nature walks and see rice fields very relaxing fresh air and clear blue skies all day
Free and Amazing! . This is such a beautiful walk/run. We walked to Karsa Cafe for breakfast one morning and then went for an early morning run on it the next.

Walk, talk, walk.... And Enjoy!!. This is a great walk but mostly uphill and thus mornings would be better. The track is pretty good but not that easy to find so make sure you have the directions before you start. Up the top you come across some great little galleries with very reasonably prices and a few cafes. The Karsa cafe in particular is worth a visit! We kept walking after a great coffee and walked back to Ubud via the longer route. You just continue and go left taking the way to BlancoMuseum... Definitely more than 2 km !! But you end up near the bridge again and going past many interesting places.The road is pretty busy but well worth it as you come across lots of locals and much better than just returning the same way.Enjoy it!
Nice scenery. Well worth a walk, it's short and am easy walk but does have steep slopes. It's not as good as publicised.

Very relaxing walk with great nature views. We did this one way and we started from the end of it :) as our hotel was close to this. I think it is a great way to do it because it ends in the centre of Ubud. It took around 45 minutes and it was lovely and easy walk that everyone can do. During the walk you pass along some villages and can stop to buy some art or souvenirs, and then will start the nature part of it. There was a coffe place tha looked very nice and different, i think the name is Karsa, and every guide will tell you to stop at this. We did not have time as we were trying to do this walk as the sun was still up, but I think you should try it if you have the time.I would recommend doing this either early in the morning or in the afternoon when it is not too hot outside. But definetly while you have daylight! I think it is very scary during night!

A good place for a stroll - especially in the afternoon.. The ridge is good for an easy around 30 minutes walk. The trail is pretty-well built with high grass on both sides and a bit of a downhill view. Try to go there in the afternoon though - after 5 pm, otherwise it's going to scorching hot!

A must do in Ubud. I am not the fittest person by far but I completed this walk with my hubby and really enjoyed it. The scenery is beautiful and there lots of photo opportunities. We had breakfast at the Karsa Kafe which was really good after which we headed back into town. You can continue on for ages if you like. The walk is easy to find just look for the Warwick Ibah hotel on JL Raya Ubud and follow the signs.

Would definitely recommend.... It takes about an hour to reach the end of the walk. You can either walk back the same way you went or hitch a ride from the café with a small fare. Worth the hike. There is a really nice café at the end of the walk which I would recommend to freshen up after the walk

Long long road. The track is easy for pedestrian, even bicycle can go through this way. Here and there are grass and trees surrounding. What we can see only green. A long river with clear water down there. In fact, a village you can find after walking along 2 km. No ticket fee to acccess to this place.
Lovely. No fee, no one selling things, just a beautiful walk. Highly suggest while in ubud. We went mid morning and it was starting to get more busy but not overcrowded
Great walk! Must do!. The walk was beautiful, however try to avoid times when the sun is fully out since it can get very hot and draining. A bottle of water wouldn't be a bad idea.
good walk. Beautiful landscapes which needs to be seen in Ubud, but be careful what time you going for that walk, avoid the heat, no entrace fee for a change :) ...

Beautiful walk. A little hard to find the start of this (you have to kind of walk down a hotel driveway) but there was a good blog I found that helped with instructions. Once you get on the walk it is very well marked. Walk all the way to the end, there are some beautiful layered rice paddies.

Long or short walk, depending on what you want. You can choose the long route by walking the driveable road, or you can choose to get dropped off/picked up and only walk the footpath. It's a beautiful walk, best at early mornings or sunset. You'll meet locals as well as other tourists. Small cafes to buy drinks etc, plus some small shops and art galleries. A stop at Karsa cafe or the spa is recommended!
Lovely walk. No entrance feeAn easy, relaxing walk through the beautiful greenery in the middle of Ubud. Amazing at sunset!
Nice walk. Been here, done that before. it is becoming more and more touristy. Make sure to try and start early to avoid the heat of the day. Good exercise and nice scenery of course.

A beautiful walk!. I've loved this ridge since the first time I took a walk there 20 years ago. I've walked it every time I visit Ubud. I'm so happy that it's as beautiful and lush as I remember it, even though more people go through it now. It's such a great place to find relief from the traffic chaos that's now dominating Ubud for most of the day.
Best thing in ubud. No one rips you off, it's peaceful and not over rated. Go in the morning and go to the cafe half way.

Amazing and refreshing!. Set off in the morning to avoid the heat. It is a great place to job, walk, ride a bike. Beautiful view of the little villages, palm trees and rice fields. Definitely a must in Ubud!

What a nice breeze of walk. I visited this ridge walk on sunday morning, it was not a hard hiking and I was blown away with the scenery. It was so green, breezy even the weather was a bit cloudy. The Village behind this walk is a cute and artistic. One of the quiet place in Ubud in the morning.

Great walk...for young and old. This walk is a must if visiting Ubud. My suggestion is early or late and it can be quite hot in the middle of the day. Not too strenuous and you can take your time to check out the vista views. The Restaurant is a lovely spot for drink with great views upstairs. Do yourself a favour and walk around the beautiful gardens and if you have time to spare there is a day spa to enjoy before your trek back to the main road. A thoroughly enjoyable day!

A pleasant walk. This is a pleasant short walk to do (2/3km). The scenery is lovely and it's a peaceful escape from the centre of Ubud. We stopped for a drink a Karsa Kafe, which is a great place to unwind, before wandering back down the path.

Good trek but very hot. There will be a sign showing 2km to reach a restaurant, however to reach the peak only about 1km. It's better to go very early in the morning or late afternoon since during the midday the sun shines very bright and it was difficult to get a good photo with camera phone. Also the heat was unbearable if we go in the midday. Very nice view.

Hidden gems . The walk was easy. We hit the ridge at 3pm so it was kind of hot but it was also windy at the same time. The view was impressive. For me the gem is what's waiting for you at the end of the walk. Beautiful rice field, small artist shop, coconut juice etc...

our 6 year old loved this walk. we did this walk with our 2 children (aged 6 & 3) the oldest walked the entire time, on a particularly hot day, without complaint our youngest needed to be carried half the way & enjoyed running/walking the other half. It was very relaxing and peaceful with great views. We stopped at Karsa Cafe which was a great wee place for a refreshment before continuing on our way.

Stunning Views. Short walk out from Ubud town center takes you on an excellent 2km hike with rice terraces and valley views of Ubud. Well worth the visit. Lovely cafe at the top overlooking the rice terraces to relax with a coconut drink. Popular with locals too.. tricky start but easy once on the track.

Short but sweet. Really enjoyed this walk - was easy going, which was great in the heat. Beautiful scenery, lovely temple at the Ubud end, but the ridge part is paved and only a couple of kilometres long, then you go back to normal roads, so not really a proper hike. That said, apparently the route is 9km in total - we only did 4km (from Ubud centre to Jungle Fish).

A great way to see the area. The Ridge Walk offers stunning views of sweeping hills and rice paddies and a stroll through tiny villages. Perfect way to ground yourself after a long flight and a welcome relief from busy central Ubud. Following the loop back into town can be a bit tricky and there are some steep inclines along narrow roads with blind curves - a little too close to oncoming scooters and cars. You can follow the walk halfway and then turn and come back to avoid the busier roads. Doing this walk early in the day is recommended - we started at 9:00am and it was already almost too warm. There are many areas with no shade and it is HOT! You can stop for refreshments at a few cafes along the way but bring plenty of water. The loop took the full three hours.

Worth it ;). Very relaxing walk with beautiful scenary. If doing it mid day, don't forget the sunscreen as it is quite hot up there ;) end of the walk you reach Karsa cafe & spa. Very nice location; would have loved to book a massage but they were full.You can even go in the rice fields just next to the cafe. Several painting shops with very nice art. Do buy something if you like it, prices are very reasonable and most of the shops are ran by the painters themselves.

Nice walk and amazing view. If you are in Ubud, you definitely need to visit Campuhan Ridge Walk. You will have a walk uphill for about 2 km's and in this walk you will find so many nice nature around you. Beside the nature it is so quite and you can hear the birds for example. After 2 km's you will find a small bar where you can stop and relax with some cold drinks. They are very friendly. We didn't walk further after this 2 km's, because this was the best part of the Campuhan Ridge Walk. Recommendation is to bring enough water with you for the uphill trip.

Serene and Picturesque. Such a delight in busy Ubud. The walk to the cafe is an easy 2kms. Beautiful early morming stroll. Great views, serene, plenty of photo opportunities along the way. Spectacular at sunrise, a must do in Ubud

Nice scenery but a bit short. Campuhan ridge walk is more of a nice, pleasant stroll than a hike. The path can be quite busy on weekends, and its location, smack-dab in the heart of Ubud, makes it very accessible to the crowds of tourists that visit the town.Overall, the views are pleasant but don't expect to see the nicest terraced rice field there (you might want to go visit Jatiluwih). Its short duration (less than 1h), as well as the lack of steepness makes it a great choice for families and the elderly.

Loved it. My husband and I did the walk and we're delighted to find ourselves on our own for most of the time. I the beginning we were enticed to enter the small farm of "Mama Wayan" who showd us all the things she grows, and offered us fresh young coconut and cocoa beans (which I've been munching now for days, love them!) for a small amount of money. It was a lovely start to a beautiful walk, incredible scenery and fresh air. Just walk and enjoy and forget about everything else. After the walk which took us maybe a good 3 hours at a slow pace we went to Clear Cafe located not too far away - highly recommended.

A Memorable Experience . I visted the Camphuan Ridge Walk with my travel companion and had an amazing experience.We walked the 2km to the Karsa Cafe.( I think it was 3) The scenery around Camphuan Ridge was simply stunning and breath taking definitely worth the uphill climb.Looking at the rice paddies,cows and other wildlife was an experience I won't forget.The Karsa Cafe was a nice end to the walk supplying lovely refreshing drinks and food. Definitely a must for those after a different experience not on the tourist route. Not as vigorous a walk as you imagine. A totally invigorating walk.

Lovely walk and must stop at Karsa Kafe for a drink. Found this place on TRipAdvisor, otherwise we would never have come across it, as it is on the outskirts of the main town at the far end of the Main Street. It is signposted, just after you cross the bride. Well worth the trip, a lovely relaxed walk, after a bit of a steep initial climb, but then you feel as though you are miles outside of busy Ubud, not minutes. Surrounded by nature with beautiful views, you pass a few homes and a couple of places selling paintings, then you happen across Karsa Kafe.....This restaurant is built of wood on wooden stilts, surrounded by koi lakes with lotus and lilies. It is absolutely stunning, and such a nice place to stop for a refreshing drink, or lunch. I think they would pick you up for evening meal from your hotel, which if we'd had time, we would have done for sure.

Enjoyable walk through the valley. I thoroughly enjoyed this walk around 7am every day of my Ubud stay. There's some lovely views over the valley. So relaxing and peaceful to be surrounded by nature. A fantastic cafe called Karsa Cafe is at the end of the walk and definitely worth a stop off to enjoy the rice fields vista and pretty, calming and tranquil lotus pond sipping an awesome Balinese coffee

Nice walk - would recommend. We did this our first morning in Ubud - beautiful views along the way - thought it was an easy walk but it does get hot. We only went to the restaurant at the spa - sat upstairs and had a snack and coconut water - great view from up there and the spa is really beautiful. Real nice man that has his own shop that he paints in - we all bought something from him. Would definitely recommend doing this.
Nice Stroll. Went here midday, and took a nice long stroll. Views all around, good spot for a picture. If it's in the area, worth a visit.

Great trip to relax. Take a chill from Ubud central and make your way along this very easy, yet relaxing walk. Yes it's on the ridge between 2 green luscious valleys but that's the charm. And where there is charm people will come. Busy with locals and tourists and why not. You don't need a map or a guide book it's sign posted along the way.A good chance to check out the rice paddies as they are farmed!

Enjoy the fresh air and nature!. You start with passing by the great temple. The view of the temple is really great. All sites are nice, even though it is better if local people cultivate the site for rice or other crop plantation which not reducing people eagerness to come as the trekking already set properly. But of course surround it is already cultivated. I really enjoy the fresh air there

Magical. Was so surprised to see this not far from bustling central Ubud. Very quiet and peaceful, you really get the jungle /rainforest feeling as you are surrounded by it as you walk on the ridge. Once you start the walk follow the arrows to this kasa cafe (forgot that also has a spa but was fully booked. Great to have a drink or some snacks.

Escape from the Ubud streets. Really calm and scenic walk outside Ubud. It was nice to escape the bustle of central Ubud and there's plenty to see. Rice paddies, locals carving, spiders, lizards, jungle, temples, etc. We must have missed a turn somewhere because we probably walked about 8 miles, down hills, up hills, through random neighborhoods, etc. If you do get lost or just tire of the heat, there are taxis all over the place, they can get you back home for a couple dollars.

Beautiful and peaceful walk through the rice fields. Campuhan Ridge Walk starts right behind the beautiful Parahyangan Jagat Payogan Agung Gunung Lebah temple, some 200m from the bridge over Campuhan river. It goes up the ridge, through rice fields (these are not terraces though, but rather huge rice meadows). The path is hardened (concrete and concrete slabs), so high walking shoes are not absolutely required (although advised).After some 1.5 km the path changes into an asphalt road and approaches a hamlet with a few farm houses, restaurants, hostels and a small temple. Then the road seems to continue into more inhabited areas (although we came back, so I cannot really tell).For the first 1.5 km there is no protection from the sun and no drinkable water, so bring your own water, and on a sunny day get some protection from the sunburn.The view in the fields is gorgeous, especially close to sunset, when the shadows are long and all the ridges and gorges on both sides of the walk are beautifully exposed.If you intend to return to Ubud center, the easiest way is to return the same path you just walked. You may also get a lift in the villages ahead, but it is quite a distance by car/bike (the road goes far around the rice field before it returns to Ubud).

Beautiful in the morning. You should go this walk. I recommend doing it in the morning. Early morning! Don't worry, you can not get lost, the path is paved all the way. Be sure to also see this side of Ubud so that you know that just 5 minutes away there is tranquility and beautiful nature.

Good little walk 7 views. Good little walk, great views and pretty relaxing. We didn't make the whole walk, sadly we had eaten so much this holiday that our poor legs couldn't carry our expanding carcasses the whole way....

Don't skip this lovely walk. First of all: don't expect to much of it. It is just a lovely walk on the ridge of a hill but well worth seeing. At the beginning of the walk you will find a beautiful temple, on the way you will have some nice sceneries and at the end you will find yoursef in the middle of the ricefields. Best of all: it is really not that far from the buzy city.

Beautiful walk, incredible views. Such a brilliant walk. So quickly you can forget you are in a town like Ubud. Green vistas, trees, wildlife. And a fantastic organic cafe at the end. I wore Birkenstocks and coped absolutely fine. It's hot - so maybe choose your time of day wisely or be armed with lots of water.

Stunning views. This is a lovely walk most times of the day but especially in the morning wjen it is a bit cooler and fresher. The walk takes about 45 mins to one hour depending on which direction you take. I did it the easier (downhill) way ending up at the Ibah Hotel in Ubud.It is a great wlak, excellent views and phot opps.

Relaxing hike. Not to be missed. Easy hike over rice paddies ending at Karsa spa and restaurant. Second time doing this. This time in a light drizzle late afternoon and dinner overlooking rice paddies at sunset at Karsa restaurant on upper level
Nice short walk - to be done early morning. Better done early morning to avoid the Balinese heat - suitable for young kids (at least 3/4 years old)

Phenomenal. I walked along the ridge to get to Karsa Spa for a massage. Most fabulous was the temple near the start of the walk, but all of it was gorgeous. The length of it took me less than 30 minutes to walk, though I did not take any detours. There were plenty of prople walking, but it never felt crowded. I look forward to doing this again.

Not a must-do, but nice. Went there yesterday afternoon around 5 and it took me half an hour one way. It feels good to be out in the nature for a little while, escaping Ubud's traffic and hectic. The "trek" itself is a relaxed walk for an average healthy person. There are a few decent lookout spots, but nothing spectacular. Didn't go to Karsu Cafe btw, but had a coconut water at an old lady's place. Karsu is expensive!

Easy walk good for early morning. The ridge trail is short, but the scenery is nice. After 9am, an umbrella will be very useful. At the end of the trail, there are nice villages to explore, with boutique hotels, villas, small galleries, spa & cafes. On a clear day volcanic peaks can be seen from the rice field. The trail entrance is not marked on the main road. Just look for the sign for Warwick Hotel on Jl. Raya Ubud (walking from Ubud market to the Palace and Lotus Cafe & keeping on, walking on the right).

Real highlight!!. We absolutely loved this 3hr(ish) walk. Stunning views and hardly any other people. A real snapshot of Balinese life outside of Ubud's busy centre. The rice fields were beautiful (so beautiful we actually felt we didn't need to go to the famous Tegalalang terrace.) Quite easy to get lost after the main ridge, but finding our way back was half the fun!
Great walk!. Excellent walk not too hard, picturesque, best advice people.. go early, once sun is high too hot. And it's free!!

Easy walk and Amazing view. Easy and straightforward walk from central Ubud. Very scenic and way better than in the pictures you can see on the internet. It might get very sunny and hot so better bring sunscreen and water.

Amazing views !. Great views, amazing setting, enjoyable and easily doable fot all ages. Both our 6 and 15y loved it. Great little stop along the way to grab some fresh coconut juice, interesting artist along the way making and sellong handpainted eggs. Great !
If you're bored..... Nice enough, but not as fabulous as some reviewers would have you believe. Quiet, which was welcome.

Don't miss this walk. This is a wonderful walk but hard going if you go uphill. My suggestion, if you don't feel like the hard uphill slog, is to get a taxi to Karsa Cafe and walk back downhill. The rice terrace views are stunning and early morning or late afternoon are the best times to go.

Early morning walk. Got up early this morning and headed off to do the campus an ridge walk before 6.30am was a good time of day. Walk was fairly easy,!with some nice opportunities for photos especially with the sun just coming up. Not too many people about walked through the village at the top which was nice we were too early for the cafe robe open but stop there for a drink of water and some photos, lovely. The only thing that spoilt it for me was that a lot of the vegetation along the path most of of it actually was weed. Someone one day will need to do some weed control or the beautiful Ubud will be ruined not just by commercialism but by weed.!it is sad to see such beautiful surrounding getting overtaken by weed. With all the environmentally friendly people living in the area someone should start a Landcare group if not one already.

Nice walk in early morning and late afternoon. This walking trail is before the Campuhan bridge. Some steps and elevation. Make sure to wear good walking shoes. The view was amazing at the trail. It is like 2 kilometers long and you can walk until the end of the road to reach Karsa Cafe.

Great stroll in Ubud. A very recommended walk in Ubud, easy to reach from Ubud and dotted with small art shops and yoga/spa places. It's not a hard walk, so suitable for children and couch potatoes. Bring mosquito repellent, even during the day!

Great Walk!. This is a great walk and like many other reviewers have mentioned it ends with Karsa Café/Spa as a welcome reward. Stunning views and an easy path make it a great thing to do. We stayed in Como by Ubud and waited until the clouds came in before walking down to the start of the ridge and then walking to Karsa and back before returning to the hotel. I've seen this described as a trek but i'm not so sure! It was a comfortable walk for me and my wife (30 & 31) but as it's hot in Bali you will need some water. Including a drink and relax at Karsa I would allow around 2 hours to complete this as on the way in we grabbed loads of photos and looked at locals shops, rice fields and paintings. On the way back we didn't stop and it took about 20-25 minutes to get back to the roadside! Don't get a guide, it's free and easy to complete. Well worth doing!
Beautiful walk! Highly recommend!. Lovely walk or even run along the beautiful ridge! A must if in Bali! Check out Karsa Spa cafe after 2KM! Very quirky little place! Enjoy!

Great view . A really nice little hike. You definitely want to come back the same way you go since the road around is really busy. I went to Karsa Spa and loved it but you probably need a reservation since they are busy. It took about 35 minutes to walk one way.

Nice walk in the semi-countryside. There are not a lot of signs on the main road (west on the main road where the palace meets Monkey Forest Road) As you walk left at the top of Monkey Forest Road maybe 100 meters or so before the bridge, before the covered area of the road it is on the right hand side of the road. No signs to say though, just an "Ibah" hotel sign, so you head down to the left on that short road, maybe 50 meters, (Ibah on the right) then take the stairs down to your right. There is a moto parking area on the left just before the stairs on the right. The first thing you will walk by on your left is a temple... the road/trail becomes paved in stone or concrete the further you go down the trail. There are many rice fields and and open grassy areas. Many hillside villas along the way, many galleries and homestays as well. It was a nice walk not so far from the town, but less crowded for sure.

Stone Path. A few helpful tips, try to do this walk in the early morning or the early evening. There is little to no shade along the path so sunblock and a hat would be helpful. The walk itself is not hard. There are a few small hills but I didn't find it challenging. The stone path can be a little problematic. I have small feet so I felt at times like I was playing leap frog in order to not trip between pavers. There is a spa along the way called Karsa Spa. It's rated number one in Ubud. Make sure to book appointments ahead of time. They seem to always be booked. I had a foot reflexology and it was very good. Definitely released some blockages. I felt it immediately. There is also the Karsa Cafe right in front of the spa. I grabbed a drink and s snack before my treatment. It was nice to cool down and relax before I checked in at the spa.
Lush and Peaceful. This was my 4th visit and Champuhan Ridge is still on my "Must Visit" list each time I am in Ubud. Beautiful views amidst nature with clean air.

Lovely walk. We did this walk but only to the Karsa Kafe nigh is about 2km one way.We are 3 ladies, youngest being 56 and the oldest being 75.On the way to the cafe a lot of the way is slightly uphill with a few steps at the start but most of the way is fine.We started the walk about 9am and was quite warm.Early morning or late afternoon would've been a better time.The stop at the cafe was lovely, beautiful scenery and a nice cold drink.
A breath of fresh air from busy Ubud central. Rolling hills, friendly locals, fresh air and many photo opprtunities along the way! Definitely worth a walk.

Get a little exercise. The Ridge Way walk starts next to the Ibah Hotel with a steep walk down the brick paved hill. A look to the left at the river crossing will provide you with a view of two converging rivers, which is considered very holy. After crossing the river follow the paved walk-way which takes you up hill where you will find yourself on the ridge between the two rivers. By continuing your walk for about two kilometres you will find a lovely warung for a meal and or a drink. You may decide to return to Ubud via the ridge way or continue on to take a left turn at the road. This will take you to a good bit of exercise as you climb the hill, where once at the crest you follow the road to the left. At the T junction turn left again and follow the road back into Ubud. Stop at a warung for another drink or hail a taxi for the three kilometre drive back to the Ubud markets. Enjoy the walk while enjoying the views.

Increasingly the thing to do whilst in Ubud. I have done this walk hundreds of times. You can either start near the bridge at Campuan down the hill from Ubud or at the other end at the village of Bangkiang Sidem (tell the taxi driver that or Klub Kokos). If you start at Bangkiang Sidem it is basically all down hill and will take you no more than 30 minutes moving quickly. But if you are fit or take your time you can start at Campuan and either do (1) the round trip - once you get to the top I would recommend you walk on at least one km and have a drink at Karsa Kafe which has fish ponds and which are fun for children OR (2) keep going and walk all the way back to Ubud via Lungsiakan and Payogan - turn left at the first road to the left 1km after Karsa Kafe and continue to the main road where you turn left and which leads all the way back to Ubud via Campuan. Be aware that option 2 has a very steep hill of some few hundred meters. Walking quickly and being fit the round trip from Campuan to Campuan will take 1 1/2 hours but there are lots of places to stop and look at such as art galleries and cafes so I would allow 3 hours. The walk on the ridge gets very hot after 11 as the grass on each side of the track holds the heat. The locals clean up rubbish on ridge walk so it is remarkably clear of rubbish compared to elsewhere so please help them by not littering. There are blue coloured rubbish bins at different points on the ridge walk.
Nice walk but nothing impressive. If you have seen some rice fields before then these don't impress you. Though it's a nice walk away from the crowds.
Day trip. We did this with the ebike tour and loved it.The scenery is spectacular and you feel like you are really getting a taste of the real Bali.We would do this again by foot or bike.

Enjoyable walk through the rice fields and villages. A relatively easy walk from the centre of Ubud, passing through the rice fields and small villages, above the Wos River. There is a good cafe overlooking the area for refreshments.
Nice rest-bite from Ubud. A lovely easy walk, peaceful break from the hustle and traffic noise of Ubud. Lots of other people doing it though!

Near Ubud, easy and with good landscape . I want just to say that i made this treekking and i rented a flat for 1 month without planning. It is about 2-3 hours. Many people who stay in Ubud make daily walkings here at mornings. You will like here.

Well worth the effort. We almost didn't fit this in, but were very glad we did. It was a pleasant, scenic walk, and the well-signposted cafe at the top was great. There's also a very talented artist (on the left heading up) who is well worth visiting.
Great walk. A good break from the hustle of Ubud. Around quiet coconut valleys around sacred rivers, this is not near buy Ubud. Go to the number one day spa at the end, K

Nice chance to walk in Ubud. It is a nice green path in the hill. Quite shirt though :( In fact, this path from the pictures is 2 minutes long but to get there will take 10 - 15 minutes. Dont forget water and snacks! Will be nice to make a stop on top and enjoy the view.

Lovely walk but easy to get lost!. The walk over the ridge provides some really lovely scenery and there are some great cafes/warungs along the way. Only slight problem is we got a little lost on the way back, ended up walking along a busy road - not quite as good. My advice would be to get a better map (we were using the guide book) or at the top of the ridge turn and walk back down. Also it is quite an exposed route, little shade if any, so sunscreen/hat are an essential.
Nice easy walk. A walk of about 2km with lovely views over hillside jungle, villas and rice fields. Reward yourself at the end of the walk with a coffee or juice in the cafè by the rice fields.

The ridge walk shows you the rural side of Ubud. This is definitely worth doing. Go early morning, don't forget your hat and sunscreen. We saw a Balinese couple having there wedding photos taken there.

Relaxing walk around rice terraces. I have spent two hours walking among the rice terraces and hearing the water flowing near the small road that take you from the caos of motorcycles of the center of Ubud to a beautiful and peaceful place.You can find a few coffee shops that sells delicious fruit juices (not only!) and some artisans as well.The people you see around is polite, they don't harass the tourists.It's free and you don't need guides or anything... Just bring your camera!
Incredibly peaceful. Another great little walk with plenty of cafes and small restaurants along the way. as with other reviews be sure to wake up early to beat the sun and bring a hat.
Try another walk down the road.. I enjoyed this walk but isn't as beautiful as the one nearby that passes Ubud Yoga House, Sari Organic etc....give that one a go!

Nice walk over the valley. The walk is easy to find, the view is beautiful through small villages and rice fields.
The return along a main road is less relaxing but enables to discover an interesting district with artists galleries and nice shops.

Worth while . This is a pretty easy stroll, and so close to the centre of Ubud but you feel so far away from the traffic! Beautiful scenery and if you feel a bit hot at the end of the walk you can cool down with a nice drink at Karma cafe. Beautiful walk, free and peaceful.
stunning. you should take this walk in the early morning hours..maybe u will meet some residents walking their dogs...also its the best light for takin pics
Easy Walk. Did this walk on late afternoon. Scenery rice field, peaceful, clean. Great opportunity to enjoy the day, taking some pictures or just walk uphill. Recommended visit
Worth taking the walk. We decided to do this since we had some time left and took the walk straight away from central Ubud. Loved the experience and the drinks at the Karsa Cafe.
Fresh. Its a very lovely place with outstanding views eazy to find and not far from ubud u can go walking, it was refreshing to go there ,

A Lovely Walk along the ridge from Ubud to the Kasa Cafe. We did the walk along Camphuan Ridge around 09:30am - it wasnt overly hot and in fact had a heavy shower along the way which was actually really nice. The walk to the Kasa Cafe and Spa is only a couple of Km and pretty easygoing. The scenery for the first 2/3 is very beautiful, peaceful and relaxing and then you hit a village along with roadside artists selling their "original" works. There were some lovely artworks and we purchased one of some Koi which we hadnt seen anywhere else before. I was really impressed with one artist Wayan Rana whose work was really beautiful, he does painting classes there also and though there are similarities in the painting you see his stand out as pretty exceptional. Once you get close to the Kasa Cafe there are motorcycles and cars so the ambience changes somewhat. Still a really nice walk though - can be a little tricky finding the entrance/start of the walk - its about 800m or so past the Royal Palace - directly opposite the On The Bridge Restaurant
Great walk, ended too soon! . We loved this walk, only wished it was longer as took 30 minutes if that. Lovely early in the morning before it got too hot!

Pleasant walk with a lot to see. This wasn't the best thing I did in Ubud, but it was a great way to fill a couple of hours one afternoon. It takes you around rice paddies and near to a river. We stopped at the Karsa cafe and got some of the largest coconuts I've ever had (much needed - we were quite sweaty after all the walking!).

Beautiful and peaceful . I loved this walk so much I did it twice! Immediately you are out of the craziness that is ubud and the views are amazing all the way to the volcanoes. I walked up the ridge, onto the road and then took the first road over the river and walked back south on the road. From this road you can take some paths off to the west that go through the serene paddies. Amazing!

Great way to explore outside Bali. The ridge walk is a really fun adventure. I would highly recommend booking a massage at Karsa spa at the top as well. The walk has beautiful views and is both popular with locals and tourists. I recommend going in the morning in the evening as it gets hot!

Amazing views!!. The Campuhan Ridge Walk is such a lovely walk and a really nice with dogs! It is best to go early in the mornning, or last thing at night as it can get quite hot. Best to wear sunscreen. Only a short walk from the centre of Ubud.

UBUD WALK WITH AMAZING VIEW. This is my first time to walk along the Campuhan Ridge Walk. The view is so beautiful with the river valley on both our sides. It is a pity we start late in the afternoon. It seems an early morning walk is much better for nicer view with Mount Agung in the horizon.

Amazing view!. If you love nature, you would love Campuhan as much as i did. Best to go early in the morning (before 9am) to avoid the heat. I walked up Campuhan Ridge and stopped at Karsa Spa and enjoyed a spa experience (prior reservation required) before walking back to where the entrance on the ridge walk.

Stunning Scenery. The walk is lovely but could be challenging for the elderly.I have done it more than once and it simply gets better and better. The views and peaceful surroundings take my breathe away. The sari organic village walk is nearby & it is also a lovely walk to do and enjoy lovely little shops and cafes along the way. A great area to stay also for peace & quiet and relaxation.

Stunning morning . Get there early and take in the beauty of the rice terraces. It's my favourite run! Bring a few rupiah with you (park at the museum) so you can get a delusions coffee and snack or a coconut after your hike :)

Attractiveness Depends on Your Purpose. like what i said in the title, if you want to go jogging and walking, then this is a great place for you. because the road is well maintained. but if you want to see some scenery or what, then this is not the place for you. but for me this is a nice place. the parking fee was 5k idr for motorbike and there werent any entrance fee at all. at the end of the road, a cafe will wait for you.
good hiking. go here it so exciting place, so green many local also do hiking in the morning, we have a lot sweat here,

Beautiful . It's steeper than I thought, all the pictures I've seen are pretty much of a beautiful flat path. It's not really like that. We took a pram which we carried up the stairs for our 2 year old and even though it was tough going that crappy $20 stroller from kmart was amazing. We where able to go the whole way to kafe and get their amazing food and juices. Go early if you can, we got there at 10am and back out by 1pm with a 45 min stop and 2 children.
Great walk. Was a great walk! My wife and I left town at 4.45pm and it was a pleasant walk up to Karsa Cafe! Easy walking! Great views! Not to busy on the track

Great afternoon walk. We did this walk on an afternoon when the weather was overcast and it was very pleasant. The rice fields and village scenery was quiet nice. And the walk is obviously popular with tourists so easy to do for someone on their own. Ample opportunity to get refreshments at the 2k mark and next time we would make time to do an extended walk.

Great Views. Good if you want to get a sweat up heading uphill or just pleasant downhill if you start from the Northern end. Mix it with the rice paddy walk for a good half day out. Google Maps a must- not that well signposted.
Beautiful walk. It's a really beautiful walk, and the temple at the start (or end?) is amazing too. Can't miss this!Best to go in the morning when it's not too hot :) enjoy!
Okay. Nice to have a walk and get out of Ubud chaos, but nothing too special. Ricefields view is nice but I would do this only if you have lots of time to spend.
Good walk nice views . Rice fields are limited to near the Kafe. Views are nice and you will get some good pics. Temple at the beginning of the walk is really nice

Don't miss this hidden treasure.. This walk is absolutely stunning! It's sad to think that many people visit Ubud and never know the Campuhan Ridge Walk exists. Do it in the early morning before it gets too hot and enjoy a meal at the Karsa Kafe at the end of the walk. You'll be so happy you did. Just take the walkway that veers left, up the driveway of the Hotel Ibah.
Nice short walk. Take your time to do the walk as its not that far. The views are great. Dont try to find an alternative route for the way back, you will only walk on roads with cars and motorbikes.

Nice walk. In spite of all The negative comments about it being overrated and crowded with tourists, i enjoyed this walk a lot. I went in the morning and it was pretty quiet. Do stop for a fresh juice or coffee at the karsa café!

Lonely Planet version of this walk is awful. The lonely planet book maps out this walk as an 8.5km loop. The first half of this walk up to Klub kolos is nice and peaceful. Views over tropical forest, rice terraces etc. (Although nowhere near as spectacular as the jatiluwih rice fields it's still off road and away from the noise of central ubud). However, when you get to Klub kolos, which is a nice cafe with views of the rice terrace it's time to turn back and come back the way you came. You will have had a nice walk. If you carry on to sangingan then you will be hugging the side of a small road as lots of scooters and motorbikes speed past at 90 miles an hour constantly beeping their horns at you and at each other. After the stress of this you will have to do the last 5k of this loop down the Jl Raya Sanggingan, which is a really busy, noisy, dirty main road. I have no idea why the lonely planet map out this route but don't waste your time on it. You will end up tired and stressed and dizzy from the petrol fumes and the only thing you will be able to hear is the constant 'beep Beep' of aggressive Balinese scooter drivers.

Great view and Karsa cafe. The path is easy to find and you get into the greens very soon. The path is well defined and very soon you will see a pretty valley and also abundant greenery all around. After about 30 minutes walk we found ourselves at Karsa Cafe, a great stopover for beer, lazing around in the middle of fields, watching the ducks in the fields around the cafe. We did not complete the entire walk and returned the way we came to get back to the centre of Ubud. We would have liked to go back again but our stay at Ubud was just 3 days

Lush peace and a splendid view. Definitely worth doing this if you are in Ubud. The noise, mopeds, street traffic and taxi touts were wearing thin, and this, easy going, short walk gave us respite. The cafe was good after 2km and we then went to Bridges for a lovely meal.
Awesome view. Good place to do jogging with green view around and the track is so challenging. Nice to biking here too.

Nice views. It was a very nice mini hike with great views, and end it at Karsa cafe with a couple of beers to enjoy your way back ;) a 4 km walk that deserves to be done. You do not need a private tour as it is near and free walk. Make sure to get down to the river at the end/ start-point near JI Raya Ubud street

Beautiful walk through ricefields. The Campuhan Ridge Walk is a nice 4km walk through beautiful ricefields. Its about 2 km one way, and 2 km back to Ubud citycentre. The signs are clear.Along the way you will see a few cafes. Have a rest there.When i walked the walk, it was raining, but still pretty.

Good walk, Nice Views, But Nothing Special.. We did the shorter walk (bad knee!), but also on the advice of locals that we know. They (and some reviewers on Trip Advisor) recommended this as the village at the end of the 'long' walk has become very touristy and is no longer the delightful place it was in the past. Also, the longer walk apparently goes via a lot of roads eventually, and not through the lovely fields/ridge. The views were nice, but nothing we hadn't seen before. It was a good walk and not too taxing, nevertheless we were quite warm when we reached Karsa Kafe at the short-walk turn-around point. We went in August and left Ubud at around 11am. (High season July/August - no humidity compared to other months)! If you go during other months of the the year you will need to leave early morning or late afternoon to avoid the heat/humidity.

An OK hike but nothing more. We started the hike at around 10:00 AM - sun was out, and indeed it can become hot. When we started, it wasn't busy yet, on our way back there where lot's of fellow-tourists doing the same hike.I didn't find the hike very special - there are great views but honestly, Bali is full with great views. Parts of the hike were not that pretty (abandoned construction sites etc.).And around 11:30AM it became busy at a level where it started to be annoying. Sorry to say that this hike didn't make my day (whereby I have to emphasise that Ubud as a whole made a great impression... especially the great variety of awesome warnings & restaurants)

Nice views and a good finish line at Karsa Café. A good hike in the fields of Ubud. You can see the forest around the town, a beautiful Temple just in the middle of the trees and you can have a good time to refuel energies at Karsa Café, where you can find a spa. Be prepare to walk and to a strong heat.

It was a bit disappointing. All the buildup and it's just a walk on a ridge surrounded by the city. It's alright to go to if you have a free morning or something but otherwise there are better things to see and do.

Nice walk. The Campuhan Ridge Walk is a must do when you are in Ubud. You have an amazing view on rice fields and you can meet nice smilling farmers ready to show you how they work in the paddles if you want.I ve done it twice and it's calming, relaxing to walk peacefully.Quick Tip : Bring water and avoid to go in hot hours, the sun hits quiet hard up there.Enjoy your trip to and while you are there, stop for a while at the Karsa café and spa, you will love it !Cheers
Nature hike next to our hotel. This was just right next to our hotel. We did a evening walk up the ridge, but did not go far before turning back. Go in the early morning or evening when it's cooler.

Wonderul hike with gorgeous views. I did this hike 4 times during my stay in Ubud .It was a 20 minute walk ,along the hustling and bustling Ub ud main road, fro Monkey Forest road,where I was staying. I saw many people doing the hike in flip floos..but I suggest running shoes as it is quite steep in thr beginning. Lovely views from the ridge,very much a jungle feel!  As it flattens out..on the well made path..the rice fields are on either side.with local farmers plowing and harvesting. Very interesting to watch. Thr Karsa cafe.which is after 2kn..serves a excellent Jamu juice and fresh coconut water.

Nice walk that takes you out of the bustle. Lovely little walk that is not too strenuous but provides some beautiful views of the valleys of Ubud. The walk leads to some nice rice padis, cafes, and restaurants, before a leisurely stroll back down to the town.

Simple, Enchanting, Memorable. One of my fave parts about Ubud was this ridge walk. Seemingly there isn't much to it but once I started walking, a feeling of peace and contentment washed over me. It's a beautiful walk, and not too difficult. I did in running shoes. I started around 9am hoping to avoid the worst of the heat but that didn't last long.
