I had the path to myself for 80% of the time, encountering just a few school kids in the way. You can definitely go at your own pace and make this as short or as long as you want. I did end the trek at Karsa Spa, which I highly recommend as a way to cool off. Again there was hardly anyone there and you feel like you have the place/rice fields to yourself. It's just a simple, but very peaceful walk, and I loved the fact that it was hidden in plain sight i.e. tucked away just at the brink of town. Highly recommend.

Nice family stroll. Campuhan ridge walk is a lovely walk to do with the family. I would say it's no more than 2 kilometers long. Only one slight hill but other than that it's easy going for adults and kids. We started off 730AM. Ended up at karsa cafe and then returned. This is a morning activity and well worth the effort

Nice calming walk. Very beautifull and calming walk in amazing surroundings. The walk starts from beautifull river bays and ends in to fice fields. It's totally different surroundings compared to the huzzle in the city streets. The path goes via temple and artshops and "ends" in the Karsa spa & restaurant. Offcourse you can walk in to even further by the street, but then you have again the huzzle of cars and motorbikes. Karsa is just amazing place also. We wanted to go there and have a spa treatment also, but the next awailable time they had was one week later. So no go this time.

Absolutely beautiful!. We did this walk in the afternoon about 4-5pm that way we didn't suffer too much in the sun and got to see the sunset over the rice terrace at Karsa Kafe which was great. The only problem was the traffic so our driver dropped us at one point and arranged to meet us at an agreed time at the other side. There are a lot of great Cafes around this area so make sure you are hungry.

Views were nice but walk was really hot not much of a breeze . Views were nice we didn't compete the entire walk due to such humid weather I'm used to the heat but felt disgusting and sticky walking was just dripping sweat but worth it for the nice photos Was a very busy walk people everywhere

Get amongst the rice terraces. This walk is a little hard to find the entry to but once you do it takes far away from the hustle and bustle of the main part of Ubud to a lovely path amongst the rice paddies. We stopped for a juice and tea at Cafe Pomegranate (the service wasnt mind blowing but it had a nice vibe). Friends have also recommended going on a little further to Sari Organic restaurant.

Great scenic track. Enjoyed an early morning walk along this great elevated and scenic walk, close to Ubud and well sign posted. We followed the 8.5km walk set out in the lonely planet guide which loops back down the roads on the other side of the river. Not as scenic on the return loop, mainly following the road, but we enjoyed it for a good long walk. Take note that if you do have the lonely planet guide, it will tell you to cut into the rice paddies on the way back at Mozaic restaurant, however this is an error, it actually cuts in higher up the road. There is a sign at Mozaic restaurant alerting walkers to this error. Highly recommend Karsa cafe for a drink or breakfast at the top of the ridge, good food, toilets, spa and scenic views.

miss the unbeaten track. This is lots of fun and an enjoyable activity that gets you away from the oppressive business of central Ubud, but it has lost its "natural" quality over time, as it is permeated with tourists. This is only natural, given that Ubud is now a tourist economy, but to think that tourism is, in part, connected to the very rice fields through which you walk, there is a sadness here, as well.

Nice easy walk with full 360 nature view. A must do activity in Ubud. A walk there just around 2 miles with nothing but nature. A field of grass and coconut trees in the background. A nice healthy getaway from crowded road of Ubud. There is no entrance fee. No souvenir sellers. No house no motorcycle. Great for photos.
beautiful. a wonderful walk up along the Campuhan ridgecan be very hot- take a hat and water if you're going after 10am or before 3pm

Must do when in Ubud . Campuhan ridge walk is a must do when in Ubud as the views are surreal and you can explore in your own pace avoiding hoards of tourists that you find at Taralalang rice fields . This walk is not difficult however make sure you have water and sunscreen as there isn't much shade along the way . About 25 minutes into walk you will come across shops and restaurants where you can have relaxing lunch and enjoy the serenity .

Nice views. The Campuhan Ridge Walk is an easy walk not far from town with great views into the jungle. Along the way one can stop at cafes or enjoy a spa treatment at Karsa Spa. Recommended if you want to get out of the busy town centre.

Rice paddies. Picturesque walk through rice paddies. An easy walk to do without a guide. Get a taxi there as entry to walk has no signs. Do the walk early as gets very hot. Nice cafe and village at end and lots of local artists selling their artwork.

Nice easy walk away from busy Ubud. We went early in the morning when it was still cool and quiet. The walk is fairly easy to find from the Ibah resort entrance, and gentle with nice views over the countryside and some rice terraces. There are some shops and cafes along the way, but this does mean that the path, in places, becomes a road with bikes, motorcycles and cars so it is not all rural footpath. Still an enjoyable excursion away from busy Ubud. It is so easy to find and safe that you can do this easily yourself for free without a guide.

A good mornings walk. Although a bit hard to find the start of the walk, this is definitely worth seeking out. There are a couple of slightly steeper bits but overall, most should be able to walk the 4km round trip. For the more adventurous, there is the full round trip of approx. 8km.The walk takes you along the edge of the jungle with rice paddies easily visible in the small valley. Halfway there is a cafe for cold drinks and snacks before deciding which way to make your way back. Lots of photo opportunities throughout the walk

Wear proper shoes... We stumbled upon the walk whilst making our way to the market and I was no wearing the proper footwear for the occasion. I had sandals on which meant that we did not get to make it all the way before my feet couldn't take it anymore. It was very muggy when we walked this so I recommend early morning or late afternoon. It was spitting but the water drops helped us keep cool. It such a beautiful walk and not what you expect when you head off from the busy Ubud streets.There is also a lovely cafe waiting for you at the end!

My favourite sunset walk . Stunning stunning stunning. Views in all directions, and a beautiful run, walk or romantic stroll. Well worth doing at sunrise or sunset. You can't come to Ubud and not walk the Campuhan Ridge.

Campuhan Ridge Walk. An easy 2 hour stroll (round trip), hot but certainly do-able in the middle of the day - just take water. No real need to pay for a guide. It's a good chance to get away from the busy main streets in Ubud and see some of the countryside.

Hidden Place in Ubud. best place to do some activities with nature view in the morning (Jogging, cycling and exercising). It is free (no enterance fee). some people visit this place to take prewedding photo.

An easy stroll, a noisy walk. Having done this bare foot due to broken flip flops, it most definitely is doable as an easy stroll for most people. Like most reviews say, go early. We went at 9am,and should have gone earlier really.The views are good but not as good as I was hoping for, plus there was felling of trees going on so it wasn't the nice peaceful walk we were hoping for.Definitely nice to get away from the busyness of Ubud.

Amazing Ubud. Wow this was well worth it! Started at around 10:00 we walked untill the cafe. The way to the cafe was breath taking bringing you to the local scene of ubud escaping the busy streets seeing ricefields and daily life. On the way you see warungs and places to buy art. The art is really good quality and a beautiful souvenir to bring home. Overall u this should be in your to do list if you are in Ubud!!Dont forget to take walking shoes because of the rough path and steeps. I did it with slippers its do able but shoes are better for comfort.

Beautiful Place to Walk. We cycled along the Ridge as part of our hotel's cycling excursion - it was a difficult cycling path but would have been fine to walk. The scenery is beautiful and depending on where you start/end, you can find yourself right back in Ubud by the Temple - it was the end of our cycling trip from Mt Batur and it was the perfect ending. If you have the time it is really worth while - and if you continue for a bit after the trail ends you can even see some beautiful rice paddies.

Spectacular. A must do when you are in Ubud. The Campuhan Ridge Walk is arguably the best known Ubud trek and with good reason. The sparse crowds and the aesthetically rich vistas remind one of why people from around the world come to Bali. The trail starts at the historical origin of Ubud, the confluence (or Campuhan) of the Wos Rivers.

Peaceful walk in busy Ubud. This walk was so beautiful, calm and refreshing. I had no idea there was somewhere like this a simple walk from the main city of Ubud, but a roomie in my hostel told me about it and I had to see it for myself. The walk itself along the ridge to the Karsa Kafe (one way) probably took less than half an hour, so I went a bit further up the road (which I recommend if you want to see how people really live in Bali). The view from the Karsa Kafe was also really nice, and I stopped there for a drink before heading back into town. If you are considering this walk, don't hesitate!

Spectactular views. Excellent views.Easy to find the start my Ibah hotel and drink and food stops along the way.Not very busy but busy enough not to feel alone and unsafeQuite steep and best down early or late when cooler

A pleasant scenic walk. Campuhan ridge is about 10 minutes from the Art market and provides a scenic walk close to the centre of Ubud. The entrance is up on the left hand side from Bridges restaurant, about 150 metres walking back towards central Ubud. Look for the small sign providing directions. The walk is best done earlier in the morning as it has little shade at the beginning of the walk which is mostly dirt track. However there are paved pathways and sealed roads along the way. The walk is dotted with artisans and small Warungs (cafe) all spruiking their wares and the vistas with the more popular views have larger premises for the discerning visitor seeking refreshment. The prices are reasonable and would recommend a fresh coconut for refreshment from the Warungs.

Easy walk with spectacular views. A must-do in Ubud, this walk is quite easy and best undertaken before 9AM or after 4.30PM as it gets quite warm at other times. The views are spectacular and the total distance (to and fro) is about 4kms. Plenty of warungs and artist homes with works for sale along the way.

Very nice activity away from the noise in Ubud. Quiet walk in the rice paddies - good to avoid the noise.
Would advice to follow this from Ubud to the Karsa Cafe - and then turn around to avoid the car traffic on the full 10k loop
Morning walk. Great place for early morning or late afternoon walk, a little exposed to the sun in the day, only 1 km from near bridge to the village, with cafes and massage.
Nice evening stroll. This was a lovely little walk. We travelled in further at the end to get to Jungle Fish bar, which was a brilliant way to end it. Bring swimming gearfor the infinity pool
Nothing special. First part of it is OK, but by the time you arrive at the shops,you have to either turn back where you came from, or continue the road via bigger and not very interesting roads.
Stunning. Make the effort to do this easy and beautiful walk ~you will not regret! We went late afternoon, stunning!!
Great walk. beautiful views and gorgeous place to walk. Easy to do on your own with out a guide, perfect for sunrise photography!

Found by accident . At first we saw a sign saying 'rice fields 50m' although I doubt if it wasn't closer to 200m, it was truly beautiful and a unique experience. There are multiple restaurants in the middle of the rice fields. They support the farmers and the community. Amazing place!

Beautiful walk!. We we dropped here by our Bali driver to complete part of the walk and it was beautiful. Great views of the rainforest and our buildings along the way and also walk past a temple. Stunning and would highly recommend!
Quick and easy walk to enjoy nature.. Make sure you take a poncho or umbrella - never know when sudden showers might appear. We got drenched on our way back down.

Beautiful and easy-going walk. Perfect way to spend a morning or late afternoon (mid-day will get very hot). Walk can be done in slip slops and not very challenging. Do not advise going all the way, rather stop for refreshments aprox.2kms in at the cafe and turn back.

Amazing scenery. A great walk for those who like walking and enjoying nice scenery and listening to the sound of falling waters . You feel close to nature, it felt amazing as it was raining too.You have be prepared as it is a long walk and uphill at times. Great

Nice walk away from the city noise!. Very nice walk in the countryside! Dont forget the suncream during the day! You can go up to jl rsi markandya II, there is a nice spa there, I just went for a picture You can also continue the road on your left and get to jl raya sanggingan but note thats its a good walk, maybe 45min, but nice, not busy and many trees (I was lucky to get a lift from a nice lady!). Info:smoothie and indo taPas at Fuzion Cafe very good (nice break after the walk)! And just in front of it cute little shop with batik clothes (local clothes), the lady is super nice, I bought 8 pieces!
Amazing view!. Tougher than i expected but so so so worth it! Amazing scenery :) Good to go nice and early before it gets too hot!
Beautiful. It's beautiful from the hill. We can see a long way field from there. It's fresh because the wind blow. We we're enjoyed the way to go to the hill.

Greta escape from the crazy Ubud traffic.. I'm not sure exactly where the ridge walk ends but I turned around at karsa kafe. It's and easy, uplifting walk that gives you a great elevated view point of the environs of ubud. There's a good breeze up on the ridge and everyone I met seemed super chirpy so that was a nice bonus. Cute to see young school-age couples just enjoying the views and hanging out too even if it made me feel old! I highly recommend doing this short walk to blow the cobwebs away. It wasn't easy to find the start. If you are coming from the palace direction and you get to the bridge over the valley you've gone too far. Just ask a local to help.

Good walk. This is a good walk. Best to do early morning or as evening walk. Can be challenging in spots (the uphill bits)if fitness is an issue but overall just need to set your own pace and enjoy the beautiful scenery walking the ridge with jungle on one side and rice paddies on the other.

Not exciting. Easy walk but nothing special. Mostly paved. Can be very hot. Up the ridge the path is also used by motorbikes and cars - not what we expected. We stopped at the Karsa Café for a drink and snack. However, waiters were only interested in the mobile phones and not in serving us. After 20 minutes of waiting we walked back to town.

Great way to get fit. I am in Bali for a month and Saturday timed by walk...hope to improve on this. You can start at the temple near the local school and do a round trip which is about 7km...lots of up and down hills and you also get to walk through local villages. I parked my bike at Bintang and walked down from there. The walk took me 1 hr 18 mins but I'm a fast walker :) Best to go late in the afternoon or early morning. For a relaxing walk stop at Karsa Cafe for a juice or water and soak up the atmosphere. A must in Ubud

Nice easy walk. The ridge walk is a nice easy about 2 K walk across the ridge with nice views, there were many Indonesian couples there with professional photographers having their engagement photo's taken
Relaxing walk!. Visited at around 3.30pm, had occasional breeze to accompany us on this relaxing short trek. Note: you can visit Karsa Kafe (as the destination) before heading downhill!

Nice scenery. 5 Kilometers does not sound like a lot....
But with the temperatures and humidity we experienced we have only walked 2 kilometers. We really regret we did not walk the whole Campuhan ridge walk.
Next time we will walk it again at the end of the afternoon!!!!

A must visit in Ubud. Anyone who likes to walk, to enjoy beautiful scenery... must walk through Campuhan Ridge Walk.
At the end of the walk, you will find a small nice coffee shop where you can rest.

Nice walk. We have chosen this trail because it is not very difficult for elderly people.The entrance is a bit difficult to find (from Bridges restaurant cross the road and continue about 200 meters towards Ubud centre. Go there to the left), and you have to climb a few stairs.But then it is a nice walk with beautiful views.We continued until the café, took something to drink, rested a while and then walked back. In total it took us just over two hours.

Tension release. I don't have do exercise regularly and I found that doing this 2 km track is fun and exciting! A great place to be. It's not to hard to follow the road but make sure you have proper shoes and you can bring your bicycle too (I saw few people did it). A tip from me, it's better to start the walk in morning.
Great place to see some amazing scenery. It can be bloody hot but this is the real Bali - you wont be disappointed with the walk, just do it early in the day
Nice walk, but HOT!. Definitely worth doing, but I would recommend going super early as my partner and I went midday and it was way too hot. Beautiful views though!
Favourite walk. A must and be sure to visit Karsa Spa and Cafe at the top. Very scenic walk and be sure to visit Karsa Spa and Cafe at the top. I have done this walk many times

Nice mix of scenery on a leisurely stroll. This was a nice walk just outside the busy Ubud center. It begins near the Pura Gunung Lebah Temple, where we saw many locals and couples passing by and sitting on the steps, enjoying the day. There are stretches of grassy spaces and a path past some local shops selling artwork. We enjoyed a refreshing coconut from Karsa Kafe, before our walk back to town. We did the Campuhan Ridge Walk in the middle of the day, and realized partway through that walking earlier in the morning or later in the evening might have been a little more comfortable temperature wise.

Pretty. A nice short-ish walk, depending on how you do it. We followed the Lonely Planet's route and wish we hadn't, as a lot of the way was on winding roads with too-fast traffic and no sidewalks. The ridge itself is really pretty, and rather than doing a circuit you may be better off just coming back to town along the ridge - the same way you came.

AMAZING HIKE and JOURNEY!!!. I had been to Bali a couple of times before I discovered this AMAZING HIKE! I have done it several times now. It is peaceful, serene and just BEAUTIFUL.This last time I stopped at KARSA SPA for a reiki and relaxation treatment! WOW!!!! So special.I found out about this hike originally through TRIP ADVISOR! GREAT GREAT GREAT ADVICE!This is a must do! However, go in and out the SAME WAY. Do not go out into the village and into the main road! WAY TOO MUCH traffic and ruins the experience. In and out the same way is magical. The artists along the way. The village. Everything.ENJOY!
Lovely walk. Lovely walk and nice get out of the busy town. Bit of an up hill so be prepared to get hot! Lots of lovely countryside views and cooling breezes.

Peaceful hike, beautiful views. The Campuhan Ridge Walk offers beautiful views and a few artistic shops along the way. The walk leads to one of the best message places in Ubud (I recommend making a separate trip for the message, or arranging for a drop after the spa treatments). The walk was easy and peaceful. I wouldn't recommend it if you are looking for a harder hike or getting a workout for the day. It was more for relaxing and a great way to start your day and get breakfast or a massage later. It can be a bit difficult to find the starting point for the walk, but once you find it its a very straightforward path. * Don't forget to carry water, some cash incase you feel like picking up a painting from a local artist, and wear a cap!

The ridge itself is still beautiful, but the village at the top is being over-developed and spoiled. Having been walking the Campuhan Ridge for over 20 years, we are horrified by the rapid development taking place at the top of the steps. What used to be a sleepy little village is now becoming a conglomeration of buildings aimed at the tourist industry. I guess you can't blame them for trying to cash in, but let's hope they don't end up ruining the very thing people used to go there for. Having said that, the ridge itself is still beautiful, albeit now starting to be overlooked all the way along by developments along the next ridge. Whereas we used to be almost the only ones walking the ridge once upon a time, now there is a continuous stream of people walking along, often in groups, and they will push you off the pathway if you let them. We are glad we saw it when we did, and have the memories of it before it fell victim to over popularity.
Great walk. We walked this around 11 am was a bit warm but was certainly worth it. Bought some beautiful art work at a local shop NYOMAN SUDIRArecommend you check it out
A great walk especially early in the morning. I love this walk it is very quiet and just right for your early morning hike. Breakfast and coffee after is on the schedule.

Something different.. My wife and I walked from our hotel near the Monkey Forest early in the morning(6:00am). Walked through town, great to see people starting their day. We did the walk which was very pleasant and relatively easy. Had a tea/coffee at the café further along the track and returned. Many people walking/jogging. Suggest go early before the heat.

Nice walk. Away from the chaos of the middle of Ubud this is a very pleasant walk. Finding the start of he walk is a little tricky as it doesn't appear to be signposted until you reach a stream and a bridge.The views from the walk are very pleasant and green.After about 30 minutes walking there are some stalls and access to food and drink.As would be expected this hard going in the Bali heat so try and do this walk at a cooler time of day and definitely take some water and sun protection.

Unexpected loveliness . Go early in the morning before it gets too hot or on a cloudy day. The ridge runs adjacent to one of the main roads and overlooks the jungle & river. You go through small, traditional villages & get to see some of the real Bali. Definitely worth it.
Sunrise walk. We were taken to the start of the walk and made the ridge by sunrise (just). It would be very hot later in the day so happy to do it early.

Okay, but not outstanding. We did this at the afternoon, it was hot but not too hot.The views are nice but it didn't offer anything extra ordinary. You could take your hike/walk as good some other place

Great Heartstarter. I found that I wanted to workout whilst in Ubud. I made a time to go up and down even thought the humidity was oppressive.
The views are great. The people along the walk are great.
Just do it.

Early morning Walks . Hidden entrance off the main road that cross the river east of the bridge.Scoot down the back slope from the road and stay right to the walking path that crosses the river and runs alongside the large temple at the bottom. Then you come up to the Green - very picturesque but also very steamy hot even at 9am so start early. I normally just walk from start to about 2kms along, grab a water at the wrung at this point and head back.You can go further for several kms even all the way to the Jungle Fish hotel with the infinity pool. Common spot for expat joggers and Bali youth looking to get away from family eyes. A patch of quiet and green amidst the bustle of Ubud main thoroughfare.
Lord have mercy.. This walk is wonderful, my friend and I take our dogs all the time.its the perfect walk for the whole family.

Worth the hike. This is a great way to spend a few hours. The entrance is to one side of the Warwick Villa entrance, turn left instead and go over the bridge up to the temple, past the school on the left. Stunning views over rice padis and Ubud. One of the cafes has the route signposted.
Great early morning. A wonderful escape from the busy streets of Ubud. Do it quicker for great workout or slow and easy to experience natural beauty, birds, peaceful environment.

Journey from valley temples to hillside rice villages.. Early morning is by far the best time to enjoy this walk. Starting from the newly rebuilt temple built at the meeting of the rivers you rise through the low hills to the scent of exotic spices , herbs and flowers to rice paddies clinging to hillsides and eventually arrive at the Campuhan ridge. Explore the small villages and support the local artists , then make your way back to Ubud for a delicious brunch.

Amazing little hike . This ridge walk was beautiful, and better than I expected.Started out a bit late in the day (10.30ish), and it was slightly too hot. There's something about all the greenery around that makes the humidity on the trail, real hot ! So do bring water, have that hat and sunscreen on, and you will be fine. Stopped at the end of the trail for lunch and a spa treatment, and walked back. Awesome adventure

Relaxing walk in Ubud. For a relaxing 20 minute walk get a driver to drop you at the furthest point of the walk and walk back into town finishing at the temple. Saves you the long walk back to the main road.

Cannot be missed in Ubud.. Find the trail by Inah Warwick hotel off of Jalan Raya Ubud (across the street of the Blanco Museum). This is a trek along an elevated ridge in the outskirts of Ubud. Great views of greenery, paddies, etc.

Great views near the centre. It is a nice 2km stroll to Karsa cafe, located on the rice fields with great views. It is not a serious hike, leisure walk, also good for jogging, but a must when in Ubud as it is peaceful and serene.
Started half way. Starting half way at the top of the ridge walk meant an easy 2 km stroll back into Ubud. A good alternative if you're feeling lazy!

Escape from busy Ubud. Only 5 minutes easy walk and you feel you are in the jungle yet so close to central Ubud which was once a peaceful village but is now packed with traffic and tourists. We didn't walk it all but enough to see jungle and rice fields. Well worth doing.

Nice walk . Nice walk along a path through fields and to a cafe. If you're wanting to see rice terraces though then this isn't the place. It's just more rice fields which are quite flat. You would be better going to the tegalalang rice terraces. It's a nice enough walk though and suitable for all fitness levels.

Good exercise, average views. Started the walk at about 9 am, wouldn't recommend setting out much later than this as much of the path is without shade and the days heat comes early. Its a fairly casual walk of about 2 km, average incline to begin then it flattens out. Walked as far as Karsa Cafe (seems like the best place to stop, nice views over a picturesque rice field) and then turned back.This walk is probably better for exercise than it is for sightseeing and photos, but its a good option for those who don't want to spend money on overpriced rice field tours. Along the path is engraved the businesses who have donated to its building and how much they donated- might be a good way to seek out the scrupulous tourism vendors in town!

Great views of Ubud. This is a very popular track through the rice paddles and village life of Ubud. You can make it a round trip or turn back along the way. Take a water bottle...it can get hot or plan a stop along the way at one of the coffee shops.

Good for jogging . Lots of stairs, beautiful scenery of Ubud. Better come early morning before sunrise. You can park your car front of the stores near bridge and walk through warwick villa. There is a sign to campuhan ridge walk and Karta cafe.

Escape and relax. It is always fun to leave a hectic city for an evening walk. This short Rigde Walk does the trick. Little hard to find, but you have the feeling that Ubud is so far away. Just go down at the right side of the bridge, coming from central Ubud. Free.

Nice morning walk. Entry on the left side of IBAH hotel and on down on the right side of the bridge. Recommend this for a few hours, going up all the way to Karsa Cafe where you can get a nice breakfast, tender coconut drink and take beautiful picture of the lotus pond

Trekking for Sunrise. Long walks with sweeping Panoramic view... Went looking for sunrise and it does not disappoint. But do go early as it can get crowded on the trail and as soon as the sun gets a bit higher, it tends to get very hot depending on the season.

Rice Fields Walk. This is a 2 Km walk among the rice fields With a few small cafe's and local hand made crafts along the way. We finished at Kafe Karsa.Please start early to avoid the heat. Carry water bottles. Take your time and enjoy the lovely views.

A long road to somewhere.... Great walk - not for the faint hearted as there are some hills. Best done early or later in the day before . Scenery is great and there are some lovely little art gallaries towards the end (well our end) of the walk. Recommend comfortable shoes and a big water bottle!

Very nice walk just next to the center. . This was located just next to our hotel, so we went for a walk here several times. I even did some running here a few days. It is the perfect place to get away from the busy streets of Ubud.

Easy walk with nice views. We started early in the morning which I would recommend as there isn't much shade and it gets hot. We walked just past the Karsa Cafe which is probably about a 2km walk and is where a lot of people turn around, however you can walk much further. There are a few artists displaying their wares along the way which is interesting, and a couple of places to eat. Nice to get out of the hustle and bustle of downtown Ubud and do something other than shopping and eating.

Nice for a stroll not a hard walk. Stumbled across this walk. its well signed so you cant get lost. only walked to the restuarant then took a buggy back into ubud central.Nice rice fields , trees and a temple. great views nd photo opportunities

Great walk. What a beautiful walk! We loved the walk on top of the ridge with the beautiful scenery around us. Felt like we were far away and yet it was just a few steps away from the busy street. We stopped at karma cafe and spent quite some time there before going back but we could just as well have gone on for a longer trip. It's an easy walk.One of the best things we did in Ubud!
Nice scenic walk. Very easy walk on a nice path. Views are gorgeous. Only went as far as Karsa Cafe which is easy well traveled path but you can continue further.
Decent walk but the view was a bit boring. This walk is great for those wanting a nice jog, but if you're looking for scenery then this isn't really a MUST DO.

Fantastic local experience. Get a local guide - it gives the walk a depth of experience you couldn't get without them. My guide was from The Purist Villas and he was fantastic. Introduced me to locals, explained the local culture and lifestyles, the workings of the rice terraces and explained what almost every plant we encountered was used for by local healers.

Nice walk, beautiful view. We went at the end of the day (our mistake), to get to the starting point we had to walk almost 30 minutes and if we had chosen a taxi we would miss the sunset because of traffic, so maybe morning is a better time for this visit. It took a while to find the start but once you find it there is no mistake, there were also many people going and returning. We did not do the whole walk, just past a little of the Kafe. It is worth visiting, recommend

Lovely scenic walk. We did this walk with your two young children 4 and 2, it has beautiful scenary and paved route. We did the walk from the slab village down into Ubud. You can stop at Karsa Cafe & Spa, which has a very beautiful garden, and great spa treatments, book ahead for treatments as they are normally fully booked.
beautiful walk through the hills of ubud. a tranquil walk through the hills of Ubud. Great opportunity to see the rural aspects of Ubud and some of the little towns at the end of the walk.

Pleasant stroll out of Uud. Easy walk a few kilometres along a ridge with rice fields beside it, plenty of creatures around. Great views. Best to do early before 9am or after 4pm, as gets hot. Reward is cafes at the end with cool drinks.

very peaceful. A lovely way to spend the morning and get in some exercise. The trail has such a peaceful aura. It takes about 30min to walk from the main road to the top of the ridge, where you can stop and enjoy a drink and a snack at Karsa Cafe.The cool breeze blowing through the cafe was very welcome after heating up during the walk. On the walk back, consider stopping at the first artist gallery on the right. It has beautiful, very cheap art work created by the most lovely man (I forgot his name). I had unwittingly given him $150 rather than the required $100 for the 3 pieces I bought. I would not have realised this as the notes were stuck together, but he unhesitatingly returned the extra $50 when he realised I'd given him too much. How many people would do that?!
Enjoyable stroll. We started from the bridge and walked 10 mins past the cafe at the end and back again. Some pretty scenery and not too busy. Worth a look

Great walk to escape hustle and bustle. We did the Ridge walk one morning after breakfast with kids aged 6,8 and 12. Was lovely. Some steep bits got the heart pumping but nothing too difficult. Walked to Kasa Cafe as suggested then continued on. Was interesting walking back but would not recommend as buys steep roads and no paths. Just retrace back along the ridge.

Lovely views!. We did the Campuhan Ridge Walk based on a recommendation from our tour guide and we were not disappointed! We had the most incredible views of the jungle at the beginning and got a feel for the true Ubud. I'd definitely recommend this for people wanting to travel within Ubud.

Beautiful. We were staying up in the Tegalalang region and decided to take the walk down to Ubud along the trail. It's a stunning walk, along a concrete slab pathway, with not to many ups and downs so therefore suitable for most people. It's very well maintained.Word of warning, go early morning or early evening as the midday sun is ferocious and the trail offers very little in the way of shade!!

Do not miss this!. A must do if you're in Ubud. Escape the noisy and bustling Ubud centre and see the real Ubud. Farms and rice paddies surrounding you, it's beautiful. Shaded some of the way and lots of cafes and guest houses along the way if you need to stop for a drink. One of the best things to do in Ubud!

Never had enough. Its my 2nd visit here. Its was as lovely as 1st time even I was a bit late to come as sunrise already a bit high. If u want to come here, try to catch when the sunrise appear. U'll get to see beautiful ray of light during ur walk.

Lovely walk early morning or late afternoon. We did this walk twice - once with a guide from the bridge to the village and once on our own in the opposite direction. I would recommend walking in the late afternoon as the morning walk got very hot. I would also suggest getting dropped at the village and walking towards the bridge/temple as you can then walk into Ubud town center afterwards. The views across the valleys on each side are beautiful and you'll see rice fields, houses and the occasional shop. It's not a difficult walk if you have a moderate amount of fitness but wear sneakers as the ground is not always level.
Picturesque walk. The Campuhan Ridge walk is a lovely way to start the morning in Ubud, and a good tip is first thing in the morning and late in the afternoon for the sunset.

Hersan1205 Indonesia. I have already heard about this place before but this morning I have a chance to walk along the hills. The view is very spectacular. The weather is so nice so we enjoyed very much. The path is very clean and easy to pass by.

Beautiful walk but at the end of the ridge turn back or get a taxi. The walk from Ubud along the Campuhan Ridge is beautiful although extremely hot so take plenty of water. The book we read gave a route turning left at the end of the ridge and looping back round. This was extremely bad advice. The road was busy and not really suitable for walkers so just re-trace you steps back across the ridge or find a can to take you back.
Great walk. Good place to go for a scenic walk. There are a few people on the trail but it's nothing crazy for the most part
Beautiful walk. We enjoyed this walk a couple of times on our visit to Ubud.Earlier is better for less people, but not if intending on breakfast at top, they don't open until 9

Lovely rice-paddy field in the evenings!. We really enjoyed the walk through the lovely rice-paddy fields in the evening as the sun was setting and having the walk to our-self. It was so refreshing after a long day out.

A hour to two hours return leisurely walk.. A paved, stepped, hilly but fairly undemanding walk for anyone of average fitness (a couple of stairs challenged this short legged, dodgy kneed, 50 year old, but overall I would rate it easy). We saw Balinese couples getting their wedding photos, rice being harvested, muddy ducks feeding and lovely views. The walk takes you on the ridge between two rivers, I don't like heights, and the trek wasn't a problem for me. The first half is all nature, shops and stalls appear in the second half and there are plenty of places to stop for a nibble or drink. Overall, a pleasant walk, perhaps avoid midday sun, we left about 9am and it was fine.
Superb view. Enjoy the cool breeze in the morning. Good for exercise and enjoy breakfast in a cafe in the hill top.
lovely walk into the rice fields. it may take you 2h up and down. bring your camera! there are restaurants and hotels on the road so dont worry if you are missing water
Scenic and Serene!. A nice escape from the busy and crowded Ubud! You can stop at one of the many cafes or shops along the trail which runs 2km to Karsa Cafe and Spa (highly recommended).

A nice morning walk. It was a nice walk in Ubud. It's better to do it in the morning when it's not so hot. And don't go down to the river, it's not worth. Another nice rice field walk starts in Kajeng street.

Good walk early in the morning. Good length for a walk but otherwise view wasn't as fantastic as I thought. I thought there would be more rice terraces to see. Don't go in mid day as there is no shelter at all. Remember to bring water.

A beautiful self-guided walk. My wife and I took about 3 hours and enjoyed this walk through the rice fields. We stopped about half-way through for lunch/juice at a cafe along the path which has really beautiful views of the rice terraces. The recommendation per Lonely Planet's guide to Bali was to continue north on the path then head west to connect with one of the main roads. It was a little confusing though we eventually found the right road which was busy/loud. There is a fantastic gelato shop - Gaya Gelato which is 100% worth a stop, though you wouldn't be missing much if you simply turned around at the north end of the ridge walk to return to Ubud.Bottom line: If you have 2-3 hours (or more) and want to see some rice terraces, this is a great option right out of Ubud. There are certainly more expansive and beautiful rice terraces (e.g. tegalalang) that I would recommend if your stay is short.

Nice walk, go further down . This is a hike for even beginners and make a good morning exercise. Go before 9am else it'll be too hot. Go further than Karsa cafe to see local farmers hard at work in the fields. Some residences are open for visits and the locals will show u their handicrafts and serve u cold drinks for a small fee.

stunning views and walk through rice paddies and traditional villages. great walk across the rice paddies of Ubud, through local villages and lots of cafes and warungs to stop and have a drink or meal

Refreshing. We took this walk several years back and since then the track has been improved and there are more people taking on the walk. If one begins the walk from Jalan Raya, you will not miss passing the river and a temple and ascend a flight of steps up to the ridge. By and large the ridge is overgrown with lalangs and you may spot skinks along the way beside other interesting flora and fauna. However, its the view on both sides of the ridge that would attract your attention. Two rivers flow on either side. As you come to the end of the walk, and reach the artists' homes and villas, don't turn back, go beyond Lokha Ubud and see the rice fields spreading on either side of the road that takes you north towards Tegalalang. The serenity and tranquility of the walk makes it worthwhile even if you have to battle the heat from the scorching sun, depending on the time you take the walk. Be prepared with sunblocks, hats and sunglasses.
Nice view!. Nothing special but worth a visit when its cloudy. Very cool for pictures or biking. Not so busy normally

Please do this before 10 am. It gets incredibly unbearable after 10am. The highlight of ridge walk picture place is the grassland with three separate high palm trees and the valley and ridges. Such Luis Vutton Commercial Feels!. Its off 3 KM after you start the walk. If you continue the stretch, the scenary is not that good. Recommend only do the starting 3 KMs. And do it in the morning!

Nice walk. Nice walk through the area of ubud. The route is easy to follow (signs along the way) and fairly easy to walk if you have a good condition. Do bring water, as it gets quite hot during the day. In about 30 minutes you reach the Karsa cafe which has a great view, spa, good food and cold drinks!
Beautiful trail. Cool fresh air and probably the most gorgeous hillside in the region. Looking forward to going back soon <3

Worth the walk. This is a gorgeous area of Ubud. It was nice to escape the hustle and bustle of down town and see the rice patty filled country side. Plenty of places to grab water and food along the way.

A good, but not spectacular, morning walk.. Walked up the ridge early one morning. It was good for a not too strenuous leg-stretcher before breakfast. But the views are nothing too wonderful, and all too soon the paved track turns into a road lined with painters houses and showrooms. We walked as far as Karsa Cafe, and wanted to book in for a spa later, but the spa is not open until 10 am, and nobody was around, so wandered back down to our hotel in town. All up just over an hour wander. Do early in the morning for a cooler walk.
Nice walk . Follow the main road West from Monkey road until ll you see the signs for the walk. Nice views of Rice fields

Decent walk, but urbanized. Nice but somewhat difficult to find path unless you know what you're looking for (Warwick Ibah Hotel). If you go at a good clip, you can get your heart rate up but otherwise not particularly difficult. A lot of villas and hotels have been built up on both sides of the ridge, but I imagine the view was absolutely stunning before that, now it is picturesque. If you go when it is dark, make sure to take a flashlight as the path isn't lit well and there are areas where it is easy to slip.
Pretty rice fields. Lovely easy walk from the centre of Ubud. Nice views and a few restaurants on the way. Wear sunscreen, there's not much shade!

Enjoyable visit to vanishing scenes near Ubud. This well-marked path leading away from the bridge near Warung Marni will take you up past rice and grass fields to see the beautiful countryside above Ubud. Likely, think will all be overbuilt with holiday homes if you come back a few years from now. Already, most houses are "for rent " and were clearly meant to be an investment, not a home. Still it is a gorgeous walk, well worth your time.

Great walk - pace yourself and watch the humidity. Beautiful walk through the hills surrounding Ubud. Do it early (6.30am I would suggest) - the humidity is a killer later in the day ... Finish at Karsa Cafe for breakfast - you will be happy

Keep healthy on holiday... It was a nice walk and i strongly recommend to do it in the afternoon... But make sure you finish before it gets dark. It is also recommended that you wear the right gear ... for walk/running.
Great walk close to center. It was a great walk. start from the small road next to a hotel resort. It is bette to do it in the morning or later afternoon to avoid the sun.

One of our highlights of Bali Holiday. Away from the traffic and shops in Ubud, this walk is a green oasis. For the first 20mins, it's a nice greenery walk. Then you will pass by a small village with art shops.Its a beautiful walk, and will recommend you to keep walking to Karsa Cafe to relax and enjoy the surrounding rice terrace view. The walk to Karsa Cafe took us approximately 45 mins.Bring sunblock, hat and shades! Best done in early morning or late afternoon.

Want to escape the hassle & traffic?. If you are staying in the centre of Ubud, you need to escape the endless traffic and chaos to see a little of the real Bali before this too disappears! For peace and tranquillity and a little exercise, wander out into the rice fields on the well defined walking track - great for photos and to breath the fresh air and hear the tinkling of wind chimes to scare away the tiny birds eating the newly formed rice. Very picturesque - try sunrise out there - just glorious
Beautiful nature walk away from the bustle. Recommend this walk preferably early morn or late arvo to avoid the heat. Picturesque and with the great Karsa Cafe a reward at the end!
Rudge Walking in Ubud. Lovely peaceful walk through wild flower meadows, temples, rice paddies, steep valleys on a safe wide path.

Beautiful scenery . We were lucky enough to rent a room a few meter is this walk. During 9 days we walked it and we were never tired of the scenery and animals. At night please use a lantern, since it's very dark and you don't want to kick a toad :-)

Tourist Walk. An easy walk (although the sun makes it very hot) I suspect that it would be much nicer as the sun comes up there would be less people and a bit cooler. There is some great scenery and its worth doing while you are in Ubud I only gave it an average rating because if you can get 10 minutes outside of Ubud you can see just as beautiful views in the rural villages without walking behind a trail of other people. There are plenty of places to stop for food or drinks and shops selling arts and crafts.

Really enjoyable. A really pleasent walk that isnt too strenuous. You can easily do in sandals/flip flops. Would definitely advise to get up early and go though as the heat quickly hits you. The views and surroundings make the walk well worth it.

Nice!. Nice walk, nothing incredible but still nice to go. After 2km there are a bunch of art galleries, guesthouses and cafes. Most People (including me) just turn and go back after that because the path turns into a street with traffic. But sitting in the cafes with a view over the ricefields paired with the nice landscape is definitely worth it!
Nice stroll in the early evening. Its a short climb out of Ubud then a lovely 2km walk to views over rice fields - do it late afternoon for sunset
A beautiful walk. This was a fabulous walk.The walk isn't too strenuous so would be do able by most. It was a delight at 6 in the morning but I expect it would be less pleasant later in the day.
Free activity at Ubud. Go in the morning!. We did the Campuhan ridge walk at 11am and the view was stunning. However, the heat can get a little uncomfortable so do it in the morning!

A hidden gem. The Campuhan ridge is a peaceful and picturesque green stretch at the end of Ubud market that you can easily explore on your own. With beautiful views of the river valley, forests and the rice fields, its a wonderful way to explore the quiet countryside on the outskirts of Ubud town. You'll also encounter plenty of friendly locals on their evening walk. Make sure you carry a camera for some great photos.Tips: 1. To reach the ridge, walk west of Ubud market, until you reach Ibah hotel, where you'll find a road leading you downhill. 2. The ridge is at its coolest early in the morning or late evenings and takes around 1.5-2 hours depending on your stamina and the duration of your break.3. The slope is gentle, but it can get hot and sweaty after a while, so its best to carry a water bottle along. 4. If you have time for a break, you can stop at Karsa Cafe, which overlooks the surrounding rice fields. Refresh yourself with fruits or tender coconut water and then return down the same trail.

Good trek with some pretty views. Not an amazing trek with with amazing views, but for a 20-30 min walk this was pretty good. Walk till you reach Karsa cafe, have the a drink and then go for a massage at Karsa Spa.
Great way to start the day! . We started our walk at 7.30am, great way to start the day! The walk is amazing, great way to get the heart rate going! We stopped at Karsa cafe for breakfast! Yummy!

Spectacular views and character. An amazing walk that will provide you with an entirely different view of Ubud. Some brilliant art dealers on the way round as well and views over the rice fields are spectacular. Make sure to stop off at the Karsa Cafe for a drink on your way round. Oh, and take some water!

Easy walking. I walked part of this to get to Karsa Spa - from Ubud - so only about 30 minutes of it Easy walking on 12 inch concrete pavers, inclines somewhat - but average fitness should be able to do - I would not call this 'trekking'.Pretty views and nice breeze.

I love doing this walk but only early in the morning.. This is a very easy walk if you are unfit with only a few ups and downs, but it is exposed so if you are doing it in the middle of the day then expect to roast in the sun. The saving grace would be arriving at the cafe on the ridge. Cold drink but poor service.

Great Day of Exploring. The ridge walk was a very scenic and peaceful hike in the Ubud area. Starting at the bottom you pass by a waterfall and river valley, followed by an impressive temple. As you progress upwards you are awarded with beautiful views of the river valley. Once at the top of the ridge there are several artisan shops and cafes. Some of the cafes have great views of the surrounding scenery. From bottom to top and back again took us about 2 hours, including a stop for lunch.

Gorgeous evening views of the Ubud Sawah and forest. This attraction will really provide a first hand look at the beauty of the Balinese rice fields around Ubud. The reason for maintaining such an integral part of the cultural and community linkages becomes apparent when you see the way rice has been grown here for centuries. The walk takes you past beautifully manicured Padi fields and lush jungle bordered by deep gorges where cool streams rush seaward.

Daily walks for free. It's free so don't pay for any guides, best go around 6.30am and walk to cafe and back is around an hour walk and covers nearly 5k's. The first part is steep and makes ya puffed but the views are stunning so take camera and a water bottle, you walk past a stunningly beautiful temple too

Good for a quiet walk . We cycled from the centre of Ubud to the start of the trail, next to the ibah hotel, on the right just before the bend then follow the signs to the trail. We cycled along the trail so didn't take us very long, stopped at the cafe at the other end for a drink before following the road around to the left and back to The centre of Ubud. Nice to see he rice fields but nothing special, buildings being built so wouldn't be surprised if the rice terraces slowly start to decrease. We started about 9:30am and it wasn't busy saw about 10 people along the route. Easy walk flat surface after the few steps at the beginning. Wasn't the best bike route, lots of parts we had to carry the bikes up stairs and push up hills but coming back to ubud was all down hill so not actually a great deal of cycling. Nothing much to see on the road back so I'd get a lift back or walk back along the trail. Taxi services at the end of the trail No entry fee

Pretty easy walk close to town. A good, easy walk to do to get out of the hustle of Ubud for a bit. There are small signs near the entrance. A cafe near the end has great views from the 2nd floor and very good wifi
Walking. Easy walk with beautiful scenery. Stopped and had a refreshing juice at the top, and returned. This is easy to walk to while staying in Ubud.

Campuhan Ridge Walk is a nice walk.. Campuhan Ridge Walk is a nice walk. It is indicating that Karsa Kafe is 2 km further. Then you have the choice to return the same road or ... go much further, it is still about 4 or 5 km, but very nice. After Karsa Kafe you must follow the road about 1km and go then the first real road on the left . This is a road for scooters and cars. Sometimes quite steeply. You pass Pura Pakraman Lungsiakan, then along some desa's of Ubud . Follow the road and go always left. Until you come to the first restaurants in Ubud, Jalan Raya Sanggingan . Then you come back to your starting point . Tired but happy.

Walk with beautiful surroundings. When you are in Ubud, try not to miss this walk. Campuhan ridge walk is easy to find. Best time to visit is before the sun gets too hot. At least for Indonesians or Asians like me, I find Bali has way too strong sunny morning during dry season. So I recommend to have a visit between 7 to 10 AM. You will be spoiled with green scenery, really lovely and really makes you feel happy being in a tropical country. For me, it's a valuable view as I live in capital city and there's no way I'm gonna miss this kind of view while I'm in Ubud.Don't forget to wear comfortable outfit and shoes accompanied by sunblock and hat if you like.

Surprisingly close to town. You don't need a "guided" tour for this. Look it up on google maps and just walk it yourself. Nice for an early morning or late afternoon stroll (little shade so it'll be hot during midday).There're some shops selling artwork at the end of trail and also a cafe too.

Spectacular views!!. This was a fabulous walk and we wish we were able to explore further. There is an steady incline at the start of this walk out of Ubud town but at the top of the ridge it is easy walking and shouldn't be missed. It was hot and sweaty but well worth it and the scenery amongst the rice paddys was spectacular!!!
Beautiful Bali walk. The Campuhan Ridge walk is a slice of the authentic Bali. Beautiful scenery, friendly people, restaurants and spas nearby, easy enough for the whole family.

Dont miss this walk. A lovely walk on a fully paved path, taking you through great scenery and little villages to finish at a cafe/spa that serves good food in lovely gardens surrounded by the rice fields. Highly recommended.retirednomads.com

Have done this walk 4 times now. This is a great walk, can take 10-15km's if you walk back through the village then down toward Bintang supermarket via the main road. I plan on taking my folks this year. Great views along the ridge. Then a walk through working rice plantations. Followed by some up and downhill along the windy road, over the river. Great experience either way being surrounded by jungle. You then walk through a small village/suburb with it's traditional housing. You end up at a slightly more main road that takes you back to the centre of ubud. I recommend asking someone for a lift back into town - I'd probably offer 100000 - you'll be tired by now.

Go when the sun rises or goes down. The walk will take some 1,5 hours and is most beautiful when the rises in the morning, you will most likely be quite alone at that time. If you go later in the day the heat can take the best of you. Another option is to go when the sun sets but be sure to be back in the streets before darkness, it will be pitch black..

Go early, enjoy the exercise and view before the heat rolls in.. We walked the Ridge from 0730 to 0930 with a 30-minute break at Karsa Kafe for breakfast. The walk is really nice the one is rewarded for the exertion with a beautiful view of rice paddies at the peak of the ridge. However, it gets crowded and on our trek back to the road it was a bit busy with dog-walkers, joggers and walkers. I prefer the serenity of having the walk to myself.

great morning walk. a 1.5 hour walk through villages and rice padiies accompanied by a hotel staff member. Botlles of water and hats provided by the Kayon and great information during the walk from the guide

Best time is early morning. We did this very early. It was a cool and pleasant walk. There were also not too many people around. There is a village at one end which has art and craft shops as well as some cafes overlooking some picturesque rice fields
A really lovely walk - the perfect way to begin the day in Ubud. Great way to get some peace and time-out in busy Ubud. Lovely rice-paddy views. Do it in the early morning or late afternoon/sunset.

Very nice and quiet place ! . Nice walk trough rice fields, nature and small Balinese villages. Very easy to come here from Ubud (approx 30 minutes), every one can do it :) !You must come here if you want to see the "real Bali" ;)

Gorgeous ridgeline views of the vallys running through northern Ubud. We did this walk in the afternoon, which was a great time to do it, the afternoon light was golden and very atmospheric. It took us a bit to establish where the walk actually started from ('near the bridge' was all we kept getting told) but figured it all out after watching a wedding party descending one afternoon while we were having afternoon tea overlooking the ridgeline at one of the nearby restaurants. Requires some level of fitness to complete this walk, I wouldn't want a bad knee or be in a wheelchair or on crutches, but you can manage it at an easy pace with average fitness. Not a very wide path and quite a few people were tackling it on mountain bikes, and a lot of the local lads (soccer team??) were using it as a training run, meaning we had sweaty puffing teenagers constantly overtaking us. But their enthusiasm was admirable, if puzzling as it was quite hot up there! Lots of swaying grass and views either side of the ridgeline where there are very steep descents to the rivers below. Glimpses of rice terraces and resorts dotted along the opposite sides of the valleys and the walk brings you up to a village and temple which is the point at which we got lost and ended up going north a little far and nearly walking to Taro! So a 45 min walk turned out to be a 2 1/2 hour one and I think we walked the entire length of Ubud and then some. Came back down into Ubud via Jalan Ubud in the dark pretending we weren't scared of the local dogs which all seem to have woken and taken up purposeful and slightly menacing poses outside their residences. Learn't if we didn't eyeball them, they were cool with us. Just a word of warning about the 'footpaths' all around Bail- they frequently have their tops missing meaning if you are strolling along in the dark not watching where you are putting your feet, you could wind up stepping into a very deep hole where a paver has been removed. Given there are large drains running under these paths I don't think this would feel too good. And there isn't much lighting in these parts at night. So best if you do this walk, turn around and walk back down when you get up to the little village. And allow a couple of hours to complete it leisurely.

Beautiful Walk through the rice fields. Well worth an afternoon or morning .... with a few nice places along the way for a lunch or drink .... not easy to find from Jln Raya Ubud; follow Warwick Hotel and pass left ... and pass the temple complex on the right and continue the path .....

beautiful. beautiful views, peaceful surroundings. Not too taxing but go early so it's cool. Café on the way for refreshments worth a visit, it's at the end of the walk so nice to stop and chill before setting back. I would recommend going to the café and walking back the same rout rather than going through and back on the road.

Incredible rice field walk so close to Ubud center. The Campuhan ridge walk starts at the Ibah hotel in the Jalan Raya Ubud street (ubud's main street). The get on the ridge, you have to climb a steep bath in the beginning but from there on the walk is rather easy. It takes about 35 min to get from Ibah hotel to the nice Karsa Cafe (a common stop). Along the way, you can see the Ubud valley and many rice fields. What we liked in particular was the fact that this nature walk was located so closely to the main hectic center of Ubud. It's almost unbelievable that you can find rest so close. When we were alking there, we passed a couple of other tourists but it never felt crowded. Highly recommended when in Ubud!

Paradise on Earth. Amazing lace and very relaxing and quit, if you like trekking it's the best place for you at Ubud.. you will walk for 2 Km but at the end you will feel that it's only 200 M because of breath-taking views around you
One great ridge walk. Great walk at any time of day. Fun to see both tourists and locals enjoying it for the views and for the workout. Great free activity in Ubud

Appreciate the real Ubud!. This has alway's been one of the "must do's" whilst in Ubud. Best to go early in the morning or later in the afternoon so it's not too hot.You can get a driver to drop you off at the village at the top,That way you then walk mainly down hill, ending up down the bottom near by Bridges restaurant. Or if starting by Bridges you can get a driver at the village. It is a extremely hilly and twisting road from the village out to the main road with no footpaths. There is a hotel at the top of the walk or Jungle fish restaurant (a it further on) where you can hire towels and pay to use their swimming pools. There is a nice spa and cafe at Kafe at the top of the walk.We have gone from walking this pretty trail to seeing it now, slowly being commersalized.Get the walking and enjoy it before it's all gone!
Quiet walk for morning or afternoon. Walk with jungle and river views, best done in the morning because the sun makes it very hot during the day.

Real ubud. Must visit before it's becoming too touristy! Go there in the early morning and maybe there will not be so many people :) It's a good place to go running, no cars only pure rice fields and nature

Great quiet walk through pretty scenery. We were on a day trip to Ubud and wanted to avoid the crowds so had our driver drop us to the start of this lovely pretty walk along the ridge between rice paddies and other fields. To get to the start find the IBAH hotel/villas and the start of the path is just to the left.We went early in the morning so it wouldn't be too hot and there were only a handful of other people walking (and nobody trying to sell you stuff) so it felt very quiet and peaceful.It's only a couple of kilometres so won't take you more than 30 - 45 minutes one way (first part of the walk has a moderate incline but it's not a particularly challenging walk; we walked it in flip flops!)At the end of the walk you'll pass a series of small local artist workshops before you come to the lovely Karsa Kafe where you can have a rest and a fruit juice or coconut with a beautiful view before tackling the walk back.

Scenic Pretty Walk. If you're into hiking then this is for you. It's just a nice hike up and down some hills with some beautiful scenery. There are long stretches of the path with no shade so be sure to protect your skin accordingly!

Must do. This is a must do for any visitor the views are not only breathtaking and spectacular you will find yourself returning time and time again. Make sure you start early just before sunrise is great or 1 hour before sunset
Hot hot hot. A beautiful walk along a a ridge. One word. HOT. It is very humid and there is no shade or anywhere to seek shade but defiantly a must in ubud

What a lovely way to start your day!!!. We set off at 7.00am thinking it best to do this walk before it got too hot. I think this was the right decision, as it lovely and cool which made for a pleasant journey. The walk itself was nowhere as taxing as I thought it might be, thanks largely to the fantastic path that has been created for us to walk along. The views were nothing short of spectacular and the walk itself only took an hour or so. Well worth the effort!!
Bali village life. This is the soul of Asian village life. since i am an asian, it probably did not excited me much. However, the walk is highly recommended for westerners.
Brilliant . Didn't know the walk was there we saw it on google maps and gave it a go. Really nice views with rice fields around too. Quite steep in places but all ages were doing it

Gorgeous views . This is a beautiful pedestrian-only walk right in the heart of Ubud. Lovely to have a break from the cars and motorbikes and take in the beautiful scenery. It's quite a short walk, but we'll worth the trip - try to set it up with a massage at Karsa Spa at the end.

Spiritual Journey . We started out our walk around 7am and walked past so many beautiful local art galleries . The people, the view , the air totally makes you feel ALIVE! The views as we strolled were stunning and gave us a true appreciation of nature, life, humility and so much love . The feeling in Ubud is So peaceful and spiritual . I felt like a new person and loved every minute of our journey . Make sure you head to Yoga Barn and Organik Cafe

spectacular. This walk should really be done early morning. There are very few places to escape the sun so the middle of the day is just too hot. The views are spectacular on both sides of the ridge and there are quite a few small temples and other interesting places to keep you inspired. The hardest part of the walk is the very beginning where the steps are quite steep but after that one would only need moderate fitness to complete the walk. Breakfast at the Karsa café at the end is a must and if you are tired taxi back to Ubud is 100k. We were quite refreshed after breakfast and decided to walk back. Later that day we had a massage to get rid of our tight calf muscles. Was a memorable experience that I would love to do again.
Awesome walk. Lonely planet has directions and a map but some signs on route beyond the advertising for Karsa Kafe would be handy
Perfect Start in the Morning. Fantastic views along the walk. Get to the end and there is a cafe that has little bungalows in a fish pond where you can feed the fish.

Beautiful scenery. I loved this! Really close to Ubud main street and not hard to find at all. Quiet, beautiful but even more so during sunset i reckon. There is a small village at the top where there's beverages if you're thirsty.

let's run. This is my favorite while visited Ubud. Not just walked, i ran along the ridge walk. We came at 7 am, but I thought we had earlier because the sun was so bright at that time. We loved the green reeds and the blue sky.

A Walk with Lots of Greenery and Clear Blue Sky. Advisable to do the walk early in the morning, like 7am. We went at 9am and the sun was shining right above us. But no complaint as we woke up late. It was a great walk as I love greenery and blue sky. We had a drink at Karsa Cafe and the view was lovely.
Wonderful walk. This is one of my favourite things to do in Ubud and I try and take the walk every time I visit. Highly recommend if you're keen to get out and about in the countryside.

Nice walk, not difficult. Start the walk from the Campuhan Bridge and walk a few minutes in the Ubud direction until the entrance of the Ibah Villa's. Then turn left at the barrier and you are on the trail.We walked one direction until the Karsa Cafe in 40 minutes while stopping often for taking pictures of the beautiful landscape. After some refreshments at Karsa Cafe we walked the same route back in 30 minutes.It is advised to walk early in the morning or late in the afternoon because of the temperature.

Finding the ridge walk. took some time to find this lovely walk but look for sari organic sign on the right hand side of japan rays ubud before it goes down hill. Walk up and go left along a very narrow and walled road and watch out for motorbikes before turning right you go up to a lovely walk along the ridge.
Great End of Trip of Walk. End of our trip in Bali, so we had a lovely sunset walk along this ridge. Near the end, found a little place on the rice fields to share a coconut and watch the sunset.

Pleasant Walk. Walked the return trip to Karsa Kafe . Best done early or late as it gets pretty hot. Views are ok but location of Karsa Kafe with great views over the rice fields make a great place for drink and snack. On an easy walking track away from cars at the beginning but does lead on to a road towards the Kafe. A nice free activity in Ubud.
Must do. Highly recommend doing this in the morning before it gets too hot! Entrance is just past the Warwick Ibah hotel. Bring money as some great cafes and galleries once you hit the villages
Great view. 1-2 hour walk up a ridge in the jungle.. you'll have a very nice view on the surrounding plethora of various trees
Wonderful views. Nice walk through narrow lanes and paths, past villas and looking down a valley or out to the rice fields It is worth the walk lots to look at and plenty of photo opportunities

Great hike. This is a must-do in Ubud when you like beautiful views and want to enjoy some peace and quiet.If you walk the ridge for about 3,5km you can go get yourself a drink (and something to eat) at a place called Jungle Fish, it's a hotel where you can go for a swim whilst paying a fee of 300.000idr. This amount is returned to you in the form of anything you order from drinks to food.

Nice walk with pretty views. The Campuhan Ridgewalk is a nice activity for the morning or evening hours as it gets really hot in the afternoon. You can relax in a cafe with nice views of the rice paddies or talk a stroll around them.
A noise free walk. Go early in the morning to avoid the heat & enjoy walking without having to dodge motorbikes or traffic. Terrific views and a great cafe at the end of it!

Fairly easy walk. Well worth the time to enjoy the green and quite away from the busy centre of Ubud. Refreshing as an early morning walk with breakfast at the Karsa Café.The half walk and return from the Bridges to Karsa Café can easily be done in an hourand is a great escape. If staying in Ubud is worthy of multiple visits.

Worth the visit.. My fiancee and i live near this campuhan ridge on our first 2 nights.It actually link to the town area in ubud after 20 to 30min walk.Would recommend peoples to go either early morning..or slight before sunset. As the sun here could be quite torturing when it is high up in the sky.And also..avoid this place at night when the sky is dark..my fiancee got chase by 2 dog when we walk past a private resident area!! She had a bad fall which resulted in an abrasion on her knees!

Fairly easy hike with amazing views. It's a fairly easy walk that can be completed in less than an hour one way (if you regard the Karsa Kafe as your end-point), with really great views either side of the ridge. I would suggest doing this either early morning or late afternoon or it might get a little too hot. I would also suggest making a U-turn after a pitstop at Karsa Kafe - my husband and I decided to venture beyond Karsa Kafe after taking the advice of a local and ended up walking on a path with pretty steep terrain and fast cars, and most importantly, no sidewalk. It's really much better to just make a U-turn and enjoy the views for a second time - why not?

Take a quiet walk through the ridge. If you want to take a casual stroll around the area then the Ridge Walk is a nice easy one to take. The trail is made up of a stone path that follows the ridge that leads down the the river and gives you some nice views of the hostels, resorts and hotels that populate the small river that the ridge walk follows. It doesn't take a long time but there are other trails you can take that go into the rice fields which have more character. There isn't much around the ridge but it is quiet and I think its nice to do in the morning or close to sunset but there are no lights on the walk so remember to get back or walk along one of the roads that goes pack into town.

The payoff. Tricky to find. But once you find the trailhead, karsa cafe has done a great job of marking it. We didn't see many other people at all, and there is no shade but a lovely walk nonetheless! Walk through the village at the end and have a drink at Karsa. Just lovely.

Great to escape from the hustle and bustle. Really nice walk some of it paved other bits you have to walk on roads so be mindful of trucks and bikes etc. That is if you do the full circuit which takes you past Payogan and Lungsiakan villages. The walk runs from Ibah Spa resort to the road that the Neka gallery is on. Its a good way of escaping the streets of Ubud.
A place not to be missed once you're in Ubud. Under the blue sky, small path among green meadows, standing stills in the middle the junction of 2 rivers of Wos.

Great way to start your day. We did this walk in the mornings which was a great way to start the day, no traffic and lovely views. Not all that long for a high energy walk but you can always add in extra length to satisfy your needs. Maybe avoid the trail after heavy rain due to mud.

Nice walk in midday sun. Road is really nice and view of terraces in the end is worthy of all that sweat, but it's better to choose another day time than midday. Road is long 2 km and leads up and down with minimum shadow. In the end is nice coffee shop with fine view of terraces, it's nice refreshment.

Still special despite the influx. There are still some special parts to this walk, but the inevitable encroachment of buildings and tourist trekkers has impacted the initial 'natural' ambience. It's sold as a trekking expedition - but you don't need a guide as long as you find the temple in the middle of the rivers confluence near the bridge and then the track on the east. The rubbish bins are a sensible addition - if everyone picked up two pieces of rubbish the whole track would be clean in a week. It's great to see the benefits of recycling and no-littering being spread by so many businesses and organisations throughout Ubud. To complete the full circuit takes quite a bit more effort and a little navigation, but if you keep heading left it's a good 5 km walk plus some decent dips and hills.

Great adventure away from the tourists. This walk is really worth doing particularly if you want to get away from the main tourist areas and enjoy some peace and quiet. There's some nice views from the top of the ridge as well.
Always return here. Perfect for morning jogging and late afternoon walk.... Would be perfect if we had a fresh coconut at the end of trail at karsa cafe

Nice view!. Might want to set off to do this walk early, it was almost unbearable to do an occasionally steep walk like this in the midday sun and although there are a few vendors and a lovely restaurant and spa half way, a bottle water is also a must!

A lovely stroll. This walk is very pleasant.
It was a great way to spend an afternoon.
The views are spectacular.
It was nice to walk without having to worry about traffic!
We walked to the start from central Ubud. It was easily accessible.
Gorgeous walk, but.... A must, but I would come back the way I came because the way back via the main road is a pain, a bore and a bit dangerous.

average kind of views..... A bit ho hum. We started at the bottom, the river is nothing special, just the usual dirty bali river full of rubbish. We walked up the hill, the track is just long grass, lantana and weeds! Nothing very nice at all. The view is ok, not spectacular. Where the view really comes into play is up at the karsa kafe. Lovely spot. You can get dropped here by car without the walk, even better get dropped here, have a bite to eat and then if you really feel the need walk down hill. The drivers are out for a scam, it takes longer to walk up hill,hence more money for them!! If you just want a bit of exercise the its ok, it only took us 20 min from the bottom end ip to where the art shops start, then another 15 to the end. So not sure how it takes people 2.5 hours.....

Great for a morning/late afternoon walk. A very nice walk in the middle of the nature.It is great to do it if your hotel is nearby. The walk takes about 30 minutes, we went late afternoon and it got dark on the way so it didn't look the safest place as there are no lights. I would recommend to keep in mind the sunset time and go just before that or early in the morning as it can be difficult to walk in the midday heat there.
Nice, gentle walk. Nice place really near town. Relaxed atmosphere. Bring water, sunscreen and mosquito repellent. And of course your camera.

Go Early. We started our walk around 7AM and went all the way up to Karsan spa and above. The path is nice and wide, and it's hard to get lost on this trail but with runners and other walkers along the way it wasn't as peaceful or as interesting. It's a nice and easy stroll though. The temple right at the start of the trail is beautiful; we read that it's from the 8th century. Karsan Spa's lotus pond is also very pretty, and the staff let us take photos from there as well. Be ware that the trail is quite exposed and you won't get much relief from the sun. Go early or late in the day.
A Real life of Village living. A great place for morning or evening walk at Campuhan to see real ubud village life. The padi field view is nice and amazing.

Relaxing, beauitful and enjoyable. If you take your time to stop for photos and browsing the local art galleries, you can spend up to 2 hours walking the short distance of ~3km, but it's time well-spent. We came away with plenty of nice photos as well as some lovely artwork for an amazing price. well recommended.
Nice Walk. A walk worth taking when visiting Ubud. Going early in the morning is ideal, but any time of the day the walk is enjoyable and it is possible to sit in a small cafè if it is too hot.

Beautiful for a sunset stroll!. You've seen the photos - the undulating ridge paired against a dramatic valley that's lush with palms and illuminated by luxurious-looking villas. Yes, that's all there and the views are quite beautiful. You just won't be enjoying them alone. Timing is very important as it could get crowded. We went at sundown and came back using a flashlight so we had the ridge mostly to ourselves. The trail is well-paved and accessible, so it can be enjoyed as a leisurely stroll by all ages and families.
