So-so. It is a lovely walk but, I'd say the per padi walk is better and you see more scenery and it's more peaceful. I did both, which makes a couple of nice afternoon walks away from the traffic chaos

nice for exercise but no longer offers what it promises due to some developement. I began at 6am and glad I did as the first bit is uphill. A pleasant walk for exercise and some small rice paddy views, you can get up close and really see the rice growing. Some warungs to sit in and rest or fancier cafes and some art shops. Seems to be a few villas in the area now, tastefully done though. It is a nice walk but don't think you will be alone in the 'woods' I did manage to find several quiet spots by wandering thru the grass and had an hour to contemplate my belly button all by myself on the ridge. If you want to see a bit of rural life but not comfortable walking too far from the beaten path this is a good place to see some local life. The path is paved and in good condition, go slow up the hill, take water and rest when required. You will be back in the hotel pool in a few hours anyway. Enjoy.

Just beautiful! . Behind the scenes in Ubud! Absolutely beautiful scenery, perfect for an early morning walk. We came at 6.30 so it was super peaceful. Stop at Karsa Cafe for breakfast on your walk back for an awesome view. Definitely worth it

Great walk to nice tranquil area. This walk was well worth the effort, but it took us a while to find the starting point near the Warwick Ibah hotel in the Main Street. We went in the middle of the day, so it was warm, so some people would prefer to do the walk earlier or later in the day. You get a great view of the surrounding area, and the final destination is amazing. Karma cafe has a beautiful garden setting over the rice fields. A great spot just to chill and soak up the Balinese vibes.

Glad I did this!. Was expecting this to be super challenging after some of the reviews I had read but really, if you have any degree of fitness you will be fine. Early in the morning would be best as cooler, but I went at 0900 ish and it was Ok. Shady spots and good photo opportunities along the way. 2km each way from Ibah in Ubud. Wear decent shoes, bring some water and you'll be sweet!

nice trail to see the country side. I well worn trail that was worn by foreigners and Indonesians alike. There are some awesome views of new construction and the countryside once you get a little further down the trail. There are a few hotel restaurants and nick-knack shops along the way. Its not too difficult and well worth it to feel like you are in another world.
Nice scenic walk. Walk to Karsa Cafe or further. Pass some interesting artists shops a few other cafes and Spa's as well. Nice picturesque views along the ridge

Not exactly a hike. If you're after some physical activity after eating all the delicious food in Ubud, the Campuhan walk is a reasonable option. However, there's really only a small section that is very attractive - so can't recommend it for the scenery. Also it can get quite full with other tourists and local school kids. It's a short walk - maybe 45 minutes end-to-end at a leisurely pace.
Clearly Recommended . Nice scenery and atmosphere. ~ 2km from main road to Karma Kafe with stunning view. Gets warm if sun shines. Slightly uphill on way there.
Early morning walk. I started from the Ibah end of the walk which meant the first 45 minutes was uphill. Good exercise. Well worth it when I got to the end where the views were spectacular.

Good spot for having a photoshoot or morning run. I visited this place in the morning.At first I thought it would have a long track with beautiful scenery so I decided to have a morning run there.Turned out, it was not that long.Maybe I was over-expecting it.The scenery was not that wonderful either.Just one or two spots were great enough.But I think it was the best place to have a morning run in Ubud area.

Wonderful morning stroll. Trail was very close to our hotel at Sri Ratih Cottages, was a great way to start the morning. Can get a little warm later in the day so an early start to see the sunrise was the best way we found to experience this lovely spot.

Beautiful walk. This walk is a great option to watch "different side of Bali" or "another Ubud". There's no places of interest on the way, just quite village life and amazing views.It's hard to consider this walk as "trekking", because it is very easy, even for children and elderly people. Recommended for nature lovers and for travelers seeking peacefull, beautiful scenery. Without this walk my personal impression of Bali real life wouldn' be full.

Amazing for an early morning stroll. This is the best place for a walk in Ubud. We stayed at The Lokha Ubud, which was very close to where the walk began. It takes you straight into Ubud City center. An extremely picturesque location. It provides breathtaking views of the dense forest on both sides. It takes about 20 - 25 mins to reach Ubud City Center. Small Warungs (cafes), painting galleries line the sides of the walk for the first 400m. This has to be on the to-do list of every traveler in Ubud.

A little off the beaten track. General advice is to head off as early in the day as you can, as there isnt much shade and you will get hot! This was a lovely walk into the countryside out of Ubud, certainly worth the effort. Once you have found the path (see other reviews for directions ) it is a well worn path, special footwear is not necessary, I just wore my thongs. Do take a bottle of water. After a rest at the Karsa Kafe, where the menu was about the same price as in town, I was ready to head back to my hotel for a rest.

Hard to find on foot without a map but beautiful walk once we got there!. We did this beautiful walk at 6am in the morning and hardly saw anyone other than some very friendly locals- it was beautiful the fresh morning air and watching the sun come up at the fog settle. Relatively easy walk- took us around 2hours return from our hotel ( we walked back along the road into ubud once we got too the end, which was a nice way too see the locals all heading off too school and setting up there offerings etc)
Beautiful walk. We walked a kilometer or so from the Ubud entrance on the Campuhan Ridge Walk. This is a nice relaxing walk away from the crowds of Ubud. The views are beautiful.

Really nice . Our villa was really close to the start of the walk so we had an afternoon stroll here. It was really nice. It is very picturesque & we really enjoyed walking through the rice fields. You can even see some rice terraces in the background behind the trees. The route is quite short if you are used to walking but still beautiful

Nice walk. For those who enjoy nice and long walk, this is a nice place to go. Some sections have no shade at all, so you may want to do this early in the morning if you do not like the heat or too much sunshine.

perfect for a sunset walk. the entrance to this walk is a little hard to find, but once u found it, the walk is very rewarding. it goes through some grass land, rice fields and many small villages, depending on how far u r willing the go. the best time for this walk is definitely at sunset. it was so beautiful

Great first day in Ubud. I got into Ubud last night. This hike was on the to do list. I couldn't sleep that well so got up relatively early and started from my hotel about 7:30 am for the ridge walk.I was on the south side of Ubud and walked through the mostly closed city to the trail head. It was a little tough to find. It is a split off the main road and is actually a set of stairs doing down on the right side. At first there were ominous signs that seemed to be some sort of danger or keep out and a price listed. I think it was a notice for fining polluters on the trail. There were plenty of trash cans on the way to toss out water bottles along the hike.It isn't very arduous but does start relatively steep. Really quickly you are suddenly in a Bali ridge looking across valleys on both sides and suddenly the city is gone. That was the coolest part.At the top there are several shops, food stops etc. There were artists selling supposed original works. The works were original at the first stop. Later I saw the exact same pieces over and over again. Three different galleries proclaimed their stuff was shown in town. The exact copy cat pieces. There was however one artist that seemed legit but his art was selling for $300+ which was WAAYY outside my budget. Even had a piece he claimed was $10,000 (us dollars btw).I stopped at two of the cafe's at the top of the hill for coffee and waters. I opted to continue the loop that went left and back to the city. No sidewalk. I ended up walking along a very busy street but did see a lot of interesting things such as some crazy small statues that littered outside some homes, A guy invited me inside his gated yard to check out his statue collection. Had a brief conversation with a laundry lady. One sad part was crossing some of the bridges when you look down a deep ravine into thick lush jungle and small river the view is destroyed by trash, full on garbage bags, at the bottom. It is obviously a normal thing as full garbage bags were stuck in trees a hundred feet from the bottom of the ravine. Incredibly unfortunate.There weren't that many people on the trail at that time in the morning. Some some locals doing their running workouts. At the top many tourists came in by motor scooters.The good part to this being the first day for me in Ubud was at the end as I came into the city I was more than ready for lunch and seeing how different the town was before opening and in full swing approaching lunch time.I definitely recommend this as a good morning routine. If you get on trail just before sunrise you can definitely be back to a nearby hotel for breakfast if you want.The trail isn't that difficult but do have some water with you. If you happen to not take any there will be water available at the top for a reasonable price.

For a quiet, evening walk. The start of the trail is a little hard to locate (from the city side), but once you do you are in for a nice hour's walk along the well paved ridge with some nice greenery around. It is also time to engage with some friendly locals that frequent the place. Plan your walk in the evenings (or early in the mornings) to beat the heat.

Lovely walk. Warm but shaded areas.. Found this walk fairly easily as there were signposts from the main road.The trip advisor location is accurate.Really enjoyed this walk. Superb scenery. Along the way various shops / artists / cafes. We walked about 4.5 km and then walked back. It was warm but there were areas of shade. Not a difficult walk at all.

Nice walk. About a good 2km stretch of walk. Very hot but there is some shade coverings in some areas. Good to go see if your in ubud. Bring cold water with you as there really is no stores only at the end of the walk with some small cafe's and stores along with some artist shops.
Crowded. Green View. Easy walk. it's best you come in the morning. we visited in the late afternoon so it gets crowded. the green view is alright, nothing spectacular though.

Simply a beautiful walk. I hadn't really thought of walking it, but walked back to Ubud from the spa. Pleased I did, peace away from the buzz of town. There isn't one thing that is amazing to see, but lots of lovely views including a temple. If you have the time go for a stroll it's quite relaxing, not in midday sun as I did.

Lovely Walk. This is a relaxing and enjoyable walk, best enjoyed in the morning or early evening. It could be unpleasantly hot midday. There is a nice resto and spa at the top where you can refresh yourself with a fresh young coconut or a lime juice. I wanted to try a massage as well, but the place is popular--book ahead. One of my favorite aspects of this walk is the few small family shops at the top. You can watch the artists creating their work there, and the prices were much better than down in the main market.
Campuhan Ridge Walk. Great walk in the early morning, stunning scenery and no vehicles. Best to get transport to the top and walk down. A highlight of our stay in Ubud.

Hot and breathtaking. We had not done this walk on previous visits to Ubud and the first attempt resulted in an extraordinary change of plans which resulted in us being taken to a once in 50 years temple ceremony outside Ubud - that is another story.The walk commences off Jl Raya Ubud near the old Royal Palace and temple close to the Campuhan River. The initial part of the walk is quite steep as you make your way up the walls of the river gorge to the ridge between the two branches of the river. Once on the ridge which continues to slope upwards you are in rice paddies and also can look into the gorges of the two ranches of the river. The views are superb and you can see the scale of the massive torist developments taking place in the Ubud area from here. Along the path are various art studios, health spas, massage etc venues - also a range of small Warungs (local cafes) where you can purchase drinks (fresh coconut juice from a coconut is really nice) and light snacks, You need to keep a look-out for motor scooters and motorbikes as this is quite a busy trtack. Also it is a popular track for cyclists on rented cycles. We walked to the village at the top of the track. The walk back downhill was much easier. This a really nice way to see the traditional side of this area. The views are lovely and the walk is not too taxing. Highly recommended activity

Crowded during weekend. My first trip to Campuhan was on weekdays and it was pleasant walk. I went to Campuhan on weekends for my second trip and it was crowded with people. My advice, if you are going for photo snap, do not go on weekends.

At least once in a lifetime. Go there early in the morning, 8 am is a good time. Bring water because the terrain is a little bit challenging and will dehydrate you fast enough. At the end of the walk, enjoy cold coconut water at Karsa Kafe with its refreshing view.

Scenic Walk - Take a Guide to Maximise the Experience and Walk South from the Northern End!. We took a car to a village north of the Campuhan Ridge Walk, because we had a guide and so walked down the road to start the walk at the "pizza restaurant end". Pizza restaurant I hear you say, yes, at the northern end there are a number of artists making and selling their works in small shops/sheds, so it's culminated in the more commercial café/bar/pizza restaurant. This should give you an indication that you are not really trekking through the wilds in some remote part of Ubud! Anyway, keep going and enjoy the local scenery.Tip: by starting at the Northern end you are walking south back to Ubud. If you intend to walk all the way, and start at the Southern end, you will walk up (mostly up hill) and back (mostly down hill). Of course depends on your energy levels!If you want to limit your walk, start at the Southern end, over the river, past the temple and up the hill to the ridge, and then return. This means you won't see the artists/more commercial part of the walk. I have attached a photo of the Hotel driveway that you walk down to find the start of the walk - it's called, Warwick Ibah Luxury Villas and Spa.

A nice walk in the morning. The trail is just beside Warwick Ibah so we took the walk and it turned up to be an incredible nice experience. The walk is fairly easy and you get to enjoy great view throughout. At the end of the trial, there are also craft shops and cafe so do being some money with you.

Nice walk through rice fields. Loved this walk, as soon as you step out from the "big city" you are immersed in a landscape of peace, tranquillity and of course rice fieldsMany nice small warungs along the way serving organic food and Karsa Spa at the top

Nice walk. Well it was a nice small walk. The views were good, however there are quite a few homestays/hotels along the way which obstructs the view but still a nice place for a morning walk. Go there early in the morning.

Gorgeous vieuws. Between two river valleys I enjoyed the incredible landscape of Rice farming and quiet authentic villages along with stretchers of tropical nature. Easy accessible , right away from the town's center into the countryside, a truly memorable experience.

pleasant walk, nice scenery. Beautiful scenic walk out of the city centre of Ubud, into the ricefields. Several art and souvenir shops, spas and restaurants along the trail. Retrace your steps from the first village as the return walk along the city road is not so interesting - unless you would like to take in the Neka Art Museum

Best walk in Ubud. Beautiful any time of day.. I did this walk almost every single day I was in Ubud and loved it especially at sunset. The views are incredible, and it's well frequented by locals and tourists alike. I highly recommend walking to Karsa Cafe at sunset and indulging in the views and great food once you get there. To Karsa Cafe it's a good 1.5 miles - 3 miles round trip - with the first part mostly uphill. The path is well paced so you can wear sandals or cloth shoes.If you want a quieter walk, take the road before (xx) and stop at Cafe Pomegranate. This is more secluded but the quality of the roads aren't great and there's no light at night. TIP: Wear bug spray especially if you're going at night.

Nice way to walk off breakfast. During our recent Ubud trip we walked from our Hotel in Monkey Forest road to the top of Campuan Ridge stopped for coffee & returned to our hotel, this is a nice way to see some different sights in Ubud & well worth the effort.

Beautiful walk/hike on endge of Ubud.. Definitely worth an hour or two to escape the hustle and bustle of Ubud. You can do this one-way or round trip from the edge of downtown Ubud. It's a medium difficulty walk/hike, mainly due to elevation change and steps at the beginning, but once on the ridge it is easy, and beautiful. Roughly ~30-45 minutes each way.

Short but nice. I expected a little bit more but it was very nice! The view of the rice terraces is great and there are a couple of nice cafés where you can relax after walking in the sun. It wasn't touristy at all which was very nice after a couple of days in Ubud. Definitely a great way to escape for 1-2 hours the busy life if Ubud :)

Walked down the ridge into Ubud. We had been at the Karsa Spa, and after lunch, decided to walk down into Ubud. It is quite a lovely walk with many nice viewpoints along the way. It was warm, but we had water and were fine. Bu the time we got into Ubid however and climbed the hill into the city we were pretty steamy, but nothing that an iced coffee couldn't cure!
Campuhan . It is good place to walk in the morning. Come here till 6 to 8 otherwise it will be too hot for you. Don't forget to take water with you.
Pleasant and gentle. Did this as a one way walk shuttled by the hotel. Lots of pretty rice field scenery and animals along the way. Was hot, but so was most of Bali, didn't seem especially so.
Good place for short walking. Quiet and pleasant area for walking and it's good because it is short but has everything.. temple, forest, stream, rice fields, good resorts and restaurant too.

Great for brisk morning jog. It's free. Great view, friendly people. Just go before the sun is well up. Not really for kids, unless you don't mind carrying them halfway. Some steep Hills, but nothing to complain about. The entrance is a bit tricky to find, look for a Canyon near an ATM

Serene walk through the rice fields. With the beautiful Balinese sun above us we took the day off to follow the Campuhan Ridge Walk it was a truely inspiring and unforgetable wander through picturesque post card like vistas of the rice paddys and small villages that adorn the route the occasional small independant artists studio was a nice surprise too
A lovely walk. You start with a beautiful temple and after it is 20min walk through the rice terrasses. There are some restaurants and cafes to enjoy the view...

The perfect exercise walk. Surpiingly scenic quiet getaway rural walk in the middle of bustling Ubud.Between 2 steep gorges for early mornings between 5.30am and 7.30am including passing a beautiful temple at the beginning. Volcano views in clearer weather.

Good Exercise & Pretty View. It is a good workout in the morning before you indulge in food. The hike up was worth it as the view along the way was pretty awesome! We went about 7AM and came back down 9AM before the sun gets too hot. Bring sunglasses, water and a big hat. And wear a sports shoe for the hike. :) I thought i won't make it up because halfway i was panting already (probably it's just me) But please keep going and once you're up there, it is worth every sweat!

Engaging artist aea. Take water with you! We walked between 7.30 and 9.00 and were SO pleased we had grabbed some water as we left our accommodation. We did wonder what the fuss about when climbing the steep grassy ridge, but were so pleased that we had continued when we reached the villages and rice fields.

Amazing and relaxing way to see Ubud. the hike was breathtaking and almost picture perfect. It was truly a great way to get away from the traffic and everything else and just see Ubud. There are several nice places to sit down and have a bite to eat or drink with amazing views as well. Continue on the trail and you can loop around and through several small villages on the outskirts and back into Ubud.
Green view. It was a bit tiring to hike up the hill. The view was good and green. It's better to come before 10am or after 4pm. And don't forget to bring a water!
Good walk with views. Easy walking distance from Ubud Palace. Good views. Best done early in the morning or evening! Walk up to Karsa Kafe ... Nice view of rice fields from the top level of the cafe.
Nice walk, nice view. We went just after a big rainstorm so it was a nice quiet walk with a pretty view. It's worth the walk when you visit Ubud. Don't forget to bring some water.

Stunning!. I did this walk this morning and loved it! The scenery is absolutely stunning so come prepared with your camera! Also be sure to wear comfortable walking shoes, sunscreen, and a hat! Oh, and bring water!
Nice view. The hike up the hill was a bit tiring but once we reached to the top, the view was pretty amazing. Will go again next time.......

Great walk. A really fantastic and scenic walk through villages and rice fields...do it early morning or late afternoon out of the heat of the day. Can choose several options...easy or medium...we did the full 2.5 hour trek...with a guide but can do on own as we did again. Don't let the odd dog put you off! Just raise your arm & make some noise to deter them.

The Hill Behind The Temple. I accidentally found The Campuhan Ridge Walk when i followed an old local name Made Satre who told me [after a brief conversation] that he want to find some grass to make roof and other balinese ornament. And i found myself walking at the ridge, taking picture of him and the surrounding area.The enterance to the ridge were situated at the side The Gunung Lebah Temple. It was a little road, around 3 meters wide which going up the hill [that's why i called it "Bukit Belakang Sekolah" or "The Hill Behind The School", taken from an old animation movie i watch as a kid].There is several things that have to be prepared to explore this place. First things, bring something to drink and a snack because it was a long way walk. Second, if you affraid of the sun, prepare your sunscreen, sunglasses, and a cap or hat. The third and the most important things, bring a camera because the view were great.

At last!. Something that has been on our to do lists for a while! Finally did it this week.Don't think it would matter what time you set out - it's hot!Magnificent viewsLoved stopping to chat to some of the artists along the wayGreat photo opportunitiesMiddle grade walk, there are some steep areasKarma cafe an absolute must doAs others have said, take hat, water and sunscreen.Good idea to have mosquito repellent Don't put it off - go for it!

At one with nature . What's not to love about this walk, run or cycle!?? This Ridge takes you to local villages as well as from the villages to the Main Street in Ubud. Connect with nature and enjoy all that comes your wayPros -Connecting with nature or simply talking a shortcut either way you're going to feel total reinvigorated or connected with the land. Cons. Undulating paths not advisable afterSunset.

Nice start on the ridge - but short. We enjoyed our walk on the ridge. It was very hot, even when we started before 8.30 am. Some nice warungs along the way to enjoy. Depending on the length of walk you are trying to do, this could be a bit short. We thought the ridge would last us at least 45 minutes, but soon we arrived at the end of the ridge which turned in to a road. While we followed the map route along the road (and it sure was an adventure!), the road is narrow and busy with cars. A nice adventure all in all, but definitely not in the rice fields!
Great walk . Good walk through the grass and nice views of the jungle, we rode push bikes through good to save some time lots of good photos

Charming adventure. Just a little bit outside of the main town lies this trek, hidden from the public view. This has a nice temple at the beginning of the trek and a mild climb leading to a verdant ridge. An interesting adventure that opens up many vistas.

Great views from Campuhan Ridge. The walk is pretty straightforward (well paved in most places) with great views. There's not much cover so use sun block or wear a big hat. We got a driver to take us to the end of the walk and then headed back towards Ubud - where one can easily get refreshments and cool down.

Long but rewarding walk. You need to be fit to do this walk. Some places are steep so strong legs and back needed. Rice fields, tropical forest, green...green..green! There are full of small shop stalls so water is available to purchase.

Nice bit of exercise . Go early in the morning before any heat , around 7 or 8 , this is a nice walk with a couple nice cafes , bring a camera for some nice shots ,also trainers , if you wish you can go down to the river .. But not advisable if you have not trainers on .. Also if it's wet

Nice walk out of Ubud. If you want to get out of Ubud and see the countryside for an hour or two this is a nice place to start. Walk out of town and up the ridge, and when you come to the road head on a bit more to see some art and have lunch at Karsa Café or one of the other places along the road. As long as you can walk for a couple of kilometers each way and can handle stairs and an incline this is a walk anyone can do.

Serene. Did this walk in the late afternoon. It was a lovely, quiet stroll through the rice paddies. Make sure you wear a hat and sunblock - it was sunny and hot. I sense the rest of Ubud is encroaching on the tranquility of the rice paddies, so I hope when I come back it will continue to feel as serene.

A nice way to get out into the country. We did part of this walk the last time we were here but this year we came to do a bit more. I was using the map in the Lonely Planet guide for Bali and Lombok and we did the walk in an anticlockwise direction. We stopped for a coffee at the Karsa Kafe and enjoyed the pleasant surroundings before continuing.According to the map in the Lonely Planet guide the track is supposed turn west shortly after this café but we must have missed the turning. We went a bit further north than I expected before we could head down across the river. We past another group of walkers going up the steep hill on the other side of the river and they also had a copy of the Lonely Planet guide in their hands so we weren't the only ones following the long path.Following the road down the western side of the river goes through shops and houses and isn't as picturesque as the walk along the ridge but it did show us a bit more of the Bali culture.It took us about 45 minutes to do the 2km to the Karsa Kafe and about 1 hour and 50 minutes to do the 6.3km back to the starting point following the track around.
Very nice landscape. A 2km walk from city, near a temple, up to a hill and ridge, with beautiful landscape on both sides. Very relaxing.

Lovely walk and cafe a must see at the end!. We set out very early as advised in the cool of the day and really enjoyed this walk. Our seven year old son also enjoyed it and the café right up the end (keep going!) is a must see. We were there before opening time but were able to check out the top deck overlooking the stunning fish ponds and were very glad we kept walking to find it!
Great short trek in the heart of Ubud. I liked going on this walk. It was very short-paced, serene, and relaxing. Great views of the Ubud town. Must go and also great for children and elderly.

Beautiful Views But Long. Must start Early in the morning, say 6.30am as it is a 14 km roundtrip, and steep steep hill to walk at one part, but well worth it, it is very peaceful also if you do early, I bought some very unique art up there. ake sure you do the curcuit it is worth it.

A beautiful walk that is even better at sunrise or sunset. Close to town but a world apart. We highly suggest this walk. The green forest and fields are amazing. Lots of young Balinese walk it together everyday. It will raise your heart rate.

Nice little walk out of Ubud. A nice and easy treck to get out of the traffic of Ubud. Once up on the ridge you have some nice views over the valley and the surrounding fields and palm trees. The main ridge is only about two kilometers long, so it's a short walk if thats your goal. Once past the ridge you can continue on the road amongs the rice fields and visit the cafés and spa's along the road. Probably the nicest thing about this short treck is that you get out of the bussy traffic and get to experience something closer to what Bali used to look like.

Good place for energetic couple. Enjoy long walk, around 3 kilometres (1.5 kms go and 1.5 kms back to starting point (measured from Endomondo)), with beautiful-field scenery on the side of the path. Not recommend for people who afraid of lizard because you will meet a lot along the way. Not too tough for seniors (55+) because I saw many of them there and seems like no problem to them. Parking might be a little problem if you drive. You can park at the school area close to the entrance (but lets talk to the teachers there first cuz our driver did ask for the permission before parking). This time we did only half way there, but surely will come back next time to the end of the path.

Nice walk but there are better.... This was a nice walk but not a huge amount to see really. Takes about 1 hour return (unless you keep going along the road into the town on the other end). There are a few cafes and warungs to stop at as well for food, bathrooms and water.I would recommend getting started early in the morning (8am) to avoid the heat. There is little shade along the ridge and it can get quite hot.

Great walk in the countryside. We left our accommodation on Jl Bisma at the crack of dawn to do this walk. It was so beautiful being on the track to watch the sunrise over the rice fields. This is the such an easy way to see the more real rural life of Bali without driving for miles. As it was early the cafe's were not open but we avoided the heat of the morning. This is a must do when staying in Ubud. You can slowly stroll or power walk/run the track.

Stunning Landscape. We did prewedding photoshoot yesterday. Very popular for local and foreigner. They loved to run and enjoy the scenery. Great place enjoying Green field plus giant coconut trees. Worth to visit.

Lovely views. A lovely hike. You need a certain level of fitness to do this walk. One review I read suggested "a gentle uphill slope" for most of the way --> this is code for 'lots of steep slopes'. Highly advise going early morning or late afternoon when coolest.

Paddy amble and the breezy ducks. A good escape from the busy streets of Ubud. Upon arriving in Ubud I already regretted not being born 30 years ago in the times of better British explorers and edgier travel writers because Ubud was way more developed than I had suspected. This walk helped me forgive the hoards of tourists before me for bringing Ralph Lauren to Indonesia. It starts inconspicuously enough ducking past a swish resort, then follows a quick sharp climb to get you on to the ridge. The views are great and it only takes an hour or so to get a feel for normality in the locals way of life - which is what I wanted. I couldn't for the life of me find the left turn that the lonely planet points out to make this a circular route and now wasn't the time to earn that long awaited duke of Edinburgh award cutting my way through palm in 35 degrees. So an out and back it was! We stopped off at a lavish hotel on the way back for a drink and a view into the valley - well worth it!
Great walk . Very good walk, very easy but humid and warm as expected (of course haha) nice view and plenty of room to keep walking!

A must do in Ubud. A very beautiful walk outside of downtown Ubud and a must-do if you are staying in the area. Great views of the rolling mountains outside of a busy city and a nice way to spend a few hours strolling. It's very hot so be sure to bring water, sunscreen and wear a hat! Don't forget your camera!

Nice rice field walk!. We headed there on a cloudy mid-day, although the rain stopped us from walking all the way, there were plenty of cafes restaurants and spas all the way along the paved path you could get sheltered. It was a quiet walk outside Ubud, few scooters were also passing by the narrow path beside us. We enjoyed lunch with a beautiful view of rice fields and an excellent reflexology break on the way back. I say it is a must see if you are in Ubud but mind the heat if you are there on a warm day. You can also find some rental homes there, I think it is a nice spot to try your luck and to find a place to spend the night.

Good trail for sunset. Good trail for sunset walk. The ridge is not too far from Ubud palace with small signage in the road front. It was nothing there really, just a trail with high grass. If you like to see nice sunset, this is a place to be.

Nice walk outside buzy Ubud. Very nice walk and worth the sweat! The walk is not to long but it can get hot. Start in later afternoon after lunch and walk to the Sunset bar to enjoy a drink while looking over the sunset on the rice fields. BEAUTIFUL!!

Lovely - more suburban than rural. Did this walk late afternoon - the start is wonderful, through a temple and a dark gorge - you then rise up between the rivers with a gorge either side of you. Initially the path is paved pedestrian, latterly it's a road through homes and a few shops - there was quite a lot of traffic, even on this road, so it's not very relaxing. The walk is beautiful and recommended but it's not really countryside, more like walking in Surrey than Dartmoor. As long as you are expecting this, you will have a great hike.

Good Morning Walk. It was an amazing morning walk with the karsa kafe at the end to welcome me. I feel at one with nature and peaceful again. Try to do it in the early morning as it is super hot when you do it from 9am onwards.

Great view. This was an easy walk into Ubud from Sunset Hill B & B. We chose to walk back this way also and although it was hot, it was an easy walk. I would not recommend heading out at sunset as it gets very dark quickly and the mosquitoes can be relentless. A cab is a safer way to return after dark.

Dying out. It takes more than an hour to walk at Campuhan Ridge, on our way, we have met many hikers. In fact, it seems much more easy for such a walk. You cannot miss it from Temple Etiquette at the very start because there is a signboard indicates how long does it take. Thanks to this instruction, the winding path along the ridge leads us to the village where you can find the studios of some artists at the end of your tour. Greenery woods, high-top trees, wild grass along the path with not much of a breeze are scarcely found in sardine-packed Ubud . Unfortunately some buildings are underway at the very end near the village, in the near future, I think, it would be more commercial than nowadays. Don't forget to bring a bottle of water as well as your camera, take a shot before the whole area is dying out.

Hot but beautiful. This walk is a little tricky to find but worth it. The entrance is located down the hill from central Ubud near the bridge. This walk takes you past a temple and alongside a river before heading up into an open area with lovely 360 degree views and then into a small village with many artists displaying their goods alongside the road. There is a restaurant / cafe towards the end of the walk with a lovely pond and a great spot to stop for a drink and a chance to cool down. There is little protection from the sun so this walk is best done in the early morning / late afternoon. Fairly easy walking.

Worth the sweat. The ridge is very pretty with nice 360 degree views but there is little to no shade. Because of the heat I would recommend only trekking up the ridge near sunrise or sunset. It's a thin path that also can get quite busy with cyclists and walking tourists so be patient and take your time! The first bit is uphill but then it flattens out. We entered near the Warwick hotel and they had signs you could follow to get to the ridge walk.

Beautiful! . Not too strenuous, this walk is about 2km long and it has stunning views 360 degrees. There was a nice breeze during our walk which gave us some relief from the heat. If you have some time, saunter along this path and don't forget your camera!

Do it every time I am here. At least once.. This is a beautiful walk that takes you by a beautiful temple, sacred river and along the ridge to the village of Bangkit Sidem. At the end is Karsa Cafe, a nice place to have a drink. I haven't eaten there often, but the food is OK. They keep growing and adding things like pavillions where you sit over a pond full of fish. It is lovely and one of my favorite spots. On a clear day you can see a mountain range that starts with Batu Karu over near Bedugul. Though there is more development than there use to be, you can still enjoy the very best Bali has to offer. Rice fields, coconut palms, mountains, ducks feasting in the rice fields, and beautiful Balinese people. Karsa Spa is also here and it's a real treat. But book in advance, it's always busy. I take an umbrella, there's virtually no shade. And a small bottle of water.

Fantastic!. A beautiful and leisurely walk with some beautiful scenery. Great for pictures! I even bought an original Balinese painting by Wayan Marta...check out his art studio at the top of the ridge in the little village.

Tranquil early morning walk. I would highly recommend this walk be taken at or around sunrise not only to avoid the heat of the day but to make the most of the tranquility of daybreak. Not a difficult walk but having reasonable level of fitness is also advisable.

Favorite Morning Walk in Ubud. Visiting Tjampuhan Ridge Walk is one of the way to enjoy Ubud. Beautiful Grass & Paddy Fields along the way. Sometimes we can see the Balinese doing their harvest ritual. At the end of the walk before we walk back, there's picasa cafe.
Wandering Around. Again just wandering around as you see a lot more walking, it's peaceful and a good walk and look, if you up there give it a go.

Lots of Up and Down but extremely worth the walk. I have walked the Ridge three times during visits and always marvel at the views and the scenery. Doesn't require sturdy shoes (we saw a young lady in honest to goodness high heels half way along!) but make sure that your shoes are walking comfortable. The path itself is paved but tends to be overgrown in many places so single file required at times. If you take your hat, sunscreen and water you will be rewarded with some exercise (the first bit is basically up hill all the way) and great views away from the hustle and bustle of the town...allow a leisurely hour to hour and half for the return trip but try to allow more and stay for a drink at the Karsa Cafe - which i consider to be the turning back point for Ubud (after a few cold drinks of course). For the feint hearted, a taxi back from Karsa Cafe is IDR100K.

Nice break from the normal scene of Ubud. We started from Monkey Forest road, where there was a nice temple at the start. As you can see from the pictures, we saw plenty of lush greenery and blue skies. The sun was scorching though, so definitely bring some sunblock. We set off at 8 am but still managed to get sunburnt.Nice padi fields and some wildlife spotted along the way as well.

Good short walk. We decided to do this walk on a cloudy afternoon. It is nice to get away from the busy areas. The walk is quite easy and is a gentle incline from the Ibah hotel. We carried on further than the Karsa cafe and managed to walk back to the top of Jalan Sanggingan which took about half an hour more. There were a couple of French restaurants in that area. The roads are not paved and it was tricky as the sun had gone down so we needed a torch. I would not recommend this part of the walk.

Easy walk with grear views. This easy walk is best done in early morning to avoid the tropical heat. Spectacular temple near the start at the Campuan bridge and some quality artist studios at the end. Allow about 1.5 hours for a return trip with some time to enjoy the sights on either side of the narrow ridge.

OK but hot!. Nice but would not recommend for small children. I was surprised at how many families were trying this. Beautiful temple at start but lots of uphill and it is hot if you start after 8 a.m. Family with stroller struggled on cobblestone path before turning back. Lots of signs about Karsa Cafe and Spa ; good marketing since you are ready for drink or massage after that hike. Nice view of lily pond but you can also see that at Puri Lukisan museum.I found the rice field walks much nicer. For river and valley views, hire a car and take a tour outside of Ubud.

Dry Plants. There is nothing special in this area, I happened there during the dry season so all the plants look brown and unattractive but the place is enough to enjoy the late afternoon or early morning. Daytime appropriately used to take pictures.

Beautiful, HOT. This was a lovely walk but it was HOT. Would suggest going in the morning to beat the heat. Ended at Karsa Kafe for a cool juice and a lovely view of some rice terraces. The temple at the base of the walk is beautiful as well. Because of the heat, I walked very slow...so it took me about 35 minutes to get there.

Nice place for an evening stroll. We had a lovely walk here in the late afternoon. Very easy to access from behind the bridge - you just have to walk down a short slope from the road and suddenly you're out of the chaos of Ubud and amidst the long grasses and rice paddies. I can imagine it would be pretty hot during the middle of the day, but it's a great spot for an early morning/late afternoon walk or jog. You can also stop in at Clear Cafe on your return for a Chai tea and a snack, as we did! Highly recommended!
Good and easy walk for free in the heart of Ubud. Is a good and calm place to go and enjoy nature, away from the chaos of the "crowded" streets of Ubud.

Not much to see. If you're looking for something to do and want to go for a walk somewhere that isn't in town, have at it. There's a short scenic part but otherwise there are resorts and the like on the neighboring hillsides and before you know it you're back walking through shops and accommodation peppered along the road. Absolutely DO NOT pay anyone to take you here. As listed on wikitravel there is a trekking tour for $40. I can't imagine what you'd be paying for.

Nice walk along the rice fields. We took this walk in the morning and were suprised how nice it was. There is a crossroad to go down to a river which was pretty cool. All in al nice to pass some time!

A great morning walk. The mist and the fresh air ,the views of the volcanoes, the rice terraces,all that make for the magic of Campuhan Ridge. Go early, have your breakfast at the small coffee house at the end and enjoy the day...

Breathtaking scenery. Simply beautiful walk. Gets very hot but you have to expect that when visiting the tropics. Would recommend going in the afternoon when it clouds over but most of all, take a camera! You won't be disappointed

If you get tired of ubud's traffic. Nice little walk! It is short but easily done, nice scenery and peaceful. I got lost trying to find it though as there are no signs indicating it from the main road!... Please put a sign... This walk is also popular with locals for friends hanging out and taking pictures.
Perfect. Words canot describe how magical this place is. Totally reccommend when visiting Ubud. Its a good Idea to set out early as it becomes very hot after 9am.
Great way to spend a few hours. The walk is easy with great views and so different to the rice paddock walks we have done here as well leave. In the early morning to avoid the heat but it's good fun

Nice place to chilin with pet. If you want to enjoy one of bali nature, this place might be suitable for you. Thats a beautiful green scenery that will relaxing your eyes. Even my dog love to explore this place,and force me to work out! Lol. One thing that annoy me was the rubbish around that place.

Every shades of green. Its "entrance" near to the centre of Ubud(10min), but overall 2-3 hours there and back. A good walk, but go in the morning, because very hot later. When you reach the village, there is an amazing cafe (Karsa Kafe). The surrounding is amazing!

Really liked it . Of course you don't see rice terraces but it is nice to see how fast you are in a green and lush nature after just being in the bustling city of ubud. Also a stop at karsa kafe worth it for the view

Another green around buay Ubud. The walk is not long and it suits everybody. On the way you can see a temple and the ricefields and at the end you have cafes where you can have some lunch. Its a great area where you can go walkibg, running, breath or even just take photos.

Very good short cut to see Bali. The Campuhan walk is a very good short cut to see Bali...
It is so easy to walk and in a few minutes you are in a very beautiful country side with a lovely view to the rice fields.
nice walk. Very nice short walk with great panoramas. U have to go to Ibah Warwick hotel and turn left and go down and easily u can find it
Short walk, nice view, but nothing special.. Much shorter than I expected. It is a nice, relaxing walk... but there are many other similar places you can go and perhaps enjoy more.
Awesome!. This walk was a bit strenuous in 90 degree F weather, so be sure to bring water with you. It was lovely to stop at some small village artisan shops along the way.

Great walk, not too long but lovely views and no traffic. It's was a bit hot and sweaty by 8am, so maybe try even early, but this is a fairly easy walk, about 30-40 mins one way (or you can walk 9km loop if you keep going, but we didn't). There is a gorgeous temple at beginning, then nice views and actual walking track with no bikes/cars along a section of the ridge, then you hit a village and then some rice fields and then a couple of cafes. Really worthwhile morning exploration.
Nice and calm walk. A little bit hard to find but absolutely amazing. It takes about 45min to go forth and back! And it's free! You can also do it with a family, maybe also with older ones.

Good for getting really hot. This trail is easy enough to walk on as it is paved with cement, but the heat can be intense in the sun - there are long stretches with no shade.Best to go early in the morning if possible to avoid the heat.

Refreshing walk into the hills. An easy nature walk into the hills and rice fields around Ubud. Very peaceful, away from the bustle of the town. You walk past some wonderful craft shops - stop and talk to the artists, it's very interesting. Stop and have a refreshing drink at the Karsa cafe before walking on or returning to Ubud. Fully recommended.
Beautifull . Really nice, specially at sunset. With a little bit of luck you see the javanese kingfisher. A lot of young Balinese couples who are in love..

Hot but worth the hike!. We went up at 9:30am and sun was scorching! Entrance hard to find -Look for Warwick hotel and go into that entrance then you see on left of entrance a very discreet sign 'to the hills'. Walk down steep walk path and at bottom go down steps to right at beginning of bridge. Then follow path uphill all the way. Some shades until you get to the top and it is hot,hot, hot all the way even at that time of the morning . Best to come early 6:30 am. Or evening 5pm. Met a bride and grown trekking up for their pre wedding photos. After some distance, you can rest at Kasar Cafe, pricey and did not try as menu not as appertizing. Good view of rice field as Cafe is elevated.

My tip start at the top. Beautiful walk. My tips are to start at the top and to start reasonably early. Also take an umbrella for shade and water. I'm not fit but I could manage the walk down without too much difficulty. There is little shade along the way. I met several people heading towards me who found it hard, especially uphill and in the heat around 10 am. It's a pleasant walk.

Beautiful walk, go very early in the morning. My husband and I love the Campuhan Ridge Walk. We are staying in the main road of Ubud and went there by foot. You should enter when you see IBAH Hotel.. go down the path and go UNDER the bridge, don't cross the bridge. We left around 7am, the walk was very pleasant, we stopped at a Cafe for breakfast. Our way back (around 9am) wasn't so pleasant because of the heat and all the sweat.

Hard to find but worth it. We set off for the ridge walk right before sunset. We got a little confused on where the trail actually started and ended up walking quite a ways past it before turning back. When we turned back we saw a small sign for the trail leading into a hotel area. We followed the sign (which was actually for the cafe that is along the trail) which took us along side a temple and up to the trail. The trail is beautiful and was filled with more locals than tourists at the time we walked it. It is a beautiful place to watch the sunset and take it some majestic views of Bali.

Beautiful walk. Beautiful walk not far away from the center of Ubud. The first way is uphill and pretty hot (we did the walk around noon), but if you keep walking you will reach Karsa Kafe at the end of the walk. They are beautifully set in the ricefield and serves delicious juices.

a good unwinding walk through the greens. We were walking without any place in mind and ended up going here. Evening was just setting in and the walk turned out to be a very memorable one. As we kept walking we came across rice fields and litlle balinese villages. Something I will always remember.

Well worth the effort. Keep an eye out for the signposts to find the start of the walk, they are a little small.We started early in the morning and were surprised as to how many others had the same idea.Fantastic views across the valleys on both sides.Quite a few artist studios at the end of the walk with little Bali 'deli' shops, keep walking until you get to Karsa Kafe, lovely place set in the rice fields with the coldest juices we have had in Bali.We continued our walk north through the village and were surprised to find not 1 but 2 Fench restaurants out there in the 'sticks'.There is a little spa between Karsa and the village that has a taxi service to take you back to Ubud for 100k it you don't want to take the ridge walk back.
Pretty walk. The first 30min is beautiful. Once you get to the top, though, it gets quite touristy. Go early when it's a bit cooler as there isn't much shade.

This is a nice stroll for sure...... Early morning is best as mid-day can be a beast what with the heat and humidity. The vegetation can grow so tall that walking the path through it you are occasionally surrounded by green and when hot it is stifling!!! We walked to Ubud. The start was nice as we stopped at The Eggman's shop - wooden eggs and paintings. Wayan Rana was great to talk to and has an incredibly photogenic face! He reminded me of Yoda!!! The walk to Ubud is mostly - do the math if you walk from Ubud, I.e., it's uphill! But the views were very interesting capturing vistas of major construction in the adjacent valley rims. No question that Ubud is growing kind of happy and sad at the same time. Once done with the walk (perhaps more like a stroll) you end at a Hindu temple followed by steps up past a school to a main drag. Take a left and walk through a forest (not the Monkey Forest) about a kilometer to Monkey Forest Road and the Ubud Central Market.

Very enjoyable. I found previous reviews really helpful with directions for getting to the start of the walk. We had no problems following the directions. We walked from central Ubud and started the walk about 7am. We did not find it hard at all and the path makes it an easy walk. We decided to walk to Karsa Kafe. Thoroughly enjoyed our breakie there with a lovely view. We walked back the same way to Ubud. It was great to be able to do an activity without too much planning and independently. I would recommend this walk. Views were great and caught a glimpe of Mt Agung too.

Good walk close to Ubud center. Beautiful walk. Fun for the whole family and really nice early in the mornings! If your in Ubud and want to walk somewhere with out honks and people offering you taxi and tee shirt then walk over here for some peace and quite

It's ok. Perhaps it was a similar view as the Kayumanis Ubud restaurant area, but I wouldn't go out of my way to view this. It does look nice, but with little to no shading, you would be hot and sweaty from this. There were a few local natives on this path, and even they were sweating quite a bit!If you happen to go to the Karsa Spa (which we were doing), then this walk would make sense for you.

Delightfully scenic sunrise walk. We were able to fit this walk in at sunrise one morning, which would definitely suggest (probably also really great at sunset) as it was quiet and cool.It's easy to find on your own - especially as Karsa Kafe have put up a little sign showing the way - so not sure I would book a guided tour for this. We took the path that drops down from the main road towards the river, a little concrete bridge over the river and then the path winds around past the stunning Pura Gunung Lebah temple. Just past this your walk up a little slope and through the trees and bushes and suddenly the whole stunning valley is there in front of you! We walked along the ridge and then back to our starting point which gave us double the treat because we were able to see the ridge from both directions. There is also a great artist living along this walk who creates miniature paintings and painted wooden eggs if you're looking for something unique and affordable.It's amazing to realise that you're barely minutes out of the busier part of Ubud, and the scenery along the ridge is really beautiful and SO green! Despite all the walking we had been doing during our holiday, we appreciated this chance to walk in nature amongst the tall grass fields.We also went up along the nearby path towards Sari Organik after this, which is a different but also beautiful walk amongst working rice paddies.

Nice Stroll. Nice walk with beautiful views. You definitely need to go very early or very late in the day as it gets very sticky otherwise. Check the Q&A on how to get there.60 min - walk up60 min - cafe stop45 min walk back

Gorgeous morning walk. Don't let the stairs on the way down or the early incline deter you. The ridge walk is beautiful and quiet. Go early in the morning to avoid the hot sun and be rewarded with soft morning light for photos. A bonus is seeing the carvings on the Campuan temple close up

Limited vista but rigorous exercise. My husband and I have de many of the walks around a Ubud at this point. This one is through fields of high grass so not as much to see as the neighboring walk at the end of Jalan Kajeng

Walking, walking walking................ What a wonderful walk!!! Through the beautiful jungle. Easy path, paved even granny could give it a go. We passed a few people on push bikes. Lots of kodak moments. Do it if you are in Ubud, then reward yourself with a nice lunch at one of the restaurants on the walk.

A walk through the paddies. We did some walking on the Campuhan Ridge, but there is too much development activity now - and many, many tourists! We expected to be walking amongst rice paddies, but it probably takes more time to reach them.

Great easy walk even in rain! . A lovely walk at dusk even in the rain as the thunderclouds were quite dramatic - the path is mostly paved and easy. Its not very protected so would be hot during the day. There are some good websites giving very clear directions how to find the start of the path but most hotels would probably know it. Just as lovely but quite different is the very nearby rice field village walk (not the one on this site) which I did at sunrise which with all the water in the paddies was spectacular!
Quiet Walk. It was a nice quiet walk, with nice views along the way. I recommend when you just want to see Ubud, without really doing much of an "attraction."

Wish this walk was more pristine. The hike started out in the most stunning of ways, beginning at the entrance behind the Tjampuhan Hotel. Simply splendid in the morning light. However, the walk suddenly turned commercial about a 1/4 of the way in and after having hopes dashed of the peaceful countryside returning, so we turned around and came back.

A Walk in the Rice Fields. Easy walk near to Ubud and cafes for a beer and meal at the end. Wouldn't recommend doing the circuit beyond the ridge and Kasa Cafe as you will be walking on fairly busy roads. Best to return alongthe ridge for a second look at great views.
Aim to reach before 7 for sunrise.. Nice and gradual walk. Aim to start before 7 and you can enjoy a cooling and amazing sunrise walk. Very picturesque and lots of photography opportunity.

Great relaxing walk. This is a great walk. Scenic and easy.
I would not do this walk at night which my husband and I did. There are no lights and the lights which we borrowed from our hotel were inadequate.

A quiet peaceful spot. If you want to find a good spot to take pictures, or just to see a green view, go to the main road in Ubud, before the downtown, find 'Ibah resort' and there will be two paths, choose the left side, it's going down and ups, just follow the path, and then you'll find there a green hill, with a nice air up there. It's good to chill there, if you want to walk further, you'll find a restaurant with a view.I love this spot and it's free! bring your favorite camera, and drinks, cause it will be a bit tiring to go up, and going back!

Very peaceful and away from the noise. Came here in the morning and was amazed with the views. It's a bit of an adventure to find, but it's so worth it. I was a solo girl walking here, and was always cautious on the way to the trail. But walking back, I was not worried at all, since the trail is very short. Tip: come as early as possible. I got here around 8:30am and it was hot.

A good walk but.....?. I have been doing this walk for ten years as we used to have a villa above the top of it. The best part of the walk is splendid with great views, but like many features of Ubud, it is not what it was. There are lots of people doing it now and the traffic is much worse in the upper section to the Karsa cafe. The guide books suggest a return by road through Payogan but the road is very busy now and walking unpleasant. You can get a taxi from the top or walk back down. Perhaps the best option istqoget a taxi up and walk down.
Great walk. Leaving from Ubud the trail was easy to find. Heading from ubud its just under 3km with 25 flights of stairs worth of climbing. Very humid today, lovely views, great walk.

Nice Nature and nice stops. Very nice walk and easy to find from Main Street. We didn't book a tour just walked and I think it is enough as you pass temples, nice views, rural housing and little snack stops. Route can be also done be many level of fitness as you can take a break or get a taxi back. Just bring enough water to drink.

Still not sure if we walked the right way. We wanted to do the walk after reading about it online and in travel books. However, had to proper research the directions but still not sure if we went the right way. Once you finish with the ridge path and walk past the restaurant/cafe, we carried on the path/road. Then we came to the point where it turned into a proper road. So we weren't sure whether to go off to one of the little paths between rice fields or carry on the road. We picked the road and walked until another junction and turned left. Then the walk got really tough. It was going down at first and then you had to go back up a steep hill to reach a temple. By the map that we followed from Lonely Planet, I felt that we followed it correctly and met all the meeting points but still not convinced it was right the whole way. If you don't fancy a tough walk, I would turn around once you see the main road. But if you do fancy it, its good, do it. You also walk past the typical Balinese town streets where you can have a better look at everything. Its worth it! It took us around 2 hours.

Nice and peaceful. Yes, go in the early morning or at sunset. Very relaxing and beautiful. There is one artist there along the way who does beautiful work, not the touristy crap you see in so many other places. Look for his place on the left, where you'll probably see him painting at his desk.

A wonderful walk in the country. After a few days in Ubud, even the hardiest traveller will be jaded by the heavy traffic, expensive tourist shops and aggressive taxi touts. But on Campuhan Ridge, you can escape the hubbub of town and experience the peace and tranquility of rural Bali.Walking from town, it can be hard to find the start of the Campuhan Ridge trail – if memory serves me correctly, if you climb down the steep path that runs alongside a stone bridge that crosses the river, you'll easily find the pathway. If you end up walking over the stone bridge, turn back because you've gone too far! The trail is popular with tourists so, if in doubt, just follow the crowds...Once you're on the trail, the Campuhan Ridge path is easy to follow, and winds through luscious paddy fields, small villages and remote farmsteads. If you follow the path it eventually loops back into Ubud town – but be aware that this is a long and exhausting walk in the Balinese sun, there are some steep hills to climb, and when you're walking on the road you need to be careful of oncoming traffic (especially overloaded motorbikes).But if you have time to kill in Ubud and want to see what life is like outside the town centre, the Campuhan Ridge Walk is a fun and rewarding way to escape the urban buzz.

great view. Campuhan Ridge Walk is a free and easy nature trek, popular among repeat visitors to the central highland town of Ubud. The area provides a great retreat from the more hectic southern parts of the island, but this trail presents an even more pristine outback to escape from the contemporary boutique, guesthouse and restaurant-lined Jalan Raya Ubud. While the hike lets you enjoy cool fresh air and probably the most gorgeous hillside vista in the region, it also allows you to shed off some calories too with its nine-kilometre hill track.Getting to the starting point is relatively easy. Those staying at the Warwick Ibah Luxury Villas and Spa have the best starting point to the Campuhan Ridge Walk, as the main access is a concrete path just down from this boutique hotel’s main entrance. Smaller letterings under the signage of the Warwick Ibah, bears “Going to The Hill” with an arrow pointing left, and as soon as you take on this path, the verdant surroundings of the Campuhan Valley immediately come to sight, lined by dense tropical foliage.

A peaceful walk in the country. Wanting a little peace and relaxation and wanting to see the greenery within we opted to do part of the Campuhan ridge walk. Our Starting point was by the Gunung Lebah temple. The start point is sign posted by the Ibah Hotel. The Ridge walk is actually 9 kilometers long from start to finish, and is not a circular route. The day we made arrangements to do the walk it rained heavily so we decided only to do a section of the walk. However it was a peaceful walk, and offers wonderful natural views. It is a good idea to do the walk early morning or late afternoon, as there is very little shade to be had, also a good idea to take a hat and plenty of water. The path is quite clear and a lot is on a narrow block pathway,though sensible footwear is also worth remembering. The ridge is set between two rivers, and offers wonderful views of the valleys below and beyond. The path does lead up into a village so you an get refreshments if you need them. You get to see dramatic landscapes with rice terraces and small villages of yesteryear. A great form of escapism.

Amazing View!. The walk offers an amazing view of the forest. There's a river that runs along the walk but it's not very reachable. I suggest to go around dust to take some stunning pictures. Bring bugs pray!There's also a spa at the end of the walk.

Gunung Lebah Temple, Tjampuhan river, grass hills, Karsa café, Keliki, Trekking. Tjampuhan trek started from Ibah Warwick resort, from down town Ubud on the way to Kedewatan. A downward pass to the river sent us under the bridge crossing Wos/Oos/Tjampuhan river. Following the bridge is steps leading to Gunung Lebah temple, one of the temple built by Rishi Markandya, Balinese explorer that searched for the sacred light in this island. Towering pagoda resembling Mount Meru, the axis mundi in Hindu mythology and high stone walls is the highlight of this Pura Gunung Lebah. Behind the temple is hills, resorts, river and private houses. A slow walk on the track passing hills and tall grasses for an hour is a quiet walking meditation. At the end of the track is a village that house many small and private resorts, private houses and cafes. A famous Karsa café is a good spot to rest the feet while enjoying the rice terraces. Karsa café provides international food with decent quality. Beyond this café, the walk is actually not enjoyable, going to Keliki, Kedewatan and back to the town. Karsa provides a shuttle back to Ubud town, or you need to get a taxi, which is not easy. This trek can be accessed by bicycle. Don’t miss to visit the home of Balinese artists like Balinese painters, egg painters and wood carvers. High quality hand paintings at much lower price than in shops near Monkey Forest can be found here.

Beautiful short walk, popular with locals. We did this walk this morning, and started it at about 7 am. Walking very slowly with lots of photo stops we arrived at the Karsa Kafe after about an hour. It is very beautiful and I would certainly recommend it. What everyone says is true, and only the first kilometre or so is a specific footpath, however the road is also scenic with shops and rice patties to peruse...it's certainly no epic hike, however it was an extremely pleasant morning activity, and the Karsa Cafe is a very picturesque place to sit.

one of the highlight of the trip. Everything you read abt this place is true ! We love it but do go prepared as it can be very hot. We were very lucky having gotten there at 2pm on a very cloudy day. It's a must place to do some workout when in Ubud !
Beautiful walk in ubud. WE walked early morning and treated ourselves to drinks around the lilypond at the end. Great way to see Ubud from the top

Nice walk. It is a nice walk, but do not expext to much. Only the first kilometer from the Ibad hotel is free of other traffic. After that you just have to follow the public road with motorcycles and cars and you have shops along the track.Still it has some nice views and we enjoyed walking this trail.

A feat for your eyes. Beautiful. Green view. The track is not difficult. Just don't come here late. We arrived at 7 and it only last around 30 minutes before heat starting to felt. 6 or 6:30 should be fine. Enjoy the view...

See some of the real Balinese countryside. We took advice from a previous post and took a taxi up to Kasar Kafe then walked down into Ubud. It takes no longer than 45 mins but takes in some breathtaking scenery.

Excellent views.. Good free option to get some great views in Ubud. It is a bit of a hike initially but does even out on to a road with no numerous art galleries.Karsa cafe is your reference point. Apparently from there it is another 6km to complete the round trip but I'm not sure how this happens from looking at. The map.As other people have said, can get very hot so outside peak sun hours may be best.

It's just sort of boring. It starts off pretty nice and fairly lush and scenic but as it goes on it won't exactly knock your socks off. The cafe up at the top, Karsa, that provides the signs pointing you in the right direction is alright and if you're like me (generally feeling guilty for how lazy you are) it will certainly help you get over that guilt for a day or two. The walk is easily completed in sandals/flip-flops. If you want a ride back to the centre of Ubud it's a hefty 100,000!If you really want to punish yourself for being lazy you can walk back via the road (about 6km).

Gorgeous, gorgeous, gorgeous!. If you are staying in Ubud this is a must! Start the walk just past the palace, and head uphill through lush green grass, past rice fields, and along a ridge with a beautiful vista. It's a refreshing change from the bustle and noise of Ubud village life. No cars and fresh air. Perfect. Pack plenty of water because it can get very humid and hot. In fact, if you can, do the walk early in the day to avoid the hottest time. My hot tip is to book yourself in for a massage at Karsa Spa as a reward for the end of your walk. It's located just past the village at the end of the walk. It's in a stunning location - small spa huts surrounded by ponds filled with water lillies, overlooking ride fields. Before you enjoy your massage though, enjoy a fresh juice from the Karsa cafe just next door. Then walk back down the ridge into town refreshed and relaxed! NB. The walk is not strenuous, but due to the humidity it can be challenging, especially going uphill. It is paved the whole way.

Easy varied walk, so close to town. Came across many folks confused by the entrance. Simply go down the school driveway and you'll get to it. Starts by going past the temple, into a meadow and gradually climbs for a great view of the ridge. From there, you go past a number of art studios and small cafes.

Great walk. Make sure you go before it gets to hot, it's a really lovely walk and you pass loads of little places with art worth a visit. Make sure you stop and have a drink at the Karsa Kafe brilliant views and a fantastic spa next door.
Breathtaking views. This trail passes through scenic villages and rice fields before ending in downtown Ubud. Definitely not to be missed for a taste of authentic Indonesia.

Like a highway. Used to be good some years ago but has now become too busy and commercialised. Sadly a couple of nice art places where we bought a lovely painting 2 years ago have been closed and sold off to developers

Beautiful. We did this trek with a toddler in a Mountain Buggy pram - which at times was tough going even for a three wheel all-terrain pram due to the trail becoming quite narrow and deeply trenched from motorbikes at points. But the views and the quiet serenity were well worth it. Would recommend doing the walk in the early morning or afternoon as it gets unbearably hot in the middle of the day. There are plenty of warungs and art stalls along the trail to break up your walk.

Nice little hike, nothing special. I liked the ridge walk at Campuhan, but I was expecting more. It wasn't as scenic as I assumed it was when I went there. I'd recommend it if you are looking for an easy hike to get some exercise one day in Ubud

Morning walk with fresh air. Campuhan ridge walk is really good for morning sport. The air along the path so fresh.You must use Warwick Ibah hotel as your direction. Go with the road to Ibah gate, don't enter the gate, there's a road at the left and a sign with direction to the ridge. I think this attraction lack of sign from the Ubud main road, so pay attention. If you use a car, you can park at a small space at the left of the road...Take a walk to the sign that point to the ridge, there's small path with a stair, walk and walk and you reach the ridge path. Very beautiful scenery along the path, very fresh and still nature preserved. I don't think there's a rice field in this ridge path, I'm sure it's a plant called Alang Alang?Go in the morning like 7-8 AM, it's very good for exercise. The path end at the Pura or some kind of Balinese building. This attraction is free of charge, no tickets, no parking fee, nothing.....all free. Prepare your drinking water.....
Excellent place to reflect on life. Go early before the heat sets in. Take your time to enjoy the views and contemplate life. A great way to get away from the crowds of Ubud.

Scenic Walk in Ubud, Bali. It is walk towards the North of Ubud, starting point is near the bridge before Blanco Museum. There is scooter and car parking facility before the walk, Campuhan ridge walk is not all that well sign posted, but ask the near by tourist office for directions. There are few steps to reach the walk so getting there with prams and push chairs will not be easy, but I did see few brave young couples with their prams. Once you are up on the paved stone path way it is glorious green scenery all around. There is small cafe's selling tender coconut water, coffee, ice creams etc on the way. It is a long walk of 6 km, so go there early in the morning, take some rain protection if weather forecast is rain.

Great way to see rice paddis and admire two rivers below. Excellent walk outside Ubud, no sarongs selling, no taxi offers only you and nature. The ridge is an easy walk up from Ubud ending in a small artistic village with nice restaurant
Lovely, relaxing walk. This is a beautiful walk (around 2 km) from the main part of Ubud. Very charming, beautiful scenery, and very easy walk. I wish it was longer!
Lovely trek. We completed the trek from close to our hotel. We did it that we finished at the bridge in the town. Very nice walk with lovely views.
Really short walk. Don't expect much from this walk - it's really short. The fun part is only maybe 20-30 mins after that you're back in Balinese streets.

Great views.. Really simple walk. Fairly easy to find from Ubud town. Go off the trail if you are feeling adventurous! No shelters so its best to bring a brolly. Only a little cafe and some galleries at the end of the concrete path.

Great views and ice cold coconuts! . We started from the warwick ibah end and walked to the top of the hill where there were some little shops and a cafe. The views of the ravines on either side were great. We had our toddler in a backpack (which was feeling heavier and heavier as we ascended) and the day was heating up so decided to grab a cold coconut at the top to rehydrate - one of them was the biggest i have ever been served! Our son had crashed out so we decided to not complete the circuit and head back the way we came. Great walk but would recommend starting at or before 8am.

Nice little walk. Don't need to say much, read the other reviews. Started from IBAH hotel and followed some directions another reviewer posted which were accurate. Started around 6:30 and it was perfect.

Enjoyable walk with great views. The walk is enjoyable with great views of the ubud landscape and natural flora. A suggestion would be to book a spa at one of the many facilities available in the area and turn the walk into a more substantive and relaxing experience. Be mindful to come prepared during hot weather.

A lovely morning or evening stroll. This is a great way to see some nature and is free. I used this as a running trail for early morning runs before my yoga classes. The hills weren't too demanding and the trail was mostly level offering nice views around the ridge. It gets quite hot so mornign or evening might be best, plus sunrise and sunset views are nice here. Therer are some shops and places to have a meal if you wish. Its a lovely way to kill soem time on the cheap while getting some exercise. If you wander further up into the villages you can get an idea of ordinary life. Most of the dogs were quite nice but be cautious as there is the odd less friendly one but usually only when with their owner

Beautiful not to hard walk. I love this walk as you travel past the temple and up the ridge and after 20 minutes find a great cafe over looking the rice fields.I prefer the morning before it gets to hot.
Beautiful Walk. Its hidden but asked around on how to get to the track. Absolutely worth it but bring a bottle of water if possible. It can be quite hilly walk on some parts but absolutely worth it.

Easy walk for all ages. Using the Palace as your starting point walk west. You will go down a little bit of a hill and then see IBAH Hotel on your right. Turn in as if you're going to the hotel, but go down the (steep) hill to the left. There you can park a bike. There will be a sign for the walk and directing you to Karsa Kafe. That hill is the steepest of all the walk. Go down the steps to the right of the bridge, follow them along the temple wall then to the right and up the hill again, you have started the walk!It is paved and kept in good condition, but be aware there is little shade, so a hat and water are good to have with you. About 3/4 of the way to the cafe it changes to gravel, as you pass by a number of art stores. Karsa Kafe is recognisable by the three huts on the left hand side of the road. You can continue past this or use it as a good marker to break before heading back.A pretty day walk, great for how simple it is to walk from the centre of Ubud straight to it.

Ridge with a view. A lovely walk amongst nature. And on a holiday day great to see the young Balinese out with their friends and cameras! Many "hellos" exchanged onroute. A cute little cafe about 1.5 kms from the start is a nice stopping place for a cold drink. A bit further takes you to a village and a view of some rice fields.

Great walk. I walked all the way from the other side of Ubud so I'm sure I didn't get all the way. Round trip it took me five hours (pat me on the back people). The best thing about this is that it is well away from the crazy town of Ubud with the shopping. Walk through small villages and sit and chat with locals at the little shops. Eat some of the local stuff. I had a lovely rest in one of them and enjoyed an ice tea and some local food for 10,000!!! I reckon I saw some Europeans that walked the whole way and they looked as though they had participated in a mud wrestling competition. They passed me when I was having a Bintang in a small shop on the way back. I love European mud wrestling but that's another review isn't it?
