Must do!. Gets into the ranks of my all time top ten favourite walks! Simply beautiful with astonishing wildlife and views. An easy paved trek passing by local artists displaying their wares.

Beatutiful. Great walk in February.... We didnt have a 'guide' just followed the track and stayed visual....
Make sure you bring your Camera!

Highly recommended walk. Easy to find and surprising walk from Ubud. Great views of the rivers on each side and the rice terraces. Visit the Karma Café for refreshments or a nice meal (there's a spa as well if you need a massage) before you head back to town.
So beautiful!. For runners a marvelous spot. Run the ridge and end in one of the villages in the rice fields. Hardly any cars or mopeds. Running back is much easier due to the down hill track.

Stunning views so close to town . Stunning views and so close to town, a wonderful way to see the hills and rice paddies. Plenty of Cafes at the other end, and even spa options to indulge if you wish.

Awaken your senses with a walk through these luscious greens. After having breakfast at Sari Organik, I walked a bit to Ibah Hotel then started my walk through Campuhan Ridge. It was the perfect day to do so. Cloudy with no rain, no sun. It took 30 mins to walk from Ibah hotel to Karsa Café but it is completely doable even with kids if they are with you. The scenery was one of my absolutely favorites in Ubud and you know how many lovely places there are in Ubud! Bring some water (there are no shops along the way) and if you are not keen on walking another 30 mins to get back, just call for transport from Karsa Café.
Beautiful. We went here early in the morning at sunrise. It was so beautiful and only a few other hikers so it felt like we had the ridge to ourselves.

Early morning is best. We were dropped off at the top of the Campuhan Ridge Walk just after 6.00am a beautiful walk watching the world come alive. Would recommend this walk the earlier the better before it gets to hot as by the time we arrived back at our resort which I might add was the other side of Monkey Forest it was very warm and a quick dip was had before breakfast arrived around 7.30am.
Lovely way to start the day.. This is a beautiful walk.. I would recommend to go early morning before the heat of the day sets in.

Beautiful sights. We took a guided walk but it is not necessary. Our guided walk came with our stay. Very pleasant but warm, so go early to avoid afternoon heat and bring water. make sure you have a camera as you will take many pictures.

Love the View. We got a little difficulty in finding the entrance, but after asking here and there, our efforts eventually paid off.As for you, the first-timers, this is my advice and directions to reach there.[By car] Park your car on the street side near Murni's Warung or the bridge. You will find stairs down to a school named SMKP Putra Bangsa Ubud. Pass the motorbike parking.[By motorbike] Find Warwick Ibah Luxury Villas & Spa; it shares the same alley. Park your bike for IDR5000/visit on a school parking area.Best time to visit the hill is in the morning!Have a great time!

Beautiful sunrise walk. The ridge walk is best taken around sunrise ie just after 6am. It is totally worth it. You dont need a guide. Walk from Ubud centre towards Museum Blanco and turn right towards Warwick Spa and Villas. The entrance to the walk is on your left. Peaceful and moderately challenging.

Lovely walk with great views. We started just before 7.30am before it was too hot and enjoyed a lovely walk with stunning views. The track is easy to follow and not difficult, and the Karma cafe at the turn around point serves breakfasts and drinks in a beatiful location. Definitely worth doing!
Challenging hike but well worth the time and effort. Great hike taken on our first full day in Ubud. Beautiful scenery and great views. Very popular trail.

Awesome walk. We found the Camphuan Ridge Walk easy to find, one morning we walked to the village after Karsa Cafe and return, another morning we started early and walked the loop returning past the Bintang Supermarket. The views are lovely and most of the way is pavement of some sort. Definitely worth the walk.

Must do! . Sounds so simply but this walk was one of my favourite things in Ubud. It's fairly easy to find, and there are heaps of maps online to help you get there. The walk only took us about 20 minutes each way. Near the end you'll find a lovely little cafe called Karsa Kafe with amazing views, definitely have a drink or bite to eat there.
Beautiful walk. Nice walk and great view out of the traffic of Ubud . Go there early in the morning and enjoy the peace of this place

Get lost and enjoy!!. Beautiful walk to the ridge and through the rice paddies. You can easily get lost but the local warung owners are friendly and helpful. I went early morning and saw the sun breaking through the clouds as it was rising. Tranquil as I was the only one out besides for a few farmers.
Fabulous walk . Great views of rice paddies, flowers, countryside away from bustle of Ubud. Wandered through organic garden to Warung Palau Kelapa restaurant for lunch and coconut ice cream.

Walk one ridge to east is better. Had a nice easy hour walk north to south. The end portion by central Ubud is fairly steep. Thankfully the great owner of Nyoman Sandi Guesthouse drove us to the northern start point. Doubt I could have found it otherwise. He also has a map of a better scenic rice paddy walk which was a nice 2.5 hr walk.

Wonderful walk that local teenage boys ruined. The nature views are fantastic, the air is clear, and the walk is refreshing, even in the oppressive midday heat.Unfortunately less than 5 minutes into the walk there was a gang of 10 or so teenage boys harassing tourists that walked by, and suggestively grabbing the women. I was not amused, and felt vaguely unsafe the rest of my walk.
One of the best walks in Bali. A challenging walk and not the best in very wet weather, but the views are just awesome. Wear sneakers NOT thongs and take your time and camera with you.

Surprisingly scenic stroll. We were driving around ubud on our motorbike and say this cool valley area with bridges and a stream. The walk is just a short two km there and back but quite beautiful. It's good for couples or families it just a slow day around ubud. Parking is 2000 and the walk is free. There are some artist studios at the end of the trail and a good place to buy art for a good price without the haggling of the market.

Nice, but there are other walks that are much more interesting. A few years ago I tried to find the campuan ridge walk, but by mistake I followed another road that leaded through the ricefields and I loved it. It was so quiet and pieceful, I lostt my way completely but who cares when you can enjoy such beautiful landscape. This year I found the correct Ridge Walk and I was disappointed. It was less beautiful than the walk I made before. Not much shade, not pittoresk, only the cafe almost at the end of the trail (I forgot the name) with the three huts in the water was very nice to relax and enjoy the view.

Beautiful walk. We did this walk several times as our lodging was near the Campuhan Bridge in Ubud and a five minute walk to the trailhead. We walked in the early AM, for both the heat factor (less) and the photo factor (sunrise golden hour). We would walk to the Karsa Cafe for an expresso then return to our hotel. Maybe a 5 KM roundtrip, time about 1 1/2 hours and we are older and leisure walkers. The path is well marked and in decent condition as paver stones are used on the hilly sections. There are steps and some steep sections, however a short taxi ride to the village end of the trail would allow someone of less mobility to enjoy the ridge view with minimal walking. The entrance is located off the entrance way to the Ibah Resort, maybe 30 meters from the JL Raya Road (and about an 800 meter walk west of the Ubud Palace area). There is a mini mart near the main road for hydration supplies. The entrance is signed with small placards and easy to find. There is no parking at the 'trailhead' that I could see. The walk follows the ridge, then a track thru some artist shops, warungs, and lodgings to a small village. As noted the walk to Karsa Cafe and return was plenty for our morning exercise. On the weekend was more people, the weekdays practically enjoyed to ourselves in the early (6:30AM-ish start time). A nice walk and quick, quiet getaway from Ubud's sometime noisy and crowded streets. Enjoy.
Jogging track . This place good for walking in the afternoon. With beautiful view ...And time for family is nice if you do here ...Maybe if you going to ubud you can visit this place ...

Nice walk and even better spa.. It's a nice walk up about 30-40 minutes and when you get up there is a nice place to relax and have a smoothie, even better is that there is a very good Spa to have a professional massage. If u look for a nice walk with a view and some good spa, then it's a good place to go.

Good, but not recommended for busy travelers. This will be a little tough because of hot weather. It's hotter and more humid than the street. There's nothing surprising all the way to the Café Karsa. If you are lucky, you'll be able to see a little hummingbird. So, if you don't prefer physical activities nor want to have a slow trip, you'd better not try.

Beautifully scenic walk, but definitely go early morning to beat the heat!. We did this walk in January 2016. At around 9:30am it was already extremely hot making it difficult to complete the walk as there is no shade. Definitely recommend coming early morning (around 7am) before it heats up!
Morning Walk. Experience the amazing morning walk and fresh air surrounding the campuhan hill. I recommend to bring your dog or partner to enjoy the sunset also there

Rice terrace walk. We completed the entire walk and it was very pleasant. eVen though it was quite humid, the sights were interesting. The further you walk, the more remote it was. These rice fields were flat so did not offer what you might see on a terraced field. By all means, take water with you. Folks on the road were friendly and there are a few artists along the way. If you walk the entire field, it leads right back into the heart of Ubud.
Alright..... We did this walk on the way to a spa. The views are nothing spectacular. It's nice to just get out and walk though. There are better places to see rice paddies.
Great walk. It was nice to escape the hustle and bustle of town and head up the ridge. Great scenery on both sides. We started off around 8am and it was already quite hot. But definitely worth it.

Great spot for a run. One of my favourite running spots: scenic, no cars or bikes, didn't run into any aggressive dogs (I'm sure other runners have had the angry dog experience), just the perfect run. You can extend past the campuhan paved area and continue straight up a quiet country road as far as you want to go (couple of the barking dogs up there but not too bad).

a sunset walk. I heard this route is recommended as a sun-rise walk but we did the opposite. We were around to visit Gunung Lebah temple and we could not resist continuing. you see the signs and it is very easy to access from the temple but do not attempt walking before afternoon. It is not challenging but the heat is not easy to deal with when you are climbing. I recommend doing this in a weekday because at the weekends it is packed with local and foreign tourists so you cannot feel the peaceful atmosphere. after 2km there is a great cafe&Spa so no need to worry about being tired....

good views. We found this walk a bit of a push and had the full intension of turning around, retracing our steps but the walk kept us interested so we ended up doing the whole 9 kilometres. Our usual walk is 2klm on flat ground. Bit sore today.

the best walk is parallel but on other side of ravine. Not easy to find further up the hill closer to town centre where a bridge crosses the main road. It is up a steep rough road for 100m usually where building materials are sorted then a marked paved track wide enough for scooters only, after another 100m opens out onto the paddy fields and a different world. Just keep going you will have paddy fields and coconut palms on either side and lots of places to eat and drink on the trackside. Enjoy it's magical.

Beautiful. An enjoyable walk very close to the centre of Ubud, suitable for all ages and fitness levels. I would recommend doing this walk straight after breakfast before it gets too warm as the walking path is in full sun. Stunning views of Ubud

Famous, breathtaking walk. This justifiably famous walk offers respite from the busy streets of Ubud central. It is an easy walk that offers lovely views of the rice fields and villages. After 25 minutes of walking from the Campuhan temple, you'll find yourself in the charming authentic Balinese village of Keliki..
Great hike. Hiked this trail with my 2 year old (in a baby carrier on my back) and my 8 year old sons. Beautiful views. Not too difficult. Worth doing.
Go In Morning. It was a lovely walk to go on but we went a little too late in the afternoon. My husband was miserable the whole time due to the heat. So go early and enjoy the views.

You don't have to miss it . If you stay a few days in Ubud take a couple of hours to go walking here. Relaxing and enjoying the quiet wonderful landscape among rice terraces with mount Aung overlooking the ridge. A must after the traffic and the noise downtown. At sunset it's magical!

Nice views not so difficult. A nice walk, not very difficult with nice views. Go early in the morning because of the sun, we went round 7 o'clock and it was got already. Don't go further then karsa café, its looks like a compound for western folks when you go further.

Great walk. Easy stroll from Ubud . Go early before gets too hot
Karsa cafe at the end has brilliant views to rest before return walk

Simple things can be extraordinary. Sometimes simple things can be extraordinary if you spend it with your loved one. Walking together with your lover at the Campuhan Ridge Walk is one of the examples. It allows you not just to enjoy cool fresh air and breathtaking hillside vista, but also helps you to burn off some calories. This nine kilometers walking trek is a perfect combination of romantic, exotic and refreshment – something that you need to level up the attachment with your lover. Located not far from central Ubud, this tropical area is surrounded by nothing but an undulating sea of green, covered in tall reed grass. It also provides heaps of meditation spots overlooking the gorgeous fields. The sun in Bali is intense these days, even in the morning or afternoon, so you may want to pull out an umbrella to your lover on rice paddy walks. Ignore other joggers/walkers around you, as when you are in love the whole world belongs to you both.

Lovely morning walk. I'm not a person who hikes or even exercises. But this was a great experience. It is a very easy walk and many people come here in the morning. The view was great. I climbed up slope off the pavement onto a grass field and saw a couple taking wedding photos. Also talked to some people along my way down and it was quite interesting. Do start earlier as it gets quite hot in the afternoon.
Little bit of calm . We got dropped off further up the hill and walked back down into Ubud. It's a lovely walk with views of rice fields and countryside before dropping back into Ubud

Best early in the morning. The start of the walk was very near to where we were staying in Ubud so we decided to get up early one morning and walk before breakfast. The temple at the start of the walk is beautiful. Once you get to the top of the ridge there is very little shade so it is very hot. The walk itself is not too hard but I wouldn't try it in the afternoon due to the heat.Nice views

Amazing. Local call this place as "Bukit Cinta" or Hill of love. No wonder if you come here you will see many local couple teenages sitting and taking pictures of their lover ;p Very nice place to get not-so- heavy trekking, and at the top you will find nice cafes with good view too. Worth to try if you visit Ubud.
Lovely walk. Great walk very easy with good walkers on.Beautiful temple on the way and a place with great coffee in the middle of the paddies.

Nice break from the crowds, but not really a trek. Very exposed and thus very hot after 8am. Honestly, not that impressive or difficult. This is hardly a trek, more like a 30 min walk to a road with some cafes (I booked a treatment at Karsa Spa - fantastic!) and then you can turn around and walk back or arrange for a taxi. The best part is just getting some peace and quiet from the main roads of Ubud. No vendors or people offering taxis! Other than that, the views are just okay.
Good exercise and great views. We need the walk early in the morning at around 7am but it was already very hot and humid! It does provide lovely views over the hills and terraces.

Perfect walk. Incredible views. Easy walk. Spa and cafe at the end. Hello - that is perfect. Make sure you do the walk on a Sunday. That is family picnic day and you will meet lots of beautiful Balinese families out enjoying nature, the views and you can practise your Bahasa.

Escape The Ubud pollution. Unfortunately Ubud is a congested , polluted and noisy town these days , not the traditional Balinese village it's still advertised as. Obviously if all us foreigners didn't come, it would still be a traditional village more or less...The ridge walk is one of the fastest ways to get out into the fields and fresh air, it's quiet and green and had nice views. Although rampant development seems to be swallowing up the green fields all around quite fast...
Walk to a heavenly massage. You have to do this walk early in the morning as it gets very hot. The massage place at the end - Karsa Spa - is heaven and the food there is also great.

Go early. Headed out at 9:15 and while not scortching hot, after a relaxing break at Karsa Cafe - grab a bungalow if you can - for the return, it was pretty warm. OK, it was damn hot. Worth the trek though if you have the time.

The rice field walk was once an attraction.... ... today roads are built across former agricultural space and villas are constructed in rice paddies. Nevertheless, there are some parts left of the former beauty, you just have to ask the locals when getting on the next road.

Lovely short country walk near central Ubud. Great views of the local nature, along the road there are some good and relatively cheap art stores with handmade crafts. We also enjoyed Karsa Kafe along the road, low prices for good drinks (fresh juices etc.) and food, and the rooftop terrace had a beautiful view of the surrounding area!

Beautiful walk close to town . So close to town you wouldn't know it's there! Beautiful walk, don't go in the middle of the day cause you will melt, like we did! I think an early morning walk here would be perfect! We picked up some clean healthy energy bars from the Clear Cafe stall just over the bridge before the walk. Cool art galleries and places to stop for a cold drink along the way.
FREE FREE FREE. It's a FREEEEEEEEEEEEEEEE walk in between fields, what else are you looking for ??!!! you have to give it at least 2 hours to reach the fields.

perfect scenery. told by the villa receptionist to take a 20 mins walk short cut to ubud through the path way near our villa. so we decided to try. we had a morning walk, didn't expect to catch this beautiful view!amazed by the perfect scenery!

Campuhan Ridge Walk. The walk was great, again early in the day as it gets very hot. The first part is the worst. The egg artist is a great place if you are looking for that art. He will sign his name. Stopped at the very end for a coconut drink and view. The spa there is lovely. If you have time you can continue and will come into town from the other direction. A must for sure.

A Breath of Fresh Air. The Ridge Walk was really easy to get to and super refreshing after being in the city for a couple days. If you are strong and get all the way to the cafe at the end of the walk you will not be disappointed! Really delicious food and drinks served with a beautiful view.

Wonderful walk but can get quite hot. A wonderful walk which takes you through fields and a bit of rural Bali. You start the walk from Warwick Ibah villas and follow the path. It's about 2-3km to Karsa Cafe which is a great place to get a drink and take a breather. It does get extremely hot even at 930 am so do take a hat. Given the heat I took the same route back. If it's cooler you can take the 6k longer path back to Ubud palace.

Beautiful, but not special. The Campuhan Ridge Walk is close to the center of Ubud and that's why I decided to do this walk. You only have to walk 2 km (one way) so everybody can do this walk. It's a beautiful walk but not very special. You will see a temple (you can visit it if you're wearing the right dress code), rice terraces and some beautiful nature. I can recommend this walk if you have enough time in Ubud.

Very scenic in middle of Ubud. Just near the bridge was the entry to the walk. If you're not an early riser, best to do at dusk like we did. The start was tough being uphill, but then flattens out and the views were nice.
make sure do it in early morning. make sure you do it before 8am. otherwise it could be too hot to enjoy. the scenery is nice, but not worth it in hot weather.

morning sightseeing and healthy jogging in campuhan ridge. I spent a week in Bali, looking for any beautiful non touristic places. Campuhan Ridge is wonderfull, the place that I never understand before, but quite familiar in my ears. When I was in junior high school, I love an alternative music. One of my favourite Indonesian Band is SLANK. I still remember the title of a song Tepi Campuhan. Last year, when I stand on Campuhan Ridge, it was unbelievable. I stand between dreams and reality. Beautiful scenery and I was enjoying an morning jogging.

MUST do while in Ubud. It is a beautiful walk through the countryside. Great views of rice paddies, jungle, fancy resorts, temples, and wildlife. We only walked one way (from Karsa Kafe to Warwick), which was perfect for the hot afternoon sun. It took about a half hour to walk and was an easy flat walk. We even saw a huge monitor lizard hanging out by the river. This was one of my favorite things we did.
Nice view. Love this place, nice view . please come to campuhan ridge walk early morning to get a best view, because at 10am until afternoon, the weather is very hot (sadly I came here at 1pm).

Most beautiful walk, very worthwhile.. We set the alarm to do this walk and started from the bridge around 6.15am to make the most of the cooler conditions. At this time there were also only a few other walkers and the occasional jogger. I absolutely loved this walk! It winds its way past temple, through tall grass, along the ridge of the river valley, rice paddies and villages. We walked another 2 km past the cafe and realised we must have missed the loop road back to Ubud. No signs we could see past the cafe so you might like to plan ahead with a better map than we had. No problems though as we simply turned around and retraced our steps back to the bridge. I'm so glad we walked the extra distance as we had the best views of rice paddies being tended by farmers with the vista of the mountains in the distance. Not only was it authentic, it was free!Definitely do it, and go early!

peaceful strawl. Lovely peaceful walk. At the end of the ridge walk there is an restaurant/spa where you can chill/rest.
Go there early in morning are later in the afternoon since you want to be here when there is nobody ;)
Great views. Great views of the Campuhan River on both sides of the ridge. Easy walk of a stretch of about 3 km - of smooth elevations and easy terrain.

Easy 2km walk. Not a strenuous walk but nice stroll. Recommend early morning or late afternoon to avoid the heat of the day. Cafe/restaurant at the top is a good place for a fresh juice and snack. Don't be fooled by the first little shop... keep walking about 500m to find restaurant. We went up and back the same way... a recommendation from another traveller.

One of the most beautiful trekkings around Ubud.. If you start with a delicious coffee in the garden of the IBAH Hotel , close to the Campuan Bridge, than you are really ready to do this trekking that will take you one hour. The walk over the ridge with the beautiful views is one of the most beautiful around Ubud. One of the best places to end this walk is at the "Karsa Café", where you can take a rest with beautiful views and great food. There is also a Spa there in the middel of the ricefields. Stay some time there before you walk back to Ubud.

Must do in Ubud. Best walk in Ubud. Super easy and beautiful. Start early in the morning to beat the heat. Could bring a bike, but probably better to walk because there's uneven pavement on most of the walk. You can start at either end and keep walking to breakfast!

Stunning walk . What a great way to spend an afternoon , the walk is just stunning. Surrounded by rice fields and locals working as you pass by. There are great restaurants for a snack or a well deserved drink. Be sure to wear sun protection as there is no shade and it is extremely hot
Good leisure trekking. A good outdoor activity you need to do in Ubud. Just do it early in the morning (start at 7). So you don't get burned by the scorching sun.

Go early and take water!. Great walk along the ridge with views across two valleys. If you don't turn back when you get to the village at the end and go back the way you came, you will have to walk through Tegallang and Kedewatan villages to get back to Ubud making the total walk around 10ks. We did this and despite the fact that the steep hills between the villages at the end almost did us in, we really enjoyed it all in the quiet of the morning. Don't recommend doing this after 10am as it would be really hot and humid work. Definitely take water and sunscreen. To find the start of the walk go to the campuhan bridge on the opposite side to bridges restaurant, as you face the temple, the stairs are to your right next to the school ...these take you to the riverbed where you will need to cross the river...the day we did it there was a makeshift bamboo bridge in place to help us do this. Once you cross over, take the steps up to the temple, then turn right and a sharp left before the tarred pathway starts - almost a u turn back on yourself to find the path up the ridge. There you will see a sign marking the actual start of the trail. Worth the effort for fabulous views and to escape the now incessant Ubud traffic.
Beautiful. Make sure you have everything mapped properly. It reaches a point where it becomes easy to get lost. The views are spectacular, though. Bring lots of water!
Beautiful and relaxing, despite the high noon sun. One of the greenest, most beautiful, lush walks my wife and I have ever taken. Stunning and free. Don't miss it if you're in Ubud.

Go at sunrise or at sunset. Please note - there is almost no shade during this walk so to avoid disappointment better to do it at early morning or at sunset. There are really nice views alongside the walk, plus at the top, there are number of small cafes. We stopped at one place which only served Balinese coffee and it was excellent.Carry water and apply sunscreen before heading on.

Charming walk. I would recommend doing this walk in the morning as it gets really hot in the afternoon. We had a great walk and there are cafes along the trail. Its really pretty and worth it. Gorgeous scenery. Easy hike.
The only time we saw the rice fields in town.. Great views, great restaurants and best massage along the way! Bring mosquito repellent and sunscreen. Brutally hot!

Short walk but bring a hat/umbrella on a hot day as no shade. It's a decent free walk where you can peek down the valley on both sides although there isn't much to see with the tree canopy - you can see a little of the river at the start of the walk.

Short, steep walk with beautiful views. This is a walk worth doing in Ubud. It is about 2km each way. The ridge is between two rivers and has lovely views of lush vegetation, rice fields and coconut trees. Lots of photo opportunites with great views. If the weather is fine you’ll also be able to see Mt Agung. It is a rigorous walk on the way from Ubud with some fairly steep sections but once on the ridge the path is farily flat. It is a well maintained trail.The walk can be accessed from Ubud and Penestenan. It starts near the bridge in Ubud, goes alongside a temple before the steep ascent to the ridge. You can continue on the trail at the end of the ridge to a small village of artists where there are a few cafes. At this point we turned around and walked back.As most of the ridge is in full view of the sun. I would recommend walking this trek in the early morning as it can be quite hot if walked at midday.There is no fee for this walk.

Nice walk, no shade, rice fields dormant. We started early (but not early enough) and walked to where the rice fields were supposed to be, The walk is almost entirely in full sun and was horribly hot, even in the morning. Start early, like at 6am. The villages were nice, we stopped and had refreshing drinks at the top before walking back. But the fields were completely dormant, not very green, nothing special at all.
Fantastic view. Very nice trekking with view over river, temple, djungle and ricefields. We stopped after 3 km and took a taxi back to our hotel...

Beautiful view!. Excellent activity for the family. The hike up is not too enduring, the view is magnificent and once you get to the end of the ridge/walk, a gorgeous Karsa Cafe awaits with beautiful ponds & refreshing drinks.

Really enjoyable. Fun walk with beautiful views- about 2km to Karsa Cafe, where you can stop to enjoy the amazing view and nice food and very cheap day spaIt's not a tough walk, but mostly uphill. The options back are the way you came, or a longer 6km route, which we tried to find, but got lost and ended up returning to the original track. Will probably do again, maybe at sunset.
Ubud highlight and free! . Great walking trail and you can see so many scenery and pictures. Totally free. So much better than the other activities which are rip off prices.
Very nice stroll. It's about 1/2 hour out to Kasra Cafe, less back. Some Art galleries, some inexpensive eateries some nice vistas.

Good 3 km walk, take water and good comfortable shoes. This one was the second walk we did around Ubud, the first one was beautiful and this one was not exception, just a lot longer than "Ubud Kajeng Rice Fields Walk".The walk as such isn't hard, make sure you are wearing good comfortable shoes as the whole walk is about 3km in a single direction (about 40 minutes walk), we did the return (about 6km in total) and the scenery was beautiful. I was about to do the walk in thongs but the hotel administrator advised me against that (so glad he did).Ubud (Bali in general with the exception of Kintamani) is pretty hot and humid, if you are not used to the heat, sweat will be your enemy number one taking a big toll on your water reserve that has to be replenish constantly.The footpath is pretty good in general, concrete for most parts and there will be lots of places where to stop to buy some food if you are really hungry.
Nice stroll. Wasn't a hard walk, went around 4pm. Quieter in the afternoon but still warm. Gorgeous views in some spots.

Take water alot!. Very nice though take a lot of water. Got lost in the rice fields at the end only to be found by a guide, he must look for lost tourists there. 15km later we had to pay him but was worth it his knowledge of plants and the villages, saw places we never would have seen.
Great view. The walk is easy to find and in the middle of ubud. Great walk between the rice fields. Absolutely worth it, great experience

Beautiful walk. We walked to the start of this Ridge Walk from Ubud Palace. Just walk aling Jln Raya Ubud heading towards Jln Bisma. Just before Bridges the restaurant there is a sign for Warwick Ibah Luxury Villas. Head in towards this and there is a path on the left on the entrance to Warwick Ibah. This is the start of the Ridge Walk. It's really picturesque past green luscious fields, temples and local villages. You will get a sense of how peaceful Ubud is. It's hot so make sure you bring water or there are shops along the way to purchase drinks. When you get to Karsa Cafe, stop for a drink and a meal. It's worth it. And if you keen keep going for another 6km and it will take you back to Ubud. We turned around from Karsa Cafe and walked back to Warwick Ibah, a 25 minute brisk walk easy. We would do this walk everyday if we lived here.

Beautiful and peaceful. It's a little difficult to find but once I found it I was happy I did! It's a pretty easy little hike/walk--except for a section or two it is not terribly steep and the path is paved with stone tiles. It was a beautiful escape from the bustle and bules of Ubud. I went at noon so it was pretty hot and there's not much overhead cover on the walk (so wear sunblock if you burn), but it wasn't unbearable and the occasional breezes along the ridge offered amazing relief. There weren't a ton of other tourists on the walk and I'd say of the people there it was about equal parts Indonesians and foreigners (so a plus if you're a little tired of the foreigner-saturated streets of Ubud).The views are incredible and definitely worth the visit. At the end there are some resorts and cafes. If you bring a swim suit I think you can take a dip in one of the resort pools. I wish I had! I also met some Indonesians along the way and made some new friends! Overall, this walk is worth it for those who want a quick respite from the bustle of Ubud

Beautiful walk. This was a great walk that I herd about through trip advisor. Super beautiful scenery and not too difficult to walk i.e. the hills weren't that steep! The walk seems to take you to a restaurant/spa which looked very nice but I didn't stop. You can carry I past it through a nice village and do a loop.

GREATEST MORNING EVER!. Great paddyfield with terasering and subak watering system. Do not forget to bring your jacket when you visit this place in the morning if you use to live in a tropical country. Many dogs on the street in the morning. Stay away from looking on their eyes unless they will run after you.

Good morning walk. Stayed nearby at Bisma Eight hotel - this place is a short 10 minutes walk/bike trail. Nice scenery along the way, at the end of the trail there's a local cafe that you can chill and admire padi field scenery.

Stunning views; a world away from the bustling centre of Ubud. This truly is a beautiful walk - and it's hard to believe that it's so close to the centre of Ubud. It's not clearly signed, though I followed Lonely Planet's Campuan Ridge Walk guide which actually guides you along the ridge starting by Warwick Ibah Luxury Villas on Jl Raya Ubud, and then on past the village of Bangkiang Sidem and doing a full loop back down Jl Raya Sanggingan. The walk in the Lonely Planet guide book is around 8.5km (3.5 hours) - starting and ending at Ubud Palace - and is definitely worth a look, as it gives you a chance to view the ridge, as well as taking you through a few of the smaller, traditional villages before looping back around. I went mid-day, so it was insanely hot, but that also meant that there were very few other tourists along the route which meant I got to really enjoy the stunning surrounds with a feeling of tranquility Take water with you!

Happy trails. I do this hike almost on a daily basis when in Ubud during my annual Xmas break at Villa Amala. I am always impressed by the views of the verdant jungles on the walk. It's only 3 km from the Champuan Bridge to the end of the trail , during which time you will see cafes, restaurants, numerous villas for rent and art galleries. I always stop off for coffee of coconut water at the Karsa Cafe, which is doing so well, it's added an extra floor and a spa on its premises over the last 4 years. It's a fairly easy walk, so you can wear you regular running shoes, hiking gear not required. It's nice to take a break from th hustle and bustle of Ubud town center so do make it a point to take this walk.

Lovely morning walk. Beautiful morning walk, try to do it when it's not so hot outside e.g. When it's cloudy but it was good to get to get some exercise with such beautiful views especially after all the food we are eating on holiday. Definitely recommended and it's free! Extra bonus

Good Walk. It was a good 15 mins walk from Hanoman Road. Very green and if you are into nature , you'll probably love it. The sound of the stream was pretty soothing. Try to start early to avoid the heat and humidity.

Short walk. It is a lovely walk through rice fields and above the river. But for a hiker it's a short walk before you reach the houses and cafes. Well worth a visit and maybe best to take swimsuit and have lunch at the restaurant with swimming pool. Take sunhat as for stretch no cover. Worth it for views.

Fun and beautiful. Went on this walk with my wife and kids (8, 6, 2). We had a great time just walking and talking. The walk up was indeed hard for the younger kids and it was a hot day but they made it. There area few cafes up top as well where you can have lunch and take a rest.

So relaxing!. The walk takes about 1,5 - 2 hours both ways and you can even go with flip flops. View is impressive and you can take some time to cool down. No need to take a taxi and really easy to find with Google Maps. There is no admission fee.

Start from the top!. This walk takes you through local villages, rice paddies and along side a river. The walk is best enjoyed early in the morning to avoid the heat & to absorb the quiet sounds of nature. It's a steep walk up the ridge so most people walk only one way if they can get a lift to the top. There are warangs (cafes) along the way as well as artist galleries & yoga retreats. Well worth getting up early to do this. Walk finishes a little west if the centre of town.

The views are beautiful. Views on the walk are beautiful. The only thing that detracts ( and this is everywhere in Bali) is the refuse. I hope Bali can do something about this because it's scenery is spectacular
Just a ridge. Just a ridgeI guess maybe ten yrs ago, this is a nice path, but now too many people. Visitors step on grass, plastic bottle on the ground.
Lovely walk. Go up to the cafe, have lunch and back there. Lovely photos to be taken! Walk at noon when it's not too crowded but it could be really hot all the way

Authentic Bali!. Spent in Ubud nearly two weeks and this walk was one of the most authentic where you can see real Bali and meet local people.Its nice to remember now.Of course some part of the journey its very hot but at the very end there are good few places where you can eat and have a drink.

Nice walk in the morning. Short walk in the morning is recommended. However seems the ridge is getting more popular, could observe people trampled on the grassland and this affects the view.
Please do not do that when visiting the ridge or otherwise the ridge will no longer attractive.

WORTH GETTING UP EARLY FOR!. We arrived at the start of the ridge walk at about 6:15am, and we were the only tourists walking at this time which was fantastic. We walked along the ridge for approx 40 minutes before we turned back (as I recall it takes 3-4 hrs to walk the full 'loop' as per lonely planet). It was nice to walk through the rice paddies and see local farmers tending to their crops. The sunlight was also nice early in the morning and not too hot. We were shocked to see a scorpion on the path - however after googling when I arrived home I understand that they are not deadly, their stings just hurt ALOT. I would recommend walking the ridge if you are in ubud and would suggest doing it either early in the morning or late afternoon.

Don't miss this one!. Entrance: Next to Ibah. Directions are given as you walk along. Things you see: The bridge with fast flowing water flowing underneath. Across the bridge is a Hindu temple. I love the next part of the walk where both sides of the track are lined with lallang grass and in the distance you can see the winding path. On both sides, in the distant are hills with coconut trees and Balinese houses. After about 20mins walk, you will reach the top of the ridge, a village, which has cafes, art galleries and hotels. Continue walking, another 10mins max, till you reach Karsa Kafa where you will see rice fields and nice lotus ponds. There is also a good Spa here. Worth doing. I would recommend to end the walk here. I walk on but found nothing more interesting n decided to turn back. Also, after this point, the road widens and the traffic becomes heavy. Difficulty level: Easy walk, sneakers, slippers will do. Open area, no shade. Bring hat or umbrella to shade from weather elements.

A walk to behold. If you are sick and tired of the busy life around central ubud, make you way here to behold the beauty of the place. I would recommend wearing a pair of walking shoe if you are planning to do a longer walk as the paths may not be well maintained.

Very nice walk with typical ubud view. Campuhan Ridge Walk is so famous that it's very easy to find. Actually, the length of Ridge walking is probably 800 to 1000 meters.But view is stunning. After the Ridge walk, there is small ubud village, which is more quiet comparing to Ubud center. But, if you follow the map from Lonely Planet, you won't find the road marked as #5 in the book. So, you either walk down a very long distance to go back Ubud center. Or, just take a U turn at Karsa Cafe

Beautiful scenery! . The weather is really hot and sunny - you'll get sweat and gross but the view you get to see along the way is totally worth it. There are many great spots to take stunning photos.

Not your typical walk in the park. Definitely an early morning walk (or run for runners - not wannabes) - bring water, stay hydrated and enjoy wonderful scenery including the rice fields. We missed a turn doing the loop & ended up doing 6++ miles - nevertheless a great break from shopping with your spouse.

Great morning walk. This is a nice walk to do in the early hours in the early hours of the morning before it gets too hot. The walk is very easy to find: just get a cab to the Ibah hotel, and it's to the left of the entrance.The walk itself is steep at times, but nothing too strenuous. It is also paved most of the way, so no need to worry about mud.

An easy walk but best done morning or evening. This is an enjoyable and easy to find (don't fret about the hard to find reviews - just head down the side of Ibah towards the river, follow the paved path on the river side of the temple - you can't miss it). It's quite steep in parts but just take it slowly and enjoy the view. It runs along the ridge and you wont be in rice paddy until at least 1 km from the start after you pass through a small village where you can but the usual souvenirs. There are better walks out of Ubud but they can be difficult to follow, so start with this one and explore from there.
Gorgeous. Great scenic walk. Very easy. Arrives at the bridge in Ubud. Bit of a hike into the centre of town. So don't underestimate your total trip.

Early Morning Heart Starter. The first part of this walk is absolutely stunning. You take the left fork from the driveway of the Warwick Ibah luxury villas and descend to the river and a gold painted temple. You then ascend a paved pathway through elephant grass to the ridge. That's the heart starter! Locals and visitors alike use the path for exercise. The view of the lush river valleys either side of the ridge is gorgeous, with luxe hotels on the west side. After a couple of kilometres, you enter an artists village with several cafes, not open the early hours we walked through. The pathway becomes a road, with increasing traffic. Taking the first main left, you can follow the road around to the west, north and up a steep hill, west again then a long south stretch back to Ubud. About 6km all up. If I were to do it again, I would return along the ridge path once you reached the road, as walking on the road (no footpath) with busy traffic is not very relaxing!
Gorgeous walk!. It was an absolutely lovely and peaceful stroll full of gorgeous views! This would be a lovely place to bring a pic nic or curl up under a tree along the way with a good book!
Amazing place away from tourist eye. Such a lovely walk, surrounded by jungle from both parts. Green everywhere, a really nice place to watch the sunset
early morning walk. I walk the ridge at least 3 times a week... early in the morning and make a stop at carsa caffee for a kelapa muda!

It looks gorgeous when all the rice is green. I was tempted by all the beautiful pictures of this place in the internet. So I went there with my friends on October. It is indeed beautiful, too bad when we were there some of the rice paddies were already harvested. Instead of lush green, we found dried brown.Fortunately the peace and the natural surrounding made up for the view. Go here if you are up to hike up for 2 km.

Yes, there are still rice fields in Ubud. But you have to work for it. Flocks of birds and the best coffee & pandan jaffles await at the cafe along the trail. It's a working path so expect to see kids on their way to school and daily life going on. Go early. It gets hot.

Great scenery! . The 1-1.5h trekk from the lux hotel on the concrete road through jungles and the countryside is truly amazing. Last hour is just homestretch to the palace through an calmer part of Ubud.Not that challenging, only sneakers and of course hat needed. Never any kind of brush or terrain that calls for longer pants.
A great walk, lovely and scenic.. A great walk, took about 45 minutes. At the top is Karsa Cafe which is in a brilliant setting overlooking the padi fields and nice and cheap!
Definitely worth it. An easy walk, nicest in early morning.. Nice views, easy walk, nothing exceptional but worth the exercise with no traffic and not many people.

Good serene views.... Wake up early and have a morning walk here. This place is so calm and has great picturesque views.
It is not an easy place to find. Find the temple that is next to the river. The trail starts behind the temple.
Really enjoyable walk. Thoroughly enjoyed the walk although the directions towards the end were not accurate. An excellent way to see the countryside

Greeny greeny everywhere. We aren't really want to visit this place at first. For me who hates hiking, this pretty challenging. But everything paid when you finally there, nothing to amaze you except green scenery around you. Its good and satisfying! Burn fat, workout while have amazing view

Stunning - Enuf Said. I am a hiking and nature junkie, and this is one of my favorite walks anywhere. Very close to town and an easy incline, so this is accessible to small children and the less fit. I go before sunrise and have the place to myself as the light creates its magic on the jungled river valley, the traditional hillside terrace houses, the rows of volcanoes to the west, and the majestic Mt. Agung rising from the sun. I could go every morning and not get tired of these views 5*+
thumbs up to this nature walk. So glad I plan this walk in my trip. It's amazing! Do plan to start the walk at 7.30am as it will get very hot in the morning. Bring water with you.

A Place To Be For Refreshing Morning Walk. I and my friends decided to go to Campuhan on our second day in Ubud. U may find a way to go there using gps if you rent a motorbike. Located a little bit outside of Ubud Central. If you got lost just ask a nice and helpful Balinese people and they will help you to find the way.The best time to go there are between 5 - 7am. During that time the air was so fresh, cool and calming. After that time it is a little hotter. If i am not mistaken, the ruote was about 3km from end to end. Must try!

Interesting. My husband wanted to check this place out, so we went for a hike in the afternoon. It wasn't quite what I expected - views are nice, but not spectacular. There are hardly any people along the route, which was nice. At the end there are some shops and restaurants which are nice to check out. Beware it's a long walk and impossible to get a taxi back into Ubud, so if you can't hike back you might want to turn around halfway or so.

What a view. This is such a Great Wall. I have done it a few times. This last time was about 3pm which was a bit to hot. I would recommend early morning or just before sunset,Well worth the effort to see.

Easy walk with lovely views. This is a lovely short walk with lovely views. You can take the downhill or uphill option depending where you start and finish. Ask your driver to drop you at the top of the ridge then head towards the bridge where it ends. It will take you 20 - 30 minutes downhill.
Lots of water . Bring a hat and lots of water .. . it was blazing hot on the day we went for the walk and I got sun stroke.. don't wear black !
Just gorgeous!. A rather short walk, but absolutely gorgeous. Excellent to do around sunset. I can't really add much more to what has already been shared here. You've gotta check it out!

Good Walk. Did the round loop walk, but a bit difficult to find way in later stages (Lonely Planet directions do not exactly fit ! With notices on prperties telling you it is wrong). We started fairly late in the morning so the intial steep up hill climb was fairly hot and exhausting, reccommend earlier or evening to avoid heat. Do take lots of water with you

Fantastic Walk. This walk is fantastic & costs you nothing, so you can spend your money on some souvenirs from the little shops along the walk or at the cafes of spas. Go early in the morning to avoid the heat. Plenty of photo opportunities along the walk in amongst the rice fields & ridge terrain. A must do when you come to Ubud.

Gorgeous. So glad we decided to do this walk . The view is amazing and its just so nice to get away from town for a second and connect with the locals and environment . My tip is make sure you bring some water and aim for 5pmish so you can catch the sun going down its pretty spectacular :)
Best money you never spent. It is free, it is beautiful and it is worth the walk. One option is out and back, the alternative is a longer loop walk - both have their advantages.

do not miss this trek. a great trek thru beautiful rice fields and such. do it early in the AM. stop in the village of Bankiang Sidem at the end of the walk for a look/see and cool drink. would suggest turning around and returning the same way you came as continuting on to town the other way makes for a long journey.

nice views, go before sunset. very touristic, with locals selling souvenirs. once you pass them, there are really nice views. some of the villas for rent there are quite amazing. i would love to stay there at another visit. we wanted to go in the afternoon but turned around as it was way too hot. we went back before sunset and it was beautiful.we took our scooter the whole way though.

Nature near the village. Nice walk with good views. Did it early in the morning-guess it may be hot later as tere are no shades. Round trip to the small village behind the cafe takes about 1 hour to 1.5.
Nice easy escape from Ubud. Easy short walk. Good for a sunset stroll. Just a little bit of nature but peaceful and simple. There is a nice cafe towards the end.
A beautifull walk in great nature.. Walked in this wonderfull landscabe with a Group. For some it was a bit demanding at times, but all in all a great 1 1/2 hour walk back and forth.

so worth it!. Amazing...to put it only in one word. The views along the way, the connection with nature, its a tuff up the hill walk but after when you can sit and simply enjoy the view of another rice terrace is simply amazing.
Take Your Pics !. Thought it would be a long journey but it was about 300meters walk and we can see beautiful hill. Awesome backgrounds for photoshoot!

Relaxing Afternoon. It's a nice walk through Ubud's grassland. We were there in the afternoon shortly before sunset and the light was beautiful. Nice view, good walking track, not to heavy. I had a very relaxing afternoon. We drove here by bike and started walking at Karsa Café. Most people start at walking at Warwick Ibah Luxury Villas and Spa, but I recommend to drive to the other beginning of the trail (at Karsa Café) and start walking there. the rice fields around Karsa Café are also nice to see and by starting to walk on this side you can enjoy them without having to walk the entire track. Karse Café is also a nice place to relax and great pizza's!
ok walk do it early morning or later afternoon. too hot during 9am period. do it before sunrise or sunset prob better option. not far from ubud 3km to 4km

Get out and enjoy the morning with a relaxing but challenging walk. One of the closest rice paddy walks to downtown Ubud. It is a well maintained walk with excellent views and is easy to find. I highly recommend people do this walk as a nice intro to hiking around Bali.

Beautiful and full of teenagers in love. It's a nice walk that let you enjoying the scenery. The last bit into Ubud is full of happy kidss and teenagers cheering you on. Bring water and a sun hat and cherish the peace.

Don't do the whole Thing. If was doing the walk again I'd go to the point where the trail ends, there's a cafe at that point, then the road starts, it's nothing to write home about after that. It's not well marked along the road easy to take a wrong turn .

Easy walk offering great scenery. We started our walk quite late, at around 2:30-3 PM and the heat was a bit stressful, however, when we got to the rice paddies we didn't care anymore. It's a great walk to escape from the noise of the city. There are plenty of restaurants after the first part of the walk, so if you feel like taking a break, there is a variety of options to choose from.

Beautiful 9km walk. A good way to escape from the busy Ubud for a few hours. If I can have one advise though it would be to leave as early as possible to avoid the heat. :) On the way you can visit a lot of beautiful temples ! It is good if you can take your sarung.

Nice walk. Easy to find and easy to walk. A nice path to get a little exercise and fresh air just outside Ubud. It can get quite hot, so start as early as possible - if you start before everybody else you will see (and hear) a lot of sun skinks along the path.After around 25 minutes you will reach a few painting studios and after that a few cafes. The walk back is even easier...

Nice early morning walk, beautiful setting. We left our hotel at 6.30, found a driver nearby who would take us to the Ubud Clinic (which is right next to the trailhead), then walked about 2 km of the trail and back with the kids. The settings are very beautiful, and just as we'd read before, there's very little protection from the sun for large portions of it, so it's a good choice to go either very early or late in the day.There was very little littering along the path, which was a nice change from much of what we've seen in Bali before. We walked to the village with the art galleries and back in just over an hour with two pre-schoolers.

Go early to avoid the heat. I started my walk to the ridge at 6.30am, I didn't do the full walk through the villages but did part. I turned back and by the time I returned to my hotel at 8.30 it was too hot. Other suggestion would be late afternoon. It did take me about an hour and a half to walk it. Thoroughly enjoyed it.

great walk around Ubud. Leave early in the morning and enjoy a quiet walk far from the noise of the city. At least for the first half. You will find many places where you can have a good Bali coffee and rest from the heat. The second part of the walk could be more hectic, as you have to walk on the side of the road and there is no pavement, most of the time.Nevertheless, it's a nice walk and a lot of restaurants in the second half will offer you the right place to recover and relax.

Easy walk from Ubud. Easy walk of about 25 mins, great little cafe at the end of your walk called Kasa the village is picturesque..then unless you want to take an hour and a half and a strenuous walk back, turn around and walk the ridge back ☺️

The walk on the ridge is great, with some beautiful views. The walk is very nice, with some spectacular views. Arriving to the top of the walk, you cycle along rice fields - most of them have been harvested while we were there, but at the end of the walk (before turning to the main road), we found a whole array of young rice fields - with some fine views.

A fantastic view and easy walk. My husband and I took this walk on our way to Karsa Spa (also well worth it). The spa's website location page offers directions with photos for how to get to the walk, so download this on your phone so you can refer to it when on your way. It was a beautiful walk, about 45min to an hour. There were local school kids hanging out along the long winding path. Bring a hat as there is no shade and can be quite warm. We took a taxi back after the spa.
Ubud. Close to Ubud, but feels a world away. Nice quiet walk with decent art stores, and a couple of nice places for a drink and a meal.
So Naturre. this place are so Greeeeeen. And make me really close to the Sky. I came to visit this place at 2pm. Maybe you thought that's gonna be HOT! Yes It's !!!But I very enjoy my ride !!

This is Ubud!. This was by far my favorite attraction in Ubud. It's just a path through the rice fields. You can walk as little or as much as you like. The path minders through the rice fields, and it goes way up into the hills, into the local villages. On it you see the daily life of Ubud, a coconut cutting, rice production, children going to school, local villages, fantastic organic farms along the way. If you do nothing else, do this while in Ubud. Just walk as far as you can walk and soak it in. The nature and the locals are mesmerizing. We even got invited into a local house to see the Bali way of life.

Beautiful walk - Go early to avoid a very hot walk. Lovely walk to do and you can reward yourself with a drink at Karsa kafe if you feel the need. Views down the valley Let as you walk along the ridge.Nice to do a walk like this right by the town. The temple at the start is stunning too.If you're after a gentle walk this probably won't be right for you as there is a bit of an incline at the start but if you want to get away from the city noise then this is a good option.
Beautiful . A very beautiful walk. Amazing sceneries. A must if your staying in Ubud and bonus: it's free! Can be romantic as well for couples.
Easy Walk Great Views. This is a good easy walk, lots of places to stop for rests/ drinks etc. Is definitely much more picturesque during wet season when the rice paddy fields are green.

Best spots for breath-taking view. The best time is for morning walk or sunset walk. Coz at noon, the heat will killing you. Beauty will surround you, and no wrong frame if you taking a picture here !!

Lovely walking track. This is a beautiful quite easy walk from next to the Ibah hotel along a ridge overlooking a separate river on either side of the ridge. Scenic, quiet and not too far to walk before one reaches little stalls and artists homes/ homestays there is a lovely spa a little further on which is a great way to finish the walk. If you like to get off the beaten track in a way that is not too 'hard core' or endurance based while getting a feel for Bali off the main streets I highly recommend it

Great but Long Walk. Try to come here in the morning or before noon which can be very hot to walk. It is approximately 2 KM walk. We bring our 9 months old daughter and she's doing great!After tired walking, we stop by Karsa Cafe to have lunch which the atmosphere is very nice!

Stunning early morning walk. The Camphuan ridge walk is great for morning exercise especially. Get up early, put on your runners and go for a stroll up and down the hills or choose a vigorous run. As you go along through the rice fields and get on top of the hills you may be lucky to see the vulcanoes in the background. I was lucky in January to see them in full view out of the clouds. They are truly majestic. You pass many little artist studios where paintings are displayed. Towards the end of the first section you come to a wonderful little lotus cafe. I especially enjoyed sitting here and drinking a fresh coconut with my friend. The Lotus in the pond are stunning. I managed to take some really nice photographs of them which I use on my website now.

Nice walk along the ridge & extend to local villages & rice fields if feeling energetic. Due to a bit of a misunderstanding with the quick drawing the guys at my guest house gave me, I ended up on a 17km trek instead of the usual 6km (there & back) or so of this walk - but in the end it was great (Ubud - Sebali - Keliki - Tegalalang - Ubud). There is another 'rice field walk' very nearby, which is the one they meant, & after the start you continued walking & turning right until you came back to town. So after having a look around the temple & under the bridge, I found this walk that looked great, and headed off (thinking it was the other small 'loop' one). It continues on for about 2.5km or so along the ridge & offers some pretty good views of the Ubud area. Most people apparently walk back after reaching the little shops/art galleries & café. Assuming there was more to this track until I turn back into town (there were probably another dozen or so walkers I encountered upto Keliki village), I continued on, eventually coming to lots of rice fields with ducks & field workers. There is one area near Sebali village where you can walk through the rice fields & view how the irrigation works & see what the field workers are doing - it's a 10,000 IRD donation which goes towards the maintenance costs of running of the irrigation system. A number of spots in the area there are 'transport' guys who will drive you back to Ubud via Tegalalang if it gets too hot & sweaty & tiring. There are little shops in each village to sit & have a cool drink in the shade. There is a spectacular bridge crossing in the jungle at Keliki village heading toward Tegalalang with a massive drop to the river running below. When you get into Tegalalang, Jalan Tegalalang features lots of shops for arts & crafts all the way back to Ubud. Take your time & allow 5-6 hours for the whole walk. Lots to see, interesting interaction with friendly locals. Make sure you have a hat, water & good walking shoes. A great walk & great day :)

Lovely early morning or afternoon walk. Go early as it is a bit steep and it gets pretty hot in the exposed areas.Start just over the bridge past the school there is a sign to the left.We went under the bridge first and thought it was a bit risky with just a couple of bamboo poles over the water I guess this was for the locals or the adventurous! Once we found the right path it was easy going.Strole past the temple and on up the ridge is lovely great views and plenty of little cafes and spas to stop off along the way Kara cafe and spa is fantastic we went three times,well worth it but book ahead for spa treatments they are very busy food is great too.Late afternoon is lovely to watch the sunset and again a bit cooler.Make the effort you will be well rewarded.

A must do walk. We went early morning to see the sunrise, it was fabulous and not many people around. Passed locals walking to start their day tending the rice fields and the occasional jogger. The views were spectacular. Take your own water, suncream and a hat suggested but we were there early morning so didn't face hot weather and being October it was slightly cooler too.

Wonderful way to spend a morning in Ubud. We started the walk from the Ibah hotel entrance as instructed by an online travel blogger. Passing the beautiful Gunung Lebah temple and heading up to ridge to see and stunning views over the the green fields. The signs say 2km to the recommended half way point - the Karsa cafe - but you can continue further onto the village from here.We went in the morning to avoid the midday heat. It was a beautiful morning and thoroughly enjoyed the walk. Stopping at the cafe, sitting by the lotus pond, drinking a coconut overlooking the rice fields.
Wonderful Walk. A beautiful way to spend your morning. Walk early before it gets too hot. Stop at Karsa restaurant and have a fresh coconut.
beautiful. perfect for running and just walking around and see the nature and rice fields. there's a really good massage place at the end of the road.

Morning Walk or Bicycle Ride. My friend and I took our bicycles along the Campuhan Ridge Walk this morning, activity I highly recommend especially early in the morning. Take your time as there are some steps and challenging slopes along the way, stop as often as needed to rest, enjoy the views and share the ridge with hikers and joggers. It is a perfect place to visit early in the day. I highly recommend exploring all area's small roads, walks, each and every one. You will be able to discover so much more than what one can see from main roads! Hills, deep ravines, ridges around Ubud are stunning!

Beautiful. Came here with my husband and our friends, to experience a lil bit of Ubud more for them. It has beautiful scenery but I wouldn't recommend such place for the faint hearted. It's an uphill road on the first 500-700m (approximately). It was tiring but definitely great for those who love to walk or jog. Be careful of people doing their runs there. It was quite a bit crowded when we came, because it was nearing the sunset time.Tiring but worth the tiredness :)

Highlight of the stay in Ubud!. Walking amongst lush green fields, with beautiful views and sounds of river flowing, the campuhan ridge walk is certainly not to be missed while one is in Ubud. Starts near the Ibah Hotel, the the walk is roughly 2-4 Kms, and could take varying amounts of time depending upon how frequently you stop on the way. Be sure to start early morning, as the temperature is low, and your'e likely to catch the sunrise. Check out Kasra Cafe on the way for breakfast.

Nice enough walk. This walk is pretty enough, but not as spectacular as I was expecting. The first 1km or so is nice, walking along the ridge, with the rice fields either side, and the river below. However, after this time, the walk becomes a dusty road with scooters and the occasional vehicle and a few little souvenir and art shops along the way - no different than any other outlying road in Ubud. The cafe at around the 2.5km mark, Karsa Cafe, was ok, but pretty poor food (at least what I had). I didn't go past the cafe, but I believe the walk continues and is quite nice past that point. Overall, a nice enough walk, and worth doing, but don't expect breath taking views. Though to be fair, mid October was a little late for the rice to be at its green best. Definitely go early morning or evening to avoid the sun.

Great way to get a little exercise with a view. We walked here on our last day in Bali, then went to the spa after for a 3 hour treatment. Very nice walk, and gave us a little exercise, with great views.

Great walk for both sunset and sunrise. You can easily find this hidden walk, it is near Ubud center. Good time to visit this place is in the morning or late in the afternoon before sunset. Bring your own water, you only can find coffee shop after 2.5 km. We spend 2 hours there for sunset and we love this place.

Pleasent Easy Walk To Lush Paddy Fields. A very pleasant escape from the traffic noise and fumes or Ubud. On route you pass a bubbling river, an ancient looking temple, and lush rice terraces. There are small art galleries and refreshment places to drink, eat and rest, Well worth the walk which is very easy and can be done in 3-4 hours, there and back at a slow and relaxing pace.

Great Walk in the Middle of Ubud. This walk is marvellous but should be done early in the morning as it gets quite hot. There are magnificent views to be seen and you walk past a temple as well. Well worth the effort!

Nice easy walk. Its a nice climb up a hill and you pass some nice sceneries. Theres a small river that you can follow. During the walk you will pass some small shops where you can buy some drinks or coconuts. You see beautiful Balinese houses too. At the top of the hill theres a cafe/restaurant where you can have a drink or small bite. Just pass that top you will see some nice ricefields and lovely views to take pictures. Its not a hard walk but you will feel it so be aware of the sun.
nice paddy fields. There are good places to for you to take photos here and exercise with your friends and sharing stories and it is quiet entertaining

Lovely morning walk. We really enjoyed our walk and ended up having some fruit and cool drinks at the cafe at 2km mark. I wouldn't do this walk any later than starting at 8am. We were the only ones on the walk and our way back, at about 11am, there were a lot of people coming through, and they were hot and sweating.

Nice scenic walk near central Ubud. This walk is a nice way of taking in a bit of rural Bali just a stone's throw from Ubud center. The path is paved and can be traversed in 30 mins or so, with a very nice (if a bit pricey by Ubud standards) café at the end.

Nice hilly walk near The Bridges in Ubud. We had a nice walk on the ridge in October 2015. I recommend taking water as you go. There was a snack and drink vendor at the top when we went by but not guarantees. It is a nice climb up to the top and seems to serve as a "Lovers Lane" to young people the sit together and giggle and take selfies among the flowers and foliage. It was an enjoyable climb that got our heart rates going. There is a nice restaurant at the top that looked like a great place to have a drink. My guess is it was about a 2 mile roundtrip depending how far you go up. You pass through villages, rice fields, past banana trees and get more of a birds eye view of the rice fields across the river. Definitely worth the trip.

Nice .... but no wow factor.. This is a nice walk. Not something special, but nice. If you want to take a walk trough an nice field, this is something you can do. The beginning of the road is a bit hidden. Go before the bridge on jl. Raya (Ubud side) to the right, the path goes down (keep left) you pass a temple. Just follow the path.

Nice walk with great scenery!. We went here for a morning walk. We started at the Ibah hotel, went past the Karsa spa and cafe then walked back on into Ubud in a circular walk. Best done morning or early evening due to the heat. We stopped off at the Karsa Cafe for a welcome cold drink. Great scenery on this walk and also free of charge.

Great free activity in Ubud!. I found this walk with the instructions on previous reviews. Head toward the Ibah hotel and look for a sign pointing toward the walk and the Karsa Cafe. It is very unprotected from the sun, so early morning or evening is probably the most enjoyable. It's a short trek but has lovely views from the top of a ridge looking down over two river gorges on either side.
Fabulous views in peaceful setting.. This walk is well worth the time and effort. It winds through the hills and rice paddies as well as jungle in behind the busy city of Ubud.

Not by far what we had expected from the reviews. Being frequent hikers we had been looking forward to our morning hike on the Campuhan ridge walk following all the positive reviews we had read in advance about this hike. When we reached the little village about 2 km form the start of the trail we thought "is this it?" so we walked on and on but on a narrow and highly trafficked main road, so all in all this was an absolutely overrated experience.

Beautiful walk. We were there at the end of September, which is a shoulder season so there were not many people there. The walk was pleasantly nice and quiet. Good to get away from the central area of town where locals kept asking if you want a massage or taxi. Nice cafes along the way.
Only if you fancy jogging. Apart the temple at the start of the walk nothing to declare.Disappointing walk. I thing it is popular with expat who wants to go fro a run
Nice. A nice walk, some lovely villages on the far side to walk through. Have an amazing deep tissue massage at Kari Cafe at the top of the hill
Nice gentle walk close to town. Nice easy walk. I did in the late afternoon so the light was great and surprisingly nice views so close to town. Do it now before the villas take over all the land.
We love the view. We love the view on the afternoon, there's so many tourist and locals that travel this path, some are tracking, some are jogging, its so blissful and quiet

Beautiful views. Great walk over the hills and through the rice paddies. Go early in the morning, before 9:30 is the best time as it does get hot walking up all those hills and there isn't much shade along the way. Great to watch people working in the rice paddies as you walk by. Green views as far as you can see. The walk is well sign posted and there are many cafe's on each side of the walk. Not suitable for the elderly, unfit or people with weak ankles/knees as the path can be uneven, terrain steep and sun hot.

Nice rural walk. As others have said, this is a pleasant walk away from the crowds in Ubud and it is free. Do it early as there is not a lot of shade. You will see galleries, little cafés and rice fields. We stopped at the Karsa Cafe for a nice smoothie and then kept walking for another couple of km to enjoy the villages and views along the way before turning back to Ubud. All up this would have been about 8 km with the return all downhill. Easy walking apart from the steep first km ( we are in our 60s and had no trouble with it).

Interesting walk with a nice view. My boyfriend and I read about this walk before we came to Ubud. It's not difficult to find if you follow the recommendations online and you'll see lush rice fields with long bamboo stalks soon. Unfortunately we got there in the dry season so it didn't look that nice anymore.Still interesting and it's always nice to enjoy some nature.Make sure to bring enough water along since it can get hot and there's almost no shadow...

Early morning or late afternoon walk.. The walk starts at the Ibah hotel and is well signed to the Karsa Kafe & Spa, however this is not the only café that you can stop at on the way up. The path is good and has a few steps in places, but on the whole is not overly steep.We did stop at the Karsa Kafe as it is about 2km into the walk plus the reviews were quite good. It's here that you need to make your choice, walk back the way you came or continue through two villages to make it a circular route, another 6km, we continued on.The route is not hard to follow but as you have already reached the Kafe they have stopped the signage, but if you take one of their cards the route is on the back (see photo). As you can see it is all Tarmac road from Karsa however the route to Payogan drops you into the valley which also means you have to climb back out. This is a steep road but has places to rest on the way up. None of the roads have pavements (sidewalks) until you get to the Fly Café. We stopped here and at some of the shops before getting back to the start so I am unable to give an approximation on the time it takes.Try not to start the walk in the heat of the day as there is very limited shade on the way up, there is good shade if you choose to do the circular walk all the way to the Fly café from the Karsa Kafe.

Nice walk in the afternoon. The walk is quite short, but nice though. I strongly recommend taking this route either early in the morning or before sunset to get the best juice out of it. It's amazingly close to the very Market center so good if you want to relax and see some nature (especially while your friends go into shopping Frenzy)
wonderful colors. To observe since one works and the wonderful colors of the valley that change according to the light

Good, not great. A nice walk whose main attraction is its accessibility - being right outside Ubud center. A few days before we were hiking Batutumonga Ridge in Sulawesi - the Campuhan walk does not even come close.
Beautiful walk!. The walk was uncrowded. There are several art galleries along the way, reasonably priced. The walk is about 2 km, I think.

Wow.....as a young lady remarks. A great place to visit but as mostly said, do it earlier around sunrise, it must be a scene! Otherwise, all the way without shadows to chill down upon the hill, makes the heat more challenging then the treck.Can't say my girl(5y8m) enjoy it very much because of the heat(8am) but looks like the other kids are ok.A different Ubud if you care to see.

lovely walk. great walk, but must be done early or late, not at midday!. Nevertheless, its not such a long way, and there is a nice restaurant at the top where you can eat a great pizza or healthy salad. There are also some painiting shops, my favourite is Wayan Rana, you can book to take a paining lesson with him too. We went to the top and walked down hill most of the way ending at the Blanco Museum. This is better if you have small children.

Peaceful, tranquil, serene.. A lovely way to start the day, with a sunrise walk along the Campuhan Ridge. An easy walk for anyone with a pedestrian level of fitness. Very enjoyable and highly recommended.

Favorite in Ubud!. Ubud is very disappointing to me, but one piece of Bali (what you'd think of Bali when you think of Bali) was this trail. It is through the rice field, and fairly level the whole way. You can walk as far as you'd like through the villages. We actually got ahead of ourselves and had to cab it back. The only place in Ubud you'll see real people working fields and there is a really amazing cafe, Sari Organik, not too far into the hike (absolutely plan a stop there). It is very hot, and no shade, so bring lots of water!

excellent way to spend a few hours. We where lucky enough to be staying at the Ibah hotel (best hotel in the world) so we took advantage of our location and walked the Ridge Lots of small rice fields being worked by locals small shops set up along the walk and some wonderful views

Nice little walk . This walk is very nice. Not exhausting. It is quite short. You will find access close to the bridge in Ubud. If you're walking uphill, it's a small road on the left and there you start. Towards the end you will find Karsa Café and Spa. Food is mediocre but it's such a beautiful location and the treatments at the Spa are good!

Just walk the first 10 minutes then turn around!. We walked a total of 1 hour there and back and truly the best bit was the first 10 minutes. After that fairly uninspiring. It was hot and not much to see. A few shops along the way and the walk finished at the cafe and spa. Had a drink and then turned around and walked back.

Great for getting out of town and into the countryside. We enjoyed our walk along the ridge up to Karsa Café and Spa where we had breakfast and a massage. The walk itself only took about 1/2 hour from temple to café. There is limited shade in areas so don't recommend this if very hot. We went early, around 7:30 am and it was great.
