We walked down again instead of continuing on or getting transport. Walking on towards Jungle Fish would be recommended for a relaxing afternoon beside a lovely pool.

Nice walk to escape the busy town centre. We did this walk in the middle of the day which wasn't very sensible - it was boiling hot! The sun cream melted off me.. The walk was very pretty and relatively easy, it was the heat that made it harder. At the end of the ridge are some cafe's if you need some refreshment.

Nice short walk which we turned into a long walk. The walk gives you the chance to admire the hills and valleys and different vegetation of the area. At the end there is a cafe, but we decided not to stop and keep going through the villages and the rice terraces and get back to Ubud the long way.
Great place for outing. One of must visited spot in Ubud. This place was unbelievable beautiful. For those who loves nature and adventure, you should get yourselves here at the soonest.

Do this walk early. This is a great walk. Not to strenuous bit would recommend a really early start to avoid the worse of the heat. One reviewer noted that there is next to no shade on this walk and that's true. Karsa Kafe is open from 7.30 if u want to have a break and that's where i had breakfast this morning before returning to Ubud. Planning on an earlier start and doing full loop tomorrow. Trekking sandals or sandshoes a must
Nice short walk. Nice little (3km each way) walk along this ridge with a pleasant cafe at one end. Views were nice and an ice cold bintang at the end is just the ticket!
Breezy lush green walking lane. A nice breezy walking lane , early morning or late evenings should be an ideal time to feel the rich color of the nature
Good. Very good for walk after dinner :) Green fields, fresh air and quiet relaxing views. A piece of real Balinese life while hiking.

Cycle for an extra thrill. I did this on a bike and despite having to carry up the odd set of stairs here and there I would recommend over walking as you can continue the ride right up into the hills followed by flying down the hill to the spa at the top of the ridge. Really good morning in ubud :-)

Scenic Trek. I have been to Ubud many times but this was the first time I've done the Campuhan Ridge walk (finally!). The entire trek goes on for about 9km and some tour companies offer a guided walk, however, I decided to only trek as far as the Karsa café and then turn back. That would roughly be about a 3.5km walk to and fro. As the weather tends to warm up in the day, you should try to start as early as possible, anytime from 7am so it's cooler. There is no shelter along the way so bring your sunblock, water and cover your shoulders if don't want to get burned. There are a few steep slopes but nothing too difficult. Views are great along the ridge, with beautiful valleys and padi fields on both sides of the ridge. You can definitely do this without a guide but if you prefer to do a longer trek and have someone provide you with the local cultural tidbits and history, then joining a walking tour would be the way to go.

Nice walk. Nice walk in Ubud. The beginning is quite steep and there is very little shade along the way. Nice views, well paved walking track and the bonus was arriving at Karsa Cafe with its lovely pond full of water lillies and enjoying a fresh coconut before heading back.

pretty walk in the morning. going down the steep stairs is the start of a lovely walk along the trail, with the steep banks of the river on either side and lush foliage it seems remote from the hurly burly of Ubud, well worth the effort and I will go back and do it again.
Scenic Walk. This is a lovely thing to do in Ubud, it's free and the scenery is very pretty. There are lots of rice fields nearby which are also very beautiful

Took the kids in the stroller. My husband and I and two daughters, aged 4 and 5, did the walk from the temple to the Karsa Kafe and back. Apart from a few stairs here and there, particularly at teh start of the trail, the path was pretty flat so we were able to take the stroller for the kids, as it was very hot.Nice views, and didn't take us too long to get to the cafe.I would recommend this for anyone going to Ubud :)

Don't miss this!. Went here for a run in the early morning as the sun was coming up. AMAZING! I imagine it would be hot once the sun comes up. If you are in Ubud, take the time to run, walk, stroll up the hill and you won't regret it. :)

no doubts, you wont regret it. hi allentrance is near Warwick Ibah SPA Hotel (see any map) - from there you will see sign posts, so its 100% impossible to get "lost" ;-)reward is the Karsa Cafe (short lunch break + walk back)yes, avoid the hot time during the day (we did not and enjoyed it !)yes, you will meet "many" other travellers having the same idea ;-)and you can always stop and watch some interesting objects on the waysuper for the "warm up" in Ubudcheers

Must visit 💚. I just spent the most relaxing afternoon stroll here. Great and easy track with beautiful scenery. One of a kind, dare i say. You should definitely visit this place at least once if you are in Ubud. The location is a bit unexpected as it is very close to ubud center - so i was quite surprised, but it is a good thing! Now i know where to go for jogging after y work is finished.PS. Very touristic so can be packed with people.

Try the rice padi walk instead - this one is too darn hot.. This walk is hot, and yes there are some unique photo opps but the views aren't nearly as lovely as the rice padi walk on the other side of the ravine. My family walked this trek (2 kids 13 and 9) and found it to be underwhelming. Views are average compared to rice paid walk. There is a nice cafe right at the end so it's worth stopping there for a juice - well actually it's mandatory because you'll be parched by the time you get there. On the day we walked, a spontaneous bush fire erupted - this gives you an idea of how hot it is - mainly because of lack of shady spots.
Wonderful hike. Amazing hike to the top of the ridge and went for spa and lunch at top...great views, stear clean of local dogs

Great walk with beautiful views. We walked to campuhan ridge walk on Wednesday. We started out about 9am and the heat was pretty intense by the time we reached the end. Walking with a toddler in a backpack it took about 45 minutes for the start of the track. After a beautiful stop at the cafe at the end it took about an hour to come back (little man wanted to talk some of it too). Defiantly take a hat and lots of water, there is very little shade on the walk and nowhere to buy drinks on the track.

Almost 2 km walk by foot, but the view was great!. I often hear "Campuhan" from one of my friend that loved to bike, yes, he even went to Campuhan using a bicycle. Almost 5 months living in Bali and I haven't go to Campuhan, until last week finally! After a lunch at Bebek Tepi Sawah, we went here unplanned. Walked by foot almost 2 km or more, we sometimes stopped for awhile and took photos hahaha! The view was green with beautiful sun light!I always enjoy the view around Ubud. Really a nice place to retired.
Great views. Lovely walk and beautiful views, a must do if you are in Ubud. Very easy to find and a decent path to follow. Also do the rice fields walk.
Fabulous must do walk. this is an excellent walk. Make sure you don't miss it. Once you get to the Karsa Cafe, turn back as there is nothing else ahead.

Brilliant. This is a lovely walk starting on the edge of Ubud. The track heads up the ridge, and has great views. Once you reach the top, keep walking along the road and check out some of the local art work.
Short walk on an interesting terrain.. Nice views on both side of the ridge but more and more housing developments starting to pop up. Just a short 20 mins walk to Karsa Spa.

Go!. Easy and very beautiful walk. Very green, nice views. At the end, after the little village, there is a beautiful restaurant with good food. They have big fish ponds where you can feed the fish which is fun for kids.
Great place to jog. People looking for a nice place to jog, I would recommend to go there. A few hills and stairs, but it is worth it!

Great for morning walkabout. We started from our homestay at Sandat Bali at 7am. Detoured to visit the lotus pond. From there, it was still quite a long walk to reach the ridge & sun was rising fast. In Sep, the breeze in Ubud is cooling and made the walk pleasant. At the end Jln Raya Ubud, we walked down a long shady sloping road which had few vehicles at that time. Finally reached Ibah Resort & from there, directions to the ridge are quite clear. We walked down the path, crossed the bridge over the river, peaceful surroundings, past the temple on our left & headed uphill. On the ridge, we were greeted with unblocked views of the surrounding areas, with nice villas on hill slopes on both sides of the valleys. We stood among a large field of lallang & the ground was dry. It was getting hot at around 930am. We did not complete the walk & only took some photos around the first knoll. There were local children playing in the area & several joggers past us by. Will return & explore the ridge more when we have more time.

Go early . Beautiful view, but go early for it can get extremely hot and there are certain parts of the hike where there is absolutely no shade. It's a short walk, but can get pretty brutal with the humidity and heat. Not an absolute must do when in Bali, but if you have time to kill, I say go for it.

Beautiful little walk along an undeveloped ridge in Ubud.. It's so nice to find a small spot near the center of Ubud that's not been developed. Nice views to the surrounding hillsides and a great opportunity to stretch your legs without worrying about being hit by a car or motor bike.

Beautiful views and a great walk. I have done this walk twice in two weeks and each time I was blown away by the scenery. It starts at a beautiful temple and from there, after a very brief stretch of walking through tall grass and shrubbery (several minutes at most), the view opens up magnificently. Valleys, palms, buildings cut into the ridge, beautiful architecture, artists' shops, and then the lovely Karsa Cafe. The hike can be intense because there's not a lot of shade but there are some shaded areas to take a break if you need to. There's a lot of up hill walking and several high steps here and there as well. But if you are prepared - hat, sunscreen, cool clothing, practical shoes (leave your flip flops at home), and lots of water, you will make it to Karsa Cafe unscathed where you can relax in their beautiful cafe with its lotus pond and huts over the water or on the terrace/deck seating area. Walking back is pretty much downhill and is just as lovely because you are seeing the beautiful views from a different angle. Anyone who has said the views are lacking must have been walking with their heads down. It is truly a beautiful walk.

A nice nature walk along the ridge. Lovely afternoon hike on the ridge. Beautiful views. Great for a quick outdoor activity. Bring water, especially if you go midday when it's hot. You can also stop off at the Kafe along the way for a fresh coconut or other beverage.
Nice walk and view !. Very nice view, not too difficult but if you can do it when it's not too hot ( in the morning or sunset) its more convenient :)

Nice walk with great landscape. This walk gives you a nice view of rice field very close to Ubud (10 to 15 min from the center of the city). It's free.When you are on the main road of Ubud (the one with the palace), continue until you see the Ibah hotel on your right. Then from there, take the street that goes down on the left of the Ibah hotel.The starting point of the walk is on the right, just before the bridge. During the walk, you can continue until you arrive at the Karsa cafe to enjoy a drink if you want. From that cafe, you can return by the way you just came from or continue and cross villages and return to ubud.

It's alright. We are walkers; loved to explore and see sights wandering about. The walk from Ubud, near Ibah back to Puri Sebali was a nice walk but nothing spectacular. Maybe because the weather was too hot without much wind. Though we're used to walking about in all different conditions but the trail was rather boring. I suppose we had so much greenery and beauty around our resort that the walk seemed just mediocre.

A quick escape from the busy streets of Ubud.... After having seen the busy Ubud with alllllllllll the motorbikes and cars, it was time to get our walking shoes on and do the Campuhan Ridge Walk. We love to hike and after reading the reviews here on TA, we are looking forward to this hike. What worrried us beforehand was how to follow the right track. A lot of reviews here are giving advice on which path to follow and where to turn left or right. For us it was simple... if you stand in front of the IBAH Hotel, walk past the time and simply follow the Campuhan signs (perhaps these are new). Or follow the tourists because the reputation of the track is well known now so you won't be alone. The walk itself is lovely and easy to make. I bet you can even do it on flip flops. Disappointing was the length of the "good part" of the hike, which was rather short. Before we knew it, we were at the Karsa Cafe / Spa and from there, it gets uninteresting really quick. I can totally relate to the ones saying "turn around and walk back to where you came from!". The second part of the track is not only boring but also a bit dangerous, walking next to a busy road with almost no room to walk. It really takes away A LOT from the scenery you saw only minutes ago. So indeed... believe me... turn around and stay with the good memories. Only reason we decided to go further is because we wanted to do the Sungai Ayung Valley walk, since this walk wasn't that tiresome. Anyway, a nice and quick way to get away from the Ubud madness without needing a driver. Unfortunately, the walk is short since the second part is not recommended. Also, the scenery is nice but nothing compared to sightings like Mayong village, Segumpul waterfalls or Jatiluwih. We didn't stop at Karsa Cafe but the view looked lovely from there. We did try to get a massage but that was only possible three weeks from now haha. Now THAT is a succesful business!Enjoy the walk guys!

Get some exercise!. Great place to exercise - beautiful views and safe pathways to walk on. A few steep bits which will get your heart racing at times. Stop at the top, have a drink and appreciate the views.

Nice to escape from Ubud. This walk from Ubud is apparently 2km but didn't feel like it - perhaps it's the fact that half of it is up some very steep hills and stairs! Some beautiful scenery, eventually taking you through some little villages, heavily dominated by artist shops. I expected the rice fields to be more spectacular - maybe we were unlucky with the weather/fact they weren't being worked. Definitely stop at the spa/cafe for a juice and some lovely scenery of the fields beyond the lily ponds. Take water - it's a hot walk

simply amazing views. A must visit for every person coming to Ubud. This walk is easy and does not take up much time, you get to see an amazing landscape and feel the air as you walk along the ridge. I live in Ubud and keep coming back there early in the morning or towards sunset - don't forget your camera!

Easy walk. A serene view and walk through village and fields. If you love nature, this is one of the activity that you should go. Easy walk but the taxi driver might not know the place. So make sure to ask the hotel first so that they can tell the driver the exact alighting point and pick up point.

A nice hike, but go very early!. We started late (about 8:30) which meant that we were soaked through with sweat by about the 3 km. mark. The walk is very easy but there is very little shade. There are some interesting artists along the way, especially with their wooden eggs. As we were running short of time on our last day in Ubud, we ended up turning around after about 3 1/2 kms and returned the way we had come as it was still about 6 kms to finish it.

Lovely walk but not stroller friendly. Our 18 month old had to ride piggy back because our $20 stroller kept getting stuck in the path. It's a gorgeous walk overlooking the river, rice paddies and houses. Make sure you get an early start. We got there at 9am and should've gone 2 hrs earlier as its stinking hot with no shade.
Serene n Green Stretch. Long green stretch, worth a visit. Do carry water and opt for a time when the weather its pleasant (Early morning or evening)
Greens. Get out of the traffic and relax by doing this walk with views. See rice terraces, gorges, local people, butterflies and greens.

Best thing to do in Ubud. Just a beauty walk. Not hard. Very doable there and back. We left at 6:40 and were back in the city by 9:00 a.m. (and spent a good hour drinking tea at Karsa). The Karsa Spa looks amazing....we got there too early for a treatment unfortunately.
Nice view but common for the island. Romantic nice natural view but nothing special or we were unlucky with the weather as it was cloudy.
A slow adventure. It was a very nice experience. the walk was 4 KM to karsa cafe and back to ubud. The view was spectacular. A must for someone who likes slow walking.

A Scenic Walk. Apparently this place is not one of the more popular choices among the tourists. My driver told me he had not heard of this place before. He had to call around to find out where this is. I can see why this place is not "touristy" It is really meant for people who like to take a walk in the nature. There is no shelter or pit stops for you to rest and buy a drink. But, the walk should be on your to-do list if you want to take a scenic walk in the nature and enjoy a panoramic view of hills and vegetations. The walk is not very long or maybe I was really enjoying every moment of it. Do wear proper walking shoes and slippers are not advisable. Bring your own water and caps. Best to do it in the early morning when it is not so hot.

Lovely walk to escape to nature. Quickly escape the noises and smells of busy ubud centre by following this walk up and out onto surrounding rice paddies. Finish off with a nice drink and food at the end.

Rice paddy wonder. I went on this beautiful walk with my family on the second last day of our stay in Bali. It had amazing views and surroundings. On the way they had cafés, restaurants and art gallery's and shops. Overall it was 8kms (although when we hit dirt road I caught a cab) so it was roughly 4km. Great enjoyable walk. Remember to bring water, a hat and sunscreen. There isn't a cafe for 2km!
Good walk. Pretty view, but lots of hills and lots of sun. We went about half way and turned around because it was hot. Bring bug spray, sun spray, and lots of water.
Well worth the walk. Awesome walk. Ended up doing it 3 times in 3 days from our villa in Penestanan kelod. Total of 8km round trip each time...Worked a sweat but was well worth it.
Great photos of the rice fields. Easy walk with great views of the rice fields and a mandatory stop at Cafe Karsa in the way back. Free!
Nice and beautiful. Nice and absolut beautiful walk through the rice fields in/at Ubud. Takes approx 30 min (but if you fail the right way then it takes 60 minutes).

Nice walk but surely nothing special. This road offers some really nice scenery. Many people decide to take the shuttle to certain drop-off points though you can easily reach it from the most popular hotels around. Finding shade is a bit tough so avoid noon. Personally we thought that the route is nice but definitely nothing really special for hiking/trekking in this beautiful region of the island.
Love Hill. also known as Love Hill great sunset walk take your time at the art shops and you better start from other side uphill and then go down to Ibah hotel.

Beautiful walk. I'm so glad we decided to do this walk. We started at about 9:30am and it didn't take us very long to complete, maybe just over an hour and we stopped a lot to take in the view and take pictures. If you decide to start later just know that it will be hotter and more humid. There and back is about 6kms and if you are lucky enough to book in advance you can get a massage at the Karsa Spa. If you can't get a booking for a spa treatment then I would highly recommend for you to ask if they are available to do a foot reflexology massage. Take some water, wear sunscreen and enjoy the view

Delightful escape from Ubud traffic. Campuan walk is a delight, and not too tough, with beautiful views opening at every turn. Being a walking track only (though we did see mountain bikes this trip) it is way more pleasant and less challenging than many other Ubud walks which take in roads which can be quite dangerous and noisy. I agree with other reviewers, early morning and late afternoon are the only times to do it pleasantly as there is little shade for much of the way. If you are doing it in late afternoon I would recommend a torch as the latter parts around the temple are deep in shade and could be quite difficult to negotiate if dark. The Karsa Cafe along the walk is beautiful. We have been coming here for many years and it has developed into a cafe with an interesting menu, gorgeous presentation and amazing setting. Don't miss it. So if you are looking for rice paddies, good food, a gorgeous temple and lovely little shops along the way I would thoroughly recommend the Campuan Ridge walk.

Really Good Place!!. I have been to this place about 3 times, the best time is in the morning; bit hard to find good place to park my car; wear running shoes so will make your step perfect jumping shot is awesome

Lovely morning walk. Lovely scenery - try to avoid the middle of the day when it is hot - there is barely any shade, but lovely walk to do to get out of the hustle and bustle of Ubud streets. Early morning is best to do this walk.

A Pleasant Walk away From The Crowds. This is a pleasant walk for anyone who wants a bt of peace and quiet close to centre of Ubud. There are a few guest houses, a nice cafe and a few art shops along the ridge
Jogging between the bushes. Crowded on Sunday afternoon, great place to have morning jog, pleasant to have an afternoon stroll :)
Great views. Very steep walk up to cafe but with fab views , we only managed to get to the cafe as my o/h has a bad back and we are now in our 60's but wish we could have gone further.
Green green green.... a nice and beautiful walk ridge between two rivers with a spectacular green view and through the rice field.
Must see and easy to do. Worth Doing, about 30 minute of total walking. You can go further, but it turns into a bigger road and goes on for a while.
Avoid the heat, very nice walk!. A nice walk. We went at 1pm. I suggest you go in the morning or late afternoon :) Nice views and scenery.

Very nice. Nice walk, nice views and very quiet ! It took only 30mn to walk through the Campuhan and it depends what's your way but you have a nice temple in the south and nice places to have a drink in the north (Sunset hill for example).

Worth a couple of hour out of your day. The walk started fairly close to our accomomdation at Sri Ratih Cottages. Other reviewers suggested to start early to beat the heat, which was a good idea. The scenery was stunning and it was great to get away from the main streets and out into nature. I loved seeing a few of the local kids who met along the walk to hang out together. I was also amazed to see someone running the route for some aerobic exercise - not my idea of fun, but you get all kinds!

Pleasant once up on the ridge. This walk is a probably better for someone who is steady on their feet as some of the ground is broken up and in other places there are flag stones but there are gaps between them making them easy to catch toes on! They are maintaining the path so in a few months will be smoother and suitable for all.The walk looks a bit dull to start with but persevere as when up on the ridge you will be glad you did. It's beautiful at any time of the day but it does get very hot up there so better to start as early as you can. At an average walking pace you could do this in an hour and half return. Don't forget to stop by the Karsa café as you pass. If you can only do one walk, do the rice fields over this one as that is exceptional.

Rater uphill walk to Cafe Karsa. We started the walk at Ibah Hotel, and ended it Cafe Karsa. It was a very nice walk, though a bit more uphill than we expected. It is not in the middle of ricefields like around Sari Organic. After lunch at Cafe Karsa, the staff there arranged a car back to the centre of Ubud. Next time I think we will start at Cafe Karsa and do the downhill walk back to Ubud, think this will be more enjoyable and less tiring! We did this walk Aug. 2014, but I can't choose that date anymore. It wasn't too hot in the afternoon.

Nice walk . Not far away of the center of ubud (10min by foot) this walk is very relaxing and offer a nice view. Lots of local people use this path. For those who want to do a footing this can a nice alternative rather than running next to the roads.

Magical walk. We did this beautiful walk at about 6:30am and by the time we were done we were glad we started so early as the sun gets very hot on the walk. Walking on the ridge was so nice. The path is often uphill so you will need to have an average fitness level. It does flatten out in spots to help you catch your breath. At the end of the walk there is a small friendly village with a picturesque cafe over looking the rice fields. We sat upstairs and had fresh juices and banana pancakes, everything was delicious! On the way back down is was just as pretty. Do it! You will love it!

Worth it. Famous photo attraction... Truly worth it if you have the energy. Best hours to visit are before or after 10h-16h30. During that time it can be really hot up there. Make sure you stay hydrated, there's a mini market just on the main street.

A great walk in Ubud. Really nice and easy walk for the rice fields in Ubud, starting behind Ibah Hotel. There are some lovelly places around if you want to stop for enjoying the views. We recomend it!!!!
Take an adventure walk. If you love to walk and enjoy nature, agriculture and what locals are up too. It's a must to done. Make sure you have a hat, sunscreen, sensible footwear and water.

A 'must do' when visiting Ubud. The views all along the Campuhan Ridge walk are beautiful, and the beauty of this walk is that it is very comfortable to do from the town centre, and yet it seems so removed from the hustle and bustle of the town. Best done either early in the morning, before the heat of the day, or later in the afternoon. There are little warungs along the way where you can bargain for souvenirs, or just enjoy looking at the variety of local arts and crafts. You can buy water along the way, but it's best to set off with some when you go. Most people with a reasonable level of fitness can easily manage this walk, but there are some steps involved and some rough sections where a less able bodied person might struggle. It is a wonderful way to conveniently get a little glimpse of the 'real' Bali.

Nice short trek. Did the short trek from Ubud to Karsa Kafe and back. Got started at 9.30 and it was fairly quiet, we were the first in the Kafe, by 10.30 it was pretty full and the walk was fairly busy back. Would recommend getting it done by 10 to avoid midday heat and tourists. Great views across the valley's on both sides. Limited shade and quite steep on the way up but not a taxing walk by any means, flip flops would be suitable.
Busy but beautiful. Busy but beautiful. We should have worn better shoes for walking but it was still doable! The photos were lovely

Scenic views . Postcard views all along the walk. Small vendors and restaurants don't seem out of place. The walk down to the river was very picturesque but could be difficult if you're unfit or have questionable knees. There's a guy selling drinks and drinking coconuts near the dog house pictured who will show you how he harvests if you ask - impressive.
The Sunset. Wonderful walk. Was there for the sunset. Amazing views for photographs. If you have time in Ubud do not miss this one!

Do it early in the morning !. Had read some much about this walk and put it down on my Ubud list of to do's.Headed off at 7am one morning to get a view of it for myself.Coming from the Ubud bridge side it is quite steep going up the first few hills but the rewards are at the top as you take in some fantastic valley views with the sun poking through the trees.The walk itself is only 2/3 kilometres but its worth it interacting with many of thge locals along the way , best to take your time and stop off at Karsa cafe at the other end , recharge and return.Some good photo opportunities along the way too.

A must do.. When visiting Ubud take the chance to walk up the ridge and escape from the hustle and bustle of the town.It is advised that you go early in the day to avoid the searing heat that can make things a bit tough for those not used to walking in high humidity. There are a few cafes and Warungs along the way and a small selection of artists studios that sell paintings and silver ware. Make sure you visit the egg painting studios that are a true delight. Overall you will feel a sense of accomplishment when reaching the top , and the walk back down the path is obviously much easier.
Not a trek, just a walk.. Beautyfull view on the ridge, but a very average walk. It is an out and back, do not continue on the road to make it longer.

Fantastic walk. I got up in time to see the sunrise as there was also a path behind my home stay. The entrance from 100m from where I stayed but upon entering it seemed like I was in a totally different place. Calm and peaceful, I wonderful walk before breakfast and one is highly recommend!

Nice walk, nice view of rice terraces. Went for the ridge walk, starting from Ibah (resort I think). Its not a leisurely walk on flat ground but neither is it difficult. Just slight gradient up and down. Avoid the hot sun if possible. We started around 9am which was still alright but 10+ am was really hot already.It was enjoyable to visit some of the art painting shops along the way! Cafes at the top, though prices are more than double what you normally get at one of the nice cafe (can't remember the name but it starts with K). Eg coke cost 20,000 idr when usually its between 5000-8000. Though that cafe has a nice view so my husband just bought coke so we could take pictures there.We didn't finish the walk from end to end because it would prolly have take 3hours or more to walk all the way and back. We turned back.Nice view of rice terraces and the surroundings but I wouldn't say its fantastic or anything.

A must do walk in Ubud. Beautiful walk, starts in Ubud and ends at the top of the ridge, Karsa Cafe worth a visit! It takes around half an hour to walk to the top, relatively easy walk and well marked, stunning views into the rainforest, peaceful. we went in the afternoon to avoid the hot sun, but make sure you get back down before dark.

Definitely... just average. My husband and I stayed outside of "downtown" and saw lots of rice paddies and green pastures near our hotel. We expected this walk to be very beautiful, but compared to where we were staying, it was... worse. If you're staying in downtown Ubud and want to see some greenery, it's a fine walk. If you're staying in a place with a great view, I think you'll be unimpressed. It'd also be a good activity if you just want to go for a walk without worrying about cars/motorbikes/running into shops.

Go early and get coffee from the restaurant along the way.. Nice and peaceful if you go in the mornings. We went at 7am and there were only about 15-20 others on the walk with us. There is also a nice restaurant partway through that you can grab a cup of coffee at. Nice morning walk.
nicce walk. Please visit this place whiles you in ubud, because you will be shock of the AMAZING hidden view in Ubud
Nice walk. Nice and peaceful walk. Not difficult and flip flops are fine. The Karsa Cafe at the end of the walk is not really worth visiting, unless it's for drinks only.

Lovely walk in Ubud.. I have walked this walk many times. I love the feeling of freedom, love seeing the loved up young local kids just sitting around, it can be hot, but a great walk to escape the madness of the centre not to mention to the amazing spa on the top of the ridge.

Beautiful morning walk. The walk starts behind the Ubud Palace and goes up from there. The path is well defined with no chance of getting off track or getting lost. Most of the walk is not shaded so do not forget water and sun screen. Great walk with medium grade.Beautiful views very close to town.

Beautiful walk! . This is a gorgeous walk from the Ibah Warwick hotel where we were staying. We did it in the middle of the day when it was cloudy. Do not do it when sunny or bring lots of water. About 45 mins up on the road you'll hit some cafes with drinks. Very pretty area with rice fields around and rolling hills. Worth the walk out of town and a neat little town a little while past the end of the walk to stop and enjoy.

Okayish. Well we went by Kids. For asians, its not worth much since u just get do farming. And Ubud is terrible with sign boards so make sure u have ur maps app on to guide you throughtout. Its a trek btw and not a walk.
Fun relaxing walk . Great way to enjoy the fresh mountain air. The walk is easy and can be completed even wearing slippers.Had fun walking with great view!

Nice walk. We decided to do this walk to enjoy peace and quiet away from the traffic in Ubud. It is worth a visit with some nice views, a few spas and artisits (cheaper than Ubud prices) along the way to the village alongside the rice paddies.
Nice walk in the afternoon!. Very nice view and easy walk, near downtown Ubud. I Went by myself and found my way without problem. I ended my journey in a small shop with fresh fruit juice. Nice!

Fantastic walk through rice fields. I have been to Ubud many times, but this is the first time I took this walk. It is very peaceful, well maintained with stones (which is helpful in the rain). Lovely views to the side down the ridge into rainforest. Great to get away from the noise of Ubud for a while...

Great leg stretcher with stunning views. Pretty easy walk really and straightforward to find. We started later in the afternoon and powered up to the top where we took in the views along the way. Quite busy with people coming and going but it didn't spoil the view or the walk. The cafe at the top does have lovely views but the service was ridiculously slow and actually quite expensive. You would get equally as good a view sitting g on the wall along from the cafe slurping your bottle of water bought from the shops at the bottom! If you're keen on temples give yourself a bit of a head start to have a nory around the large one at the bottom before starting the walk but remember a sarong/scarf to throw on. There seems to be a bit of a debate as to whether or not to do the trip one way or continue on the road back into town. We started off on the road for a bit but it's just so busy and not especially picturesque (at least we didn't think so) so we just turned around and did the ridge back into town
Pretty. Very peaceful and fairly easy walk. Would recommend doing as ealy in the morning as possible like us. There are places to stop for food and drink.

Nice walk. Easy walk that allows you to see Ubud from a different perspective. You can park at the school close by to start the trail.
The end is not well indicated..

Beautiful views. Really nice walking path in Ubud, for us it was particularly good as we just arrived to Bali and enjoyed a lot the peaceful and beautiful rice fields. Not many tourists which makes this place even more peaceful as you feel like you are far away from the the city and touristic area. On the way there are some art shops and nice small local villages - good places for taking photos.
Amazing walk before breakfast. The owner of Bali breeze bungalows arranged for us to be dropped off for this walk before breakfast. It wasn't too far and was a lovely experience

Lovely walk. It's a beautiful location, definitely worth doing. The walk it's self is gentle and it's easy to find (that's coming from someone who always get lost). No need to pay for a tour or a taxi. You can walk from the centre of Ubud. Theres a great place for lunch along the way that looks over the rice fields.

Quiet peace in Ubud city center. The best little find. If you're searching for a green lush walk on a easy path (concrete) this is it. Take your time. Amazing views and when you reach the top you can stop and have a drink/snack and view the rice paddies. Great for families and anyone who is looking to get out of the noisy traffic of Ubud center.

Easy and scenic trek!. Go in the morning and have a leisure walk, the sight is beautiful and nice photo stop! The trek is very easy to walk. The morning is beautiful and you can see the terrain and the forestation of this place.

Great morning walk. Wear joggers or enclosed shoes (no sandles) and make sure you can climb stairs and hills. Nice scenery and great to do in the early morning before the heat...theres a cafe for brekky or a cool drink at the end.

Nice walk but busy. We only had time to do a third of this walk (from Ubud through the rice paddies). It was a nice walk but there were quite a lot of other people on the walk, even though we went in the middle of the day. The reason we didn't have time to walk the whole distance was because we decided to stop for lunch at Karsa Cafe and they took an hour to serve us!
Sunrise walk through magical Bali. Closed to Ubud a stunning and typical walk through beautiful Bali. Most spectacular in the early mornings.

Amazing. Nice walk
Properly maintained and you will enjoy it specially if you are looking for a morning sport or a nice photography tour around Ubud forest
Worth the time. Wonderful walk, don't forget your camera. Be sure to go off the path a little bit and find some hidden angles for good photos

A great way to have a good workout. Very rewardiing.. Be prepared for abit of a walk..but the view is superb esp near sunset. From Ubud Palace, its a good 15-20mins walk to the start of Campuhan Ridge Walk. There are directions around there, if you can't find it, ask the friendly locals. Didn't walk the whole stretch but it was good enough for us.

Nice walk outside of Ubud. The first part of the walk between the rivers is very nice. But keep in mind that there is almost no shade so try to avoid the midday sun.After the cafe we couldn't find the track described in our travel guide and walked on the street. That was not very nice and a little dangerous due to a lot of traffic.If you have a better map it is worth a try;)

Easy walk with great views. It is a little distance away from the city centre if you are planning to walk. Would take around 20minutes to reach the starting point of this walk. The whole journey is relatively easy and can be completed with slippers alone. Do note that there is little shelter as you walk along so be prepared for a tan if you choose to go at noon.

Beautiful walk ending at Karsa Spa. Loved it, especially our foot massage at Karsa Spa! It was a bit hard with our toddler in tow who wanted to be carried, so we decided to catch a ride back to town in the jeep at Karsa Spa.
Green field. in August, the ridge walk is not as yellow as on the photo. It was so green but very nice to see two rivers combine into one in this place.

Wonderful Afternoon. We walked the ridge trail a little late in the day, when it seemed it was going to bee a little too warm and humid. But, toward the end, we were blessed with some rain clouds, occasional brief showers, and wonderful views. The overcast skies that we finished in really brought out all the greens in the hillsides. Finding the start to the trail was easy, as any map of town will point you ion the right direction. I would recommend this hike for early morning of later evening, as mid day can be quite hot.

Zen, peaceful greenery with quaint feel. This mini 'hike' was a nice way to end our stay in Ubud. While it wasn't all that strenuous, at times the walkway is a little bit steep. There are beautiful, scenic views all around you with plenty of trees and jungle views - pictures do not do justice to the depth of your surroundings. The little coffee place (Karsa Cafe) is adorable and had excellent coffee and smoothies. Definitely recommend this as a quick little morning trip!

A must do!. If you are in Ubud you should definitely come here but prepare for a 2 hour walk at least! Best in the morning or on cloudier days as it is quite a walk. At the start of the path there is a wonderful temple, one of the nicest we have seen in Bali and no one was there!
Campuhan. First half of the walk is worth it. The trek back towards Ubud along Sanggingan is not up to much. Stop at the spa at the top of the ridge and walk back the way you came would be my advice.
Great Ubud walk for those looking for exercise. One of the two best walks in Ubud, not for the faint hearted as quite steep and taxing in some places. Views awesome and the walk is all sealed.

A nice walk close to town. Walking distance from anywhere you are staying in Ubud... 45 min walk to Karsa Cafe, which marks the end of the walk for a lot of people seemingly (it is a beautiful cafe / spa, and you can request for a taxi to be arranged there). Highly recommended. We brought our bicycles which was... half a mistake, coz the beginning of the walk is uphill / steps. But once you're at the main road, it's great to ride & if you want to take the long way back to Ubud instead of coming back the way you came, it is useful to have a bicycle it's a long long way around back to town.

Romantic walk through the Campuhan hill. Highly recommended place to go if you are in Ubud and looking an easy trek to walk . Entering from Ibah Hotel and after cross small the bridge we are arrived in front of Campuhan temple , the temple has amazing Bali architecture and peaceful ambience . Looking west there's famous Campuhan bridge a cross of the river . Continue walking to the Campuhan hill is a bit hilly trek between alang - alang grass make a romantic feeling . After the hill we continuing walk through the rural village where a great scenery of rice field , local peoples house , art gallery . It was amazing easy and relaxing trek .

A nice break from the noise from the city. A nice break from the noisy center of Ubud. The countryside, right from inside the city. It was nice to get some exercise (going up and down), to see and hear nature.

Ridge walk in Ubud. This is one of the best things to do while staying in Ubud, even the locals do this walk. You can do it from either direction and because I don't like the heat I liked the downhill option. If you go from the bridge the walk is uphill.

Nice views, mostly paved walking path. Lovely walk, not too long, best in early morning before it gets hot. Just some nice views. There are longer (and more interesting) rice field walks to the east and north, but this is a nice ridge walk with valleys on either side.
Pleasant stroll. After the steep start, this is a pleasant walk away from the crowds and traffic. You can stop for a drink at one of the cafes and enjoy the view.
Good spot. Good thing to do if you want some quite quality time in Ubud. Its not that easy to find. Coming from Ubud don't pass the bridge, the way goes down right in front of the bridge.
Campuhan ridge walk. Nice walk easy not to hard , good views , places to eat and drink if to much , taxis available at the top of walk.

Campuhan ridge walk. Nice walk easy not to hard , good views , places to eat and drink
if to much , taxis available at the top of walk.

Views worth the walk. We left early to escape the heat of the day. I'm glad we did as it was a hot walk, even so early. There were not many on the walk, only the local expats who gave us some encouraging words. We ended our walk at Karsa spa and cafe. Planning to do the whole walk next time.

Incredible views . A must do walk when visiting Ubud. The walk is relatively easy for the non walker types, and due to the height there is a nice breeze even in the heat of august. It's easy to find as you walk away from central Ubud down Main Street towards the bridge. The karsa spa is a welcome treat at the top of the ridge after the walk. Highly recommended.
A must !. A must when you visit Ubud. Best in the morning or afternoon, just before heading to Sari Organik for sunset.
A must try if you like walking in the countryside. Been there with my friends in July 2015. Great view, very fresh air. The location is rather tricky to find, it is near Hotel Ibah
Nice views of rice fields. Nice and easy walk/run, specially early in the morning you can get some nice pictures of the sunrise

A gorgeous walk along a narrow pathway overlooking ricefields and the river. Plan on lunch and a Bintang at the waring near the end and relax a while before walking back. Watch out for the unexpected cyclist and runner along this route and be sure to go to the toilet before you begin as its hard to find a spot 'behind the bush'

Lovely rice field views.. This is a great way to see Ubud, away for the streets & loud motorbikes. The rice field views are lovely, so take your sweetheart. Another thing you should take is some water. We didnt but were surprised by a man who popped up out of the tall grass to sell us some coconuts. All in all it was very pleasant.
Love the nature!. Very nice place for a morning run! It is incredible that you find such a lovely peace of nature in the middle of Ubud! definitely worth a visit!

Great Walk. Fantastic walk where you definitely dont need a tour guide. The entrance, as previously mentioned, is near Ibah hotel off the main strip in Ubod. Head downhill behind the hotel until you get to a massive temple and waterfall. Proceed right at the temple to start the walk. The walk is truly a ridge walk as its at the top of two meadows so you get to admire great views from both sides. Near the end of the walk there are a few nice patios to eat or drink at. If youre into a fancier meal/cocktails, you will come across a massive place on the left with little huts built over a small river - it was really nice. Also, you can even hike through some of the rice terraces as well.Overall, im really happy that we did this hike, it was one of the most memorable adventures in Ubod.

Great walk . Off the main road to the right down a very steep hill, keep to the right before the temple and follow the path along the right. When you find it you will know, enjoy the rest. Bring your camera some good photo spots on the way up and once atop at the rice fields.

Lovely walk along the rice fields. Amazing landscape and scenery. If you walk from Ubud and head north you will have an uphill walk. We started in the north and walkded towards Ubud which is easier. Make sure to bring water.

Nice stroll in the rice fields. The walk starts off almost in Ubud centre and after a few steeper meters out of town one gets onto the rice field plateau. There a small track leads right through the middle of the fields with the farmers busy working their plots. Some souvenir-shops and cafes besides the track allow for the consumption-junkie not to miss a thing ;-)The only downside is the ever growing spread of plastic debris - sad, sad, sad

Nice walk if you have time. Took us a while to to find the starting point, but after asking a few locals we found it (next to Ibah Hotel). Starting from this point the track is mostly a gentle uphill with some stairs (which may be a bit of struggle if you are very unfit, but it isn't too strenuous). Make sure you start early so it isn't too hot and you can get some nice pictures without heaps of randoms in them. Also take some water. We walked 2km to Karsa cafe (which has a beautiful setting) and had a coconut water, then walked the path back to where we started. The walk back towards Ubud from Karsa cafe is much easier as this time it is downhill. The actual walking took us about 45 mins. Worth doing if you have time!

a green hill. Very good ambiance and atmosphere. Very close to nature, all you can see is green ! This track you may use for jogging track, good to come in the morning with the sunrise view or afternoon withe sunset.

A natural afternoon stroll on the Campuhan Hill, Ubud. I enjoyed this visit very much, my children whom were grumpy at the fact that they were not prepare to take a hilly walk on one humidly hot afternoon turned out to be very happy when we walked back to the parking lot, grinning widely. On the walk we saw harmonious grass, bamboo and wild flower hill near and far on the lest and right of the man made trail. My 70 yo mom walked with us all the way. There is a village at the end of teh trail and it lead to a road where car can pass, that's where we make our turn. I recommend a stop at "Rare Angon", a simple art painting gallery that has some umbrella seated spot for us to enjoy young coconut. Inside the gallery I saw some spectacular art painting by the owner. it is a pity that due to financial situation he has to take in some other cheap art painting to help his selling. His is the detailed traditional painting....so amazing. I too grinned, and reviewing in TA make me grin again...I salute this Trail and the painter.....

Excellent walk and views. Did this today in the afternoon and me and my girlfriend loved it. Walk right up the ridge (south to North) until you get to RSI Markandya II road. It's not worth taking the long route back - just walk back down the ridge. It's an excellent walk that feels far away from the traffic-clogged streets of Ubud.

Nice and Easy Walk. I read a lot comment according this excursion before I did it.. sometimes makes me a bit worried, could I make it this journey or not ? (cos I read someone write about 6 km and someone also write walk about 1.5 hours)..But I did it ! its nice and easy walk... definitely easy ! I walk from Karsa Spa and arrived at Ibah Hotel around 30 minutes walks, and I am not walking fast at all.. even sometimes I took some pictures, selfie, we-fie and enjoy the view...Thats true it will be a problem if you walk on mid day... Hot ! Hot ! thats why I started at 3 pm... not too hot but a bit windy too.. If you walk on the hot day... please bring your cap, water and sunglasses..

Great outdoor activity in Ubud. We love hiking, and this was a super nice walk up a maintained trail to rice paddies. We spent a few hours doing this activity. The walk is easy - not very steep, on pavers most of the way. There are cute art stalls at the top (actually some of the better art we saw in Ubud, since it was clear the proprietor had painted the works). The views of the rice terraces are very good as well.

Very Pretty Walk. A nice walk through the rice paddies - a little steep in some spots if you are traveling with older parents. A nice stop for lunch with some really pretty scenery. About 10km to cover it all. A nice afternoon.

The most wonderful walk in here in Ubud. away from the traffic no motorbikes or cars just nature and a wonderful view all the way to the top were you find Karsa cafe and Spa and I love both of them. At this moment you will love to have a good pampering or food massage if you dont have time for the whole massage and the Young coconut with Lime, Mint and ice enjoy. then you can continue your walk for 80 minutes and you come back to Ubud down the Jl Sangingan.

Well worth the climb. Lovely walk up from near the bridge. Great upper floor cafe with view over paddy fields once you reach the top of the ridge. But ignore guidebooks telling you to do the whole circuit - return back down the way you came up the ridge and avoid all the busy, dusty dangerous roads..

Fun, if you are walking downhill. Great views and a nice walk, but it is all uphill if you start at the temple. My advice is to have a driver drive you to a small cafe at the top and then walk down from there (you will end up at Campuhan Temple).

Gorgeous!. This jike took us a little longer than expected as we ended up a little lost past the restaraunt at the top, but it was well worth it. Incredible views :) I suggest beginning in the early morning as we left mid afternoon which was a bad idea because of the heat

nice but.... As this was rated the 2nd best attraction in UBUD my wife and I wanted to see it for ourselves.We took a taxi from hotel at 6 am to catch the sunrise.This ridge path is really very short and can be easily managed in flip flops so dont be tempted to 'tog up' There are locals about (nice) and it is possible to catch a nice photo opportunity.That said, an hour max will suffice as I say, it is very short walk indeed.
Great walk - a must. Good exercise and a delicious lunch spot at the end :). We did this walk several times. Great views too

Beautiful scenery. absolutely gorgeous walk, but there are steep parts and will take 30+ mins walking. really worth it though, tons of great photo opportunities. there is a cafe at the end where you can stop and grab a drink for refreshment and still enjoy the views.

See the rice paddies at your own pace. A great way to see Balinese rural life without the hassle of an organised tour. Not easy to find but here's a site with some excellellent directions.http://www.liveloveraw.com/campuhan-ridge-hike-ubud-bali/

nice if you like walking. its really nice with lots of photo opportunities. its worth it if you have time. its also the local teenage hide out at times too.. so there may be a fair number of young teenage couples hanging about!

Can't go just once. Get out of the city and enjoy the beauty of the rice fields. We took a walk as a family and I ended up running there in the mornings. It's beautiful and there are some fun restaurants. The Sari Organik one is delciious, but after walking further we realized there are more options that also look great. There are yoga classes in the morning that also look amazing.
Nice views. Nice and easy walk. About 1-2 hours. You can survive with your flipflops. End of the path you can drink cup of coffee with nice views.

Stunning Views. Beautiful walk with stunning views. Make sure you take plenty of water as the next bit of civilization can take at least 30mins (an hour for us) from the start. There is a nice restaurant called Karsa Cafe that you can stop off for refreshments and food and they can arrange a taxi back. We were with kids so we took this option as the walk back would have been too much.
nice little walk. mm, okay. nice little walk, but it was really quite busy. Better to go very early morning or afternoon to avoid the mid day sun and photo happy tourists.

Great views in walking distance to the centre of Ubud. Great way to see the views, rice fields and artists' villages. Take the time, stopping for a nice refreshing drink, to do the full walk. This takes about 2 hours, or just the ridge and back will take 50 mins.

A must do when in Ubud !. Don't do the entire walk, first part of the walk is the most beautiful ! Start your hike at Ibah hotel, after 30-40 mins you will reach Karsa Cafe and Spa. I opted for a 4h spa treatment which was the best I ever had and priced verrrry reasonably. Make sure your treatment includes a flower bath and do make a reservation in advance :-). After the treatment I would suggest walking the same way back ( the other way includes roads i.s.o. rice fields) or taking a taxi to Ubud. Try to schedule the walk in the morning as it becomes very hot in the afternoon.
Great walk!. Easy to reach from the center. Nice walks around the ricefields and nature. The restaurant along the way was really nice.

Must Go. I highly commanded everyone to have a walk here. Breathtaking!!! And do stop by Karsa cafe to have some drink or food here. I have spent the whole morning sitting there enjoy my food with the view of paddy field.

Lovely Walk. if you stay at Hanoman street just walk up the road until to the main street, turn left, pass the palace and walk until the Iboh hotel. There you take the left path direction to the temple. Firstly it goes down and the up, then the path starts on the ridge with some nice views. Walk only until the cafe, where you have the nicest views on this walk. If you carry on, the rest of the walk will be on the roadside, which is not plaant.

Guided walk. Lovely easy walk with great views. Ubud Village resort take you to Ubud where you start the walk. There are lots of spots on the way to have a drink if you like but go early as it would be less enjoyable with more cars and bikes.

Disappointed. The first part of the walk is great, looking back at the temple and ridges. But walk gets built up a bit the further and view diminished. Sari Organik walk much prettier. Ridge walk good for exercise....if you keep going you can do a 9 k loop back into Ubud. Good hills for a bit or a workout.
A good walk!. This is a fun and easy walk to do and the cafe at the end is a nice treat! It's nice to get away from the hustle and bustle of Ubud for an hour or so!
nice walk. what a nice walk with view to the rainforest and the hidden resorts!! Walking next to the river, the place is lush and green.
Beautiful!. This is a steep but easy track. Lots to look at and tons of photo opportunities. There are cafes and shops along the way with locals selling their wares.

Stunning views. It is a relatively easy hike which offers some of the best and most stunning views of the lush tropical landscape in Ubud. There are pit stops available along the way, and the trek is overall leisurely and not physically tiring. You also get a glimpse into the life of local villagers on this trek. As a practical matter, please go early in the day and avoid the mid-day heat.

beautiful walk. i go for a walk there from time to time and it is beautiful any time of the day. usually not crowded and easy to access. the scenery is amazing and you can have a really long walk. good to chill out or if you want to jog a little.

Lovely. Nice walk & clearly marked except when you get to the road.Our guide book suggested a circular walk past the Mosaic restaurant. Don't bother it's better to walk back. Otherwise you end up walking along busy roads.
Great walk. Great walk and excellent view from the café up at the top. Takes about 20 minutes to get up there, the path is good too

Good insight into the real Bali. Great walk, 1st 2kms are the best. Great views. Quite steep in places. After the cafe the next couple of kms are good but then it becomes a little repeatative until arriving back onto the road into Ubud.

charming little walk with amazing views of the forest over the river!. I've done this walk already a few times, while in Ubud.It's my favorite scape away of town, whenever I feel the little city gets too much (traffic, mo-peds, etc.)It's around 6km back and forth from the restaurant, all the way up to Karsa Cafe and Spa (nice venue, btw).The walk is peaceful and not too tiring, better avoid going during the day heat. Also, if you go early, it's less busy and much more enjoyable.

Great walk. We did the hike early morning around 9 and it was already getting super hot. The hike wasn't as long as we thought it would be. We walked a bit farther past the 2km marker and there were more cafes to stop at along the way. Great hike with amazing scenery.

Cute Hike. It wasn't especially obvious where the trail started from the main road so be wary for it!There were a lot of locals on the trail so I guess it's a popular spot. It's slightly uphill at the beginning and levels off but it was a little tiring at first (but only for like 5 min).The rice terraces were different than those of tegalalang and I thought they were less impressive but I still liked the hike. They were just much simpler. There are a ton of shops all along but I didn't feel bothered by eager shopkeepers at all. The roads weren't in the best condition when I went and it was a little annoying sharing the road with cars and scooters.I probably walked two miles and then stopped because there didn't seem to be much else but if you're looking for a nice walk/hike, this seems to be the place!Also there was massive cow poo on the road so be careful not to step on it!

Nice Walk, not spectacular but nice.. The walk itself is nice and easy and the heat is your only real problem, so i would say go at around 4. It was nice to see the locals working in the rice fields and the restaurant at the top over looking the rice paddocks is a real nice place to get your breath and relax for a short while.

Great little walk. Lovely walk / worth to stop at the cafe for a cool drink before heading back. Beautiful scenery and there were artists along the way painting the scenery. Do early morning before it gets too hot.

Exhilerating. Great walk. From downtown Ubud, it's about 7-8 km return to the cafe sat in the paddyfields. There are some art shops on the way too with offerings ranging from paintings to large statues. The cafe itself has amazing views. It was one of the highlights of my Bali stay.

Ok for a little walk. Not much there to see on this walk, the green grass fields are pretty of course, and the view from Karsa cafe is beautiful. I walked a bit further from the cafe to take more pictures of the rice terraces. Other than that this is a pretty average walk, and really hot unless you go early morning/late afternoon.
Just do the first bit. The first 2 miles are the best bit, it got to a bit of a trudge once you get to the cafes, with the last half just wandering the streets of Ubud's suburbs
Worth a visit. This is a beautiful walk. We went in the afternoon and the view compensated for the heat. A bit tricky to find, but people are friendly to point the way.

Nice walk, but don't bother coming from too far. Starting from the Ibah hotel, the ridge walk is pleasant enough. For the first half, you get to walk between ravines overflowing with greenery of all sorts — ferns, trees, brush, etc. Unfortunately, the second half that goes through the rice paddies becomes a paved road that you have to share with hotel shuttles, scooters, and other vehicles, which diminishes the experience somewhat.Thankfully, the Karsa Cafe at the end of the walk makes it well worth it, Sitting in one of the raised huts, surrounded by water and lily pads and rice paddies, and having lunch was a definite highlight. Bring a book there and you can easily kill an entire afternoon.Thankfully the walk was 5mins away from our villa by foot, as I would've been a little disappointed had I paid for a taxi or spent a lot of time traveling there.
fantasic just make sure you have water..... Loved the track.....................................loved the spa at the top of the track Karsa Spa a true experience for many I am sure...
Stunning view. Try to walk along this road in the evening! Though it was very dark, but the panorama is better than you come here at daylight.
Lovely walk. Hard to locate but well worth it. Great views of the jungle valleys. Not a difficult walk but hot and sunny and quite a bit of uphill walking.

Beautifully surprising . Cruisey walk although take water. It's hot in the sun. Very beautiful and hard to believe it's so close to the busy streets. Must do= get the lime and honey juice as Karsa Kafe

Great views. It's really worth seeing. The walk is quite easy, so even children and seniors will manage. And don't miss the shrine on the left at the beginning of the walk - one of the best we've seen in Indonesia!

Easy walk. Very short walk from tge centre to the green.
Easy doable.
Unfortunately there are a few shops and galleries on the way to the caffee.
There are otger rice terrasses close by which I liked more.

Perfect!. Fantastic experience! The beauty of the rice fields and villages around can be enjoyed by taking this easy and fun walk. The views are lovely, you might be lucky to be surrounded by butterflies on the way and even get a bit lost like we did! The end part of the walk as described in the guide book (rice-field beside Mosaic restaurant) does not exist but it really doesn´t make the tour any less attractive. You absolutely don´t have to have walking boots et al. flip-flops will do!!! Just have a hat on.

pretty relaxing for a workout. This walk was a great way to see the natural beauty and get great exercise. Great for all member of the family and for couples. Perfectly ending at a cafe with pretty views and refreshing drinks! Not very long, so do it while in Ubud.

A very nice alternative to walking on Bali beaches... If you love walking on Bali beaches but needing an alternative then this is a great one. A friendly path about 2km one way, you will return to where you started. It is friendly and not too difficult my children loved it.Paddy field along the way, almost at the end there is a local warung on the right side where you can stop and buy fresh and nice fruit juices for IDR8k. Sit on their wooden benches and enjoy a scenic view. The ridge is home to many artists and you can see the paintings and artworks showcased in front of their homes. There are several inns, bungalows and villas at the end. From the outside looks very nice. I want to stay there someday.

So much building work going on!. Oh dear, 15 years ago this was an amazing walk. Yes progress happen and I did not expect it to be the same, but I was very shocked at how little greenery is actually left and how much building work is still continuing. For the most part you cannot even tell you are on a ridge, perhaps 10 minutes of the 90 minutes. For About 60 minutes of the walk we were accompanied by a motorbikes, cars and cars and vans. Around 30 people asked if we wanted a taxi. Not at all what I want on a ridge walk. Sorry.
Sunrise from Ridge. Nice place to get out from hustling bustling of Ubud Town, enjoy green hill tracking, walking on Campuhan Ridge is kind of good sport in the morning enjoy nice breeze and sunrise.

Pleasant walk. We walked from Ubud along the Campuhan ridge walk to the Karsa Spa for the Buddah package (we rebooked this telephonically) followed by lunch in one of the over water huts and a stroll back to town. This a was an easy walk although a bit warm in the middle of the day but we were rewarded with a fantastic 3 hour treatment including a shower in our massage 'hut' to cool off. Followed by a delicious lunch at Karsa cafe. The walk back was easier and cooler. This was a lovely day out of town with pleasant views.

Beautiful walk. When I finally got to the Karsa Kafe (I was confused by earlier eateries), I was blown away by the beauty of the location. Mountains in the background, rice fields and water pond. The walk was beautiful, but I did get lost. I couldn't find the loop part, so walked a long way on the road past locals, but it was a great experience seeing more of the real Bali. One of the locals ended up telling me I was going the wrong way, so I turned around and went back the way I came. Not sure where the loop part of it is.
nice morning walk but nothing much. this trail takes you pass some of the greeneries on wither side of the walk, however nothing spectacular. good for a morning stroll but dont expect too much

Lovely stroll. This is a lovely stroll but to be honest I was expecting it to be rice paddys and it is actually through alang alang grass. I probably just hadn't done my homework properly. Having said that, it is a very pleasant walk but make sure you take adequate water and sun protection as there is no shade. It is a proper path and very easy -anyone could do this.

great walk above Ubud. this is a very popular walk with locals and vistors alike. i visited early morning and late afternoon - the afternoon had lots of loved up couples hanging around. It does not feel too busy. The Karsa Kafe at the end of what i think is the best bit of the walk is a good reward. Compared to when we last visited 18 months ago there seemed to be quite a bit more car traffic up the top end with more villas and other accomodation options opening which diminishes the more rural feel a bit but is probably how it is all around Ubud these days.

Best in the morning. I love this walk and do it often. It's beautiful in the early morning (from 7am til 9am) when it's not too hot. Takes about 20-30 minutes and is quite popular with locals and tourists. Lovely to get out of busy Ubud and escape up to Karsa Spa for the day and walk back in the early eve :)

Great and Free!. A very pretty walk up to Karsa Cafe. And all it will cost you is whatever you spend at Karsa Cafe. Not that you have to spend anything, but you probably will want to. Karsa Cafe is great.
Great Walk. We got a taxi out to the beginning of the walk and avoided the uphill walk. loved the walk would definitely do it again

Just a stroll. Not a hike, just a stroll. Very, very pretty views and lots of locals going about their farming. We went late afternoon when the light wasn't great for photos but it wasn't too hot. We were pleased to notice they have trash cans all along the route but people still don't use them so if you can pick up some litter along the way, do it.
Go there!!!!!. Beautiful and not too long Campuhan Ridge Walk. Good coffee on the way. Nice view with friendly farmers.
nice walk. Look for coconuts to buy in the villages. The river is intersting to see where they cut sandstone bricks out.

Great views. we are both in our 50's and not fit and had no problems with this walk. We started early as there is no shade so best to do before the heat of the day. The views are great and we took our time to take them in and take photos. We bought some wooden eggs on our way to the Kafe where we stopped for breakfast. We even walked back the same way to Ubud. Lovely walk.

A fifty percenter. We had followed The Lonely Planet map. All good for the first 3 km along a steadily climbing ridge overlooking two separate valleys, with views as described. The second part of the walk is on roads like most others in Ubud, and the turnoff at the Mozaic restaurant is now marked ' private road. The guidebook is wrong'. It's probably best to walk up to the Karsa Kafe and a bit beyond, and then walk back to Ubud the same way. The rice fields walk that starts adjacent to the Museum is more interesting. Although we had bought The Lonely Planet book two months ago, it turns out that it is not the current edition. Hopefully the new edition has been amended.
Wonderful natural views. The walk in totally natural &agreed environment is extremely invigorating.recommended as an early morning walk before it gets hot. Udesh Kumarf

do it in. the morning, there is ahrdly any shade but it s well worth while. The start is on the right hand side of the bridge in Ubud going towards Tschambuhan (?) , a steep decline next to a entracne to a hotel (can t remember the name). Nice walk for about 1 hr return if you take your time, great views.
morning exercise. This is not a difficult walk and the path is wide and well maintained. Better than some of the other walks we have done (because of the intrusion of villas in the landscape)

Perfect for an early morning walk..Don't miss. We went to campuhan after reading about it on tripadvisor and i must say we were not disappointed..in fact it was a very enjoyable 1.5-2 km wAlk with lush greens all the way..we stopped at the karsa cafe which is surrounded by paddy fields for some refreshment..coconut water and carrot juice added more flavour to the delightful walk..we would definitely recommend it!
Lovely for a morning run. Best before it gets too hot, before 8.30am. You can also buy a wooden duck there, if thats your thing.
A great walk.. We started around 9am. was nice and cool at the top. Out of all the activities we took part in whilst in Ubud this was by far our favourite. Best thing is that its free.

Beneficial walk. Walk was great with good views on both sides of ridge. Manage to get some good pics. We went in morning around 7, morning time is highly recommended as it will be pretty hot later. After completing 3/4th of the walk, we chanced upon a shop actually an artist studio, with paintings. Got a real good deal and ended up buying two paintings. Never knew walking can be this beneficial!

Coconuts. What a great walk, I was travelling with my husband, age 64,and my daughter and her husband and two young grandchildren. My grandson, aged six, was blown away, he loved it, being in the great outdoors, we came along to a old Balinese man, who had just taken some coconuts off the trees, and cracked it open for my grandchildren, gave them the coconut water to drink, and chopped up the coconut so they could eat it, they still talk about it. We saw beautiful butterfly's and ducks plus lizards as we walked among the rice paddies. We stopped for lunch at a fantastic organic restaurant towards the end of our walk, it is not too strenuous a walk, very relaxing

silence behind the mayhem.. Lovely walk from Ubud along the ridge. Fantastic views. Lizards, cows, chooks and ducks. Stop for a coffe along the way and check out some art work. So peaceful, I meditated on the edge of a rice field...totally alone!

Peace Amongst The Mayhem. I have done this walk a few times and with Ubud getting busier by the second, it is magic to be able to step off the main road and walk along the Campuhan Ridge. Best to do it early in the morning or later in the day as it can get very hot. Going from Ubud is mostly uphill, go slow and enjoy the views and the green tranquility.

Nice stroll out of Ubud. To get away from bustle of Ubud, this is a nice walk into the country. The ridge walk offers some splendid views of densely wooded ravines and rice fields. Not too energetic. Best to start at the upper end (you will need a car / taxi to drop you) and walk into Ubud. There are a couple of nice resorts enroute, if you need refreshment.

Enjoy a drink, meal, and spa treatment at Karsa after a scenic 2k walk. Campuhan Ridge Walk is roughly 2km (1.24 miles)Start Point: Ibah HotelEnd Point: Karsa CafeI went: Mid Oct 2014 around 10amPros-Beautiful scenery-Free-Nice photo opportunites-Good exercise-Happy we ended at Karsa Cafe where we ordered an entree / cold fruit drink for a good price while enjoying a wonderful breeze, beautiful view of the rice patties and relaxing in the open hut over a pond of fish-Karsa Cafe can arrange for a taxi to drive you back to your hotel for a charge so you don't have to walk backCons-Hot/Humid-Not much shade along the path-Felt longer that 2k because of the heatSide notes-I attached pictures with Step 1 to Step 16 photos from Start to End-Bring and drink water-Wear a hat-Good shoes that will allow you to complete a 2k walk with some small inclines-Bring camera-Karsa spa is right next to Karsa Cafe-I pre-booked a spa treatment with Karsa Spa before I flew to Bali. After a 2k walk, it felt so great to get a massage, relax and sit in a hot tub-You can buy fish food from Karsa Cafe to feed the fish in the pond, lots of fish will come up to eat it. Fun to watch.Happy Travels!

Fantastic Walk. Trust the TripAdvisor Review directions to get you there. It's a lovely walk with great photo ops. The walk itself is peaceful and the scenery is idyllic. Take the time to talk with the local artists along the way. Walk past the cafe and you'll find more rice fields.
Morning walk. I took this walk with a friend at about 6am and it was perfect. Sun just rising, morning air was crisp and cool. An empty trail made it the perfect time to take the walk.

Ridge Walk. Brilliant. We went from the Bridge and walked up to the cafe. Great spot to stop and watch Bali life in the rice fields. Over 1000 ducks were very busy. Should have turned back but went on too far. Thank goodness 2 lovely balinese young men picked us up and took us right back to our Hotel. This is why we love Bali!

Worth the visit, not a waste of time. I mean, since many were not so impressed here- I actually liked it. I went around 4:30-5pm and the scenery was beautiful. (Personally I think it's better than the Sari Organic walk) Also interesting to watch the local teenagers hang out and have fun. One tip -- A local guy advised me to come back early in the morning after seeing the Ubud market. That way, you get to see locals sell produce - a less touristy market! - and take in the early morning beauty of the Campuhan walk. Just remember to bring mosquito repellents!

Ridge Walk. If you do nothing else in Ubud you must do this. It really is a great walk but make sure you take water for the trip across the ridge to Club kokus have something to eat and walk back to Ubud, take water.

Beautiful scenic walk. The walk and the views where great. I have no doubt the walk would be leisurely and relatively easy going, however we had to toddlers and prams in tow so it was hard going for us but definitely worth it. If you are not up for the walk you can drive or catch a taxi around to the top of the ridge.
Nice hike. Nice easy hike, lovely views along the way and a nice cafe at the top for a cool drink and even a massage if it takes your fancy!

Very enjoyable but go early!. This walk shows of some incredible views of the Ubud jungles and rivers, however, make sure you go early as we did this about 09:00am and the heat was quite incredible!! A lot of it was an uphill gradient so in the heat it meant it was tough! Worth it though as a lovely cafe and spa at the top! :-D

green path to heaven. i like to do run in the morning and sometime reading book in the afternoon in this place, but sometime many couples getting hot here i don't know why they choose this place, but in the afternoon the view is amazing.

Favorite palce in Ubud. It was 2 hours round-trip by walk from Ubud center.We started to walk at around 8:00 upto Karsa cafe and grap some drinks and went back to Ubud center It was not too hot to walk in June.You can start fresh day with walking Campuhan Ridge in the morning.

Gorgeous views. It's a lovely little walk with beautiful views. There are lots of rice paddys, so this isn't very unique in its way. If you take a cooking class in Ubud, many of them will stop by some rice fields if you want to take pictures. Beware of the sun when it's hot and of the mosquitoes :)

Refreshing way to start a beautiful day ! . An easy walk along the ridge gives u a picturesque view of local life and nature.We started from the entrance at Ibah Villa in the morning around 7:30am, took about 1 hr to reach the Karsa Cafe for a leisure walk , enjoying the landscape and fresh air. We took a break at Karsa cafe to rest and to chill out before walking backwards to Ubud central . The pancake and the view at the cafe is nice ! What a beautiful way to start a day :) Tips : mosquito repellent and sun blocks are needed if you are worried of mozzies and hot sun .

Perfect sunrise walk. Lovely walk starting under the bridge in Ubud. Perfect to go just before sunrise and watch the sun come through the trees on the other side of the ridge.Man made walkway throughout with tall grass on each side.Lovely morning walk.

Warm but really good walk. We went for a walk from Ubud centrum here, the lonely planet guide itinerary, its quite hot, but the view is fantastic, and its nice to get away from the Ubud centrum with too many shops that all sell the same.
