Nice view. This place is awesome for to do a tracking with a very nice view from the rice field. Will be better if you make a tracking in the morning because the air very fresh and the people around this area vey friendly..

The start is the best. Starting at the temple and climbing the hill is the best part of this walk, the second half is less interesting although you end up at some nice restaurants at the end of the road.
A Must do!. Go early morning, you can do this in 1.5 hours with a guide, watch the sun come up as you walk the fields...

Nice walk and beautiful sceneries through the hills, the green and the locals, away from the crowded center of Ubud. The Campuhan ridge walk is a good way to see the nature and local life around Ubud, away from the crowd. Around 30mn for a one-way walk from the big bridge of Ubud near the stunning temple of Gunung Lebah Pura, all the way up up to the Campuhan hill surrounded by the two Woss rivers. The walk ends on the top of the hill in the small and friendly village of Bangkiang Sidem. There are a few hotels and restaurants on the Campuhan hill with views on preserved ricefields or Woss river valleys where to get lunch, snacks, refresments, massages and even some paintings or arcrafts. The Lokha Ubud hotel is located on the east side of the Campuhan hill near the east Woss river. However, the access on foot is not that easy. Sunset Hill Boutique bed & breakfast is located on the west side of the hill with a nice view of the Woss "Kawan" river valley (east), just at the beginning of the village if you come from Ubud.I recommend to do the walk at morning, before 11:00 AM or after 17:00 PM to avoid the heat and to get the best light for your pictures. Prefer sport/walking shoes to flip flops as the walk is going up on stairs and paved road. You can see some bicycle and guided tours around but I think there is no need of any guide or operator to go there.

Peaceful, picturesque, beautiful.. This was a beautiful walk which takes you away from town to a green dream in an instant. The walk is peaceful and you find yourself alone with beauty around you and only a few passersby. Once the paved pathway ends, you will soon see a cafe/restaurant - Karsa Cafe - facing one of the rice fields, this is a beautiful place to have a drink and sit in the floating huts. If you appreciate a quiet, scenic walk, it's a must.

Excellent calm walk for sunrise. I visited twice, once in the late afternoon, and once in the morning for sunrise. Both times were calm and beautiful! Bring your camera. You don't even have to do the full walk if you don't want to.

Quick and Easy-ish. A pretty walk that is done relatively quickly, dont keep walking its about 2 hours for a round trip back to ubud, unless you want this just turn around after you cross the most scenic part of the ridge

Walk this before it is commercialized. I read a blog about this recently and put it on my list of too do's when I got to Ubud. I am glad that I did take the time as there are many places that seem to be getting swallowed up by commercialization and profit and in the process change for ever. It is not a difficult walk but make sure you take water and a hat as most of the time you are out exposed in the sun. I only went as far as the café and didn't need to do the round trip but you had to fight your way past many groups of tourists with the intention of getting the perfect selfie. Bali is changing and not for the better, but as when I mention this to most people they just say that that is progress... really!

Great views.. Would have liked to have walked down the hill, but we got dropped off at the bottom - walk up.....thank goodness for the little warungs along the way that serve cold drinks.Enjoyed the walk, lovely views - Karsa café at the top was a welcome relief with cold cold drinks.I would recommend this walk - good to get away from the hustle and bustle.
Good walk. Nice walk to rice fields. Took only 1.5hours. Good thing for the morning hours. Not clear how to do the round course as not signalised.

Scenic walk away from touristy areas. Campuhan Ridge Walk was a nice change from all other places that we visited in Bali. We started our walk around 7 a.m. and noticed that there was a beautiful temple with no tourists in it, Pura Gunung Lebah. It was lovely to see the picturesque countryside while enjoying the lack of other tourists as compared with other places. We passed by a mother hen and her chicks, a gushing river, an almost fluorescent snail, watched nectar eating birds flying and a duck leading her troop to walk between paddy stalks. The initial part of the walk was slightly steep but the rest of the walk was a breeze. Beautiful views of the ravine and paddy fields. We passed by 2 art galleries and a massage parlour, and a few hotels along the way. We had a lovely drink at Karsa Kafe and spent nearly 2 hours just soaking in the scenery, whilst listening to the sounds of trickling water. Karsa Kafe is definitely a must visit at the end of the walk. We ended up booking ourselves into a guesthouse along this walk and loved every moment of our stay there (waking up to the sight of the ravine, coconut trees and paddy field was just remarkable). We walked back the same way that we came as our car was parked there. The walk is closed from 6.30 p.m. onwards as they are afraid that people might stray from the path or encounter snakes (rest assured we saw none during our walk). At nights, we could see fireflies hovering above the paddy fields. This is definitely a gem.

A good walk along the ridge but we did have concerns for our safety. the walk over the ridge and up to the cafe overlooking the paddy fields was very good, great views and very lush and green. The idea of the walk is that it goes in a loop but walking on after our stop at the cafe we found that the path back to Ubud was on a busy road a local told us it would take at least and hour and a half we decided to turn back towards the cafe and take the route we had come along via the ridge. We did feel that in places the walk was very isolated and on the way I had mentioned to my husband that if I was a single woman I would not want to do this walk alone. On our return journey there was a local man, just hanging around on the ridge, who took a photo of us and then seemed to be texting, as we carried on walking we turned the corner to face three men with jackets on, hoods up coming towards us which immediately struck me as odd as it was such a warm and humid day, luckily some people unconnected to these men also came around the bend. I felt I needed to share this experience as we were genuinely frightened.

Jungle mania. A must-do in Ubud. Takes about 30 mins one way and you are right in the high jungle with sweeping views either side. Stop for coffee at the cafe at the end of the walk and sit over a fish pond in a bale. Excellent Ubud experience. The views are stunning.

away from busy Ubud. you don't have to go far in Ubud before you see beautiful ravines & forests. Wear some sturdy shoes & bring some water, steep climb in parts, but worth the effort. Hope that the construction in the ravine will stop soon as it will eventually spoil what is a stunning vista......

a nice easy walk. This is a nice little walk to occupy an odd couple of hours if you can't get out to north bali. But it isn't all that scenic, and is being slowly suburbanised with new villas and s lot of painting shops.

Cracking little walk. This is within walking distance from Monkey Forest so you have no excuse not to do this walk. It's a very short little trip that loops around the top of Ubud... the whole thing can be done in and hour or 2!! If you want to see the real Bali, do this walk, it's stunning!!

A must see! No need to pay for a tour.. Beautiful and a lovely walk. I came here in the morning to catch the sunrise and it is gorgeous. There ate locals and expats that do an early morning jog on this path. There is a large temple near the start just down the hill from Ipah hotel but it wasn't open when we were there to go in. A must see.
Absolutly must in the morning or if you can spare time. from walking busy Ubud. Very quiet, beautifull views, relaxing afterall the hustle of main street Ubud.
Beautiful Walk. Nice walk to ubud from Lokha Resort however I wouldn't want to walk back as there are lots of hills. Definitely a perfect place to take lots of photos of the surroundings.
beautiful walk. Beautiful walk ...get to see some great rice fields and small art shops along the way as well ...it started off right behind our hotel

Beautiful and peaceful in the morning. This is a perfect place to come for a bit of exercise, and peace and quiet away from Ubud. You'll pass a temple and lush rice terraces, and if you go far enough (past Karsa Kafe), you might even see men "herding" ducks (trying to get them to cross the road), which is pretty adorable and entertaining. Definitely worth checking out and easy to find just beyond Ibah Hotel (on the way out of town/away from the Palace).
Beautiful Jogging Track. I was jogging with my girlfriend on the Bukit Lebah hill, the place is so beautiful. We could see beautiful landscape over there.

Lovely morning walk. We arose early so we would be on the ridge at sunrise. The walk was quite easy for people with average fitness and we were passed by several joggers. It is peaceful, scenic and just the right length if you are not looking for a trek. We didn't go to the cafe that advertises breakfast at the end. Instead we walked back and had breakfast in Ubud. There was plenty of time to do that. I wouldn't rate it as the most spectacular thing I have ever seen but it was scenic, enjoyable and a lovely thing to do first thing in the morning.

Great Walk . Great place to get away from the traffic, garbage, and sounds of Ubud! Beautiful views of lush greenery. Turn back after you get to the café. Once you hit the town there isn't much more to see then a couple rice fields.
Great Early Morning Walk. Of course, the walk is the same anytime of day, but it is hit up there (we're in Bali!), but I go early in the morning when it is cool up there.

Beautiful scenery! . An easy walk with stunning scenery, plenty of photo opportunities and friendly locals along the way. Take a stop at the Karsa Kafe and they will let you walk through the rice terraces.

Early morning. It is a very nice walk, especailly in the early morning. When I did the ridge walk and came back, there was a ceremony in the temple. Along the path are some artists and also restaurants for food /drink. I experienced it as a good way to relax from the hustle and bustle in town. PS, only one block to town there is a nice trail into the rice fields ( also good restaurants )

Beautiful but underwhelming . My wife and I definitely were expecting a wild and unique hike which it wasn't. Totally our fault for not looking at more reviews. The walk is pretty but nothing crazy and pretty short. The cafe at the end was a really nice setting which made the trip worth it. We had more fun biking around the city, getting lost and then finding this activity!

A must in your Ubud itinerary. The walk is well worth while. Try and plan your walk from the bridge in Ubud and walk along the ridge to Karsa Spa where you can indulge in an amazing massage ( one of the best in Bali) or simply rest and have a drink in the cafe and take in the fabulous rice paddy view. Try and plan your walk early to avoid the heat of the day. If you like the idea of the massage do book ahead as word has got out about how wonderful their spa is. Enjoy a lazy lunch after your massage and take a gentle stroll back to Ubud. You will not be disappointed!

Lovely to escape busy Ubud. It is very easy to walk from centre of Ubud to the start of this walk and it is signed just before Campuhan bridge. It starts of with quite an uphill stretch which is a bit tiring in the hot weather, then levels off and runs along a paved path with lovely scenery and the sound of the rivers to both sides of the path. You eventually reach a main road and turn down left to return to Ubud. The road can be busy and runs through villages and rice fields at each side. If you prefer the peaceful countryside I'd suggest you turn back and return back along the ridge

Relaxing Greenery. Lovely walk in the morning. Started at 8.30am and it was hot already... We asked our driver to drop us in front of Warwick Ibah Hotel. The walk started with a steep downslope and crossing a bridge above a river .. There are signs along the way :) From the Ibah hotel , it took about 20 to 30 mins to walk to Karsa Kafe .. It seemed quite far away and we are not walking slowly ! The terrain is up and down .. And also there are many small lizards along the way . After the grassland portion , there are some small private art painters with their small shop selling beautiful paintings .. I bought 2 pretty little paintings - slightly smaller than A4 size (rp 50,000 each only) ^^ she told me that her paintings sells at downtown Ubud art galleries for 3 times the price here! Nice nature greenery views
Get away from the hustle . Did this in the early morning and enjoyed some time away from the hustle of cars and shops. Take your camera if you want some great shots of the terraced rice patties.

Fun walk with a view. Fun and easy walk in a cool setting. Worth the walk when in Ubud.
Not very challenging and takes around 30 mins
Nice even by night !. We hesitated to go, worried to have to do the return by night and in the end we did to and it was very nice too ! So no problem if you go early evening

lovely early morning hike. A really nice hike , this walk takes you uphill through some fields , and into a large group of paddy fieldsThere are many artists and painters who live there , and some have opened a small shop ( which is usually cheaper than the marketplace in Ubud)If you start early , before the sun is high , its very pleasant , quite enjoyable.Finding the starting point can be a bit of a challenge-- so just ask someone before hand(near Warwicks IBAH Hotel )All in all an excellent way to start the daystrongly recommended
Worth the effort - Go early in the day!. Beautiful walk away from the crowds. First 3km is all up hill so take a bottle of water and try to plan your walk for early in the day as it is very humid.

Overrated. Frankly, when this is considered as the No.1 thing to do in Ubud, I was really looking forward to it. An evening stroll would have rewarded me with a sunset view in Ubud. So, I did go for an evening stroll, instead of early morning. Perhaps it was my expectation that led me to disappointment. Still, it was alright. Never had I thought a walk among the weeds would be a No.1 but it was.The sunset was not spectacular that day, but one could wait for it at the end of the Walk Ridge. There are a few shops along the way, plus a few guesthouses/hotels. And houses. And dogs that growled at me. Thank goodness I had my selfie stick to use to scare off the threatening dogs. That really spoiled my walk.There were local lovers/couples along the way, sitting at the walk, near the starting point. Perhaps at those few steps, the place was calmer. The villagers should really do something about those dogs.

Must do walk in the city. Strap your walking shoes and get on this trail preferably early in the morning to avoid the scorching heat. The views are amazing and the cafe 2 km down the trail is exquisite.

An easy 'tick in the box'. A simple but effective attraction. Nice troll long the ridge gives nice views of the township and surrounds plus rice paddies. Beats walking around the crowded streets looking at crappy souvenirs.
A nice little stroll. A nice little stroll to help you get your bearings in and around Ubud. Some good cafes to stop and get refreshed - recommend the woman selling green coconuts half way along!

walk with a view. we loved the ridge walk, recommend early morning or late afternoon to beat the heat. easy walk with plenty to look at so take your camera. don't leave it too late as the sun sets quickly.
Good spot to spend morning walk. I love to walk here in the morning, it can be so hot in the afternoon. And you can find some cafe in the end of the road.
Lovely views.. Nice easy walk along a ridge with beautiful views along rivers on both sides. Nice cafe only a couple of kms along the path.

Easy nice Walk. Start at Warwicks IBAH Hotel, well signed path. over the canyon, passing the temple, up to the sunny hill. Good scenic views, easy to go, go 45 minutes until you rech the Karsa Cafe, with cheap food n drinks and wifi in the middle of Lotus flowers an rice terraces. Then go back same way and wonder what you did not see when you came up.

Nice walk. Pretty views, not too hard of a walk, shorter than I thought. I strolled leisurely taking photos and was done in 30 minutes one way, so it's not a long trip. Walk in the morning to avoid the heat if that's an issue. Nice restaurants and stores along the way, and a cute little fruit stand. Good if you want to get away from the noise of Ubud for a while.

Picturesque amble. Very easy to locate, head for Bridges Restaurant (which is by the large bridge itself), opposite side of the road, slope down and plenty of signs - easy to see A4 size, "This way trekking Campuhan Ridge, "Karsa Kafe" 2 kilometres" and others advertising villas - really cannot miss the route. Fair bit of rubbish especially at the start - I think locals may use as a cut-through to get to the main road at the far end of the ridge. Lush valley on the right and views over to different styles of accommodation. Fields on the left, slighted elevated that give way to views of new properties being built, all interesting. More of a pleasant amble than a hearty walk really. Started walk about 3 pm in month of May and heat not a problem, as fairly short walk, depending on your pace and stopping / starting. Somebody selling drinks along the way. A few 'shops' along the way - two in particular, right hand side of path, lady selling drawings & paintings that she and members of her family had made (pictures of herons landing, which you can see for yourself when the herons return from the rice fields to Petulu Village at approx. 5 pm). Further along, on left hand side, a very nice elderly gentleman selling hand-painted eggs - we watched as he painted the intricate designs. The smaller sized eggs were approx £4.00 sterling, an amazing amount of work for such a small price, a nice memento.It is worth carrying on walking past the Karsa Kafe as interesting views and local life to see, admiring the ladies carrying large pots of sand and soil on their heads to a new villa being built. The Karsa kafe is worth stopping at for a drink to admire the beautiful views over the rice fields. Service fairly slow and not particularly clean tables, cushions that you sit on could do with renewing or washing. The Ridge is worth the walk, but when crowded perhaps not quite the same atmosphere. Lots of locals use the route as a kind of park, and sit on the ground in groups.

Beautiful scenery, a great way to see Ubud. A fantastic and free attraction to do while staying in Ubud. A little hard to find, just make sure you enter at the Ibah hotel sign and head left down the hill. There are a few small signs pointing the way labelled 'Campuhan Ridge Walk' but they are only A4 size so you have to look for them. My advice would be to do it early morning before it gets too hot or too busy, we set off at 7am and found this to be ideal. Great view of the rice paddies and the lush forest, plus you get to glimpse various resorts tucked away on the hillside along with coconut palms. You absolutely must stop at Kafe Karsa on the hill top, a beautiful location with individual shacks floating on a lily pond where you can sit and eat breakfast.

It was OK. I always liked to go for a walk or little hike when traveling so when I read about this place I immediately included in my things to do. The walk itself is not strenuous, more like a leisurely walk. From the entrance to the Karsa Café was 2 km so less than 30 minutes walk. I started early at around 7:00 am, it was a bit chilly at that time so it was refreshing to walk that early. I like the galleries along the street, I thought they were charming. There are new structures being erected in the area so it sort of losing it's village feel. Anyway, it is still worth visiting to get some exercise. Stop by Karsa Café and get that banana pancake with black coffee... yum!

Nice walk. Just set off early,. This is a very nice walk and not too challenging. You get wonderful views of Ubud and there are some nice little shops and cafes along the way. My only advice is to set off EARLY. The sun gets very hot in the late morning/afternoon and you will really feel the heat.

Lovely walk - do it now before it's gone.... Beautiful walk to do in the morning - along the ridge of the Campuhan River. Beautiful views of the villas along the riverbank and cool, fresh air is delightfully refreshing. It's not strenuous and easy to complete!This walk is not to be missed!

Pizdata! A must do in Ubud!. Having spent a couple of hours at the Karsa Spa, we decided to walk back into Ubud via the Ridge. Well worth it, great experience, beautiful scenery...this is what Ubud is really all about, peace and tranquility at its best!!

Good sunrise walk. Fresh air.. Did the walk mid May. It can be easily done in 30-45minutes. Really great to see rural life that close to Ubud. Headed out early. The start is a little hidden but it's easily found. Caught an awesome sunrise with minimal people on the track.

Beautiful views and FREE!. Well worthwhile to make the trek along here. We did do it during the heat of the day and perhaps it would have been wiser to set off early but that didn't spoil our enjoyment. The views are stunning and you really like you are in the wilderness just a stones throw from the town. We saw lots of wildlife on the trek including a huge lizard! it was around 5ft long but quickly scurry away from us before we could get a photo!

Easy Walk, Beautiful scenery. A nice relaxing, easy walk with fantastic views. Stop off for a great lunch or coffeealong the way in the small cafe (s). Slap on the sunscreen, take some water andhave a great time!!

Amazing scenery. Ask any local, and they'll be able to direct you to this walk. It was recommended to us by a friend we met in the area, and it was well worth it. I was nursing a badly sprained ankle and was able to do most of the walk.

Early Morning Walk. Definitely an early morning activity before the heat of the day. I started on the path by the Ibah Hotel and a short distance down the hill, crossed the river and saw the temple. Spent some time exploring the temple that is surrounded by nature . Continuing on, up the short hill and onto the ridge. The views of the valley and fields are glorious. A farmer was cutting the long grass that is growing in abundance and used for the traditional thatching of roofs. I walked through the village, buying water from a small stall and continued through some rice fields to a small cafe. Enjoyed sitting in a bale with a fresh coconut overlooking the rice fields. An easy, tranquil walk with stunning views!

beautiful start of the day. a delightful walk started with a view on the river and a temple followed by a walk in a lush green scenery. start the sooner the better as it gets hots towards the afternoon and there is a 15-20 distance between the spots where you can have a drink or take a rest.

Our Hike. I thought this hike was rather average after all the hype it received on Tripadvisor.Bali gets really hot, and I would not advise going even after 8am, and take a bottle or 2 of your own water.There are a few shops on the route to the cafe. The cafe is worth the visit especially if you need a cold drink. As we went during the off season, the service was very slow.It is a nice walk, but be warned we did not see any signs that the road actually ends, so you would have to choose when to stop.

Nice walk, seems overrated. The walk is nice, but at time of writing it's #1 in Ubud, which I don't understand.I wouldn't bother going all the way along, just wander in about 5/10 minutes until you're up at the ridge and come back.A little difficult to find (through the hotel entrance and first left), also if you're on an automatic bike it will struggle to take two of you back up, if you go all the way down to the entrance.

Easy accessible spot. Serene scenic walk. Not the most amazing views but great to get out of the shopping/ tourist madness and have some peace and quiet and a bit of exercise. Wouldn't say it's a must do, but definitely enjoyable and not too far. Takes about 40 mins return. Recommend going by 8:30am otherwise it gets too hot.

The best scenic trek in Ubud. Imagine a traffic-free paved path with panoramic views of rolling hills, lush forests, rice fields, volcanoes and a river gorge. This is Campuhan Ridge, more commonly known among the locals as Bukit Cinta (Lovers’ Hill). Come for sunset and you’ll see why. Frisky Balinese teenagers stroll up and down the scenic path, dressed to impress in their heels and skinny jeans or doused in heavy cologne with a kretek in hand, giggling and flirting away or love-struck and cuddled up on the grassy hills. Ah, to be young again!

Great hiking. The ridge walk has spectacular views and gets one away from the Bali madness of tourism, motorbikes, and hawkers. It's about 2 km to the peak but then an easy trail/path/road combination to add several more miles through more traditional Bali and village life.

Hot walk with a view and great Café. For childrens families: ask a driver to drop you at the other end of the walk and then walk back to the Ibah hotel. It is mostly down hill and you get to go back to the city center and solve the whole "how do we get back from the end of the walk" story. The walk is really nice with excellent views, a great cafe (Karsa, also a spa) and some nice art shops where egg painting (wood) is a main attraction. There are also art galleries along the way and a number of very nice houses for anyone interested in local living. Once back you will be at the very end of Ubud Raya and can get a taxi or walk a bit and end up at Cafe Lotus, as we did, for a nice lunch.

Lovely way to see the countryside. We regularly take this walk, which starts just after the main bridge into Ubud. Locals use it as a jogging route, and schoolkids meander in little groups after classes finish. Keep walking up the stairs once you get to the end and you'll find Karsa Cafe and Spa, where you dine cheaply in little bales overlooking a carp filled pond. The spa is half owned by an oz woman and offers very good quality treatments.

Ridge Walk. I done the Campuhan Ridge on a bicycle. I agree with all the positive comments but the down side is the amount of rubbish dumped not by walkers but by locals. You don't need to look hard to see it. Some might say this is Bali but this is rubbish

Go at dawn. Watch the mist rolling in the valley..spot the people giving offerings, admire the view, feel relaxed and calm.."what better way to start the day.Nothing will be open but IMHO the best time of day to explore the area.

What a nice walk. Definitely one of the nicest walks in the Ubud area. If you like a challenge, you do it back and forth, starting at IBAH to walk uphills. For the lazy ones, I suggest to get dropped off at Bangkiang Sidem early in the morning, to start walking downhills. Have a first cup of coffee in the café on the right, with magnificent view. Keep walking downhills easily and finish by having a delicious lunch at Murni's Warung down at the river bridge. You will do it over and again every time you come back to Bali...
Great work out with beautiful views!. Best to do this one early in the morning while it is cooler. Great views, lovely village & locals along the way.

A little hard to find the way in but well worth the effort. Still a peaceful walk with lots of open spaces. If not sure of how to find it - ask someone for directions, it's well worth the look especially at sunrise.

Beautiful and free of charge.. I love these things. It's exercise with beautiful scenery and totally free of charge. You get to see jungle, beautiful rice fields and get to visit some of the local artist's galleries. The walk is not so short so bring plenty of water and if you get hungry there are couple of stops to have lunch. Enjoy!
Hot stuff!. Lovely walk although don't go between 10am and 2pm as its pretty hot. You can see locals enjoying this walk too.

Short walk with your love one. Definitely #1 activity in Ubud.Tips: 1. Bring your camera and you will not regret on the scenic greenery. 2. Best start your walk before is getting hot. 3. When you reach Ibah Hotel, choose the left path. 4. After a 2km walk, you will reach at Karsa Cafe. Optional to grab a drink here as the price is slightly higher than in Ubud center. 5. Suitable for all kinds of companion except elderly as some path is a bit steep and with staircases.

Really Nice. This is a really nice walk, however, I am not sure it is the #1 attraction in Ubud, as Tripadvisor is currently tallying. I love all the greenery throughout this walk, but the path was a little busy for my taste. I was thinking it would be very peaceful, but there were a lot of people along the trail. Maybe try to get there really early so you can have the trail to yourself!

Nice little walk trough the ricefields. You start the path at the Ibah hotel which is on the main road in ubud. From there you head down on the slope to the leftmand then you follow a narrow patch to the right. There was some time with "trail" or something then you know you are in the right place. If you follow the path you will end up at a restaurant which had an upper floor wher you can joy the scenery and a cold/warm drink and lunch.

Beautiful Walk. This is best done early morning. The first time we left at 7am which made a most pleasant walk. There is a small village about 1.5k mark that sells artwork and the like. We had a lovely breakfast at Cafe Kasa overlooking the rice paddies. We decided to walk back the next day to visit the spa. As it was much later in the morning it was very hot but still doable.

Probably overhyped walk. A friend and me did the Lonely Planet loop walk during an afternoon. It is very hot, so please bring enough water and maybe a hat. The walk takes you alongside a nice temple and uphill towards the ridge. The view there is great and is a great way to get out of the noisy city for a moment. But that's about all. There are a lot of nice sceneries around Ubud, probably even with less tourists crossing you way. And don't bother the LP loop walk as moslty, you walk around streets avoiding bumping into motor bikes or cars. The art galeries and restarants towards the end of the loop can be visited seperately..The best way to do the ridge walk might be to reserve a spa treatment on in the really good Karsa's and get there by walking. As said, the first 20 minutes of the walk are well worth the time, but don't plan your afternoon around this activity.

Overwhelmingly hot. Me and My boyfriend went for this walk this morning. It was crazy hot and sweaty but so worth it in the end of the road. The little cafe with an ice cold beer and cold water and a crazy, spectacular view from their rooftop terrace made the whole expedition so worth the effort.

Worth 20 Minutes Tops!. Based on the fact that this is the number one activity listed on Tripadvisor, I kept mentioning to our driver/guide that we would like to walk on the ridge. Being Balinese, he was of course gracious and said it was a place young teenage couples went for a romantic date. We did the walk in the late afternoon after visiting the monkey forest. It is an okay walk (not a hike) with views on both sides of the ridge filled with teenage couples who were stopping along the way. Nothing spectacular, worn tourist trail with litter, and kind of a let down - saw much more beautiful scenery driving through the nearby countryside or stopping at the rice terraces. Takes a quick 10-15 minutes to complete the 2 km ending at Karsa's cafe. Wouldn't plan my day around this activity.

Amazing scenery . Campuhan Ridge Walk runs from the main road through Ubud right up through the hills and into the Balinese countryside. The start is next to the Ibah Hotel and there are excellent views if the rice terraces in the plateau. It is a little strenuous, especially with the heat and humidity, so make sure you bring lots if water. You won't be disappointed!
Great scenery. Beautiful walk on the outskirts of Ubud until you get to the road which is too busy for walking. Would suggest just walking back the same way.

Tiring but beautiful view. We're kind of people who like beautiful scenery better than culture, so we choose to visit Campuhan Ridge Walk when we're in Ubud.We started the walk around 7 am, at the Ibah hotel. If you can start early, please do so, since the weather is hot during April.Our destination is Karsa cafe, around 2 km from Iban hotel. We know that we don't have enough physical stamina to go all the way to the top :D.The track itself is in good condition, and already paved by cement. But please make sure that you're in good healthy condition, since the track is incline all the way.During the walk, your eyes and mind will be refreshed, looking at green valley and paddy field. It's definitely worthed the effort.Ibah hotel is in Ubud main road, near Puri Lukisan museum.

Great little walk. Beautiful walk along a ridge with rice fields and little art shops and cafes. Don't do the Lonely Planet loop though. Just backtrack when the ridge walk ends, when the Lonely planet tells you to turn left down a paved road. We did the loop not knowing any better, and the rest of the loop is on busy roads. So just backtrack.

Tranquil Walk in Ubud. I saw this on trip advisor today and then happened to pass the entrance whilst wandering through Ubud. It was a little hot for our walk, but wow, it was totally worth it! The views are just incredible and then a nice refreshment at the cafe before heading back. The views from the cafe are amazing too! Totally recommend it!
Pleasant walk. Spent a pleasant afternoon doing the ridge walk. We booked a massage at karma spa ahead to reward ourselves which I would recommend.

soothing for the soul-an insight of what ubud was before commercialisation,preferably avoid the sun. We decided to walk across this ridge-as we didnt have much to do-but was probably one of the best things we did in bali.It starts near the Ubud clinic and it takes about an hour to walk to the cafe at the end.Its amazing how this ridge is so close to the main road and yet so cut off ,towards the end of the walk is the karsa kafe-not very good food-but has amazing views and a not so expensive to quench your thirst.further down you can walk through one of the villages before you head back.The pathway doesnt have too many vehicles and you walk across several houses and into the rice fields.

Loved this walk I spent hours exploring and reflecting. I highly recommend this walk, loved it so much I did a couple of times. I stopped on the way for a cool drink at Karsa Kafe and on way back for a massage.

One of the most inspiring walks in Ubud. It's a challenge with hills and length, however one not to missed. The views are perfect Kodak moments everywhere you look. Best early in the morning before it gets too hot and walk to the end of the road/track coming from Ubud for a coconut and banana pancake at Karsa Cafe on one of their bale's over the pond, great experience.

Fantastic. A must do in ubud! We did one way from the lokha side and went down towards iban hotel as we were short on time. Lovely paved pathway surrounded by greenery and ridges, nice traditional Balinese houses, paddy fields and pleasant weather.

Very Nice Walk!. This is a beautiful walk away from the hustle and bustle of tourists in ubud. Definitely worth checking out. We stopped for a refreshment at the kafe Karsi and loved it. They have a very pretty pond that overlooks the fields. Great free activity!!
A great walk. Beautiful views and a lovely cafe/day spa at the end for some much-needed relaxation.Make sure you take plenty of water and mosquito repellent :)

Nice walk. I walked Campuhan Ridge once and liked it. The path starts right outside Ubud, so you don't need go somewhere far to enjoy balinese nature. Of course there are more stunning views on Bali, but it's worthy to do this tiny hiking just for a change

Peaceful and colourful walk. Easy and fairly quick walk, best done in the morning as the start is uphill. Lots of people along the way to say hello to as I was walking alone. Great views on both sides with a small village at the end of the path. Must see/buy a wooden egg painted by a local man, very impressive. Didn't pass the small village, but headed back to Ubud. Nice open walk away from the main streets of Ubud

Average compared to other views/walks. I suspect many people like this walk because it was easy to get to. We had gone to see the rice paddies and other sites before deciding not to do the Campuhan (pronounced Chum-pu-han) ridge walk. However, curiosity got the best of us after finding out Pura Gunung Lebah was closed to visitors. The weather (10AM in April) made the uphill portion rather unpleasant, but the anticipation of "the gorgeous view" at the top kept us going until you realize you are not at the tallest or the prettiest peak. After that the only motivation was getting to the Kafe for hydration. We took transport (100K rupiah in the Kafe's menu) back to central Ubud. Save your time/energy/water for other places, unless you want to feel betrayed by the inflated reviews.

Nice walk if it's not too hot. This is a beautiful walk and surprisingly quiet for being right in the middle of Ubud. Unfortunately we were just too hot to walk the whole thing, but it is definitely worth checking out.
Worth the walk on a good day. The walk to the café is great but the rest not so special. Possibly nicer to walk the same way back than finishing the ring

Good thing to do. Can't add much to other users' postings. Nice walk (2km but still - we were actually pretty exhausted due to humidity), just out of ubud you can see examplary nature of (an more authentic) bali. Good trade-off between ubud life, fresh air, and physical activity to sweat off all the bintangs ;)Enjoy, would go again ...

Fresh Morning Stroll. Neat & clean path with awesome view. Very fresh air in the morning. You'll meet local poeple doing their daily routine. Morning offerings in the temple, going to work on rice filed or just stroll 7 jog.

Beautiful walk, not a hike!. Beautiful trail along the river ridge. We cut through a school parking lot near Bridges Restaurant. It's across the street at the opposite end of the Jalan Campuhan Bridge from Bridges Restaurant. Don't walk down towards the river, stay on the trial up top and you will come across a sign marking the beginning of the trial. We walked the whole loop. (not recommended) Halfway along you end up at the beautiful Karsa Kafe & Spa. You pass by some talented artisans and rice patties. We wished we would have turned & gone back the same way we came because the loop turns into a roadside walk that is not picturesque past the Karsa Kafe. Recommended to stop at the Karsa Kafe for a fresh coconut :)

Lovely walk - nice picture taking opportunitites. The walk itself is unshaded in many places - which is a problem in the heat of a Ubud afternoon - better to go early in the day. The light is better for taking photos as well. We did get to see Rice Farmers doing their thing - but the highlight for me was the Pancake restaurant at the mid-point. Such a wonderful place, good food - and a much needed break from the heat and the sun.The egg painters that have set up shop all along the top of the ridge are an added bonus - no pressure, but you do get to see exactly how intricate this art form actually is!I wouldn't rate this a not to be missed - but I'm glad I went. It's a nice walk away from the cars and motorbikes of Ubud.
Stunning walk. Went early morning ( best time before it gets too hot). Had breakfast at the small cafe at end of walk which was good food with a relaxing view over large Lilly pond .

A simple trek in Ubud. We are not fans of hikes and trekking but the Campuhan Ridge Walk was a nice change to shopping in Ubud. We went at 8 am and the sun was already high up. Nice trek and we enjoyed a short stop at Karsa Cafe. Do check out the waterlilies and plants at the Cafe as well as views of paddy fields in near distance.

Short, gentle walk. Not a spectacular or long walk by any means but extremely easy and a good way to kill an hour or two.Best in early morning with the clearer skies and lower temperature. Once you reach the start at the Ibah Hotel the ridge is signposted clearly so you cant really miss it. It goes uphill for 2-3 minutes and then flattens out so its extremely easy. Its about a 3km walk to the Karsa Kafe point.From there you can turn around and go back to Ubud that way OR do a 6km loop to get back. The loop itself is mainly along the main roads so not very good so best option is a short there and back to the Karsa Kafe.Not earth shattering but decent views and very very easy so suitable to everyone. It wont take more than 2hrs though so do it before breakfast.

Must do. Amazing walk between two rivers ending in the merging of the two rivers. This is one of the most scenic walks that I have ever done. Very easy and it takes you past some of the most amazing painters. An easy walk for all ages. Highly recommend this walk for anyone visiting Bali.

Awesome for runners. Best to start early before it gets really hot. You have gotta run up through here if you are a runner. The greenest nicest bit only goes for about a mile. But when you come to the steps at far end, you can run well far ahead, it does not end, well worth it.

Beautiful walk in nature with great views. Love the Campuhan walk in the early morning and early evening for sunset. Sometimes the temple underneath ceremonies going on - this is a great experience. Go to bridges restaurant down the road for a glass of wine afterwards.

Not to be missed. This walk is not to be missed on a trip to Ubud. Accessed just off the main road on the west side of Ubud near Penestanan, it is an easy walk of about 30 minutes to get to Karsa Spa where you can stop for a coffee or lunch. Then either walk back the way you came, get a taxi back to Ubud or walk back to Ubud via the road- about a 9km walk in total if you go that way.The views along the ridge then through the rice paddies are beautiful. Start early in the morning and get beautiful views across the rice paddies to Mount Agung and Mount Bator.

Had to do it, second morning in Ubud. Finally, you are out of Ubud urbanized area... It's a long ridge walk (be prepared to walk and bring proper shoes), can be little cold during mornings but totally worth. The experience is not the same that you will have in Tengalalang or any other rice field walk. Take some shots and enjoy that clean air.

Great Morning Walk!. take 40 mins to finish. Dont go after sun sets because it is dark - no street light or anything... Stop at Karsa Kafe - and try their balinese coffee. :) not very good but you know: since you are in Bali!

Good Start to the day. A perfect way to start your day in Ubud.. couple of km walk to run to the Kafe and back each way early morning can be highly refreshing and fun. I had the added attraction of photographing birds

One of our best days. Despite being told to walk the Campuhuan Ridge Walk in the morning so it is cooler, we had no choice but to do it in the mid afternoon heat. The scenery is stunning and the Karsa Spa & Cafe at the top is well worth a visit. The whole experience of the walk and the spa & cafe was awesome and one of our best days in Ubud.

Walk in reverse with kids. We were with kids aged 2 -12, decided to walk after 4 pm. Our hotel driver took us to the opposite end so we could walk towards Ubud and have dinner. The sun was low and it was much cooler, beautiful walk!

Nice nature walk. We got up early to do this walk as we didnt want to catch the hot weather. We started our walk just after 7am from the top of the hill just where there were 1-2 cafes which seemed nice enough for a brief stop and drink. If we had done the reverse direction walk uphill, we would certainly stop at one. It was a nice refreshing walk, not too warm even with the morning sun. U see some interesting houses/boutique hotels afar on the right side while walking a gentle downhill slope right upto the river. The stroll would take you an hour from the top to the bottom bridge.
Great walk with nice scenaries. Close to Ubud, nice little stroll with very nice scenaries. Not too difficult to perform. We stopped at Karsa Cafe and spa on rhe way.

Green!. Walk a bit to the west out of town and you'll find this ridge to walk or cycle onto, and enjoy massive vistas of the structures and river of Ubud. The path is made of concrete and is safe to walk on. Once reaching the top you can reverse your steps into town or stop for drinks and art shopping along the way

Well worth the effort. This is a daily fitness routine for us and we run/walk the couple of kilometres from the temple up to the Karsa Kafe and back each morning before breakfast when we are staying in Ubud. It has become quite popular so we find the easiest time to go is before 7Some great scenery along the way with friendly people enjoying the exercise.
Lovely walk through nature. A must do when in Ubud, though you need a lot of water and sun protection. A offline map will also come in handy!

Nice walk but not many rice fields. We started the walk near the ibah hotel. Our guide was nice enough to offer to walk with us. I wanted to see rice fields but after a long walk i only saw a few.We stopped by some artists shop and bought a painting while my partner played with the dogs of the shop owner's friend. Be sure to have good walking shoes, water with you

Lovely, reasonably easy walk. We just arrived in Bali today so we wanted to get out in the fresh air. Sure, it gets warm, but it's Bali.... Lovely views over the rice paddies and the valleys. Stop at Karsa Kafe, go up to the top deck for a beautiful view and to enjoy the shade and refreshing breeze

A gorgeous stroll away hustle and bustle . A lovely stroll through the lush greenery of ubud. While you're only a few minutes from the Main Street it feels like you're miles away. We started at around 3pm and while it was hot, didn't find it unbearable. By no means a "trek", we did it in flip flops an we're carrying shopping! A great way to pass time snapping photos and enjoying the breeze

Lovely but perhaps overrated.. I did the 2k walk as a loop from our accommodation in the north to get to Ubud and it was lovely to leave the hustle behind and follow the road down past gorgeous houses and resorts, temples and galleries. Kaspa Kafe looked amazing and worth doing the walk out and back to have that as your reward. I had hoped to see wildlife on the walk but spotted only one fat gecko. It's definitely a good activity to do while in Ubud but should it be #1 in Ubud or #15 in Bali? I don't think so!

A must do in Ubud. We do this walk every time we go to Ubud. It has changed a little in 25 years, but the beauty has remained the same.You can make it as long or short as you want. It is beautiful going both ways, and seems different, so you can just go as far as you want and reverse it. It is a good idea to do it at sunrise, or sunset, or on a cloudy day, cause it can get very warm. Worth stopping in at Karsa cafe and/or their spa if it is open. One of the best restaurant settings in a place where their is plenty of competition.It really is something to make a definite, even if you are only in Ubud a short time.

Persevere, the view is worth it!. A lovely, easy walk from the centre of Ubud, takes you right out of the hustle of the town. The path is a bit narrow and overgrown in parts, but it opens out onto the most unexpected and fabulous views of the ricefields snd mountains. There is a very picturesque cafe at the top of the hill, where you can have a drink and enjoy the view. Also several local artists studio on the route. About 25 minutes back down into Ubud centre. Recommended.

Green and peaceful. A nice walk on a small path that takes you pass rice fields and beautiful green landscapes, although not all the way as you pass through some guesthouses and private homes as well. After 20 minutes, you will reach Karsa Spa and Restaurant where you could have a drink overlooking the rice fields, or have a nice massage/spa (need to prebook first as they are quite popular).

Beautiful walk. We went for a beautiful walk in the morning before it became too hot. The walk is easy, beautiful and very relaxing. We definitely recommend to take bring a book and to enjoy a smoothie at the cafe next to the rice fields. A beautiful and relaxing location.Don't forget to put on sunscreen even if the sky is cloudy.
Great experience . Truly great experience. A must if you are in Bali. Feels unrealistic to sit, drink a young coconut and enjoy a view like this. The path was absolutely Ok even for the kids.

Great views but Needs some remedial work. We came to the walk from the North, as a the last stage of a long circuit through the Western side of Ubud. The views along the walk to both the Eadt and West are great, but the pathway is sorely in need of maintenance. The path is supposed to be about 1.5 metres wide (four paving stones) along its entire length, but has become so overgrown that much of the oath is now only two paving stones wide and some sections are down to just one paving stone in width. There is also one short section where a small land slip has covered the paving entirely.The other thing to be aware of is that there is not much shade along the top of the ridge, so it's a hot walk. Also there is nowhere at all sit comfortably along the length of the wal (that is there are no path side seats) but there are a few spots where you can sit on the ground if you really need to.We ran into some mountain bikers on one of the steeper parts of the path and had we not been able to see them coming down might have had trouble getting out of their way.Do, all up, it's a good walk if you are young and fit, but not do much if you if you don't fit into that description.

Leisure walk. We started the walk around 4 pm, so it was very pleasant. Very close to Ubud town. We loved the view from there as we see the landscape from above. Many local teens go there for hanging out, working out and also making out:). Choose to go there either early in the morning or around 4 pm so it's not too hot.

Good short walk. It's a great walk. You don't need hiking boot for this trail, it's paved. Your normal comfy shoes should do the job. It's not a hard hill/ridge to climb, great for kids and only takes 20 minutes until you come to the first villa. you can carry on pass paddy field but once you reach the temple at the junction, it becomes a bit boring. Best to turn back walk back down the ridge. I made a mistakes trying to do the loop, I think it's about 9km and one big hill to climb and really it's not that interesting.

Not a must do - Very average. If you plan to go make sure you get to the start at 7am or before, it was hot even walking back on the downhill. This was a fairly short walk, about 2km max and fairly leisurely with a slight uphill and nice art shops along the way and some nice views. Not a lot to see besides some rice terraces, a few hotels alone the way and tall grass. I wouldn't say this is a must do, a nice walk in the morning but very average.

Beautiful view. The walk starts next to the entrance of Iban hotel and went up for quite a while. The walk was a lot shorter than we thought but very beautiful. At the top you pass a cute cafe with pagodas overlooking the rice fields where you can rest and enjoy a fresh coconut. The walk is marked in the beginning but after half an hour we weren't sure where to go as there were nno signs. Maybe bring a map.

Paradise! A must if you stay in Ubud.. We started the walk at around 7am, as we wanted to get back to the hotel by 9:30am. We took a taxi to Ibah Hotel, which is the starting point of the walk. Our hotel was near by the Monkey Forest Ubud, and the taxi ride cost us IDR 40K. The walk looked a bit scary at the start, as due to the wet weather, the grass was long and it was difficult to cross. Views are amazing once you reach the half way round the walk. It is mostly uphill, around 2.5 km, until you reach Kafe Karsa (took us about 40 mins).We stopped our walk at the cafe, had a Banana smoothie (cost IDR 35k) and fresh Coconut water (cost IDR 35k), also clicked a couple of pics as the view of the water lilies and rice paddies was amazing. Downhill was much easier while returning back. Be alert as you may find some chameleons or lizards crossing your way, especially in wet season.

Start at the top for a downhill stroll. Or in Ubud for an uphill slog... your choice. Either way you will enjoy some nice views. Stopped at cafe at the top for a refreshing juice and found a geocache while we were there.

Worthwhile walk while in Ubud. We have walked this trail several times and have always enjoyed it. We usually take a taxi out to the other end and walk in to Ubud. There are several places along the way where you can sit and enjoy a young coconut and the view. Great little piece of exercise andthe views are wonderful

a nice morning walk. my wife and i took a taxi to the ridge walk and spent the next couple of hours leisurely walking, mostly downhill. there were many artist studios along the way and worth a visit. beautiful jungles and rice patties nearby. do it in the morning or early evening when it is cool.

Great ridge walk in the morning. The greenery as you walk thru the ridge is amazing. It's very refreshing and enjoyable. It's good trek for photos and for someone who enjoys a relaxing walk in the nature. There's a village at the end of the ridge. You can see lots of arts and culture here and as you walk further into the village, you can stop by Karsa Kafe and Spa for a nice cool drink before heading off.

Only minutes from the hustle and bustle to find paradise. I loved this walk. Be sure to get up early to beat the heat. Enjoy the wonderful views and smiling walkers along the way. Lovely stop at the cafe at the end of the the 2 km walk, water lillies, rice paddies, sculptures and yummy juices and coffee. Just perfect!

It Is Best In The Morning. Without a doubt, this Campuhan Ridge Walk is a joy to savor. Be there in the morning at 07:00AM where milder air is still there, then climb up slowly up to the hill (2KM) where view is best. At the end of this walk, there's a café to relax with beautiful views to share. This is Perfect!

Hot but worth it. It is a very high and hot area in Ubud so take hat, sunscreen and water. Also, be careful if it's the rainy season because the weather changes quite quickly and you could get caught out.

Good to do in the morning before it gets too hot!. Lovely walk through the rice fields. We encountered a gorgeous Balinese bride and groom having their wedding photos taken along the way. Definitely worth doing if you are up for a hike, don't forget your hat and water, some areas are exposed. Good vantage point about half way to look back down the ravine at Ubud countryside.

Meh...don't go out of your way. I certainly wouldn't consider this a "must-do". It's a walk up a hill through tall grass so, sure, I suppose it is unique. It's a peaceful and pretty area but some of the pictures posted on here make it seem a little more scenic than it actually is. It's worth doing if you're in the area and have some time to kill. Otherwise, there are plenty of other things to do in and around Ubud so I don't recommend you go out of your way for this. Also, to echo some other comments, if you do attempt the walk, go very early when it's not as hot as there is no shade.

A long walk - but worth it.. The walk from near the river up the ridge through the elephant grass fields and rice paddies was wonderful - all so close to town. It is a 2km walk to a charming cafe in the rice fields. It is suggested that you return back down the walking track ( which unusually is paved with pavers, so quite safe and negotiable on the steady slopes). I decided to continue north - without a map of course - I discovered Lonely Planet has a map of the walk. I continued through paddies, a little artist village - complete with the usual gallery-workshops along the way. I turned left along a narrow road/track (sealed and used by enless motor scooters) and found myself on a major road (for Bali) through a valley, over a bridge and up a very steep incline (where the police were helping extract a large truck that had gone over the steep edge). I continued on through some small villages - met a few local dogs - and eventually followed my way back to Ubud central. It felt like a long way - and the map says I did over 8 km in the heat and high humidity/light rain - and loved it.

A pleasant and revealing walk. This walk is easy to get to from Hotel Tjampuan. Go down to the lower levels and follow the signs pointing towards the Temple. You'll cross a bridge over the river, then go up the stairs and turn right, go down the path. You'll see the sign at the start of the walk. It's a beautiful walk. Little village at the end. I wasn't that impressed with the food at Kafe Karsa buthte setting is lovely. There is a little art shop in the village where an elderly gentleman paints eggs and sells paintings. He's a good sort - no pressure and fair prices. A little further down the track is the Maryana art 'gallery'. They tried to sell me a painting for $650 USD that the fellow who paints eggs was selling for 400,000 RPH (about 40 AUD or 30 USD). So avoid being scammed and buy from the gentleman who sells painted eggs. I actually walked for about another 30 mins after I found the village - the road passes rice paddies and then swings up a gentle incline past some fairly impressive dwellings and temples.

Lovely walk. Walk along ridge of terraced rice fields. Some nice views. A lot of laughs, as the day we went it seemed to be "the" place for local pre-teens to flirt. Lots of giggling boys and girls trying to get each others attention. :)We walked through two photo shoots, passed several local jiggers and other travellers but it never felt crowded. Went to the little restaurant at the top to sit in the huts that overlook more rice fields. Overpriced but the breeze was great up there after the slog up.

5 stars because it's a great photo opportunity. I suggest going early in the morning so that the bright sunlight doesn't wash out your photos and it's still relatively cool. Some of my best photos from Bali came from this walking trail.

Awesome View!. I never expected to have such an awesome view! so Campuhan Ridge Walk was totally a surprise! Walking on the path on the green hill covered with grass, watching the beautiful bulidings on the other side of the ravine, with a nice ricefield view in the front and only two or three local teenagers passing by. How can you forget this experience?

So close to Ubud yet you feel so far away. Thanks must go to "liveloveraw.com" as Anya's directions were perfect. Leave early as it gets very hot by mid morning- we left our hotel in Hanoman at 0600 so commenced the walk by 0700 and it was hot within an hour- but the views, the ambience is awesome. Stop for a drink at the Karsa Kafe overlooking rice fields. Great couples walk.

Good exercise that ends with a nice cafe. The walk was pleasant and full of greenery. We started early about 7.30am which was already bright. The ridge are used by locals for their exercise. A good climb but a less than strenous downhill return. Good for nature lover and for photography.
Must do. Do it. Enjoy every step you take in this lovely living painting. Just sit and drink a coconut. Look and feel the great scenery of risefields. The real Ubud!

Beautiful walk. We left before 9 and loved the views, not too hard a walk, but take water. The whole walk is in full sun, the views down the valley on both sides were well worth it. A banana smoothie at the kafe karsa was well deserved. we paid the 5000 rupiah for a bag of fish food (around 50 cents Australian) and sat on a sheltered platform feeding the fish enjoying our smoothies. The karsa spa was too busy to fit us in, so if you want to finish with a massage I suggest you book in advance. walked a little further and managed to find a taxi to take us back to our hotel. All up 2 hours round trip, a great morning

Excellent.. Definitely worth a visit in the early morning or late afternoon. Nice to get away from the 'commercial' side of Ubud. Beautiful views and friendly locals. Great little rooftop bar for a smoothie or a cold Bintang. An easy walk for those willing to do something a little more than just shop, drink or laze around a pool.

Heavenly. we took off from nearby Kalangan Moding village after a slow-breakfastI took us twice the indicated time to reach mainstreet Ubud as we were overwhelmed by the unique natural sceneryJust do it!

go early, take water and hats. we loved having a drink in the Kafe Karma at the top and watching the locals at work in the padi fields. We didn't like the heat and lack of shade. as other suggest, go early (before 9) and take hats and water. (Take a good map if you intend to do the second half of the walk.. it's well signed as far as the cafe but after that.... )

go early, take water and hats. we loved having a drink in the Kafe Karma at the top and watching the locals at work in the padi fields. We didn't like the heat and lack of shade. as other suggest, go early (before 9) and take hats and water. (Take a good map if you intend to do the second half of the walk.. it's well signed as far as the cafe but after that.... )

Lovely walk, go early. This is a lovely walk overlooking the Campuan ridge, and local villages. Make sure you visit the egg painter at the end of the local village. Can be tricky to find the walk. But once on the track it is easy.

Must do while in Ubud. First I would recommend walking this. Several people said you could bike it but my husband found that too difficult. Take water and a good hat. Beautiful country scenery and a short walk through the rice fields. There is a little cafe to stop for a drink. This can connect you into a road to town but we doubled back to avoid the traffic ( which takes away the peacefulness of Ubud).

Too hot didnt do it all. but would of done early in morning.. Nice walk but need to do early in morning cause it is hot and humid. made it to restaurant 2km up very nice to sit around and watch Koi fish.

Great if your in Ubud. We just went out of our way to get to the sight. While it was great and beautiful, I would not go out of my way to take the walk. Only took us 30 mins and not as much shops along the way. At the end there were a few shops. So many beautiful tours and attractions in Bali. This is good if your in the area. Was free and good for a couple photo ops in the grass.

Well worth it. It's very easy to find the start and it's a pleasant but short walk up through rice fields to a popular stop, Kafe Karsa with stores and galleries along the way, plus views of big houses. Once you hit the road portion there's a lot of 'villas for rent' signs if you're interested! It took us about 25 minutes to get to the Kafe in the midday sun. Not a long walk but a very hot one. We went a bit further to see if we could do the full loop but as other reviewers said the road is busy and a bit alarming at times so we turned back.

Green Grasses. This place is just an open greenish field.The Sun could be very cruel if one is going to this place after 10AM and before sunset.I saw someone cycling and jogging there as well.However, it's such an enjoyable walk.

A little tricky to navigate but amazing views. We used an online page we found in order to facilitate findings this trail and we thought it was a loop trail but we ended up having to jsut turn around and retrace our steps. Views were amazing and it was really interesting to see all the local people just going about their regular day in the rice fields.

Only if you have spare time .... I wouldn't put this at the top of your Ubud to do list. In saying that tho, it was a great and pretty walk. Interesting to look over the river and see how the rich folk live. Huge homes. Water and bush views etc. Very much a contrast to the average Balinese. Given time we would have walked the extra 6km back to Ubud.

A nice stroll through the green fields . The Campuhan Ridge Walk was a nice break away from the bustle of central Ubud. The stone lined path runs between the green grass and rice fields with plenty of good places to stop and snap a good photo. Best of all, it's free! If you walk all the way to the top there are some nice cafes to stop at and get a drink the walk isn't challenging at all. No difficult hills or anything like that involved. I had a lot of fun looking around and moving at my own pace while getting lots of nice photos. Campuhan ridge walk is definitely with a visit if you have some time in Ubud!

Peaceful, relaxing nature walk close to Ubud central. Easily accessable from the main street of Ubud. We enjoyed the scenery of the two rivers and the jungle surrounding. There was not much hassling by locals wanting to sell you things which was nice. The walk up goes for about 45 min and I would not suggest going the long way back (continue the loop) as it is very long. best to come back down the same way.

Make an early start. My husband did this first and convinced the Eleven year old and I to give it a try. I'm Glad we did but wish we had started two hours earlier at around 6.00 am as it got very warm very fast. The walk itself was lovely; views over rice fields, lovely villas, happy couples and a very tasty breakfast at the end. We didn't do a full circuit...just an out and back, but it was a lovely experience.
Worth the effort. A fairly easy walk with interesting Ubud scenery. The cafe just past the first cluster of warung and houses makes a sensible end point, but you can keep going.
"scenic places". have a great scenic views...,it's wonderful and calming to ride a bike here or just take a walk enjoy the atmosphere.

Beautiful Walk. A great walk with continuous spectacular views.Uphill leading away from Ubud - but not too strenuous.2.5kms to Karsa Kafe which is a good rest stop before the return leg.Check out the egg painter near Karsa Kafe - amazing work at very reasonable prices - good souvenir.

Campuhan Ridge Walk. Best to walk in the early morning hours. It's gently sloping uphill. And a the peak you reward yourself with beautiful food and drinks at one of the little warungs the Balinese seem to be doing so well. The view is out of this world: over meticulous rice paddies to - what I think - is Mount Agung. Roosters strolling through the Warung and picking up crumbs from the floor. We didn't dare to walk back along the busy road and just turned around and walked back down. Such a peaceful respite from busy Ubud.
Fun!. This is a green oasis just off the main road, a good 2 km walk, this is a fun thing to do. lots of butterflies to chase and its also clearly the romance point for young Ubudians :)

Wonderful walk giving a fascinating glimpse of village life. A wonderful walk away from the bustle of ubud and into beautiful unspoilt countryside. Just walk down the hill from ubud palace and turn into Ibah hotel entrance, taking the left hand fork before Ibah hotel itself.Make sure you walk all the way to Karsa Kafe for juice or a latte

Great walk, start early to beat the heat. I had a great walk along the ridge, but I didn't do the full loop to come back through the village - I just turned around once past the first village. The views were nice but not really stunning, and there is quite a hill to walk to get up there, and then again at the end to get back to the street. I saw a lot of lizards along the walk in the grass. The Temple at the bottom at the start of the walk was very nice. If you want a walk closer tot he rice paddies, take the walk to the Sari Organic Restaurant, which starts a little before the start of the Campuhan Ridge walk - it is a more interesting walk.

Nice views. We did the walk in the morning, it was already quite hot, but a very nice walk not far from the hotel. We were brought there within 5 minutes by shuttle. It's a definite must if you stay here.

Nice scenic walk. A hidden place in Ubud. Not popular among local. Our driver mistakenly brought us to Campuhan Bridge instead of Campuhan Ridge. Luckily they are located next to each other.
Looks similar to Mount Broga in Malaysia.
beautiful. It only took about 40 mins and it wasn't as hard as I always imaged! Just do it as it is very beautiful!

Follow the Yellow Brick Road.. It reminds me of The Yellow Brick Road in the Wizard of Oz. Please do not drop rubbish there. Some locals do and it's such a pity but you must do this walk if you are visiting Ubud.

Walk. Lovely easy walk with views of lovely country side. Temple at start beautiful walk easy even for older folk like myself, 60+ We love Ubud except during the day when travel lots come from the south on day trips. Early morning or evening for exploring.

Nice easy walk. We set out at 8am in the morning to beat the heat. The walk was not hard, but I think if you left much later it would be a hard slog with the sub burning down. It was lovely watching the local people tending to their rice paddies and daily life. It felt like you were seeing the "real Bali".

Beautiful walk!. We started early to beat the heat and I'm glad we did. It's a beautiful walk on a fairly decent trail and we were able to walk from our villa in Penestanan to the trail head. We walked for a while, climbing in altitude until we ended up at this gorgeous little restaurant for breakfast complete with serene lily pond, huts over the water and views of the rice fields. A perfect place to refresh and hydrate! Then we turned around and went back the way we came.

Great walk through the rice fields. One of the best free activities you can do in Ubud. Walk through the rice fields, enjoy the views from the ridge and as the sun comes down you can see young local Balinese couples going on romantic walks or just sitting and enjoying the sunset. Highly recommend as part of any Ubud itinerary.

A reasonable to do walk at sunset. Not sure why it's special, there are more interesting walks around Ubud, but it has some reasonable views from its sharp ridge, perhaps with a zoom lens it might be worth taking photos. It's mainly just grass. Pay $5 for a taxi to Kersa and it's a pleasant, easy walk back down to town. Kersa has some nice terraces and it's probably the best part.
Nice walk. Nice walk with beautiful views - bring an umbrella in the rainy season ! You will find some artshops and nice restaurant at the turning point of the trail.

Burn Your Fat Refresh Your Mind. Walk up the hill Campuhan really tiring but very exciting. See the view of nature and the beautifull architecture of the villas. Prepare your physic, enjoy every drop of your sweat, explore the surrounding indigenous villages. amazing!
A great walk!. We went during the middle of the day, so it was very hot! Bring water and a camera. A great place to get away from the hustle and bustle and see a great view!
I love this walk!. I do it every time I come to Ubud, each time it is different, whole other side of Bali. If you come back the long way watch out for the traffic though.
Beautiful!. Too long back to Villa Kupu Kupu, had to get a cab half way. It was really hot that day and humid or we probably could have made it back comfortably.

Bring a Hat or Umbrella. Even on a cloudy day, most of the Campuhan Ridge walk is hot, hot, hot so bring some form of coverage and enough water. You start by the Warwick Ibah Hotel, just before the bridge and Bridges restaurant if you're coming from town. The walk talks you to Karsa Cafe which serves some great local dishes like the Nasi Campur but really average drinks. Along the way, you'll see picturesque rice fields, quaint villages and a bunch of artist galleries selling locally-painted art pieces. The walk is pretty easy.At Karsa Cafe, you can either walk another 6km and make a loop back into town or back track 3km back to the main road you started from. If you're not up to walking, there're a number of villagers willing to drive you back to town for Rp. 10,000. You can probably bargain - we didn't try and opted instead to turn back on foot.

Enjoyed first half but heat got the better of us. We did this walk in December- 6 adults 5 kids. It was 9am on a hot muggy day- first 3 kms of the walk was lovely- although mostly uphill. Lots of scenery and a gorgeous cafe called Kafe Karsa where we stopped for a drink. With 6kms to go from here the kids quickly lost motivation and there was a lot of steep climbs and walking on roads. The walk isnt very well signposted so a few times we had to play charades with the locals to make sure we were on right track. If I was to do this again it would be very early in the morning and without kids.

walk or run. Relaxing place to visit when you stay in Ubud, you can either jog or walk on this place.looking at its location, this place might not a good place to visit during rain season.The storm should be considered because you are on top of the hill and you are the tallest point on that area.... well just for pre cautions

Enjoyable both descending and ascending. The views on both sides are pleasing to the eye, ranging from the vast cliff top homes to the rich forrestation, abundant wild life to view with an enjoyable 30 min descend and 45 ascend.

wonderful walk. We started this walk early in the morning 7:30 and would recommend an early start to miss the heat and sun. There is no shade!It is hilly but accessible and the path easy to follow.This is an enjoyable walk with great views.

Easy, pretty walk. Nice leisurely walk on the outskirts of town. Didn't feel that we were in the countryside, as some reviews had me think we'd be. Views of villas and construction along the way. Just a nice break from the hustle and bustle of the Ubud streets below. Do-able with kids (8 & 5).

Nice Walk with Great Views. We started this walk with a turn through the temple across from Bridges Restaurant. It doesn't look difficult, but as it heats up you really feel the climb. Hand painted signs encourage you that the Karsa Kafe is close and closer...a few shops along the way. Wear good shoes and bring lots of water.

A Good Walk Unspoiled. The trail was not too long but under the direct sun in the heat, the walk could be quite exhausting. Definitely to bring hat, or better yet, umbrellas to shield you from the sun's harmful UV ray. We met quite a few people without anything to cover and they looked quite miserable in the heat. The entrance from the Ibah hotel, cross the bridge past the temple and uphill to the ridge. Beautiful and tranquil scenery on both sides of the ridge, and along the way, quite a few art galleries. Overall a great way to spend a morning.
Great first half/ Average second half. Loved the first half of hike up to cafe's and shops. Second half of walk too us along some main roads, so this was a bit harrowing and unpleasant.

An easy walk. I walk this trail every morning when I'm staying in Ubud at Amala Villa. It's a great way to start the day. You can break the journey by stopping off at Karsa Cafe and Spa for a nice smoothie or coffee. When you get past all the villas and hotels you have a beautiful stretch of greenery to admire. It's a great respite from the hustle of Ubud town. Go in the morning so it's not so hot.

great walk. Such a pleasurable walk-I went with Diksa and it was one of the highlights of my trip. I think one could walk on their own, but having a guide made it much easier and we also went to some out of the way places too.

Beautiful Walk. This is a nice way to get a bit away from busy Ubud, but not entriely, as there was more development then I had anticipated. My walk was to spa and then all the way back down on the road, which is quite long - approx 2 hrs total. Maybe best to go up and then go back down the same way unless you want a long walk. I went at 9am and yes I sweated but survived. There is a cafe and spa towards the top so be sure to book or bring some rupees for a refreshing drink.

campuhan ridge walk has it all. for a jakarta citizen like me, the idea of walking in between green grass, cold breeze air and beautiful view is something too much to wished for and Campuhan ridge walk has it all. just pretty, nothing more... :)

ridge walk tjambuham, Ubud Indonesia. For nature lovers ou tout simplement lovers:Best starting from the north end (at Jl Bangkiang Sidem which you can check on Google map), you will experience an excellent ridge walk at sunset time, relaxing, calm, airy between two narrow and deep valleys. Once you reach Ubud town, complete your journey at Ubud town for the drink of your liking.

Fireflies. It's very dark at night since there's no light. A bit creepy, but if you brave enough you can enjoy the fireflies while walk along the path. There are some villas nearby. Good place to stay if you want to relax

Pleasant walk but there are better. This is a pleasant walk but the views are not as good as I expected mainly because so much of the area is built on now. It is a sealed path so easy walking but there's very little shade so it can be pretty hot. Personally, I prefer the walk through the rice paddies which you can get to by walking up Jalan Kajang and following the path which wanders through the rice paddies - there is quite a lot of building going on here too but it is still nice, lots of ducks!

Nice walk , go early. If you start early you can get your breakfast at the cafe at the end of the ridge walk. It's a great place to sit and relax with a cup of coffee. It's a flat walk, so quite easy on the legs.

Amazing landscape and great exercise. This is my 3rd time in Bali and I've read about this trek many time. It has been on my to do list ever since.I've start my walk from Sri Bungalow at Monkey Forest Road, walk towards Ubud market, turn right at the traffic light and continue to walk straight until you arrived at Warwick Ibah. Here you will see the signage to Campuhan Walk. Follow the direction on the signage, walk downhill and you'll see a bridge and a temple, continue to walk through the small lane. This is where you'll start your trekking through the beautiful green landscape. It is advisable to start you walk early in the morning as there is not much shade once you're on top of the hill or you may also bring umbrella or wear hat. Continue to walk until you see another signage to Karsa Café. Once you see the this signage it is the end of the hill walk and a start of another amazing beautiful green landscape. From here you will walk through some resort, locals shop selling handicrafts and rice terrace.You may stop at Karsa Café for a Spa after the long walk or just have a drink or a bite. If you start your walk early in the morning you may see some locals farmer working in the field and get a chance to experience harvesting it with them.
