To go back to town area, you may walk back towards where you start or you may also get help from the staff at Karsa Café to help you to get a taxi (we got lucky as there's a driver who sent their customer to have a Spa and we've paid him to sent us back to our hotel while waiting for them to finish). It took less than 30 minutes to drive back.I highly recommended this walk. The rice field is not as spectacular as Tegalalang but it is still worth it especially for those who really like to see nature vs the hustle bustle tourist area/ attraction.

Highlight of My Stay in Ubud. This walk was just like the Bali I pictured. Rice paddies so green there aren't adjectives to describe them. There were friendly people, locals and other travelers, wishing me a good morning along the whole way. I stopped to just listen several times. The quiet of the morning with a freshness in the air from the rain the night before, added to the serenity I felt the whole way. I was in a bit of a hurry to get somewhere by a certain time in Ubud, otherwise I would have stopped in more galleries or even a cafe to prolong my journey. I had planned to walk in to town on the Ridge a second time, but rain and my schedule prevented this. But, for sure NEXT TIME. As there will most definitely be a NEXT TIME.
lovely walk. a must do when in Ubud. if you like/love walking/hiking, nature and culture, this is definitely one of the things to experience.
Beautiful walk. We went to a Spa called Karsa Spa and then walked back to town down the Campuhan Ridge Walk. It was a very pleasant walk through the rice fields to town.
Nice walk. It's a very scenic memorable nice walk. I wish they would have stopped the traffic a bit further up and fixed the pavement. Otherwise, it is a very nice walk specially at the sunrise.
Nice Quick Hike. This hike shouldn't take you long, it follows the ridge up along a road through rice paddies. It isn't super tranquil but it is good respite from the town.

Nice walk. The walk started very close to our accomodation at Sri Ratih Cottages. We left early in the morning to beat the heat, and even though it was a cloudy, cool day, we still worked up a sweat as there is a lot of up and down. Other reviews say it isn't very long, but it was long enough for us in this kind of weather, taking about an hour for the round trip. The scenery is lovely - the black and gold temple at the beginning, the bright green rice fields, the water lillies at the end in the cafe pond. There were also a few local children playing and chatting amongst themselves. It seems they also like the tranquility and views.

Relaxing walk away from busy Ubud downtown. I randomly found this on TripAdvisor while looking for an activity to kill time for a couple of hours in Ubud and I am so glad that I found this! The scenery along the walk was so green and peaceful, which really was a nice break away from the hustle and bustle of Ubud downtown.The most important thing about this walk is to start EARLY in the morning. We went a little before 10am and it was already scorching hot and there are no shades! Start at Ibah Hotel, walk around the walls of the temple and you'll see the walkway. It can get a little hilly at times but it's a pretty easy stroll throughout (I can't run a full mile without taking a break, to give you an idea). I saw some people walking in flip-flops but sneakers are recommended. Wear a hat, bring a bottle of water and don't miss this beautiful walk. Not to be missed!

A breathe of fresh air near the centre of Ubud. This ridge is only a short(20 minute) walk from the centre of town and is well worth the effort.Covered in savannah grass it give a a high point with lovely views especially near sunset. Sadly uncontrolled development nearby is beginning to encroach and it would be a great pity if this little oasis of vegetation and its view were lost.

Excellent Morning Walk. Pro :1) Go early in the morning (before 7.00am). Start at Ibah Hotel and end at Kafe Karsa, about 30 mins. Get your driver to meet you at Kafe Karsa or double back to Ibag Hotel. Do not walk north from Kafe Karsa to the main road, it is tiring and traffic danger.2) The ridge view is good. The rice terrace view at Kafe Karsa is spectacular. Bring some money and relax with a fruit juice at the cafe. Take photos of the terrace rice fields and buy some feed for the fish in the ponds.3) Many galleries along the walk. A few opens late in the morning.4) The walk is paved with concrete most of the way. Safety was not an issue. A few morning joggers were present.Con :1) The ridge walk is exposed. Do not walk later in the morning (when it is sunny and humid) or when it is about to rain.Will definitely do the early morning walk again. Most recommended for early morning walks.

Not an easy trail. Went for a walk at Campuhan Ridge as I was told that it's an easy trail, but it's not. Certain sections of the trail are steep, but if you walk at your own pace, you will reach a cafe that offers a relaxing view of the padi fields. Good exercise before breakfast.

Serenity. Went for an early morning walk before it got hot and it was wonderful. There were actually quite a few other people there as well. The scenery was lovely and it was a moderate light hearted walk. There are mosquitos though so don't forget your repellent!

Beautiful views. I never exercise and yet found this walk fine to do without getting too tired. We started early morning, around 6am and parked our scooter just at the entrance to Ibah hotel. There is a short walk through construction and junk before the walk commences and the breathtaking views are visible. We got to the top and wanted to walk to the cafe at the top with a beautiful lilly pond surrounding but realised there were dogs all over the place, where Balinese people all have dogs for security at their homes. Many of these dogs wander around and we are not the biggest fans of unleashed dogs! Eventually we made it to the rice fields and the cafe overlooking, where we had delicious fresh iced juices. This was a great way to start the day and by the time we made it back to the hotel, the heat was becoming unbearable, so an early start is essential while the air is fresh and cool.

Great little walk. Really nice walk to do. Best just to walk from the temple in Ubud until the Cafe and then back the sameway. We did the complete walk and after the cafe it is just walking along the road, so not nearly as nice and the first part. The cafe is amazing and so beautiful and a place you must stop and have a drink and enjoy the view of the rice fields.
Worth the Walk. Enjoyable walk through the rice field terraces with a sprinkling of art galleries , spas, accommodation and restaurants on route.

The Cycle of Rice, The Cycle of Life. My husband & I never miss the opportunity to walk through the rice fields on every visit to Bali. The Campuhan Ridge Walk is the story of rice. The total cycle of growing rice is laid out before your eyes. It is all there: from the preparation of the land, the planting, growing, the harvesting, the drying, & the ducks that control pests & fatten on spilled grain. Art galleries, spas, accommodations, & restaurants have sprung up over the year since our first rice field walk. But, these do not detract from the beauty & the serenity of Ubud's justly famous rice fields.

Nice walk with good overview of the Balinese landscape. Nice walk that allows you to see rice fields terraces, temples and take you along the top of the hills. Hopefully construction and promoters will not target it too fast.
Good morning walk.. Nice walk to do first thing in the morning. Doesnt take long. Good view of rice fields when yiu get to the top.

Away from hustle and bustle. A lovely way to spend an hour or two away from Ubud noise among rice terraces and galleries. Our basic hotel map gave the impression you could do a loop and come out near Ubud Palace. We walked an extra 2-3 kms onto paved roads looking for a road back to Ubud that never came. It doesn't loop unfortunately so our 4km walk turned into 8-9km which we enjoyed anyway. It is a very nice walk and for those looking for greater exercise it would make a nice run.

Great walk close to Ubud central.. Enjoy our 6 km return walk on the Campuhan Ridge, lovely views and the cafe overlooking the rice terrace was wonderful. Would have been better to undertake the walk in the morning but not too difficult as long as you bring lots of water and take breaks.

Walk from top to bottom!. Very nice and scenic walk. For easy walking ask a taxidriver to drop you near Karsa spa/kafe and walk towards Ubud. This way you walk most of the part downhill which makes it much easier and do not forget to drink a smoothie at the Karse kafe....they are excellent ( and so is the deep tissue massage by Gusti).

Love, lovelove, LOVE.. The ridge is right at the edge of the Ubud city center, beneath the entrance of Ibah Hotel. Go down the path to the left of the hotel entrance, then take a right to cross a bridge. After a short walk in messy surroundings (construction area, garbage heap), you will find yourself at the beginning of this magnificent ridge! Just you, a scantily few other tourists, the breeze, the tall grass, and the view on the other side of the valley. There is a paved walking path, but it does go up and down. Walk all the way across the ridge to Karsa Cafe, have a drink and some fruits, and take the same way back, or be adventurous and explore Ubud on the other side of the ridge. One trip across the ridge is approximately 2.5 km.

amazing. just look at the pictures, no words required.You will see every shade of greenBring water and maybe a hat or umbrella, limited shadewe found it easily, so don't be discouraged about other posts or websites saying it is a hard find.We walked up to Karsa and back, not sure if the rest of the track is worth it
A bit lame. I can't believe this is actually an attraction. It's a dirty page along a dirty ridge. I ran it a few times for exercise but don't go out of your way to find it.

A nice get away from the hustle of Ubud. This was a lovely walk which reached into the paddy fields and passed a few hotel and bars where refreshments could be found. It was a hot walk but it was lovely and quiet. I had had enough of the constant hassle from taxi drivers in Ubud who would walk up to me and demand that I took a taxi or drive past hooting a horn at me, At last I found some peace in Ubud with during this walk.

Was that it?. We headed out early to do the ridge walk and managed to find the start quite quickly behind the Warwick Ibah hotel.What we did not realise is that it is actually quite a short walk and we were expecting it to go on for miles.When we got to the rice paddies we did not actually realise the ridge walk had finished.It is enjoyable and I think would be a lot prettier when the grass is green.At the end of the walk there are plenty of places to find drinks.Whilst we enjoyed our walk, we did expect a bit more. There are lots of places in ubud to experience the rice paddies. The ridge walk is worth a visit, head out early to avoid the heat.

Art meets scenery. An easy walk , best done earlier in the day. Passes by a lovely local shrine and then rice fields with good views along the ridge. Now rice fields alone are very passé for an Indian traveler like me, but still the views are still pretty. And the artists along the way in the village are good. They are multi-generation artists and their paintings are good, especially Wayan Rana's. His humility and spiritual outlook plus pace of life is a reflection of what Bali is and what needs to be preserved there. We walked up to the Karsa café and back. The Karsa café is a gem and totally serene with splendid views

Make sure to go all the way.. I left my bungalow at 6:00 am to avoid the heat. Saw vendors arriving at the market but otherwise quiet. Lovely walk uphill most of the way. Good signage so you won't get lost. Local dog joined me for company. Have fresh coconut at top.

Nice walk. Not a difficult walk - however the only thing to consider would be to either do this before noon or dusk - the afternoon heat can make the walk exhausting. Overall the walk passes through some nice cosy villages and you can visit different artists shops/galleries.
Beautiful easy walk. Avoid the hottest hours of the day. We only walked the part from Campuhan to the Café on the top and back approx 6 km. Very recommendable.

Lovely walk in the morning. The path I took started from beside Ibah. The walk was nice, scenery was beautiful & the morning breeze was so refreshing! It's about 2.5km with a bit of up & downslope, nothing too serious though. Some people even jogged all the way & back. At the end of the path there's a cafe where you can relax & enjoy fresh coconut or your morning tea. Just be informed, it's not open until 8am.Since there're no shades whatsoever along the path & I don't need to get more tanned than I already am, so I went quite early at 6.30am. Finished 1 way in around 25 minutes, then walked the same way back. I really enjoy walking around especially in Ubud, so I walked another 2.5km back to the hotel which was near The Dirty Duck.So refreshing & worth the try :)

Peaceful beautiful . Such a beautiful walk with a lovely cafe midpoint. Would highly recommend if your on a budgeted day or just want to chill out. There's so much to see along the way so take a camera!

A must do. Really worth getting up early for! Go about 7am or earlier if you can. An easy walk, uphill initially alongside the temple, then it levels out. Sunny and little shade, so take a good hat. Lovely scenery, few people, a few little galleries along the way and definitely a Bali coffee or cool drink at the Karsa Kafe. There is a spa here too. I was the only one there at 8am surrounded by rice paddies with a gentle breeze blowing.

stunning views. I came to see rice paddies, and I got them on this great little walk right by central Ubud. You get beautiful views all the way up to the café/spa at the top (worth chilling there with an iced tea after the stroll in the sun). One of my favourite spots in Ubud

Amazing views. Adventured to this trek this morning and so glad I did!As previously mentioned, get in early, I was there shortly after 7am and already roasting. Sunset would be beautiful too.Once u reach the Idah hotel I actually found it quite well signed and had no problems, just keep your eye out as the signs are only A4 size. The walk itself is only around 20 - 25 mins, has a little incline and a few steps but so worthwhile. The luscious greenery is just spectacular. Café at the end is just beautiful. Make the effort to get up early, you won't regret it!

Meditative Ridge Walk. Very quiet and meditative. Lots to take in the senses, you end up at Karsa Kafe at the top enjoying the lovely rice fields and lotus flowers. The views are amazing, as well is the heat if you dont go early! A must do in Ubud Bali.

Gorgeous walk. The Campuhan Ridge walk connects the villa where we are staying with the town of Ubud. It is a gorgeous walk meandering past rice fields, by small temples, along a few art studios. It goes mildly up and Dow hill, and is paved in some sections. Because of the heat, you should go early in the day. It can take from 30 minutes to an hour or more. A lovely way to see the landscape and a few areas out of town.
great. relatively quick and easy walk, make sure to bring lots of water! great views both sides of the ridge.
Great Start to the Day. Undertook our trek at 6am before the heat of the day set in. Beautiful scenery. Not too arduous. Highly recommend.

A fab stroll from the madness. If you spend any time in Ubud you really do need to take this walk, within 10 mins you are transformed to another place, peace, silence.It is quite an easy walk, but does get hot so take some water, but there is a fine watering hole near the end.The views are beautiful and really do show you a different side to Ubud, just don't miss this tranquil excursion, it is free..........

Hot afternoon but worth it. We were going to go on this walk early morning as many here have advised but that didn't end up working out, so we went in the afternoon. It was hot up there in the hills! However, it is totally worth it. There's a warung up at the top where you can relax in the rice fields with a drink and something to eat... We actually walked on from there a bit and then went back for sunset - Partly because we didn't really know the way for the rest of the walk, and partly because we suspected that the sunset would look great from there and we were right. The walk is popular, so don't expect to be able to be alone up there but when we were up there you couldn't count it as crowded or anything. If you feel like stretching your legs and getting a bit of exercise, this is a great walk that I would highly recommend.
Nice way to start the day. Nice views on this walk. It's only a short walk and very easy terrain. We did it at 7.30am and it was very warm so be sure to take water.

Early morning splendour. We found it difficult to find, but that's only because it is off the beaten track and we've got the worst sense of direction! Go early and try some fresh coconut for sale on the track!

Beautiful walk. Highly recommended walk with gorgeous views from the ridge, just start very early as its so hot and take water. The walk starts from the Ibah Hotel carpark. You can walk for a good 2km if you are up to it. Its really lovely.

Amazing views. My husband and I took this trail to Karsa Spa (also excellent) and it was a breath of fresh air from the bustling tourist area in Ubud. Make sure to bring a fully loaded camera. There is no shade here, so bring water and a hat. Going early in the morning or right at sunset would be nice as well. We had a selfie stick for our camera that came in handy! It is about a 1 hour walk (with dropping for photos) to the village on the other end, where we had our spa appointment. We took a taxi back to the town after the spa as I wouldn't want to walk it at nightfall.

Nice walk with some nice views. This is well worth the 20 - 25 minute walk. We were lucky enough to hit the Temple at the end of the walk and see a festival in full swing. It is another 5 minutes to the rice fields down a very small ally that is easy to miss. Also of note was how green the whole walk was with the rice due to be harvested in a couple of weeks time. (our teenage son wasn't that impressed, teenagers aye!)
SCENIC WALK. Loved the cafe around halfway where we stopped for breakfast. We did the 6km round trip and as it was quite warm that was enough.
Very good for a bit of peace and quiet. Try and time it for lunch as there is a great place called Cafe Karsta at the top. Don't go further than this as there is nothing....

little exercise in the morning. wake up very early in the morning if you intend to have a little hike in Campuhan Ridge. I recommend you to reach Ibah Hotel no later than 07h00 in the morning. You can park your motor cycle in schoolyard around Ibah Hotel. The trip will take approximately 1 one hour until you reach the cafe where you can take a rest there. The landscape was quite beautiful. It is very recommended for you who look for fresh air and some sweat. Something that you shall do when you reach Ubud for the first time.

A pleasant scenic walk. I've been to Bali several times but never had the chance to do this Ridge Walk. So when the opportunity presented itself this trip, I was very excited to go!It is a very scenic walk, we were blessed with great weather as I was told it can get rather hot and humid. Having said that, the sky was a little cloudy so it was a really pleasant walk. It depends on which side of the ridge you start the walk - most guide books will advise you to start from the majestic Pura Gunung Lebah temple next to the Hotel Warwick Ibah entrance. We actually started the walk from the other end as we were visiting a friend's villa (Villa Amala) that was situated only 5-10 min drive away. From that point, we walked to the temple start point of the ridge walk. It is more of a down hill walk this way! Overall, an enjoyable experience!
Beautiful views. So special up on the ridge - quiet and peaceful with beautiful views. Great to get away from the hustle and bustle in Ubud

Very nice scenic walk. Having looked up directions and photos online for how to get to the start of this hike I had no trouble locating it. The Karsa Spa website has very good directions with photos - check this out if you are planing to take the hike.The start is quite steep but easy enough with a basic level of fitness and there are plenty of spots to stop and get your breath and take some stunning photos. I only saw a handful of other walkers on my way and it was very peaceful.The walk to Karsa Spa and Karsa Kafe took around 30 minutes. It gets hot every quickly, as I had a 10am spa booking at Karsa Spa I started the walk at 9am. Taking the walk earlier is recommended.Karsa Kafe is a good place to stop and have a drink and something to eat - basic menu but very nice location to sit in a hut over the fish pond and cool down. Karsa Spa was also amazing - book in advance if you want to go here!You can complete the loop back around to Ubud but this is around 6km and it is not as nice as the start of the walk. I would recommend either walking back down the way you came which will mostly be downhill so much easier or get transport by car as I did. Karsa Kafe offer transport back to Ubud town centre for 100k.

Got lost. Great walk and amazing scenery, but not exactly sign posted. A few other visitors had the same problem. We did have a map in our guide book which proved useless. Nevertheless great fun and views and we made it back to Ubud, which was a bonus.
"Enjoyable Walk". Experienced an enjoyable walk for 2 hours looking out over rice field vistas. There are a number of stalls to get drinks along the way.

Tricky to find. It was difficult to find the entrance off the main road, and they I walked by a school and temple with no signs telling me which way to go as the road spit into several directions. Once I finally got on the right path it was a scenic walk. However I found that it's just a one way direction because at the end you end up on a public road but stop at the restaurant/massage place to get some fresh juice and free wifi. Be sure to bring water with you.

Great workout, Great view, Great escape!. Just down the road from where I was staying, I packed up my trainers to visit this beautiful escape from the hustle and bustle of Ubud town. The ridge walk is magical as you pass the temple and the locals...then it's complete silence as you venture out in the ridge walk for hours...the view left and right is lush greenery, local homes, palm trees, rice fields....shame about the garbage being tossed around but what to do. The fresh air and excellent uphill workout while soaking in earthy sights made for this long day of pure bliss. Pack your trainers and enjoy this free solo trek for the soul!

Don't follow Lonely Planet guide. Bought lonely planet guide expecting it to be useful.Set off from palace and flowed the route, greatly helped by some posters put up by an enterprising cafe, after about 3km we reached the wonderful cafe had a drink and a snack. All great, cafe had wonderful views and friendly staff, set off for the second part described by lonely planet and walk deteriorated rapidly. Joined roads dodged traffic and eventually (4 sweaty boring km later) reached the point where lonely planet said to turn off to see more wonderful views only to find a sign saying "this is private road guide book got it wrong". Lost interest had an ice cream a delightful Italian restaurant and took a taxi back to hotel.Lonely planet guide now in the bin, why don't the writers actually "walk the walk" suspect they do it in a bar in Kuta.My advice - Go to the cafe (has upstairs viewing tables) relax and go back the way you came and don't waste money on the lonely planet guide, you can get 2 good meals for the price of it when you're here, much better value.

Ok walk but needs instructions. We did this walk recently in Ubud. One of the posts on this website was helpful in finding the start of the path (follow a path on the right by the bridge just before you enter the temple). We walked the 2km as expected from other reviews to the rice padi where we thought the scenic walk would start, however we got immediately list and ended up having to walk a couple of hours back to ubud on main roads (some of which had good shops on it).Basically this walk is ok, it could just do with better instructions being clear it ends at the rice padi or telling people where the path through the padi is.

Good for the not so good hiker. As I am not a big hiker I was told about this walk and my wife decided to get up early for the walk ahead I must admit I was not looking forward to this at all but bundled my pride and off we went. We decided to attack this walk early and left our hotel at about 6am it took us about 15 mins to get to the temple to start the trek. Now as it was nice and cool the the start of the walk did not hurt too much even though it is all up hill for the start once you reach the middle of the trek you realise why u chose to do the walk well worth it. It took us about 45 mins from the temple to the kasar cafe and had banana pancakes to fuel up for the walk home. All up set aside at least 3 hours if you are walking from accom based in the centre of ubud.

Expected more. There is a 2 km hike before you get to see the rice fields and stuff. The walk is pretty nice because you will be on a quiet pathway and all around you are foresty green trees and brown wooden houses. Very nice feel. However, having seen so many rice fields during my trip to Ubud, I kinda expected something more awe-strucking on this popular trail .
Beautiful scenery. The idea came from our LP. Very nice walk, beautiful nature but still close to centre of Ubud. There are few places where you can buy refreshments.
nice scenery. easy walking and enjoying beautiful scenery. Very easy to find this places from center of ubud. Good moment from Ubud

If you have spare time.... If you have a couple of hours to spare in Ubud I would recommend it but if you don’t you wouldn’t be missing much. Beginning: TempleMiddle: TrailEnd: A road with some small artwork shops and a couple of places to eat and drink. There are also some rice paddies and terraces a few minutes walk down the road.Finding the Trail Entrance: Find the Ibah Resort, enter the driveway and continue to the left of the sign, go down a really steep hill (pass the school), take the lower path to the right, follow it past the temple and up to the ridge.Trail: Some of it is dirt, but most of it is stonework and the end of it turns into a road. It’s mostly an uphill walk until the end where it becomes a road but it’s nothing difficult. The trail was shorter than we thought it’d be.When to Go: The earlier the better! I would suggest starting sometime before 9am when it’s a little cooler and there’s less people. It gets hot and humid very fast so bring something to drink or get something at the end of the trail at Karsa Kafe. The Kafe is right next to some beautiful rice terraces and a good place to relax before heading back.Temple: There is a temple at the beginning of the trail but when we went in mid-September the temple was inaccessible due to restoration. We were a little disappointed that we couldn’t walk around the temple but they appear to be doing a lot of work on it and it’s going to look fantastic when they’re done.Notes/Tips: Don’t forget to put on some sunscreen.

Nice quit walk. I started at 08:00 and it was almost already to warm. Get there early. It is quite a climb at some points so if you have issues with steps I wouldn't advise going. I don't think it was spectacular but it was a nice quit/peaceful walk. Which was nice to get away from all the scooters and cars.

Temples, Rice & Views. This is an easy walk from Ubud but be sure to do it early as there is no shade. Hat and sunscreen essential.You pass by the side of the just completed Campuhan Temple, then ascend to views of rice paddies and tropical vegetation. Its possible to see how Ubud is spreadingwith large villas in once agricultural areas. Cool off with an amazing selection of juices from Pomegranate Cafe.
Splendid, scenic and safe walk. Karsa Cafe was worth the hike as it offered a nice spot for lunch and relaxation. A good excursion to bring the kids who are over 4 years.
A must when in Ubud. Leave just before sunrise and enjoy a beautiful breakfast at the café. Easy to find with signs along the way. We loved it!
A must do in Ubud. Great walk with an amazing café and spa at the end. Do it in the mornings or late afternoon as it can get really hot.
Nice Relaxing Walk. The view is nice. Sometime I see people littering, do we need sign everywhere to stop people like this?

Beautiful walk. The walk takes you along the Pura Gunung Lebah temple onto a stone path which leads you into Ubud's countryside with ricefields besides the path. It's a nice change to the buzzing Ubud city life! I do suggest you go there in the early morning (07.00), because there is not a lot of shelter of the burning sun. I only went halfway until Karsa cafe (lovely cafe to have a drink and have a quick rest) and then made my way back again. A nice 1.5 hour walk with beautiful views!

Good walk, except that the weather was a little hot. Overall, I enjoyed my walk, it was easy enough for a 2km walk to the cafe, though i would really encouraged tourists to be there early in the morning. Unfortunately, i stayed at Nusa Dua so by the time i reached Ubud, it was already in the afternoon so the weather was a little too hot for the walk.On my way to the cafe, i dropped by at a small art shop to get away from the sun. The lady was friendly and the drawings were nice.Good walk, but please try to go in the morning :).

Nice escape from busy ubud centre. Easy enough to find if you get to the ibah hotel, there are small signs after this point. Walk was easy enough, worth doing for the view from the cafe at the top where you can see the rice paddies, not much shelter so best doing early morning or towards sunset

Early morning Campuhan walk. Trekked this morning early (6:00 am) as the sun was coming up and the temperature was cool..it's a short trek at best but definitely worth the effort..for all ages I would say..the beginning may be a little daunting for the elderly but it flattens out and is a nice stroll with some great scenery..a little tricky to find at first but just ask around amongst the locals..

Great for something to do on a low budget. This walk was incredible. Took around 2 hours (the short route) and the views were amazing. There is a restaurant at the top which has great views across the paddys.

Love it! Nice view and enjoy. It hard to find the entrance but we make it at last.Start hiking on 11am and reached the top around 11.30am. There is a cafe with a very nice rice terrace view. It a great place to relax after a slight exercise.It will be better if start hiking on 9am and get down before 11am..or u will get a sunburn like me lol.

Good for a morning outdoor activity but nothing spectacular. The place was easy to walk, calm and relaxing like any other hills. Manage expectations as this is just a hill. Works fine for me as I need a place to exercise.

Hiking in flipflops!. If you wanna do this walk there is also a temple at the start. If you wanna go in make sure to have proper clothing. The walk is beautiful and it takes you away from the Bali traffic and rush! Its calm and relaxing. There is also a restaurant on top with a pool! We loved getting away!

Worth doing. The walk was really nice. The first half was just beautiful scenery although the second half of the walk was more urban. It might be best to go half way and then turn back although there is always the chance that there is a better way to go that I didn't know about. As the title says it's definitely worth doing on your trip to Ubud.

Great Walk, Views & Workout!. We loved this walk & did it every morning early before it got to warm. Great for a workout and that is why we did it, also we loved the views. We also went through the little village at the opposite end to the Temple, it was lovely too see the local people & talk to some of them each day
Get it done before the villas take over !. When in Ubud this walk is a free pleasure , sadly the ridge walk is becoming a villa walk as development races across the formerly pristine rice terraces .

Average walk. The view is ok but not that impressive.... We decided to do this walk after reading all the positive reviews on this site. The walk is not difficult but the heat can be a problem. After reaching the cafe, we saw that most people came back the same way, we decided to continue but found that the path wasn't that interesting ( going on a main road) so we decided to go back as well. The view on the rice fields is ok, but honestly I don't get all those positive reviews. After visiting the rice fields in jawatiluh, maybe you can be disappointed by that one. It is ok if you have lots of time in ubud, but it is not a must- see.

Amazing, must do i Ubud!. Is a truly lovely walk, great views and peaceful. Is not as challenging as others have made out and we were comfortable doing the walk at around 1pm which was when the temperature was at its hottest. A hut at the Kacek cafe is a must and they have the sweetest orange juice ever. Also the banana pancake is delicious and the perfect kick me up to take the walk back.

Nice and easy walk. I accidentally passed by the signage showing the way to the ridge and did the walk impromptu at noon time. I had my umbrella with me but I still got some sun tan on the face. Easy to walk, the view is very green and the nicest part is to enjoy the breeze with a nice view at the cafe karsa kafe.

Beautiful morning walk!. Loved the breathtaking views at 6:30am as I walked up the stone path, and had the place mostly to myself. Definitely need to check this out if you're in Ubud- it was also nice to get away from the hustle and bustle of the commercialized main streets.

Great walk in the centre of town. You would never know that this walk is there. Great for a quick run or a stroll through the art galleries ending up at a cafe which has the most gorgeous scenery. It's a must if you want to get away from the hussle and bustle or want a good holiday training session.
Spectacular Scenery!. Stunning rice fields at the top with a Cafe to enjoy the view. If you don't want to walk down they can arrange a car to take you back to Ubud.

Nice but nothing extraordinary. I was expected a lot given it is rated as #1 activity on trip advisor.Walk is very well signed, up the hill but did it with flip flopsThe best view is at the top. But I would just say it is nice, not extraordinary. I see it as a nice morning walk, nothing I would die for.
Great one!. I love the easy walk surround by the green view of the hill. You can hear the sound of the birds, the wind and some musical instrument they were playing somewhere :)

Stunning walk, not to be missed !!. I learnt of this walk here on TA and so incredibly glad that I did, it really is stunning. Not all that easy to find, but do persevere. I went early in the morning so it was a little cooler and the light for photos was beautiful. It's good to stretch your legs and take in the stunning scenery. And then stop for a well earnt treat at the Kafe Karsa before returning back down! Perfect :o)
stunning view. it was abit tired to get there since it is a hill, but it was worth to go up and see especially in the morning and evening.

Beautiful, but stay away from the middle of the day. Easy enough to find, walk west down the main road in ubud until you get to Ibah Villas (just passed the steepish downhill part of the road where it turns a corner). The path is well signed, you walk into ibah villas a bit and it's clear where to go. Despite all the warnings from other trip advisor peeps we went near the middle of the day and we almost melted into the ground.On the flip side, the walk was beautiful and not too intense (a few hilly bits but nothing crazy). It took us about 30 minutes from the bottom near the temple to the karsa kafe (which we didn't think was as good as everyone says but the rice paddy views were amazing).

Nature's Beauty @ it's Peace. Definitely a walk (Morning) that let's you appreciate many shooting angle's of nature. Enchanting view, peaceful & refreshing. Do schedule a 3 hours time slot for this stroll. For us, includes returning after a 45mins break @ the Karsa Kafe where the Rice fields smoothing our view while we enjoyed our refreshments.
early as. beautiful but would just do the ridge and then head back as after that it just goes into streets and back to town which is ok but certainly leaves the more rural scene behind
Good views!. The views on this walk were fantastic but do go early in the morning as it gets really hot and you'll soon regret your decision!

Fabulous Views. This is a great walk. You don't need a guide simply get yourself down to the bridge by the temple and follow the signs. We walked the length of the ridge then kept going along the road and found our way back to our hotel The Uma it was a thoroughly enjoyable stroll with changing views.
The best walk in Ubud. Its such a beautiful walk which is best done early morning or later in the afternoon because it is a little hot during the day.

Great walk, no way to get lost ;). This is a walk with a view. Its very clear where to go. Just start at the hotel and follow the route that starts just right before the big temple. You can walk for about 30 to 40 minutes and reach some restaurants, bars and little art shops. There is no off route. You can walk further towards some rice fields and turn back. Or... Answer the local that yells taxi and he will drive you back to Ubud via a different route. Highly recommended walk if you have a couple of hours to spare. If you just want to see rice fields its better to go north in Ubud and at the center road head west (or a bit more north and then west). You'll find a nice collection of fields there where local farmers and very small bars will great you.

Go early.. This is a wonderful walk but gets hot so I advise start off early after a good breakfast. You will meet a few other walkers whatever time of day you go. My only concern is sometimes stray dogs wandering.
Awesome. Beautiful.. Go early before it gets hot. Dont miss this. Villa saraswatti dropped us off at the top so we just did a one way walk into town.

Beautiful & Free!. One of the few things in Ubud that is 100% FREE!!!! Agree with the previous posts about a little challenging to find... but eventually found it. The beginning is just down the hill from Ibah (?) Hotel.. continue to ask the locals about the Campuhan Ridge Trek and they should point you in the direction. Might be better off asking where the hotel is though, since it is more well known.Walk in the morning! Definitely broke a sweat, but anyone should be able to do this. Not too challenging. Karsa Kafe at the top is a must. Beautiful views and great spot to cool down. Also, some amazing artwork in the last shack before Karsa Kafe on the left. The man is cute and SO nice.. we didn't bring enough money to buy one of his wooden painted eggs, but really wish we did. Would have made for a great souvenir!

Must-take. It was a great walk! We were really pleased that we decided to take it. Actually, we took the 3h trip from Lonely Planet guide and Campuhan Ridge Walk was the first part of it - ADVICE: stop at Karsa Kafe and go back - going further is just a waste of time and energy.

Amazing Walk!!. Fun, easy walk for everyone with some great views - MAKE SURE YOU TAKE HEAPS OF $$$ WITH YOU and do the walk early or late - wayyyyyy hot in the middle of the day. Ended up walking it the next (and my last) day - had to go back and spend $3MIL on the best painting I have ever seen from Monik, that and suss out Matik's marbling canvas, or sit down and watch an old man paint wooden eggs. Best rice paddie walk (or equivalient with the walk to Sari Organik). Stop at Karsa Kafe at the end for the most superb drink ever - Lime and Honey juice - and I cannot recommend the foot massage enough - the full hour - then get transport back to Ubud. LOVED THIS WALK.

Craziest place for running. Owh Jez, really I can't describe how lucky I am to stand here. Amazing place and just couple step from Ubud Market, the central of Ubud. Easy to found just looking for IBAH villas, take a direction to Hills and you'll be find it. The hill was an wild green savanna with walking track, it made from square stone. Length about 2-3 KM and beautiful view off course. I believe that writer in TA agree with me. Will be come back this place soon, impossible.

Sometimes difficult to stay on track . The first two Ks are beautiful lush tree line views followed by some pretty rice terraces. There is an oppurtunity here, to turn back down the same path or continue 6 km through the Indonesian suburbs. Personally I love long walks, and my girlfriend and I didn't mind seeing what we could see and took the long way. There were some very beautiful, unique restaurants and art galleries along the way if your into that kind of thing. But if your main concern is of scenic value I would turn back once you hit the t-intersection after the rice terrace.

Exploring Nature and arts and crafts. We were dropped at the top at about 4pm and enjoyed the cooler evening walk which had a lot of shade at that time of day. There were still some arts and craft outlets open. Also many locals had finished work and school and were enjoying watching the sun starting to set on the trip down the hill. We stopped at the bottom and had a fabulous meal at Murnie's great service and food.
Worth a visit! . The hill isn't too bad, many of the locals even ran up and down the hill! The view was really amazing and the cafe up on the hill served a really good watermelon-pineapple smoothie!
Was a bit hard to find but worth the detective work. Loved the views! Stopped at Karsa Café on advice of other hikers (sp?) for a break and cold drink. Great rice paddy views.
Must see lush green views. Start early in the morning to beat most of the heat and you will be rewarded by excellent lush green views, rice paddies and the tranquil pace of the country side.

Well worth an early start. To avoid the heat of the sun, I recommend doing this walk early morning. Another positive of getting an early start is taking breakfast at the cafe at the end of the walk. The walk was easier than I imagined as the track is paved, although it is a bit of a climb, hence good idea to start early. Beautiful scenery on route and once you reach the top the walk to the cafe is amongst the paddy fields. Great photo opportunities along the way.
Lovely walk. An amazing walk through the rice fields, a dive in the nature around Ubud and amazing paths in the middle of the forest...
Breathtaking!. This walk is a must do. We went late morning, it was humid and hot. If we went again it would be earlier. Magnificent scenery. Take your camera to make your friends at home envious!!

Visit the end of the walk. The ridge walk itself was amazing. Very much recommended. We stayed at the Lokha which is close to the end of the walk, and originally thought that the walk ended in the area close by the hotels. However, if you pass the hotels, you will get to stunning rice fields and a great restaurant and massage parlour.

Fun experience. this is an easy, beautiful hike to do in Ubud and you can end at a nice little cafe/spa to relax a little bit. For the best experience, it is probably best to avoid the middle of the day because there is little to no shade on this hike.

Lovely easy walk. We started this walk from the entry just over the Campuhan Bridge. It was a picturesque walking track passing rice fields and ridges. We stopped to look at the galleries along the way and purchased items. At the end we continued walking around the road with the intention of walking walk to Ubud. After what seemed like an eternity we were able to hale down a taxi and were driven back to our Hotel. I would recommend turning around and the end and walking back along the same track. It is a beautiful walk, we will do it again on our return. Highly recommended :)

Top attraction close to Ubud. I walk along Campuhan Ridge every time I come to Ubud and never get tired of the views! The first time was in 2002 and we didn't meet a single tourist. Nowadays it's quite popular but stillunspoilt.

Great hike through the rice paddies. Start at the bridge in Ubud township and head to Ibah Hotel, prior to entrance of hotel go down steep road to left at the bottom turn right and begin climb up ridge. Popular café near Klub Kokos. Turn around at Bangkiang Sidem before the unsigned road turns left (west) as the rest of the walk is steep and uninteresting

Beautiful walk in central Ubud. Campuhan ridge walk is right near the center of Ubud, this is what we were hoping Ubud would be as we didn't much enjoy the rest of Ubud.We woke up early and did the walk, the total walk was around couple of hours and we saw many flora and birds. There were a few cute artsy shops near the walk.. And don't miss Karsa Cafe & Spa, it's a great place to chill and relax.If you are in Ubud, this is definitely worth a visit.

Worth a visit if you can make it. I decided to do the walk on my last day in Ubud. I was staying farther away from the starting point but it was easy enough to arrange a taxi from my hotel. The walking path is well marked just go left at the gate to the Ibah Hotel then keep right past the temple. It is fairly well sign posted. The walk itself isn't very difficult and starts with an uphill portion before evening out. I stated walking at about 615am and it took about 30 minutes to get to the Karsa Kafe before I turned around. This ended up being a good decision as I was the only one on the trail. Other tourists looked like they had started around 7am and I counted about 10 people as I headed back. I can't comment on the cafe itself as it was closed when I got there. I also had to call my hotel to send a taxi as I wasn't able to find one on the way back. All in all a good little walk that I would recommend as a good way to start your day!
A great walk. So close, to ubud, but its like you were remote & far away Beautiful views, scenery a great walk Short walk, 30 mins each way

Spectacular Morning walk. What a beautiful and enjoyable way to start the day ( best early so as not in the heat of the day ) It is about a 30 - 40 min walk and you can walk through to Karsa Spa and cafe and have breakfast amongst the rice fields well worth doing before it gets over developed

Very beautiful until the turning!. I did this walk a few weeks ago, early in the morning so the weather was fine and there were hardly any people on the trail, which made a huge difference. The road part from the Palace to the Hotel turn off was ok as i browsed through the shop windows and traffic was minimal. From there i thoroughly enjoyed going down to the river then up an incline to be met by stunning views and fields of tall grass either side of the track. Some of the galleries and craft workshops were already open, including a sweet lady hand painting eggs, which was fun to watch. I stopped off at the beautiful cafe on the left for a drink and the views from here are equally as beautiful. However, after a kilometre further than this point, i turned left and the road became more like a race track than an amble through the Ubud countryside. I always walk against the flow of traffic but even so I had some very near misses, mostly from kids on scooters and tourist cars. As my walk progressed i started to enjoy it less and by the time i reached the main road the traffic was horrendous. A great walk and some lovely old temples but the experience was hampered somewhat by the traffic.
Worth doing. Any easy low cost way to get out of ubud and have a look around. Go early morning when not too hot. Why say more???

A walk worth taking. If you haven't taken this walk yet, leave yourself time to do so on your trip. We read all the reviews and noted that early morning is the best time to do this walk, so we left our home stay in Penestanen at 6:10am, and walked down to the entrance of the Ibah Hotel. We walked to the top of the hill, with early morning light and cool fresh breezes. The early time is also peaceful with very few people out and about. I think this walk in the middle of the day would be too hot, as there are no trees for shade. We stopped at a couple artists' shops and decided at the top not to make the big loop, but to come back the same way we came. Lots of work taking place at the Tjampuhan Temple at the beginning of the route. Take water, camera and all your senses. A beautiful journey.

So peaceful.... Go in the early afternoon before it's too hot. The café at the top (Karsa Café) is a great pitstop for a drink and/or a snack. I'm sure it's pricey by Indonesian standards, but cheap by western ones. Only slightly more than in-town prices and it was the best Mango Lassi I had in Bali. (25,000 Rp - about $2.25 USD)View was lovely, too, and free WiFi and a restroom you can use. They also have a spa that seemed nice.It's about a mile and a half (3km) roundtrip. I took the long way back into town (not for the faint of heart) and it was around 9 miles (14 km or so)
A breaktaking place ever.... you can see a breaktaking view every sights..amazing..

Great start to the day. This is a brief walk (about 20-30 minutes to the turning point), but a beautiful way to stretch the legs and take in some amazing views of the ridges and hills in the area. I recommend having a coffee at the cafe at the end. Did it twice!

excellent scenery. Lovely scenery on a short walk from ubud with a great spa and cafe at the top. Worth a stroll but not at all hard so don't be put off. We saw lots of local couples on our way so think it may be an area for courting!We went at about 9 am and had spa treatments and strolled back around 2.

Great views. A lovely walk - with fabulous views. In fact, the views were better than the rice fields we saw the day before we did this walk! Only advice is not to do it in the middle of the day when the day is at its hottest (which we did because we were sidetracked along the way to the start). Despite the heat, was definitely worth it
Always a great walk. Nice exercise & nice scenery! Connects to other areas so you can either make a big loop for a long walk or a short turn-around walk.
lovely quiet and a most do in Ubud. This seem to be the only place in Ubud were its possible to walk where there is no traffic, motorbikes are almost everywhere so this is a wonderful relieve.
Great views, nice way to get out of the city. Great views, nice way to get out of the city. Stop and have a drink/bite at the cafe. There are rice fields toward the end of the trail.

The best way to see the quiet side of Ubud and it's free!. Did the ridge walk today, 9th September. Unexpectedly good footpath which I managed in flip flops. The ridge walk gives you the chance to get away from the commercial side of Ubud and see some of the beautiful greenery of the rice fields. There are several art shops at the top; we bought from the first shop where the owner was very pleasant and not at all pushy. We walked a bit beyond the last cafe, but preferred to turn back and retrace our steps rather than join the main road. It was hot, so take water and sun screen. Beware everything in Ubud is 2km; I'd say this is a bit more than 2, more like 3.

A peaceful stroll through beautiful landscape. If you like walking and appreciate beautiful countryside, Campuhan Ridge walk is for you. Leaving behind the busy centre of Ubud, it's a relaxing, peaceful walk through wonderful lush, tropical countryside. You'll see butterflies and many birds along the way. Also see some locals going about their daily jobs. The gentle breeze is very refreshing and the air is filled with many different aromas. I'd recommend taking a hat and bottle of water. Enjoy

Nice walk with good views. Nice walk which is better done in the early morning. Quite long if you do the full circuit but would be good to go to the village and return the same way to stay off the busy roads.

An Ubud Must See. Just as all the reviews said, this place was a great stop. I started walking here around 11am fortunately it wasn't too hot but trust me you will sweat. Bring a big bottle of water and your sunblock. In my walk today it was very peaceful and not too many tourist. I was asked by a few of the teenagers to take a picture with them, I kindly obliged because I'm sure several tourist have asked them to take one. All in all a great way to spend a couple of hours. I also stopped at the cafe for a quick drink it was yummy but service was slow.

Nice walk in the countryside. If you are getting tired of all the traffic of central Ubud, this makes a nice walk on the ridge between two river valleys which then transitions into an area of scenic rice fields (to the west of the more extensive area of rice fields just north of Jl. Raya in central Ubud). On this walk in the countryside, we saw people tending to their daily business working in the fields, cleaning up their yards, smiling and waving hello. On our visit, there were two large dumptrucks of youngsters (yes, that’s how they were transported) on a work crew.If you are walking with children, I strongly recommend that you end your walk and return back at around the Karsa Kafe/Art Gallery/Spa overlooking the beautiful rice terraces about a mile along the walk, as there is not much “nature” walk after that and you will begin competing with vehicles on a side road with many turns, dips and switchbacks and a continual stream of vehicles until you get to the main street heading into Ubud and then sidewalks again (with marginally safer walking, but again, not much nature). The Kafe makes for a great break, though. We sipped cool drinks in a shaded bungalow overlooking the rice fields, and you could even have a spa treatment there if you desire. The drinks were enough for us. Very beautiful, relaxing location.Just the same, it is a nice walk if you are looking to escape the urban core, but while the guidebooks tend to make everything seem essential, don't fret if you don't get the chance to do it.
You get rice paddies. On a ridge. It IS the tourist trail! Try nipping up the ridge immediately east of it for a bit more "rural" and a bit less path well worn.
Nice walk. Nice for walk a short walk in the morning and late afternoon. From Ubud to Karsa Spa is arround 30minutes.

Guidebooks are wrong - try this. By doing 2 prongs of the poorly mapped walk you get the best and avoid the worst. We did the whole walk from both sides and here's there real scoop. Only the Campuhan River side of the walk starting at the Ibah luxury villas near the under reconstruction Pura Gunung Lebah temple is well marked. This path is mostly easy walking on pavers through some picturesque elevations. Go through a small town, don't miss the egg painter who willingly posed for pictures. Farmers were doing the pre-planting plowing of a rice field right by the road with fascinating rotary paddles on tractor-type equipment - in bare feet no less. Note the walk has become a road at this point. Strongly recommend to stop at the Karsa Kafe. Sweet little place with thatched huts over fish pond for dining and snacks. You'll need refreshment at this point and it's quiet, delicious and with a lovely view, much nicer than the guide books list. It's open only tip sunset. Again I recommend -stop the walk at this point, because just past it, the walk turns left and joins a well-trafficked road that goes up and down, up and down, sharply and at quite some distance. No longer such fun; when hot and really tired you join the so-called top of the loop in really busy traffic villages. From this point on it's heavy traffic and joins the main road back into Ubud. If you go left at the T in the road you miss all the rice fields on this side. Better to have reversed direction at the Karsa Kafe. And then if you want the very best rice fields experience try the other side of the mapped walk. Go uphill just past the delightful Hotel Tjampuhan (hope you're staying there), and ascend the approx. 100 steps on the other side of the road. There's a car/scooter/guide rental in the narrow opening, but the steps are clearly visible and there is no other similar. Cross carefully in heavy traffic. Once at the top of the steps you begin to descend the next ravine (surprise, surprise), passing by accommodations, scooter traffic and small shops. Do not on any account miss the gallery of I Wayan Karja, a contemporary abstract painter with international reputation. We bought a painting. The sealed narrow road proceeds down to the river and up again to Penestanan village. Turn right at the T (regular traffic road), but shortly it will turn left and then right and you'll be in the midst of real rice fields, not just a view. Almost no one was on these narrow (1 foot wide in some places) paths, and it was a treat. Just keep going on the paths by the side of the field ditches; you can't go any other way. The weather was partly cloudy, or else it could have been a hot, killer walk at midday. That means go early unless it's overcast. There were ducks doing their eating job of bugs and leftover rice after harvest as well as new construction of what looked like some interesting houses. Eventually you come out on a paved road near the Ubud Padi resort and you're done with rice fields. Up one more steep hill and you come out on that main road (there's a small Ubud Padi sign if you need to reverse course) where a right turn will take you back in high traffic to the main Ubud street. The street does take a right turn and then starts descending. Sidewalks are narrow, irregularly lumpy, with holes, trash and construction materials. If you're tired now, try to find a taxi, because it's a significant walk past the Neka Museum and Bintang supermarket downhill and back up into the main tourist area.
Must.. When in Ubud it isd necessary to spend half a day to calm down on the fantastic rice paddies. Nice path, easy to go without a guide.

Great walk. My family and I chose to do the whole walk along the ridge i.e. circular walk as described in the Rough Guide to Bali and Lombok book. Easy to follow directions and the first 3km were quite beautiful although steep in places - through alang alang grass with fantastic views on both sides, through a small settlement, to the rice fields which were at different stages of planting and growth. Karsa Cafe well worth a stop as fantastic views, reasonable prices and the cleanest general toilet visited for a while! TURN AROUND when you get to the main road not far past the cafe unless you then want to walk another 6 km (seemed much longer) through the villages of Payogan and Lungsiakan back into Ubud from the north along roads many without pavements, quite steep in places and busy with bikes and cars. - an experience my husband and son weren't too happy about - adventurous but not overly scenic and it then leads you back into Ubud over the Campuhan Bridge. Met others on route complaining about the extended circular walk - think carefully!Would have given it a 5 for the first 3km and a 3 for the remainder so 4 overall.
Nice walk...Must do. Go early before it gets too hot. Places to drink/eat along the way. The walk is NOT a loop anymore I was told, and I never found the loop, despite looking...a lot!

Surprisingly,Beautiful. People come to Ubud to find serene view and Campuhan Ridge Walk offers that at its bestFind Warwick Ibah Hotel and follow the sign that will take you to few kms on a beautiful trackdo come early in the morning or wait for the sunset to avoid the heatbring hat and wear suncream for better and more convinient walkfor a lovely view, the afternoon walk offers many local people walk their cute dogs and its quite a bit of distraction after walk for around 3k, you will find Karsa Cafe, a beautiful cafe that serves a very affordable yet tasty foodwe ordered 2 drinks and 1 food and it costs us less than 10 USDBring your running shoes if you want to do jogging as wellbut mostly, youll end up with many quick stops with your camera and or just sit down for a moment and enjoy that serene view

Walks in Ubud. Ubud is my favorite place on Bali, and if I go again I would choose to stay in Ubud rather than the coast and explore the rest of the island from there.Atmosphere is much more relaxing than on the coast and everything is at walking distance.There are some wonderful walks to take to see the rice fields and surrounding area, with Campuhan ridge being just one of them. Apart for the ridge, on the main street (Jl Raya Ubud) you will see on the right side a small sign „to the rice fields“ indicating that you should enter a narrow space between a restaurant and another building to follow some narrow path passing peoples laundry – GO for it, it really leads to wonderful rice fields.Main market is also worth a visit since the prices are lower than on the coast.In the evening we went for a puppet show which is held in one hotel at the entrance to Ubud. It is touristy but personally worth a visit (show is in Baliese but you get a description in English before the show to know what the story is about).There is plenty of home-stays to rent and we found it to be a great and cheep way to stay in Ubud.
Beautiful walk. It's very picturesque walk with beautiful landscapes. It's approximate 3 km one way so make sure you wear comfortable shoes. You will also see a lot of art on the way.

Breathtaking views. I liked being away from the bustle of the main street of Ubud. I enjoyed the sights of the surrounding villages and fields and the fact I could buy a beautiful mixed fresh juice for $2.50 or $3 (very cheap anyway) at the top after a hot walk. Take a hat, wear suncream!

Make sure you walk all the way to the end. We set off on this walk thinking we would just walk back when we got tired but the distance goes much quicker than you think as the stunning views distract you I think.Firstly, its pronounce Champoohan if you need to ask for directions, and begins just next to the Gunung Lebah temple. The walk is not at all taxing but we would recommend going in the morning for a cooler, more comfortable temperature. The views are beautiful and the path is paved and safe, i wouldn't suggest walking into the grass though, not sure what could be in there!After 2K you reach a small village and the Karsa Cafe, which is cheap and i a perfect setting over-looking the rice fields

Not a circuit. We walked the Campuhan ridge in August. I thought it was a circuit, but it is a 1.2 km single direction walk. After walking for over an hour we reached the end. There was no taxi to ride back into the middle of town, but we met a very nice family that started their walk at the other end of the ridge who was smart enough to turn around mid way that gave us a ride back. The scenery back to town was great. Many small artist galleries and rice fields. Very quiet, very indonesian.

Ok. Once you get past the building works at the start of the trial This is a nice little walk. Over a ridge with stunning views on each side, through a village and into some paid fields. There is a nice cafe in the paid fields but I suggest you turn round and walk back at this point.
Views to die for.. Great views of hills, valleys and rice paddies with a great place for a drink at the end. Not too strenuous a walk,

A walk with the greenery. A must visit place in Ubud. You wont feel tired when you walk through this.
It is 15mins drive from Monkey forest just behind IBah hotel.
It is best to walk early in the morning or in the evening to avoid sun and the crowd.

Good short walk. This is a short walk around Ubud city.
The view are excellent and it is a good way to enjoy the balinese countryside.
We stopped at the kafé vut you can continue for 5 more kilometers.
Lovely. It is a lovely walk, but lots of people do it on scooters. There is a gorgeous small villa on the way - we might stay there next time!

Go early to avoid the crowds!. This is a fantastic walk, best completed either early in the morning, or later in the afternoon to avoid the heat. We went in the morning, and it's a lovely way to start the day. We beat the crowds, and had the path almost completely to ourselves. The path meanders over the ridgeline, passing artist colonies on the way to Kafe Karsi, which is well worth a stop for a freshly squeezed juice - try the lime juice - you won't be sorry. If you have the time, this is one thing in Ubud to add to the 'to do' list.
Nice walk. Not as many rice fields as you are led to believe, and a lot of walking on the side of roads being beeped at by motorcycles
Always different. Great morning walk to clear the cobwebs. Every morning is different. Go and explore and you will enjoy it.

Great country side walk. Lovely walk though Bali country side and rice paddies, right out of centre of Ubud. Bit hard to find were it starts. Ask for directions. Avoid Sari Organic if you like your food flavoursome. There are many other places to eat with same lovely view.

A short stroll. If you are strapped for time, this is definitely not a must. We expected a walk in nature, but it ended 20 minutes into the walk and turned into a busy village road right after the cafe. The cafe is quant with a nice rice field view. It's good way to get out if the bustling city for a couple hours max, but don't expect too much.

personally one the best experiences in bali. great for a short hike. tips: go early morning for cool weather, there are many rice terrace near the entrance and combine with other ubud attractions like tirta empul, sarawasti temple an monkey forestour guide brought us here, and i was completely awestruck at the views and scenery. the ridges provide a unique only available in volcanic islands like bali. as one friend said "its like out of a painting". Along the path u can see Balinese forest, terraced paddy fields, temples perched on the hills,resorts arranged beautifully behind hills and trees. there is even a beautiful heavily detailed and gold leafed temple called pura campuan thats well worth a visit one of the reasons i love this because i manage to one of my favourite holiday activities which is hiking at a leisurely pace and easy enough to brings kids. i even meet some high school students here
Magic. Awesome views and vistas across river valleys. A must do if you want to experience the beauty of Bali.

Amazing walk along the Ubud-ridges. The Campuhan Ridge Walk is a perfect opportunity to escape the busy Ubud-roads and experience the beautiful nature Ubud has to offer. It has a concrete pathway, which is very rare in Bali.The walk takes about 4 hours starting from Ubud Palace and offers beautiful sights. It is almost impossible to get lost, since there is only one way to go. It seems that it hasn't been discovered yet by the mass tourists, which makes the connection with nature even greater. In the middle of the walk, there is a nice little village with some cafés offering beautiful sights on the rice fields.If you have a half day in Ubud and you wish to see some of the surrounding views and natural sights, don't hesitate and do the Campuhan Ridge Walk!

Great walk. Tried out the walk in early Aug 2014. Walked on Sat evening. Curious after reading so many good reviews on TA, we tried this walk one day. Finding it may be a problem for some but those who rent a scooter and move around Bali will probably have seen the temple under construction that marks the start of the trail. Especially people who go to Naughty Nuri's ribs. There are signs marking the start of the trail but nothing much after a few km. As it was getting dark, we turned around at the café at the Padi fields, so not too sure how much further the trail goes on for. Perhaps someone should make a sign indicating the map of the trail.Yes, it shows a completely different side of the touristy, noisy, crowded central Ubud. That's why we strongly suggest all visitors to Ubud to walk this trail to see the beauty of the countryside.We discovered that on a Sat afternoon / evening, Ubud teenagers use the area as a park to get out and enjoy nature. Its nice and windy there. So do try out this walk, its not tough. You don't need walking shoes, special gear or anything like that. The local kids run up and down in flip flops.

It is worth it. This is a nice way to get a feeling for Ubud and its surrounding landscape. You will not be the only one on this path. There is a nice location at the top to have a fantastic fruit juice or something to eat at a spiritual pond at the top of the path. You can even have a massage there. On the way back we did not find the shortcut to cross the river. So we as others continued on the road and had a much longer way to go. The road was not nice to walk. But because of this we came to a cockfight, an incredible experience.

Long walk, but cafe at the end makes it worth it. Pros:- cafe at the end is lovely - overlooking rice terraces, reasonably priced food, quiet and serene- easy to access the start of the walk from the main roadCons:- not the most scenic of walks in some places Would I do it again:- yes - but would start earlier in the day and spend longer relaxing in the cafe

Campuhan Ridge Walk. Fairly tough walk in the heat but worth it for the views. Kaffe Kasse at the end in set over a lily pond offering fabulous views of the rice paddies and makes the walk especially worthwhile.

Awesome scenery. Absolutely loved this walk! Beautiful scenery all the way once past the building site and rubbish around the temple at the beginning (but it is gorgeous). Bought some stunning painted wooden eggs at the village at the end done by a true craftsman - and reasonably priced. Also lunched at the end at Karsa Cafe which had little huts over a pond. Great traditional food! It also has a spa attached if you get in early!
Do it. Good early morning walk before breakfast amid the rice paddies and farmers going to work. Locals an d expats walk there. Recommended.

A beautiful walk. We thoroughly enjoyed this walk around the Campuhan Ridge. The scenery is beautiful, and it's pretty easy terrain. We walked as far as Karsa Cafe, where we stopped for a much needed drink. It took about an hour to walk there (including stops to take photos), and about 30-40 minutes on the way back. Take plenty of water...it's very hot!

Up Up Up and pleasant enough. We did this walk mainly for exercise. We were not disappointed. It is a good work out. There is no loop track any more - so you could simply turn around and walk back down. We choose to keep on walking up. We meet some artists selling direct - they did the painting so prices were very reasonable. ( We came back the next day and bought several pieces). While walking through beautiful rice paddies, the road goes to the left towards Sayan and then down the Tjampuhan hill. This took us through a gorge = down down down, then up up up a very steep hill and on through a pleasant village down to main road. We happened to come across a warung selling Babi Guling - spit roast pig - 20rps for a takeaway packages - delicious. We also passed Arak coffee where we stopped for a most delicious flat white coffee - also 20rps.In total this is quite a hike but also quite doable- we just took our time and enjoyed the walk and scenery.

Australia do walk. This wAlk through campuan valley is fantastic, it's far away from the madness of Ubud it's an easy walk,we started at 11:00 am,to late too hot,try for 08:00 or 09:00. It's beautiful and quiet , not many people about , it also helps you feel Bali in all it's glory, don't miss the opportunity if in Ubud, you don't need to do the full walk , just go to the end of the rice terraces and back, a camera is a must, you will love it,we did!!!!
Great walk!. Lots to see on this lovely short walk through the rice fields and countryside. We started from the town end (near main temple) so that we could end the walk at Sari Organik for lunch.

Excellent Walking Path. I did walking every morning during our holiday in Ubud last month as our accommodation located near by. It was gorgeous to walk while the sun rise up, the birds started to sing and the air was so fresh. Miss that moment a lot!!

Very nice but not for young children. The walk is amazing with fantastic natural views. However, it is more suitable for adults and teenagers. It is not suitable for young children and infants because it has steep gradients and high steps which are very difficult for kids. Also, there is also the hazard of falling down to the valley for kids since the walk is not so wide and no railing on the side.
Great walk. Well worth the walk. Beautiful surroundings.Bought paintings from local family painters.We walked to end then turned around & came back.

Hot but Cool!. I did this walk early in the morning, but its was pretty hot!I thought I could walk the whole trip in 2 hours but I ended up stopping up at the cafe and eating some fruit!!I went up and came back the same route!Didn't know if you could go in a loop or not!Well worth the views!
Nice ricefields, but lot of traffic on the road.. The part in the ricefields is very Nice, but on the road disstressing because of lost of wild traffic and missing pavement.
Beautiful walk. A very nice and scenic walk outside of Ubud; recommend a very early start to avoid the crowds and the heat.

Beautiful walk.. This free activity turned out to be one of the more memorable things we did. It might have helped that we had a massage at Karsa Spa at the end of the walk. Difficult to find the path, I found some good instructions on the Karsa Spa website. Take a camera and enjoy the more peaceful side of Ubud.Note: We left quite late and after the massage it was dark with no taxis around to take us back. Luckily we hitched (paid a stranger) a ride to get home. AKA Go well before dusk.

Lovely walk - good for kids too. It was a lovely walk, but as the Temple at the bottom was under construction it was a little bit messy, and difficult to enjoy the views of the river at first. We did this walk with a 5 and 9 -year -old and it was a lot of fun, mostly as they loved running through the grass, whiich is grown around Campuhan for the traditional roofing. But it does get hot quickly, if you don't start early.

Scenic walk . The campuhan Ridge walk was a perfect way to see the beautiful scenic side of Ubud while also getting exercise. My wife and I ran from our hotel to the ridge each morning. Some of the walk is not ideal for running, but that's the perfect time to walk and take in the sites and sounds. There are plenty of little shops to buy drinks or cultural artifacts as you follow along the path. We went in the morning and this is recommended because the afternoon heat would take away from the enjoyment.
Nice walk. Gets you away from the busy roads, some nice views. Although it could be better maintained, sign posted etc.

Not a "must do" walk, but very beautiful. I was recommended to do this walk by a friend. My companion didn't want to come and it was raining that day but I went anyway, by myself, in the rain, leaving our villa at 7am. Lucky it was warm! IThe start of the walk isn't very encouraging, it starts beside a hotel (Hotel Ibah), then you walk down a laneway-type thing , past a school, then you sort of hop off the laneway and follow a sign. You go past a temple and then the trail starts. It's quite odd that it's paved, I thought. Despite being so close to bustling Ubud, I saw only one other person the whole time, and he was on his way to work in a rice paddy. The mist made the lush jungle look even more mysterious and I could hear the river. There are houses in the distances and working rice paddies. You come to a small village, with the obligatory art shop, then keep going to Kafe Karsa, which is about 2.4 km from the start. I stopped here. At first it looked like it wasn't open as there seem to be construction works going on but out the back was open so I stopped for a coffee. Big mistake! Coffee like gritty dirt and no amount of sugar or milk could save it! Apparently most people then turn around and head back but I kept going. Through another small village, then onto a road which apparently led back to Ubud. I was told it was another 8 km to Ubud so I decided to have a crack at it, walking along a road with no footpath, with people commuting to work and school. No tourists. Uphills and downhills. I made it about 4 km then gave in and a nice man in another village told me his son would dink me back into Ubud so for $AUD2 I jumped on and had a lovely ride back.This walk isn't one of the "must do" walks of the world but it is lovely and surprisingly quiet and private. It's not a difficult walk but the path can be a bit slippery in the wet. For something different, this is a lovely walk. Go early before it's too hot.

Nice View. We enjoyed this walk. Certainly something you must do if you like nature.Besides from all the nature you could hear the river, but never see it.At some point the nature stopped and we entered an inhabited part. We didn't see any sign of going back or something.

breathtaking. this is worth the walk. winding uphill along a ridge. Views off both sides.One caution, as of July 14 there isn't a loop path back to Ubud unless you want to walk the steep and windy road....with the over sized buses.better off stopping at one of the roadside stands for acold drink and return down,its a different view going back .

Gorgeous walk. Just loved this walk! You need a bit of fitness as there are a couple of up and downs, but overall fairly easy. We started at about 11am. We were lucky with the weather as it was cloudy which kept the temp down a bit! Great views and lovely scenery. We walked for about 45 mins, then turned back. Highly recommended.
Great walk!. Campuhan ridge walk have a very good scenery. It must try if you go to ubud. The place is located side of warwick ibah. You will find fresh air here

The highlight of our trip in Ubud. We hired a scooter and drove away from the madness in the centre of Ubud in the direction of Tegalalang. At a certain point we asked our way back to Campuhan and the Balinese people were really friendly to give us the right directions to the small road to Campuhan, along the river and a lot of rice fields. When you follow this road you can park your scooter there and walk the ridges on foot. Great views along the way. Some of the best rice fields we've seen in Bali!

Nice little hike with beautiful views of the villas. It was raining a little bit and the temple at the beginning of the trail was being renovated when I was there. Nonetheless the views from the trail were awesome. Mostly just seeing the really cool villas that are essentially built on cliffs was the highlight.

Lovely walk with a view. Ubud is a city full of contrasts. The main streets are loud and congested. However, only a block off the main road, little gems like the Campuhan Ridge Walk await. The scenery is fantastic; however, it is easy to imagine that there will be less scenery with all the construction that is ongoing in the area surrounding the ridge.
