You can access the ridge walk by following Jalan Raya Ubud from the Ubud Market past the Museum Puri Lukisan until you reach the Ibah Villas. Follow the paved road down the hill and across the river to access the ridge walk.

Best walk in Ubud. Wanted a bit of exercise and relief from shopping so did this walk along the ridge in Ubud.It climbs quite quickly and gives great views along the ridge and valley, not much shelter from the sun but the breeze is cooling at the top. Along the way we watched a painter as he painted wooden eggs,such lovely delicate work and enchanting scenes. Did not manage to do the whole circuit as fitness was in short supply, but enjoyed it all the same.Recommend starting early to avoid the heat in the middle of the day.

Easy but pretty short walk. Very handy in Ubud through rice paddys and village or two. Enter through Warwick Ibah Resort drive then veer left. Recommend walk to busy sealed road point (about 35-45 minutes), then simply retrace steps. Sealed road return is much less picturesque and damned near dangerous in spots.
Ridge walk. Our 2 boys managed it who are 5 and 8. Great to see what is hidden right out the back of the Main Street. Not really an adventurous walk for big Trekkers but quiet and open and green.

Beautiful Walk!. This was a wonderful, not-too-strenuous, walk with beautiful views on either side of the ridge. Go earlier in the morning or later in the day to avoid the heat.Be sure to stop off at Karsa Cafe 200-300 metres beyond the top for a drink and light meal with lovely view across rice paddies, or book ahead for a massage. There a few, very tiny art shops nearing the top, where you may be able to see local painters at work, decorating wooden eggs and drawing. They're very cheap compared with similar works that you may find in the centre of Ubud, and you now that you're supporting the actual artist.If you find the walk back down too much of an effort, you can always phone a taxi at the top to take you back to the centre of Ubud for about AU$10. Karsa Cafe will phone for you.

Great walk, forgotten Ubud. We had travelled to Ubud fourteen years ago and remembered staying amongst the greenery, which seems to have largely disappeared from the town proper. However, this walk, which we undertook with kids (ages 7 and 5 - no problems) - took us back and was definitely one of the highlights of our repeat stay in Ubud. Very highly recommended.

nice walking path. I start the walking from the village, where I left my motor cycle there. The pathways was nice , green view everywhere. Just don't forget to bring your water bottle, as there is no warung/small shop on those pathway.As I walked there at noon, the sun was a bit hot already. Morning will be better as the sun will not be that hard.

A bit over-rated. A walk with nice views. The distance is quite short and can be walked by anyone having a reasonable fitness level; there are a few steps to be climbed though. Nothing special to mention really and will take less then an hour to walk the return.

Already wanna do it again!. If you love paddy fields and love feel peace at heart, here is the right place! I had a great time strolling along the rice paddies. It was perfect because the weather was very nice (but it can be hot during the day) there were some nice painting stuff, not too many tourists at all. The cafe at the end can be very busy so I chose to chill at the place where there was a sign saying "have a break" the lady there was very nice and also was my orange juice plus you got to see the rice field right in front of you including all the geese. Love it!

Very accessible highlight of Ubud. After some initial difficulties finding the starting point (keep walking down the hill!) we set off on this walk at around 2pm on a hot day. We needn't have worried as the walk is very easy going with plenty of rest points and shaded areas. The views are stunning as you work your way out of the town and up into the rice paddies. As others have mentioned, the cafe at the top (it's the one in the rice paddies with attached spa) is a good choice with seats in little huts surrounded by fish pond. The walk to the cafe took around an hour at a leisurely pace and was thoroughly enjoyable. Highly recommended.

Nice Leisure Walk With Amazing Views. We did this walk late morning, it was rather hot. So put on lots of sunblock or start early. The good thing about starting later was that we only saw less than 10 people along the way. It was quiet and very peaceful. We enjoyed the beautiful views along the walk, looking at the greeneries, the villages, some nice resorts on the hills and finally some paddy fields. It was an easy leisure walk, with nicely made path most of the way. We took about a hour of leisure walk, with a short break under a big tree. We stopped at Karsa Cafe for a drink and rest before taking the same route back. If you feel too tired and want a transfer back, it's available at Karsa Cafe at IDR100,000.

Great place to run or walk alone. The ridge walk is well worth a run/ walk just to get away from the traffic and noise of the main streets. The circuit returns along a busy road, but you could get a taxi once you hit the village, or return the same way along the ridge line if you want to avoid traffic.

One of my favorite places to go to in Bali. Ideally, I try to go here at 6 in the morning to watch the sunrise and go for a run. One of the most beautiful places in the entire world, and I feel fortunate and grateful to be there when I can. Ubud is a hustling and bustling place these days--no longer the quiet village it once was. When you need to escape that, Campuhan is not too far away.

Perfect last day activity. Did this trek with my 2 kids and stopped in at the Cafe at the end. Along the way we were greeted with great views of the Temple (under renovation now), and rice fields, and just gorgeous relaxing landscape. A few artist shops near the end were also worth stopping in at. Did this with my 3 kids, almost 5, 10, and 12.

Well worth doing. Our group of two small families with teenagers got dropped off by a driver at a point where it allowed us to do an hours leisurely stroll back to ubud city, which worked well for us, going in that direction. It was thoroughly enjoyable. It really showed us another side of ubud, the green rural setting which of course is city is on the edge of. Rather than be put off by seeing local teenagers there, as commented on by another writer, we found it so interesting to see them enjoying themselves and we found them friendly. We also enjoyed meeting a very talented and renowned local artist in one house on the road, who delicately paints wooden "eggs" which were extremely cheaply priced, but there was no selling pressure at all. He also teaches local kids how to paint and a couple were there at the time, learning from him. It was nice chatting to him on the way, but mostly we enjoyed the scenery of the walk and highly recommend it.

Nice "drink hut" on the way. The walk is easy and relaxing...When you are on top of the hill you will find a nice place to sit and spend some time alone: it is a small house with a couple of naice little stone and wood tables outside. A friendly lady will serve you fruit drinks and beer ( see the picture with bintang beer and lucky strike...) at a fair price. Happy to have stopped there

Light Green, Dark Green, Luminous Green!. A fantastic ridge walk that really shows off the beauty of Ubud. I got a taxi to Club Koko and wandered across the top of the ridge down to the Campuan bridge. A really easy and short walk, with great vistas and tons of photo perfect scenes. I would go as far as to say that this is a MUST in Ubud. The temples can become so similar after a while but this is a standout and unique prize in Ubud. I wish I knew about it on the previous trips I've made. You won't be disappointed.
Refreshing walk. This was extremely refreshing walk. Lots of green grass, beautiful view and fresh air. Starts near ibah hotel. Best time to go would be early in morning or just before sunset.

nice but I felt scared. we went there during the sunset, well kinda scary, first I saw a huge snake like 1,5 merest long, then it was soooo crowded with local teenagers I felt uncomfortable, then someone told us that there was a robbery there, japanese tourist girls for robbed, they expensive cameras got stolen! well not that i had anything valuable with me besides a rental bicycle but I was worried and felt uneasy! overall views ARE nice!

Overrated walk!. I did all the reading and it was a must do when in Ubud. Unfortunately, it was not what we expected. We entered from the Ibah hotel and followed the signs to Karza Cafe. You really don't see very much at the beginning of the walk as you are walking on the top of the ridge and just see long grasses. Once you reach the cafe, it opens up and you see some rice fields and a duck farm; the view becomes moderately more interesting. We kept going as we wanted to do the whole walk, but it is not well posted. After the shops, you take the first street on the left, and follow the traffic. It takes almost two and a half hours from beginning to end, and most of it is on the road, so watch out for buses and traffic.

Refreshing walk. This is a lovely walk (not trek!) from Ubud to clear the mind and escape the ceaseless chants of "Taxi sir? Tomorrow sir? Massage madame? Tomorrow perhaps?". It begins a short walk from the main Monkey Forrest strip - a few kilometers from anywhere. (I would assume if you're looking for a walk to do, then you'd probably be happy to walk to the start of the track!) The track winds its way through some beautiful fields with a lovely view on either side. Young local teenagers use the track as a rare chance for private canoodling which is really sweet - maybe keep that vibe as you stroll through and keep the loud tourist chatter to a minimum! At the end of the track is a beautiful cafe (Karsa Kafe) where you can lie down and rest your legs before heading back. Fine for beginners, oldies, anyone with two legs I would think. Some hills and stairs yes, but plenty of spots to rest if you need. Early morning or on a cloudy day would be recommended as there's not a lot of relief from the sun.

Fabulous view from Camphuan Ridge. This is an absolute must in Ubud start near the Ibah hotel there are some small signs to follow to Karsa Cafe. The walk is so peacful and beautiful best to do this walk early in the morning before it gets too hot this feels like you are far away from the bustling streets of Ubud and its so nice to see the locals harvesting the rice the paddies they are only small but great to see. When you get to the top keep going to Karsa and stop for a juice perfect way to finish your walk.

A breath of fresh air from the busy Ubud.. This is a lovely trail/hike/trek/journey that starts by Ibah Hotel. It is definitely a nice jog away from the busy Ubud. Whatever your reasons for taking this trek/trail/hike/journey, it is undeniably rejuvenating to take in some fresh air and to experience the beauty of the rice paddies. I often go beyond Karsa Cafe and go into town. The rice paddies become more amazing. I often see people wearing sandals and flip-flops - and dresses - well I do not recommend these fashion statements. Wear some light hiking (or running) shoes and bring water and a camera. Some people just enjoy the views and do some meditation which I love seeing. It is a great place to do a small picnic as well. Sometimes a trail's purpose is not to look for another spa or to look for shops that are ubiquitous in Ubud. For me, this trail is to appreciate the beauty of Ubud.

Good early morning hike. We hiked the Campuhan (Tjampuhan) Ridge Trail at 6:40 am when it is still cool. If you are on Jl. Raya Ubud, look for the Ibah Hotel, follow the signs for Karza Cafe and that will take you on the trail. As you start your hike, immediately to your left you will see a temple: Pura Gununglebah, built in the 9th century. It is being renovated now for a big ceremony that takes place every 100 years (October 10, 2014). Stop and take a look and all the detailed work that is going on; we were lucky to meet a young gentleman who explained to us what was being done. It turned out that he is a member of the royal family.The hike is pleasant and not strenuous. At one point you will see small shops. One shop is run by a miniature style painter, Wayan Rana; ranapainter@yahoo.com. He offers lessons in his studio. His paintings were very reasonable.When you start encountering many motorbikes, turn around and come back. It takes ~1 1/2 hr.

Beautiful!!! A must do if you are in Ubud!. Skip the drive all the way to the more well known rice fields in Bali and just spend the afternoon hiking the Campuhan Ridge Trail in Ubud. It is beautiful. You can hike up, have a glass of lemonade at Karsa Cafe and then watch the sunset over the rice paddies. And Karsa will arrange for a taxi back to town if it gets too dark out.

Great. Saw this walking trail in the lonely planet guide book so decided to give it a go.. be warned if you start at jala raya sangingnan and walk upwards, it is not signposted so you have to rely on locals to guide you there! The ridge itself is beautiful with stunning views and like a previous reviewer mentioned, it is nice to see the locals using the path. Would recommend.

Nice evening walk. I accessed the ridge walk from the school next to the campuhan bridge, starting at about 5pm when it the sun is low and the air is cool. The initial 20min climb requires some effort but the subsequent 30min of so is quite a stroll along the ridge line. It is nice to see that the locals using this path to walk their dogs, try their mountain bike skills or just hang out with their friends after exams. We turned back when we reached the village.
발리 올레길. Went there with a baby stroller. There are some steps but with a restful mind, it's proper to overcome. Enjoy the spectacular view.

overrated walk. this could be an ok walk but unfortunately the sights arent stunning or even pretty at all. after having visited most of the highlights around ubud i must say this one is only if you have absolutely nothing else to do. throughout the walk you will see tons of plastic trash left and right. hundreds of teenage school kids sitting along the way and leaving their trash behind. the walk itself is an easy walk you could do in flip flops.still just not worth the effort walking up here. nothing to see really.

Not as beautiful as other paths in rice fields. We had a hot and good walk, it's better early in the morning or later in the afternoon. Not so rural after all but interesting to complete the understanding of dwellings along river valleys in Ubud. It gets really nice when you finally reach the Kersa Cafe there you have some very nice views. All in all a thing to do while in Ubud

Directions please!. Ok so the spot listed on the trip advisor map threw me. You head west away from the palace and markets down the hill along the main road. Turn right into the Warwick Ibah driveway and there is then a sign saying 'going to the hill'. Take that left down the hill and then you can't go wrong. The walk itself is ok. Mainly up on the way there and down on the way back. The quietness was nice as was the lush green valley. A nice change from the traffic and noise of Ubud. Kafe Karsi has a pretty ugly semi-built building in front of it but if you can ignore that the tables over the water looked nice. I wanted some exercise so jogged on the way back- I'm not fit enough to jog on the way there yet!
Pleasant Tour. Our taxi driver recommended us to start from Rommi's Art Gallery which is walking against the 'traffic'. Our back was against the sun.

surprising little gem on the way down to Ubud. We stopped here for lunch on the way to Ubud from Lovina. It is about one hour from Ubud. The restaurant is set around a man made lake with the choice of sitting in little bali huts that you can sit in and look out over the water. the lake is filled with goldfish that are more than willing to hang around your balihut for a feed. The menu is good and varied, the staff are very friendly and attentive. Main course and drink cost about AUD$10 so a bit expensive by Bali standards but it was presented beautifully and well worth the money. This place has such a relaxing atmosphere you did not feel as if it is on the side of a busy road.if you are sitting in a bali hut you have a sugar cane "bell" to summons the staff. that was unique.The toilets are clean and western. I would go back if passing by.

Alright walk. This is an okay walk, the path is easy to follow and there is a nice cafe 2km down the path. But the views are not particularly stunning and it's paved the whole way so it's easy but can be quite busy. It doesn't feel especially rural but you do escape the traffic of ubud which is nice. You can do this walk in any footwear and we went in the afternoon around 3pm. It wasn't too hot but the day was slightly cloudy so we didn't have direct sunlight.

a nice walk on the ridge. this is a great walk if you ned to get out of the busy ubud and enjoy fresh air. if carsa cafe(2 km walk) is opened you can have a drink and then walk back. if you have the time you can continue to the first junction and turn left towards payogan. remember to bring a sarong if you want to enter the temple. the total walk is 3 - 3 1/2hrs
Great walk. Need to have a reasonable fitness level. Earlier in the day is best. Beautiful views. Was quite hot the day I did it and I was later in the day
Absolutely beautiful. It is very beautiful and an easy walk but do in the morning because of the heat. Take a taxi to the end and then walk back to Ubud.

A must-do in Ubud!. This walk was a major highlight of my stay in Ubud. While the town is lovely, it's hard to get a sense of what else Ubud has to offer and this walk shows you just how beautiful the area is. The walk is not too difficult but I'd recommend running shoes and a lot of sunscreen as there's not much shade. The scenery is stunning and the cafe at the end of the walk is one of the most beautiful, serene places I've ever been and the prices are very reasonable. The one complaint I have is that it was very difficult to find the start of the walk. If looking for walking directions from the town to the start of the hike be sure to use the "driving directions" instead of "walking directions" on Google maps. The walking directions takes you through fields and private property while the driving directions offer a direct and easy route to the start. This walk can't be missed - the views are stunning!

A beautiful hike away from the noise and traffic of Ubud.. I have taken this hike many times and it is a wonderful way to see rural Bali. You pass rice paddies, small villages, and numerous art galleries. I have purchased art works from a number of artists on this trail. Not to be missed!
A nice walk. We walked from Ibah to the Karsa Cafe. It is a hot walk, I suggest stopping at the Karsa Cafe for a beautiful view. The spa there is amazing too, but book ahead.

Touristy but Pleasant. The starting point of the walk is near the Ibah Hotel just off the main street. You'll find a little sign starting at a little bridge that takes you past an old temple that is being rebuilt (as of May 2014).It's an easy, short walk on paved footpaths. The first half is a gentle uphill climb and brings you high up so that you're overlooking the hills and the luxury resorts built into them. It's very grassy and green, with lots of wildlife. Look out for the fascinating grasshoppers with yellow spotted wings and orange striped bodies, dragonflies and the numerous reptilian friends scurrying about.After that the path widens, and the terrain changes to that of rice field terraces. It's very lush and green. However, you will also encounter some vehicles and pass by villas, art shops, guesthouses, spas and cafes. It was a little bit too touristy for me.It gets really hot from about 9ish. You'll also get more people with children, who can be noisy. If you want some peace and more manageable temperatures, go early at the crack of dawn. Bring sunscreen, water and your camera. You don't even need serious trekking shoes - I went in flip flops.
Stunning walk. Took my breath away. Not a long walk. Took me and my partner about 15 mins up hill. So beautiful!! So green.. If u appreciate nature u will love it.

A walk with a difference!. This walk through the rice fields is beautiful and picturesque. Well worth putting aside 2 hours one morning. There are a number of artists and wood carvers located en route which provides a nice opportunity to pick up presents and souvenirs of your stay in Ubud. Recommend to go early morning before the heat gets too much!!:)

Easy Walk. This is an easy well signposted roundtrip starting at the Hotel Ibah if you turn back at the Karsa cafe. Do it at sunrise for best light and misty views. You can continue past Karsa and loop back to Ubud but that's mainly road.

A very easy and popular stroll. I was disappointed as it seemed a very short stroll and the countryside wasn't that great and a bit built up. The path is paved most of the way. We went on a Sunday morning and there were a lot of other people. I regretted getting up very early to do this 1.5 hour stroll.

Nothing special. I read on TripAdvisor that the Campuhan Ridge walk was a great way to see areas around Ubud. I set out in the early morning to avoid the heat but found that the walk disappointing. The first part of the walk was through some fields, on top of the ridge but instead of feeling secluded, all I could see were big mansions / hotels being build on the opposite side. Future along the walk we came to a nice dirt road that had small shops along the side and further yet we reached a small cafe that was nice and relaxing. We had a good breakfast and cooled down. We weren't too sure whether the walk continued or not (we had walked 2km so far) so we asked some people if we should continue. They said that it was best to turn around and walk back the way be came as there was nothing past the cafe other than rice fields etc. They also mentioned that to do the round trip would also take a long time. So we turned back. I wouldn't do this walk again. Unfortunately for me there was nothing really exciting to see.

Good free activity. It was hot and we were dripping in sweat when we made it to the top at Karsa Spa, a lovely walk. I was very happy to be following friends who knew the way, but if not we had downloaded directions from the following helpful blog post with photos http://www.liveloveraw.com/campuhan-ridge-hike-ubud-bali/.Take your camera and plenty of sunscreen, easy walking in terms of being on a track, but the uphill climb gets your heart beating and your smile beaming!

Nice scenic walk. Start almost from centre of Ubud the first part which is actually on the ridge between two river valleys is the nicest - till you get to a restaurant overlooking some very nice rice fields.Here you can turn around or go ahead and do a circle which takes you through different streets.

Fabulous early morning walk before th heat gets up. Super walk just the right distance to a really nice restaurant for breakfast in small thatched 'pods' with super views over the rice fields. Nice artists' studios with good quality Balinese work for sale at good prices

Not bad but has become more touristy. We id this walk years ago and it was like walking on a bush track. Now lots of little shops have sprung up and more houses built out along the track. Some of the little galleries have nice art work though and we particularly liked the one at the intersection ( Romis) on the road where you turn left to go back into town. We bought a painting there, you have to ring the owner , the number is on a table at the back of the room. Its a bit of a walk back from here on the road and yes can be hot if you leave it too late.

Go early. I left at 6.30am in the cool of the morning and loved the walk. As long as you can locate the Ibah Hotel you will be able to follow the signposts all the way. It is a lovely walk away from the hustle and bustle and the reward of relaxing at the Karsa Cafe makes it worthwhile.

Ridge walk. Beautiful walk not too hard. Would suggest getting up early to do walk and having a coffee along the way in the little cafe . Lots of art galleries in the village at the top of the ridge. Lots of paddy fields and good view of mountains

Nice walk up to art shops, cafe and spa. 5km return. We did as a run early in the morning. Good workout past rice paddys. Well signposted. The first art shop at the top was very reasonably priced as proabably the others are so take some money and water.

Five star free activity. Worth it. 4km return with stunning views along the way and a rewarding little cafe at the end. Any day again. Bring plenty of water, worked up a good sweat. Things will do but more enjoyable with proper footwear.

A lovely walk whilst in Ubud. Its a great little walk but its best to do as early as you can as it gets very hot. We went at 8am and we really should have gone earlier as it was a very hot walk still in March.Unless you are going to power walk it for exercise, allow 45 mins to an hour each way to walk to the café and for lots of photo stops inbetween. Café is perfect spot to stop grab a cool drink, revive and head back. Much quicker getting back as its mostly downhill!! There are some steps at the beginning and some hills to climb but there is a path to follow. Don't be persuaded to take bikes unless you want to lug them up all the stairs. Plus the path is uneven in places and cobbled - not ideal for bikes really. Its a lovely relaxing walk with lots of signs to follow to the café. Head to the Ibah Hotel and when you enter the driveway veer left down the hill and take the track to the RHS of the bridge. You will walk past a temple under construction and up you go!!

A lovely walk but go early - like between 7-8am. Go early in the day as it can get hot. Take water and your camera. We were lucky enough to have a guide from our villa take us, which meant that we also added a further hour on the other side of Champuan Hotel (there is a flight of concrete steps - lots of them) that takes you through a charming village and the rice paddies. You end up back on the main road but much further up. Take a guide for the second part though, as the route through the paddies was not intuitive and there are no signs. Enjoy.

Worth it. A great short walk to get the heart pumping and sweet dripping. Hard to find the start of the path. EIther through the school or he driveway about 100m before the main bridge.Only 4km round trip. Walked past three local women who were pregnant in thongs so it's really nothing strenuous. Very picturesque.

Very photogenic. Not too demanding, flip flops will do, stunning views of the river gorge, fantastic rice terracing, and a deep green colouration which defies belief. Some good birds around for birders, lots of snakes but most people dont see any, some very good huge butterflies.

Beautiful walk through the country side. Really enjoyed getting out of busy Ubud to do this peaceful little walk along the ridge. The walk is not very strenuous and there are beautiful views of the jungle as you walk between the tall grass. I would highly recommend doing this walk very early (within the first couple hours after sunrise) as it gets very hot and there is very little shade, plus it is best to do the walk when not a lot if other people are there. Definitely wear running shoes and bring water.There are great directions on finding the path here: http://www.liveloveraw.com/campuhan-ridge-hike-ubud-bali/

Just a path and only really worth doing to get to Kasa Spa. Funny to read the word "Trekking" on some posts.Its nothing more than a paved path for about 1km. its a nice enough path i guess but really why would you bother UNLESS it to get to Karsa Spa. Now thats really worth doing.

Great walk. Loved this - it takes 1/2 hour but go up to the day spa on the top - Karsa Spa. Book first!The actual walk is a lovely stroll through rice paddies beside a river. I wouldn't do it in the heat of the day.

Nice trekking around Ubud. This is an easy trekking in the rice fields near Ubud. In the walk you can see one of the most ancient temple in Bali and take great photos in the rice fields.I suggest you to wear trainers and bring water with you...the weather is hot!!

so so beautiful. really great walk and views which make you inhale deeply to take it all in! The path after the first few metres is well laid and easily managed. Very nice to end the walk at Karsa Spa
Campuhan Ridge. Gives you an excellent view of the local area while enjoying the picturesque views of the walk. It is a visit that you should enjoy during your visit to Indonesia
Almost...... Intended to do this as spent some time on the top of the trail but time ran out. Do late afternoon when temps cool. It's lovely and on my list for next year. Bring water.

Good walk!!. We chose to walk the 5 mile option and we really enjoyed it, the best part of the walk is going up to the ridge as the surroundings are stunning and the sound of the two rivers either side is very relaxing. When you get to the village you come across a restaurant called Kake Kafe and the views are great and your bamboo seats are on top of a pond which was nice. Then from there you walk around roads and some of then are steep and you finish you walk thinking you have walked a long way which was good for us. My advice would be to either walk in the morning or late afternoon as it gets very hot

Morning Run. Woken up at 6am, much to my disgust, told were going for a morning run up a hill. All i can say is wow ! Awesome run, first one back for a LONG time, such a scenic route plus we beat the heat AND other travellers. Fairly easy to find once you know where your going, we found a blog called liveloveraw.com and she has very kindly uploaded a photo guide to finding your way there from the Ubud markets. It says its 2km upto the top but I'm not too sure, we ran (more of a leisurely jog) for 40 mins and were up and back down to our scooter parked at the school.

Lovely walk. Great walk. Wear proper shoes and take water. Probably best to do it outside of 11-3 because it gets hot. Not a trek but a walk on a small path. Love the high school kids canoodling on the side :)
Great walk. Early in the morning is best before it gets too hot. Lovely vista s of rice paddies and village life walking up. Enjoyed it very much.

Pleasant walk. I good easy walk to do to get out of the hustle of Ubud. Nothing to spectacular but just enjoy being out for some exercise. Easily signposted from the hotel before the bridge. Start early as it can get rather hot.
Our last walk in Ubud area. Beautiful views, nice walk from more rural areas into the heart of Ubud. We lingered quite a bit-- but I think we spent about 45 minutes on the ridge.

Different perspective to Ubud Central. Really enjoyed walking the Ridge walk last week. My first time and did not know what to expect. Delighted to note refreshment spots and very nice artisan studios.

Wonderful Green Space in Ubud - Champuan Ridge. The Ridge walk in Ubud is a treasure - enter from the Ibah Hotel sign on the right of Jalan Raya somewhat before the Campuan Bridge, coming from Ubud. The path leads you over a river and then you'll come to the Campuan - Campuhan, Campuan, Champuan, Tjampuan!!! Ridge... there are about 6 spellings but don't let that put you off!) A breathtaking open space, you are walking along the top of a mounded hill with a path along the top, surrounded by swaying green alang-alang grass - the kind of grass used for thatching rooves here - sometimes you'll even see a local harvesting it. The walk through nature is lovely and takes about 45 minutes to the end of the ridge - take a hat/sunscreen/water... on arriving at the far end, walk a little further to pass small painting, craft and egg-painting stores, to find at last a cafe with a lovely view of ricefields, and small bales (thatched open wall 'houses') arranged over a lotus pond full of large carp that have the unusual habit of flinging themselves out of the water to slither across the top of the lotus leaves, looking for insects (maybe they were just hungry that day!)You can walk back to Ubud via the road but that involves a very steep hill..or better, catch a motor bike ride back along the road from someone at the cafe (then you'll see what's involved!). Or of course, you can simply walk back along the ridge. To walk there and back with a short stop at the cafe, you need about 2 hours. When you get back, you could pop into the Ibah hotel to see their lovely spherical flower sculpture in the reception made from frangipanis (plumeria) and maybe have a drink in the pretty grounds. Alternatively pop over the road to Murni's Warung for lunch or dinner - lovely river views, and a very hip bar with a giant metal ganesha.or cross the bridge, to Bridges restaurant, more upmarket and a truly lovely inspiring and delicious venue for a meal.
Lovely walk. Beautiful walk with amazing views and floating cafe and spa at the end of the road. Well worth the effort, best to attempt very early given the heat during the day
Morning walk. Recommended for an early morning walk where you will seed locals and expats walking their dogs. Panoramic views over rice paddies.

beautiful views of rice paddies. nice, quick walk through the rice paddies. only took me about 60-90minutes to do the walk, then I turned around at Kafe Kaska and walked back. wasn't too difficult either. would recommend it to anybody who is in ubud for a short time and wants to see the rice paddies.
A nice early morning walk - 45 minutes. In the hills close to Ubud centre, a walking track which is not too challenging, unless you plan to follow the track at the middle of the day. Beautiful views!

Escape the traffic, noise and central Ubud!. This is a must for anybody visiting Ubud, especially if your stay is short and are predominately staying in the city. We had a great day and thoroughly enjoyed the scenery grabbing some great pictures. The Karsa cafe is a great place, well worth the effort.I would not of known about this place if it weren't for tripadvisor, but still had to do my research to find it! To return the favour here are some directions which I hope will help out:Start at the market / palace intersectionHead west along Jalan Raya (you'll pass Starbucks almost immediately)Keep walking until the shops on both sides end and there is an overhead 'bridge'Stay on this road and head straight down a small hill with greenery on both sidesAt the bottom of the hill the road will hang left, keep following itYou will see a sign for the Ibah hotel on you right hand sideThis is where the trail starts and is signposted!Hope this helps as it took me ages to find!

Nice way to leave the hustle & bustle. We enjoyed this nice walk. The start is fairly easy to find and after a few steep sections at the start, the path is fairly easy. Some shops up near the top for drinks. Other walks nearby are equally good.

Not amazed, but nice. I did this walk in the rain, so maybe I didn't appreciate it as much, but I wasn't blown away. Yes it's a nice walk, but it wasn't that inspiring. Good views across two valleys on either side. I actually prefer to just walk through the rice paddies. I would recommend maybe getting a taxi to Karsa and then walking back. Maybe nice at sunset?

wonderful walk, take hat. We started trail from rural start near rice paddies. Very nice vistas, a few art galleries with friendly locals. Nice shady rest site for cold drinks or food. Downside is u share one third of trail with motor bikes. Very enjoyable, take a taxi to town if tired, very cheap.

Other world. After the simple but beautiful walk (about 40 minutes) you end up at the kafe. There pagodes in the middel of some ricefields. Very nice setting for a cup of tea, massage, Reikki, reflexology, ot whatever. Then back, the same trek. Very nice !!
Nice walk. It was very nice to see a small part of the green Bali after staying in the city all week.Very pretty, not too hard a walk.
Great walk. Even during the rainy season it's a very nice walk to escape the rumour of expanding Ubud. Beautiful ricefields, easy to find

Lovely green fields. We took the rice field walk from opposite 'Betel nut' cafe and then joined the Campuhan Ridge walk from the end of that trail. It made a nice loop. The first part was very rural and serene. There's a guy with a little shop where the trails join. We had fresh coconut milk for a cheap price; was very refreshing. Campuhan Ridge is getting quite commercial at the southern end with many reastsurants and art studios (great art but not cheap). We were 'bailed up' by an old woman picking rice who posed for a photo then 'demanded' payment (ohh dear). Wonderful photo opportunities abound.
Beautiful scenery , amasing surroundings.. I absolutely enjoyed every minute of the walk.In half way we stopped for refreshing drink surrounded by fantastic view on rice fields. Definitely recommend!

Amazing walk. Such a nice and fairly easy walk. ending at the lovely cafe which had a good selection of drinks, with amazing views for a cheap price. Really can't recommend this walk enough, great views of rainforest, rice terraces and glimpses of village life. Finding the beginning is a bit hard just keep an eye out for ibah hotel and from there its not too bad!

niceeeee. nice place , u can take a bike and go for a nice day time walk.it is very beautiful view and u better b sure u wearing very light clothes coz its was very hot there and humid.u can take nice pics there and stay in cute cafe in the rice terrace
A nice morning. Very scenic , make sure to go early in the morning, we went around 9 and it was already pretty hot. The shops weren't open yet so we were able to walk in relative peace and quiet.

Lovely walk. This is a lovely walk, you need to search for the beginning of the track, but then you are on your way. It was very humid, but beautiful scenery, we stopped at Koko Cafe for a refreshing drink.
Enjoy the sunset there. Don't wear hot pants or short skirt because you will get itchy. Other than that, it's a good place to visit. More less like savannah in Ireland, but in Indonesian style :)

Escape the Ubud Hubbub. At the foot of the hill on the way to Campuan, just before the bridge, is a roadway to the left that leads down to the beginning of the trail. It is not athletic, but it is strenuous. You might want an umbrella, as there is little shade once you start to climb into the clearings. It is peaceful and uncrowded. When you emerge on the other side, and begin your walk back to Ubud, you will pass several houses that are the home/studios of artists, Stop at the small table for a glass of soda water, and look at there work. Such a great, peaceful way to spend a day. Start in the first half of the morning, to escape the greatest heat.
Well Worth walking. Lovely way to see the valley, just stunning and well worth trekking. The path is well laid out and easy to follow.

Good Views from the Top. It is a relative short walk, about 2km one way. Lots of rolling hills and padis, as well as a river flowing along side. Do try to walk in the morning or early evening, if not it will be hot. Also one can view the "high" end villas overlooking the river as well.

Worth a morning. Can't say that this was the highlight of my trip to Ubud! but I'm glad I took this walk. Followed trip advisors advice and turned a around at Karsa after a nice breakfast. Also got a painting from the artist next to the cafe. Found the trail remarkably easy to find as somebody has placed hand written signs for the walk by the Ibah.

Stretch your legs. A great way to see the countryside, got a car to the start of the walk and then had a casual stroll along the ridge taking in the greenery. There is a coffee shop at the half way point and well worth a stop. Get out a see some countryside.

A nice little walk. Start of the walk is right before the Campuhan bridge. You'll walk past a schoolyard and turn left, then turn right before a temple that was under renovation when we were there.The walk isn't too challenging, we saw families with small kids doing the trek as well. Path's not suitable for a stroller, though.We walked to the spa on top of the ridge for a lunch and back to the Campuhan bridge in a 3+ hours during our day-trip to Ubud. There was only a 5-minute rain during our trek so don't be scared to do this during the rainy season. The path was a bit too crowded by school kids during early afternoon consider going before noon.Visited January 2014
One of the best walks in Bali. Stop at Karsa Kafe and have a coconut and pancake on one of their Bales over the water, a fabulous part of the walk.

Nice little walk. Nothing too special here, half of the way goes through a small "village".... Ubud to me was very overrated, too many touts everywhere with "Taaxiii!", "Transport!" and "Hellooo, you buy...."

Great for ealry morning exercise. We spent two weeks in Ubud and I used the Campuhan Ridge Walk as my early morning exercise on a number of mornings. The morning run was enjoyable through beautiful scenery and friendly villages. I highly recommend this walk/run to be done at least once on your visit to Ubud.

Nice view, but better walks to be had. Easy enough to find and do, but not terribly special. The walk becomes a road that wends its way through several communities. That part of the walk was much more enriching, but by that time you're very far away and it's a very big loop to get your way back. Either way, do this early in the morning because much of it is unshaded. A much more beautiful walk can be had on the way to Sari Organik. Coming from central Ubud, the turn is before Campuhan Ridge (look up Sari Organik for directions). It's through the rice fields and can be done as an easy loop.

Fun walk with lovely views. We enjoyed this walk which was only a bit of a hike in the beginning. For some reason I had expected it to be much longer and I was surprised that half of the walk was along a quiet road with some hotels and artist studios. Out of loyalty to Kafe Karsa posting good signs along the way we stopped there for some young coconut but we could have stopped at a few other nice looking places along the way. Lovely lotuses at the Kafe which were nice to see as the ones in town had been washed away by strong rain. We were happy to buy some art directly from one of the artists as we wandered back. We met a lot of hot, over-dressed Indonesian studentsin their uniforms planning picnics along the ridge, so it is best to go early before the sun starts beating down and the humidity rises. It was also interesting to watch workers carving parts of the renovated temple as we were leaving. As Ubud could benefit from a pedestrian zone, this was a welcome change from much of the traffic. I wouldn't rate it as the number one attraction in Ubud though, as the Legong dances at the Palace and the wonderful museums definitely rate higher in my books.

Stick to early morning or late afternoon!. We made a mistake doing this walk at lunchtime, it was very hot and humid and made what should have been a lovely walk a little unpleasant. Lovely views, suits all abilities, and the obligatory shops and stalls at the end. Karsa kafe was perfect for a cool drink, much needed, but make sure you walk right to the end to find them. They had lovely little huts overlooking the rice fields which looked lovely to sit in for your lunch. The start of this walk at the Ibah hotel was an easy 10 minute walk from the centre (markets) of Ubud.
Gorgeous but Longish Walk. Gorgeous walk through little villages and rice fields, finally over the ridge to Campuan temple and jungle river below. A little long and strenuous though.
Worth it. Breathtaking views and great art, food and spas along the trail. Just don't forget to take plenty of water.
Awesome vista. Easier if you start from north and walk downhill. Stunning walk on ridge top between two rivers. Some out of the way galleries and cafés on the way

Lovely walk. I was there May 2010 and really enjoyed this walk. The views were stunning. Overall it was a fairly easy walk and not too strenuous. You can easily walk back into town after doing the walk.

Great way to spend the day. So glad I found this recommendation on Tripadvisor. Had a lovely day leaving the town, getting some exercise and enjoying nature. The walk is lovely, well paved and very scenic. The shops at the end of the walk are also very charming. Pay a visit to Wayan Rana who is an artist right before Karsa Cafe. A very nice gentleman who we found to be geniune - we bought some paintings and got a personal egg painting lesson for $5 an hour. And get a coconut at Karsa Cafe to rehydrate. It will be the perfect afternoon.

Not Bad but not fantastic either. This walk has changed as it used to be less built out. Lots of houses and hotels popping up along it. The walk back to Ubud is a nice long walk. You turn right at Rommis Gallery ( fantastic paintings here, we bought one). Some traffic on the way back and can be hot if you leave it too late in the morning to start.

Good but i expected something better. The ridge walk was good but i expected something better or maybe some rice fields, the distance is quite short but there is a lot of uphill in the beggining. The cafe though is excellent with great smoothies and great view. I would strongly suggest the rice fields walk that starts near cafe lotus in jalang cajang for an excellent treckking experience within rice fields and a more traditional experience!

Lovely walk, beautiful views. A very enjoyable walk through the rice fields along Campuhan ridge. Beautiful views over the valley either side of the trail and a lovely cafe (Karsa Kafe) at the end of the trail to have a cool drink, meal or massage! We commenced the walk at the Ibah Villas (10 min walk out of town - just ask a local where to find the villas) and came back the same way after a cool drink at the Karsa Kafe. Nearer to Karsa there are a few artists working so take some cash with you!

Beautiful!. A must do if you are staying in Ubud. Get a taxi from Ubud and negotiate your rate for the drive TO the walk. You start off by beautiful rice terraces and fields and the Karsa Kafe overlooking the fields for a brief stop for a massage, lunch or a cool drink. The path is along roadway for a bit then moves into the hills. Its an easy 1.5 hour or so walk back to Ubud with beautiful scenery and its peaceful and quiet! Bring a camera...

Nice and easy. I would say this is a must when staying in Ubud. Easy to find, easy to follow and easy to walk. Nice views of Balinese green, villages and locals. Rice fields and artists. Simply go and enjoy. Safe enough for solos.

Lovely peaceful walk in the middle of lively Ubud.. Love this walk, it's so nice to just come here to clear the mind or stretch those legs! Beautiful views either side and it's so nice to come here alone or with friends. In the afternoon you'll see loads of young school friends, couples and families and it's so cute. Early morning you'll see the runners, and in the evening the sunsets are beautiful. Come here to get some lovely clean air into those lungs and press the reset button while in the amazingly chaotic Ubud :)

Beautiful river valley walk, highly recommended. Easy walk, can get there on foot from Ubud. Best bit was the ridge itself, along the elephant grass trail, with river valleys on each side. The rain added to the joy of the walk!
A Great Walk. This is a wonderful walk but do it either early in the morning or late in the afternoon. It is all uphill and you have really good views of the area.

It's just a walk. Yes, if you like walking this is a walk. Not much really up here, they have a ridge and some decent views of the neighborhood. The restaurant with the three bungalows is nice, overlooking the rice field which we stopped to get snacks. The food was ok and there were places to get drinks along the way. Seemed more like a high school local smoke hang out mid day. Also we parked at the head of the trail by the hotel, which was a school. We had a car, parked and came back and found 300 peds blocking us in. We got a massage until school was out, haha. You can walk the entire walk, and then get a taxi back too from the other end.

Nice walk, but there are better ones. A friend of mine and I did tree walks in Ubud, and we both agreed that this was the least nicest. The ricefield walk, or a morning walk alongside the river Agung were from an esthetic point of view way more interesting, so if you have few time, go for one of those. Or the bird walk :).
Great outdoor ridge.. I went here twice, with bike (however you have to carry your bike on shoulder at steps at Pura Campuhan. Don't go during hot noon, as it is pretty open and very few trees.

refreshing and peaceful. Lovely short walk, great views. You get a bit of the padi field, some village through a shady paths, a couple of art shops (not the aggressive types). Though we saw some heavy construction vehicles going past Cafe Karsa, probably toward a huge side further down the road. As we were walking with our 3 year old, we did a one way trip, starting off from Cafe Karsa and walked all the way to Hotel Ibah (ubud town) - about a 2km distance. Go in the morning before 830am, else the sun gets pretty hot at the ridges. We were there once at 10am with elderly parents, and it was hot. We felt elevated after the walk.

A nice walk outside of traffic. This walk on the ridge was a surprising find. Quiet when we were there, it is an easy 1km or so walk to the rice fields. As many have mentioned, Kafe karsi is a good place to stop and rest before heading back to the center of Ubud. I wish there were more of these quiet walks around here without having to worry about cars and the state of the sidewalk!

Awesome day!. Beautiful easy 40 minutes early morning walk out of Ubud traffic zone! So many shades of green - too many to count! Also saw many birds - blue kingfisher, swallows, yellow finches- before the path came to a small village. Farmers were harvesting their rice crops and children calling out 'hello' to me. THIS is the Bali I remember! I stopped for a mango smoothy at Karsa Kafe which has some cool huts you can lie in over a water lily pond. Then I did a massage at Karsa Spa which was the best I've had in Bali or Australia! Great day all round. Definitely recommended.

dirty of plastic bags. Plastic bags everywhere in nature, when the city of Ubud will start to think of manage this problem growing everywhere in Bali ? The fist step would be to put garbadge containers on the way (the second, education in schools...) If you do this walk, prepare your own plastic bag and collect some garbadges, as I saw some tourists did ! Shame on Bali...

Lovely early morning wander. Best to ask your concierge to order you a taxi to the start point, unless you want to trek way out of town. Get the taxi to drop you at the far end of the ridge, and then its a pleasant (downhill!) walk of about 1/2 hour through the countryside down into Ubud town. Very peaceful and scenic.

Campuhan Ridge Walk. It's an easy, paved walk. Beautiful view of the ravine/valleys but you can't get close to the river. I recommend starting from the north side and walking into town to go to Cantika Spa and Sari Organik for lunch right after.
Scenic walk. Good scenic walk if you have a few hours. There's no shade or covering though! So be warned that if it's a hot day the walk could be brutal.

Lovely walk. I found this walk a lovely break from the dust and traffic of Ubud. Definitely stop at Karsi Kafe for something to eat, or have a bintang and sit in the bungalows over the koi ponds. I would also recommend the massage spa at Karsi as I think they are outstanding. Probably the best Balinese massage I have had in all my trips to bali.

Nice walk.. I did this walk at sunrise and it left me wanting more.It's a very easy walk, I am not particularly fit and certainly no seasoned walker and it was a breeze.It's actually only a couple of km until you reach tarmac again but it doesn't stop there, the road winds through rice paddies where there's some beautiful vistas over the hills and valleys.There's no abundance of trails leading down to the river as some reviews suggested but I did manage to find one accessible one near the temple which went down to a small waterfall, nice and tranquil but a very slippery narrow and steep trail.The main trail is paved for the most part and overlooks both valleys and the many hillside properties. It's hardly the last frontier and certainly not remote but very pleasant and well worthwhile.
Great views but set out way before sunset!!. Lovely walk with great scenic views however my friend and I ended up returning back from this walk in the pitch black which was extremely scary.
Very short. From ubud town, you'll do this in 1 hour. Very nice and worth it some great scenery and it's really easy.

nice walk bring hat and good shoes. It was a bit confusing finding the start of this walk. Go to the Ubud side of the bridge, walk through the school and then ask at the little shop. There is a lot of moderate hill walking, cafe stops and artisan stops along the way. You will be in full sun much of the way, so take a parasol (my preference) or wear a hat and sunscreen.

Nice walk. Really nice walk and if you are coming from Penestanan, the trail can be accessed through the schoolyead next to the bridge. Just walk through their playground area, then take a right and cross the smaller, lower bridge on your right as you face the temple.Definitely stop for a drink at Kafe Karsa. The food is pretty good too. They have three great dining bales set over a koi pond with terrific rice field views. From there, you can either keep walking forward, walk back the way you came, or ask them for transport, which they can arrange. After a few Bintangs, we opted for the latter.
beautiful walk. Lovely half a day. Lots of little cafes en route. Well worth it if you are feeling a little energetic.

Nice walk, go early, turn around at cafe. The ridge walk really is beautiful, especially if you go early on a nice day. I wouldn't recommend it after 9am. My word of advice is to turn around at the cafe. After that there isn't much, and the constant motor bikes and territorial dogs can be a hassle. Certainly it's a recommendation of a way to spend a morning in Ubud. Directions: walk west from the Palace until you reach Ibah Hotel. It's impossible to miss. Walk into the Ibah and follow signs for the hill. Once you're on the path, walk straight until you reach the cafe at the top. Turn around there.

morning walk..... just did this trail this morning..... very easy to find the path..great information from the traveller here.. my suggestion : be there at 6 am... if you want to walk until the end of the trail is ok.. we decided to walk back as we decided to hv our breakfast at sari organik...wear you comfort shoes and enjoy it....
Great walk but do it before it gets too hot.. A lovely ridge walk with fabulous views. Don't do this walk in the heat of the day and make sure you take some water with you.

Good views along the ridge. We had a bit of difficulty finding the start of the walk (Lonely Planet was not very precise) but the walk itself is lovely. Turn back when you get to the place with the fish ... don't try and complete the circuit outlined in Lonely Planet ... just takes you via dusty roads and traffic.

Part of our daily routine. We stayed in Bali Bliss resort which is at the top of this path. We walked into town every day and it was the favourite part of our day. Very quiet and pleasant with a nice breeze and usually some locals and tourists enjoying the view. I have read a few other reviews of the walk and would recommend turning round once you get to Karsa cafe.

Nice walk, path trails off. The beginning is a nice walk, it's hard to know where the path ends, and then at the end I ended up having to walk quite far to get back to the town. So, based on my experience I would recommend going back the way you came. The "art" shops along this trail, much like elsewhere in ubud, are mass produced for tourists and not interesting or worth a trip on their own.

Quite nice but don't go too far!. We started this walk with great anticipation as it's rated so highly on Trip Advisor but overall we were a bit disappointed. There is some nice scenery but not the stunning countryside I was hoping for and there was lots of walking past houses.We found the walk ok - there are a couple of useful signs for it near the Ibah hotel - and set off uphill. The immediate scenery was very nice of rice paddies and palm trees as we walked uphill. As the gradient became gentler we could soon see lots of smart houses so we didn't quite feel like we were away in the countryside. Also I think we must have missed the paths off down to the river that others have talked of.After just a few hundred metres the lovely scenery was blocked from view as we walked past various houses, some under construction, and the path became a dirt track road. We continued past lots more houses and shops/galleries selling paintings until we found the signposted Karsa Kafe, which was nice and sold lovely cold drinks.We then made the mistake of not turning back. This was our mistake as we hasn't read the reviews fully before doing this walk. The locals assured us we would get to Ubud if we followed the road then turned left. Following the road took us past more houses and the left turn took us onto a tarmacked road which went on and on with no pavement or footpath to turn off onto and regular traffic. Eventually we got a taxi as I hate walking along roads and it was another good 5km until we were back in Ubud! Clearly this was our fault but I'm writing here to warn others.So, if you turnaround at the cafe this is a nice walk but I wouldn't say spectacular.

Relaxing getaway from Ubud noise.. Our 3rd time doing this walk in 8 years. It's really enjoyable, easy, and a great way to see some of the countryside on foot, especially if you don't ride motorbikes or have a car.
Beautiful rice terrace fields. It was a very pleasant walk (the best for us) with a wonderful view on rice terrace fields on the top! And a super bar on the top with delicious fresh juice!

A bit hot and over-hyped?. We started our walk before 8 am, as recommended, and it was still as hot as fire during the rather steep ascent to the ridge. It's not a particularly difficult walk, but is very warm and very humid. We had expected to feel rapturous along the ridge, but frankly, it was so-so. . . We had hoped for rice fields, but most of the ridge walk is simply past distant houses, with an occasional view of people collecting grass for thatching. The little Warung near the end of the 3 km walk was a lovely respite, though, featuring a breezy, cool interior and lovely drinks (our friends had mango lasses, which looked excellent and very refreshing.) A better walk, by far, is the shorter and slightly easier walk to Sari Organik. The entrance to this walk is about 100 m BEFORE you get to the Campuhan walk entrance at the Ibah Hotel. Look for the small brown sign pointing up a steep driveway (along with about 10 other similarly small signs!), with a tourist shack on your immediate right as you begin the climb. The Sari walk takes you mostly through peaceful, quiet rice fields, where you get to see rice farmers and organic farmers quietly plying their trade. Stop for a drink or meal at Sari Organik, a small and pleasant restaurant with spectacular rice field views. And don't forget to visit their nearby organic farm, which supplies the restaurant!

A beautiful mini-adventure. The Campuhan Ridge Walk was something I really wanted to do before leaving Ubud. It was a lot easier to find than most people make it out to be, starting off 5 minutes away from the main road (just spot that Ibah sign and you are set - look up some info online or ask people for directions if you are really lost). The walk itself is easy on the body as long as you bring some drinkable water with you and / or go in the morning (which I recommend for various reasons : it makes it feel more like an adventure, the air is fresher, and you are more likely to be by yourself - by noon the path is going to be packed with tourists, which is especially going to suck if you plan on taking photos). The scenery is beautiful, the feeling of isolation is great, the cliff section is really peaceful, then the village section is a nice change of pace and the local artists and craftmen will show you genuine interest (a commendable feat if you consider how many tourists they probably see walk by daily) and have a lot of intriguing work to show. We reached Karsa Kafe, rested some, had some fine hot drinks in a peaceful environment, fed the fish around the huts (an attraction worth the extra money in my opinion, it was surprisingly fun) then walked back the way we came seeing as lots of people had told us that it was the best way to do it, as the walk apparently only gets less interesting after that section. Round trip took us maybe 1,5 hour in total. We went at about 10 in the morning and already crossed paths with several groups of tourists on the way back. That walk was one of my fondest memories in wonderful Ubud, experience it while it lasts - I do not like the look of those new houses and buildings in construction nearby.

Beautiful and easy walk. It was a very beautiful and easy walk trail. Half way through we stopped at a cafe with a beautiful view of rice patties. On the way back we stopped by some stores and bought some local egg painting art for a great price.

Beautiful views. We thoroughly enjoyed this beautiful walk in Ubud. We loved watching the rice farmers go about their daily work & the ladies walking along the path carrying loads of wood on their heads. Make sure you take small change to give them if you want to take their photo. Interesting shops along the way to look at. We enjoyed fresh juices at Pomegrante cafe while taking in the lovely views.

Good climb, fantastic walk. This is a fantastic walk (uphill for the first 15 mins) on a good path - and no motorbikes until the village, where the road starts. Fields of elephant grass on the way up and, once you're on the ridge itself, a river gorge either side with beautiful views. I've yet to find a circular route (without taking busy roads) so you return on the same path. While the temple is being built, the best way to find the path is from the Ibah Hotel, then left down a steep path (signposted for the walk) and across the bridge.
Early morning. Lovey views from the ridge where you will see a lot of local life. Excellent thing to do early in the morning before it gets too hot.

Best I've seen of Ubud. There are several paths to this great walk though they are all just off the Main road, at Lotus Ibah hotel and several others. You pass by beautiful rice fields And organic restaurants, art shops, and an organic spa called Dragon Fly. Take a few hours and go in to nature, out of the bustling streets of Ubud!

A must do to escape Ubud!. Loved this beautiful walk along the ridge. Lots of green, a lovely breeze and views along the gorge amazing. Friendly locals when you hit the village. Lots of artists and village life, kids playing, people working in the ricefields. I found a great silver shop up here and had the most AMAZING massage I've had in Bali at Karsa Spa. I had a fresh coconut and Cap Cay for lunch at Karsa Cafe which was so relaxing in a beautiful setting in the ricefields. A great day to get away from the traffic in central Ubud. Next time I return I will be staying in this tranquil village for sure.

Great Panorama. No better walk to enjoy the wonderful scenery Ubud has to offer. It starts just after Campuhan Bridge, and you can walk back through Sari Organic rice paddies. Have a stop there for a drink. Stunning Panorama!

Hot, sticky walk but at least we were away from the traffic.. Shortish, circa 3km walk with pleasant views over relatively unspoilt countryside. If you want to get away from the horrible noise, hubub and congestion of Ubub it's worth a trip. I'd do it quickly though as wherever the tourists go the locals start building (can you blame them? ) and development along the route is in full swing.

Fitness or stroll - up to you. This can be a challenging walk at a fast pace but if you take your time it will be rewarding and you can enjoy some lovely Ubud scenery along the way. The full loop, Campuhan to Campuhan of about 8km, can be completed in 90 minutes by a fit person. Watch out for transport drivers going to Taro Elephant Park on the road return - they take it fast.

Get away from it all in the rice fields. This walk, plus the many intersecting paths which crisscross the extensive rice field area above the central tourist parts of Ubud, are the perfect way to spend an afternoon. We managed to get completely lost but passed several locals, all more than happy to point us in the right direction and tell us about the area and their work their. Aside from the breathtaking wildlife and views, this is really what made it so special. One man even invited us to sit in his garden and drink coconut milk with him, he got the coconut fresh from the free we were sitting by!Worth considering before setting off. We ended up on some very small, long grass tracks and on both days we went walking we saw a snake. We had flip flops on which was probably not the best idea. If I'm lucky enough to return to Ubud one day I would definitely pack more sturdy foot ware. Having said that, we just made sure to stamp as we walked and it really wasn't a problem.
Beautiful. Totally gorgeous walk with plenty of places to stop and refuel with nice food and drink. Great to get out of the hustle and bustle of Ubud and breathe.

Absolutely worth it.... This is a great walk to do with stunning views. It doesn't take a whole day but that depends on how far you want to walk. We walked up to the part where the view disappeared and we arrived at houses, which took just over an hour from our homestay on monkey forest road.

A fabulous (free!) activity in Ubud. Bali has two major natural offerings - beaches and greenery. While the former are best experienced at Kuta and Nusa Dua, the latter is present is superlative measures at Ubud. And in Ubud, you'd be hard-pressed to find a better place than Campuhan Ridge walk for the same.What it is: A walk across the rice plains, taking in a few art galleries, cafes and stuff along the way. Soak in the sights. They're gorgeous. Miles and miles of rice fields. You'll see their unique irrigation and step farming as well as tons of trees.How difficult is it?: Quite easy. Walk leisurely, this sort of thing shouldn't be rushed.When should you do it? Either early morning or in the evening, pre-sunset. Warning: If you're going in the evening, beware of kids on scooters returning from school, and plan to finish the walk before 6 because it gets dark otherwise and it's not exactly a well-lit route. Start at 3 or 4.On the way: There are many art cafes with some lovely little paintings you can pick up (bargain!) and an awesome cafe where you can pick up small eats, coconuts and of course, the ubiquitous Bintang! They have lovely seating surrounded by water with fish. You shouldn't miss it! The cafe is called Karsa Kafe.What to bring: Walking shoes and a camera.Beware: Of stray dogs. Not as friendly as some of the ones you might be used to. Just stay out of their way. Don't approach to pat them or anything. We actually wandered around and got a little lost - thankfully we were able to get ourselves to a little shop which called a taxi and we were ferried back :-) So don't be shy to ask for directions.All-in-all, a must-do if you're in Ubud (which is a must-do if you're in Bali!)
Do the whole loop, its worth it. Liked the easy to follow path. liked the Cafe along the way, liked the views. You cant get lost so give it ago
A must if you are staying in west Ubud. A great walk for fitness, views or viewing the local artists. Takes about 90 minutes at a brisk pace or hours if viewing all the art on display
Worth every step. It is a must do in Ubud, we were lucky enough to be the only ones doing the walk the day we went, it was beautiful!

Nice to get away from the "city"!. A challenging walk/run. Hilly and uneven at times but gorgeous views of the river valley below, villas on the hillside, "ending" with an amazing rice field at the cafe. I continued along for another mile or so - yes, less scenic over all (you end up on a road with motorbike traffic) but still interesting. A few art galleries and warangs. Gets hot so definitely head out early!Trailhead just past Ibah (look for the sign to the cafe, down the hill, pass the school and stay to the right.)

Pleasant stroll through the rice fields. The walk offers good views across rice fields and some villas on the hills away from the madness of Monkey Forest Rd and the market. There are a couple of small refreshment stops along the path. Definitely worth the effort. A lot of locals were relaxing in areas along the path.

a must do that's still not too busy :). a stroll through 'old Ubud' but still with some great food stops along the way. Go by bike or foot and take a real look at the locally produced carvings and art as well as the very good fare at Sari Organik (simply stunning) and it's neighbour, The Pomegranate (under a huge sail cloth roof)

Beautiful Scenery While Walking. Lots people saying about Bukit Cinta in Ubud, or maybe Known as Bukit Campuhan. I work in Ubud, so i plan to visited and do jogging in that area after work. I went there with my boyfriend. First time being there, we saw really beautiful scenery between the hill. The right side have river and valley view. From Left side we can see many resorts that look so luxurious. If you want to walk until finish point, you may take 30minutes -1hours to arrived. But in the middle of the ridge walk, i just turn round because it already twilight. While we were walking we saw lot of couples walking together like us. Many teenager congregated in some point to sharing stories or just want to rilex and enjoy the scenery. I will go there again. I need some exercise after work, then in Bukit Campuhan we can jogging and that's good for the health too. Oya, don't forget to take pictures there. Amazing view awaiting you :)

Turn back at the end of the stone-path. The first part of the path is truly nice: you are walking upwards on a winding stone-path amidst of a scenic grassland. A clear plus: there are lots of local kids coming here and neither scooters nor bikes are allowed on the stone-path, so it's quite safe to walk.I made the mistake to keep on walking though. While the further road brings you to a fairly nice (but not so spectacular) Cafe (Karsa), it goes trough a busy area, with building sites, some shops and very little charm. I found the rice-field walk that goes parallel to this one (just one hill closer to Ubud center) much more appealing and considerably longer. Also, it had quite a few very nice Cafes overlooking the rice-fields directly, and no big construction going on. If I had to choose just one, I would choose the rice-field path. If staying for longer, I would go for the short version of the ridge walk once again.
Nice walk. If you like to walk with panoramic view of savannah, rice paddies, and Balinese traditional village, then this place is for you.

Still a peacful place with Ubud getting crowded. This is still a lovely stroll to get away from the bustle of Ubud. I've been to Ubud many times over the years and its in danger of losing its majesty. The ridge though is still relatively untouched with some lovely views.

Excellent walk. We read that the while walk was a bit long and we were travelling with children.So we asked a taxi to drop us off at the karsa cafe and we walk back to ubud from the cafe. It was a very easy walk. The beginning near Karsa cafe was the best with rice fields and painting shops. I loved that walk.

Gorgeous views!. Breathtaking, fresh air to breath.. the greenest grass around, loveliest wildflowers and lots of butterflies. Heaven! The Karsa cafe was a cute lil' welcome place where we sipped on cool n sweet coconut water. Thereafter the walk to Jalan Sanggigan was quite an exercise!

Nice walk. Nice walk. Go early in the morning to see the sun rise. The round-walk is not very special. Better to return when you have reached the 'normal road' (after the warung). If you are interested in art galleries you will surely be satisfied. But do not go early in the morning then, because they will still be closed ;).

Half day nature escape from Ubud. This is a fabulous walk from near Bridges up to a ridge and long the rice paddies and looking into the forest. The starting point is a bit ambiguous - you cross a bridge over the river that Bridges restaurant is located on, but to get to this little bridge you need to turn off Raya Campuhan where the sign marks Ibah villas and then turn left again and head past the school onto the little bridge.Once you get over this bridge it's a great set up. Wide paths all well maintained, great views to the left and right. There aren't many spots to stop for water for the first 2-3k's so you should bring your own. It's also quite up hill so be prepared for some sweaty walking if the sun is out! We stopped at Karsa Kafe for juice and banana pancakes which was a great spot. We had heard the first half was the best, so we turned back at Karsa Kafe and went back down to bridges.

Scenic walk. A very easy and relatively short under one hour walk to do if you are in Ubud. It was fairly scenic particularly once you got on to the grass track. Depending in which way you start it is downhill all the way. There is some construction work along the road track but then followed by a glorious patch of green. Ends on one of the main roads in to Ubud.

Nice walk. The ridge walk itself was nice. Good scenery, some art shops along the way and at the end some rice paddies. Tip: take a drink at the end of the walk and then go back the same way. We walked back to Ubud city centre along the normal road, which was not nice and a tough walk.

Nice scenic walk to art village. This walk gives a nice overview of the local area, and leads one to a pleasant, spaced-out series of small artists houses and then temple compounds. Very pleasant in the early. Morning. Does not feel touristy.
A little trail of magic. This is the best way to get a feel of the real side of Bali, fantastic views, forest, rice fields and homes.... you will be inspired and may not want to leave
Its a walk, not a life changing experience. Its a way to get from point A to B, but lets not go overboard here people. The views are nice, but not above average for this otherwise gorgeous island...
Best walk in Ubud. Brilliant. Go early in the morning and enjoy the quietness. Return the same way instead of along the busy main road.

loads of greenery. I think I was expecting a little more due to the tripadvisor reviews. It is a good invigorating walk with some shops in the later part of the walk as you start to approach Club Cocos. There were locals along the way that made it interesting for me. I wasn't bothered by mosquitoes during the walk but as soon as I stopped for a drink, they started buzzing around me. I suggest bringing a mozzie repellent just in case. Kids above 10 years of age should be ok but it could still be a challenge for them if they do not appreciate the views or do not enjoy walking. Great for those who enjoy trekking.
Lovely views, easy walking. A lovely walk in the Ubud countryside. Nice cafe on the way to have a drink and enjoy the scenery. Art villages with some nice paintings for sale if you are interested.

We did it on a moped. This is actually a walking trail so parts of the 'road' were pretty bumpy. We stopped at the top of the Campuhan Ridge at a wonderful little cafe called the Karsa Kafe, where I enjoyed a healthy snack of fresh fruit and Hub's had a chocolate brownie muffin style cake. We both had Mango Lassis' and agreed they were the best and freshest we had tasted throughout our travels. The views along the Campuhan Trail and on the ridge are spectacular. It really was amazing how we could simply turn off of the main road in Ubud and all of a sudden we were immersed in the country side with some the most breath-taking views on both sides of us. Whether you choose to walk or ride like us, this part of Ubud is definitely worth the effort.
a bird watch walk with great view -. best time at sunrise as birds will be the most active. during day time butterflies and lots of farmers caring for their rice fields.
Great views and some exercise too. Great scenery, lots of locals were using it too. Goes up into village and rice fields. Very peaceful.

Good luck following directions. We tried to follow the directions from Lonely planet and really never knew which way to go. After multiple false turns, walking along roads with cars and motorbikes whiz zing by in the hot sun, we gave up,
Welcome Escape from Ubud's Shopping Madness. The ridge walk was lovely, great views of the valleys, however marred by too much construction of expatriate villas. Its worth it...

Very nice for walking or biking!. It is close to the center, it is free, it is beautiful! Unfortunately the ridge these days is being overbuild by all sorts of new development, but it is still stunning and worth to spend couple of hours!

Good stroll away from the hustle. This is a lovely walk with some great views as you trace a ridge toward some rice paddies above two gorges, either side. It's sweaty business on the way up but toward the end are several places for a meal or cool drinks amongst the rice paddies. There is a further 6km circuit option that apparently returns you to Ubud the long way, but the double-back return walk is the more frequently chosen and the heading back downhill into the shaded jungle is a nice reward.

Great walk. Nice to cycle ( afew steep steps at the beginning) or walk, great views across the valley and a nice cafe (Karma cafe) at the end of the trail with views across padi fields and Mount Agung.

Another side of Ubud. We eventually found the start point of this walk through the Ibah Villas driveway along Jalan Raya, and were glad we did. It's a beautiful walk alongside the valleys and rice paddies, very quiet except the odd moped passing by.

Rice fields in transition. While this is certainly a beautiful area it is in transition from rice fields to tourist villas, hotels and resorts. It is a disturbing evolution...people hear about beautiful Ubud (I tried to read EPL and couldn't get through the first few pages) come here and the increased tourist activity adds more and more pressure to build and "develop". There is a massive and ugly resort being built in the valley and another on the ridge right in the fields. Rice field farmers are being put out of work as more and more tourist development comes in.

Walk walk walk. A great morning activity,beautiful scenery, would recommend you don't turn back at the end, carry on and walk back to Ubud through the village, keep in mind that the tarred road just before the village is very steep and windy though.
